Maybe an improvement to the existing design would be to make the back half gently curved down as well, rather than a straight shot. Then users would have two options, one which could fit smaller tires better.  As is, they really are over-kill on small popup campers.  Sticking with a simple block of wood works too.  I'll be returning my chocks.
summary: Note the angle of the chock, not for small camper tires

reviewText: The point is to stop your car right where you want it in the garage.  This does that just fine.  I have rolled up on it with a Ford Fiesta and did not damage it.  Your Hummer might be more of a challenge.  The only down side is its width.  I have no problem hitting the thing, but we have yet to see if my lady and do the same.  If that is an issue you might put two of them side by side for her.  BTW, I used silicone sealant to make sure the thing can't scoot when contacted.  That worked perfectly.
summary: Does just what it is supposed to

reviewText: Only fair.  NOT very durable and do NOT fully secure the trailer.  Spend the extra $$$ and get the X-Block and / or the Fastaway (we now use both, Fastway for intiial set and the x block for final lock in)

I typically use pavers I have in the yard to chock both sides of one tire when I do any work on my truck, but they aren't much higher than 1-1.5".  These are nicer to keep in my garage than to bring in a muddy paver.  Since it's yellow, it's easy to spot in my garage, and they don't slip.  I've tested them by giving my truck a little gas while these are on and they prevent me from rolling.  They look good and do their job.  I like em....
It works use it on my twin axel trailer in s a sloped driveway, knocked down a star could use a pull string.

I use these when parking my 30 Travel trailer.  They are well made and strong.  They have been used probably 80 to 100 times now and,while a bit dirty and scuffed from use, they are still in great shape.  They work well in securing my trailer from movement when parked.

I bought a pair of these for my travel trailer. They fit fine and snug up nicely with the tire. While having a lanyard for them sounds tempting, I hate having extraneous parts on my chocks, so I like their simplicity.

I bought 2 of these, one to keep in my truck for road side emergencies and the other for automotive work use at home. The few times I have used them they work well, but just so you know they have a recommended expiration date on them. I think this is due to their intended use as a RV chock, where they would sit in the sun a lot and would degrade. But again they are cheap, and if the worries you, just buy a new one and toss out the suspect one!
These work great. I am on my 3rd set of these for various trailers. Very secure and will stop just about anything.
Not a lot to say, they are wheel chocks.They do just what they should do! They are light and easy to wipe off. Should last awhile.

I got this based on the reviews.... I kept having to jack up my car to fix a slow-leak in a back tire and I'd throw this under the opposite front wheel for added peace of mind (don't know if I did it right).It feels pretty sturdy and I just throw it in my trunk when not in use... I like the size.... not huge but perfect for my '88 Corolla ;)
These are well made, inexpensive, and work great. They are quality made in USA!And they had no shipping charges if added onto an existing Amazon order.
summary: Great Wheel Chocks - Great Price - Made in USA!

reviewText: After almost 15 years, I finally decided to replace my existing chocks with the same model.  I added a rope loop through the side hole to make carrying and removal a little easier
summary: I've been using these for years.

reviewText: They work great on my Jumping Jack trailer. I use them as short ramps from the inside of the trailer when off-loading my atv - makes it easy to get over the edge. Also use them as chocks once I'm all set up. No complaints at all!
summary: Light weight and simple, perfect for camping.

reviewText: Not much to say other than it holds up well to repeated use, still looks new after 1.5 seasons of constant (almost every weekend) use on the boat trailer and was easy to work with.Great product, would buy again (if I ever need to).
summary: Two season in, this stuff is holding up great

reviewText: I have had to cover the bunk rails several times previously on various boat trailers and this carpet should do okay.  It is NOT as thick / heavy duty as I would like it to be, but it does look as if it will do the job well anyway.  It is just a bit more expensive than I think it to be worth, so only 4 stars..... even so, I like it well enough to use it.  It is enough for one bunk only if you have a normal 8 to 10 foot length rail to mount it on, so,  you will need at least two rolls of this to redo the 2 bunks on most trailers.  Okay, it may not be the very best out there, and it might not be quite as "thick" as I might wish it to be, but I do think it will work just fine..... and you could spend a lot more for the same thing from other brands.I suggest that you wrap it around the wood bunk frame and use the Stainless Steel 1/2 inch staples that are available to secure it to the back side of the wood rails.  This should look good for a long time, be easy to apply, and not rust out any time soon!  It has worked well for me.  Enjoy!
summary: I think that for a commercial product it is okay for the money.

reviewText: i have not installed the precut bunk carpet yet. My biggest disappointment is, I can't find it in 16' lengths.

This carpet is OK, but it's not nearly as nice as what came on my trailer. It seems impossble to get good carpet, I got a quote of nearly 3X the price for more of the same stuff I had I had on there before. I searched and searched, I guess for what I consider a reasonable price, you cant find anything better than this?
summary: Thin Stuff, Hard to Find Anything Decent

reviewText: Great product to install on your old trailer bunks. I just ripped and cut the old carpet off, removed any staples that were sticking out (hammered in the remaining ones) and then glued and stapled this carpet to the bunks to make my trailer look brand new again!
summary: Looks great, Not bad to install, very affordable

reviewText: This tool is indispensable for it's purpose.  It is great in the shop and on the chart table (I have more than one set).  They hold their size without issue, can be easily adjusted and transitioned from dividers to a compass efficiently.
I use this to transfer measurements from maps and plans to scales. It works fine and is well made with precise adjustments and sharp points. It's in the drawer next to me now.

I am planning a sailing trip and I've been putting off getting a few of these for a long time.  Finally bought these and couldn't be happier.  Very high quality.  Not really super light though, which is fine.  They actually have a nice heft to them which makes them feel like good quality tools.
summary: very high quality, not really ultralight

reviewText: The vessel I'm currently assigned to has 2 pairs of these in their navigation tool chest, and they seem pretty ubiquitous elsewhere as well as I've encountered them on multiple vessels before.  All in all, they are a good solid divider, well made, and have the advantage of holding their position for precise plots.  Personally though, I find them uncomfortable to hold and the extra tension caused by the wheel mechanism requires more force to adjust which over time becomes a nuisance.  For open ocean, 1 plot/hr, these are fine; to sit down for an hour or two and use them to plow through a pile of chart corrections, not so much.  I much prefer the W&P Millenniums, but these will do the job just fine if you're truly concerned about the dividers moving while positioning them.
These are soild dividers, had to replace one of a set from 1998, and they look the same. It does say made in germany on these though.

I actually bought this for a H&R Pardner tactical 12gauge (the parts are mostly interchangeable with the Rem 870's), Fits great, very solid, easy to install. My only complaint is that it holds the shells a little too snug to quickly remove them, hopefully it will loosen a little bit as time goes on.

This was a good addition to the NEF H&R PP. I already had a colapsible stock with a 5 shell holder and wanted to add a side saddle without breaking the bank on swapping out the forend, since the PP won't cycle with the 6 shot saddle, unless the forend is replaced or modified. I used some locktite after reading reviews and the instalation was quick and easy using the supplied hardware.

Bought this 6 months ago, I have been using it and happy with it. 12g rounds stay in there nice and tight. My only recommendation would be to purchase the 6 shot. I was concerned about the forearm having trouble and didn't want to have to swap that out too at first considering I was new to the weapon. Well, 6 months later I am upgrading to the Magpul forearm and just bought the 6 shot to go along with it. You'll want the more rounds if you're not wearing a chest rig or shell sling. Gave it a 4 because it does block the serial number on the Remington 870 when other ones do not, but for the price it is worth it.

Easy install, easy use. This unit is solid, and even the plastic clips feel very sturdy and I have faith it will last a long time.My only qualm with this is that it is the alternative to the 6-shot, which sometimes is a little long. It would be nice to have a 5-shot option, or even the option of interchangeable cover plates (the part with the shell clips that is attached to the metal base plate) with the different options. The 4- and 6- shot are close to the same price, and once I receive my new, shorter, fore end, I would be able to use the 6-shot, but don't want to spend the same money again to have the extra 2 shells.

Quick and easy installation. 4 shells of my desire, for faster reloads, or to hold different loads at hand just in case. I.e. slugs, buck shot, etc. perfect for hunting, and/or home defense. Good price too.
Awesome product at a great price! Thank you for a very satisfactory shopping experience. I highly recommend this product for your 12 gauge!!!

Bought this for a IA Hawk 870 clone. My shotgun has the full length hunting style foregrip and would not allow the use of the larger shell holder without modification.  The included hardware fit perfectly, and I am actually much happier having a bolt and nut in the receiver instead of a plain pin.  The product mounted perfectly and the action on the shotgun is not obstructed.
summary: Great option if you don't want to change foregrips.

reviewText: I loved this side saddle felt very tough on the gun and held the shells perfectly even upside down. It also fit flush with the gun. Normally I would post a picture but saddle the was on gun was more or less stolen after I got this side saddle. ): Don't I'll be getting a new gun and side saddle.

I was worried by some of the photos that it would look like it was too bulky and that it didn't fit right with the shotgun, never mind that! It looks gorgeous with this side saddle. Looks the part!I was also concerned that the shell holders might not hold it as well as I'd like but that wasn't true either. Buy it, you won't regret it for this price.
I ordered this for my Rem. 870 shot gun. It was easy to install and gives me 4 more extra shells that are ready to load if needed.
Bought this to put on my H&R pardner pump. It fit perfect and installed in less than 10 minutes. Great product! Looks really cool on the shotgun too!
summary: Works great on H&R pardner pump!

reviewText: Works and functions well and effortless to install - install took but a few minutes and all of the hardware and tools included. Looks factory/OEM!!!

I was concerned with a few things with this item:  ease of installation, durability, external profile, and how it fit the shells.  Bottom line, it was great with everything.  Simply punch out the trigger assembly pins and the screws go right in and screw into the base plate, making it fit really solid on the side of the receiver.  Seriously, it doesn't budge.  The fact that it holds 4 shots and not 6 is a good thing.  6 would be wayyyy too many in my opinion.  If you need that many, get one of those stock sleeves or a bandolier sling.  4 shells is really the perfect amount.  On that note, the shell holders are the perfect median of flexibility and rigidity.  The shells slide in and out easily, but don't require an abusive amount of force.  Seems like it should last a long time, I'm really pleased.
I have a Remington Sportsman 12 870 and it fits perfectly.  Solid and rugged metal construction.  Took me all of a minute to install.  No interference with slide.

I found this product to be easy to install and the instructions were easy to follow as well. I would advise using a small amount of thread lock on the bolts to prevent unwanted loosening of the fasteners.
summary: Nicely designed and easy to install.

reviewText: I bought this for my Remington 870 Express. It came with all of the tools and parts needed, as well as some pretty clear, detailed instructions.It was fairly easy to push out the two stock pins and insert the longer after-market versions. This 4-shot version leaves plenty of room for the shotgun's slide to go all the way back and forth.The parts feel like some kind of strong plastic or polymer, and they grip the shells very well; not too tight, and not too loose.This is a very practical enhancement to the shotgun for anything from hunting to home defense. I'm happy with mine, and it's happily sitting on my shotgun hugging 4 buckshot shells.(The instructions warn you not to screw this too tightly to the gun, or it may cause some of the internal parts to seize up. Screw it until it's moderately tight; don't crank it as tight as you can. Remember, the parts that occupied the same space before were just straight pins with no threads or bolts, so it should be secure, but not ultra-tight.)
summary: Fits Well, Feels Sturdy, I'm Very Pleased

reviewText: Mounted easily onto my heavily modified 870 Express Tactical to provide spare rounds for home defense. There is room left to expand to a 6rd saddle if I ever feel the need. Well constructed and material seems sturdy and reliable.
Fits just as described , I have a Hawk 982 12 ga that this mounts to ,it's a clone 870

The 4 shot holder is perfect for those with OEM furniture.  OEM forends will usually bump up against the 6 shot holder and prevent complete cycling.  If you plan on getting the 6 shot holder, you will likely have to install a shorter forend.
summary: Just like the 6 round version; works well

reviewText: I have both a model 870 tactical and 870 express fits on both fine the long action of the express means this is a good alternative to stock mounted nylon shell holders the tactical action is shorter and can handle the 6 shell holder.  as for shells fitting they hole top or bottom mounted in the holder however the less shells you have in it the less grip on the remaining shells the holder seems to have also the smaller screw that comes with this to replace the forward pin was very snug fitting and took some GENTLE Tapping to get in just be careful not to strip the threads all in all good product will buy the 6 shell one to mount on my tactical 870 this will be going on my bird gun
This will NOT fit with your factory fore end grip!!!!  So... if you are going to change out your fore end grip for a shorter one, you may as well get the Tacstar 6-Shot saddle!
I have the Blackhawk Gen2 Knoxx stock w/ polymer pump. The extended length of the new pump wont work with the standard 7 round side saddles.

I love stump shooting, and small game hunting, and I have been using muzzy and some other judo points, and have been annoyed with how easily the springy wire breaks on some of them.  So I wanted to try these, the price was right and the reviews looked good, so I ordered these.Let me tell you, these are working great on my recurve.  They hit HARD, and can do real damage to anything they hit.  I hit an old stump, and instead of simply sticking in it, or bouncing off, it exploded!  I hit a live tree at 20 paces and it left a deep noticeable wound in the bark.  I tossed a full waterbottle down range and hit it, and it demolished it, going right through.However, despite all this damage, the arrows are in perfect shape, and not once did I have one bury in the dirt.  These seem to have the perfect mix of stiffness and rubberyness to them to both deal massive blunt force damage to whatever it hits, but also prevent the arrow from detonating on impact.These are economical, and easy to use, and so far have made it even easier and fun to stump shoot as I know I will not break the arrow, and in many cases, it leaves a good clear mark where the impact took place, helping me further tune my instinctive shooting style.I have NO doubt that these will be absolutely LETHAL to any small game this hits, even in those not so vital hits that inevitably happen on small game when shooting instinctive, this will surely deliver enough impact to crush vitals and cause instant or near instant death from hydrostatic shock even in a less than perfect shot placement situation.Whats more, as it lacks any sharp points, I bet it will leave more meat and fur intact.However, seeing how it can penetrate solid wood at ten paces or less, I am a bit worried about this going through and through on some small animals, and as the head is bigger than a normal Judo... that could mean a LOT of meat ruined...Anyway, I would definitely recommend to a friend!
Critters appreciate being bludgeoned than sliced or pierced. One or two were ruined due to compacting on hard trees. Critter really appreciated that.

It shoots like a field point out to 30 yards. Beyond that it is unpredictable. I have used them for target practice in the woods. I have shot them at rocks and tree stumps. They bounce off without damaging the arrow. I shot them at a large ground squirrel at 15 yards, thinking it would only crush it without causing excessive damage. I was wrong. It punched completely through both shoulders leaving a 1.5 inch entry wound and a 2.5 inch exit. I had planed to use these on grouse, but now I am not sure they won't destroy them. I also tried a cheaper brand of slip on rubber broad heads. The slip on stopped on impact, and the arrow punched through the rubber. So this broadhead is better then those slip on, but I'm not sure rubber is the way to go.
summary: It's okay. It's better them other rubber points.

reviewText: I've made 40-50 shots with the Saunders Bludgeon. They are very durable and do protect the arrow from damage even in impacts on stone. Accuracy was comparable with a field point out to 25-30 yards. I didn't try them at ranges greater than this. I doubt you will find better performance from any blunt projectile unless you go to steel blunts of the same diameter as the arrow shaft (and accept increased arrow damage).
I've used these on cardboard targets and they're devastating.  Looking forward to using them on small game.  They definitely transfer a lot of energy and fly very well for the drag they create.

Snapped right on, and very hard to get off! This could create some problems when attempting to dispose of the waste within. The seat is made of thin plastic, a little bit flimsy, I could see the lid breaking off at some point. The lid shuts well, and sort of seals. I like the fact that I can still use the bucket handle when the lid is on!
Decent price and great for the portable toilet in my storm shelter. Less bulking and more useful than a regular seat and a lid.

My parents use this on their pontoon boat.  Yeah. yeah you could just jump in the water, but that isn't always the best option when you are fully clothed and this is much easier than docking the boat every time.
This seat works perfectly on any 5 gal bucket.  It makes it the perfect height.  The seat is very comfortable and perfect for camping.
You snap it on to a bucket. You sit on the bucket and do your business.Is it the most comfortable toilet of all time? No. But it is on a bucket.

You get what you pay for.  It's well built and is exactly as described.  Fits a 5-gallon bucket, etc.  Just isn't that great.  Works, but you'll appreciate getting back to a real toilet.  On the up-side, it's a lot better than nothing.

It is what it is, but it's also incredibly flimsy.  I'd consider myself "average" size for an American, which means I could probably refuse seconds once in a while and still not wither away, but that said, tread lightly on this thing, folks...

MEN HAVE AN ADVANTAGE SOMETIMES THAT WOMEN DO NOT HAVE. "BUTT" THERE ARE TIMES WHEN IT IS NICE TO SIT DOWN. THE RELIANCE PRODUCTS LUGGABLE LOO SEAT COVER IS TRULY A CREATURE COMFORT. IT IS SO NICE TO NOT HAVE TO WAIT IN LINE WHILE CAMPING WHEN THIS SEAT COVER WILL ALLOW ONE TO STAY IN THE PRIVACY OF YOUR OWN TENT. IT CAN BE PUT OUTSIDE THE DOOR AT NIGHT AND OF COURSE SOME KITTY LITTER WILL DISPEL ANY ODORS.I FOUND THAT IT ACCOMMODATES ADULTS BETTER IF ONE CUTS AN OBLONG OPENING IN THE REAR AREA ALSO WITH A UTILITY KNIFE. FOR A CHILD IT IS JUST THE RIGHT SIZE BUT, FOR AN ADULT FACE IT, A 5 GALLON BUCKET IS A BIT ON THE SMALL SIZE FOR A LARGE ADULT. DON'T LEAVE HOME ON A CAMPING TRIP WITHOUT IT. DON OUT.

What can I say, it does what it is supposed to do. Without going into too much detail, its snaps on over bag on bucket, holds our weight, feels comfy enough to get the job done, lid closes, lid snaps off for cleaning. Oh, and it doesn't take up much room when storing it.

Well, it's a toilet seat. Just like it says, it snaps onto a 5gal bucket and that's about it. I took a tip from other reviewers and just used heavy duty trash bags instead of the expensive ones sold to go with this. I took it camping and lined the bottom of the trash bag with kitty litter, and kept another bucket next to it with kitty litter and a scoop inside to sprinkle on top after each use.The bucket seems pretty stable with this seat attached to it,but I made a base out of wood for the bucket to sit in and it works great. Set the whole unit up inside a shower tent,and with the seat cover and kitty litter there was no noticeable smell.The seat itself is actually more "roomy" than the porta potty I used on a previous camping trip. The plasic is a little flimsy but heck for the price I think it's a pretty good deal.
When c ombined with a 5 gallon bucket. I chose black so as to make sure no one mixes it up with food products. I t will work great during emergency problems.

Very comfy seat, I am 6' and 215lbs.  I fish out in the ocean, sometimes 50 miles from shore, and when ya gotta go, well, you know the story.  Before we were using a 5 gallon bucket with no seat and it can be uncomfortable and leave a ring around  your behind.  This seat fit my generic 5 gallon  bucket very snugly, AND, is comfortable to sit on. My crew and I are now, "HAPPY CAMPERS,  I mean, "HAPPY FISHERPEOPLE".

Product arrived as advertised.  This is a great little item to add to your disaster preparedness cache.  Most people forget that besides food and water, sanitation is also an important part of emergency planning.  This toilet seat, a five gallon bucket, kitty litter, and some disposable trash bags will be invaluable in the event that you lose municipal sanitation service.

Luggable Loo fits on any 5 gallon round bucket.  The best aspect of the loo is that it is very sturdy.  Very capable of supporting at least 260 lbs.  It is very portable as the name implies, takes up little space while travelling.  In a nutshell much better than going in free-standing latrine.  The most negative point I can make is you have to empty the bucket and clean the product, however this is not a big deal.

Used it for the first time while camping this weekend.  We needed something for our camper that did not take up lots of space and this was the perfect answer.  I purchased a standard 5 gal bucket from our local store and the seat snapped tightly to it!  We used 8 gal kitchen bags and double bagged the bucket and added a bit of kitty litter (adding a little each time we went).  No more walking to the outhouse in the middle of the night for this mom, or any more accidents with the kids because they can't make it in time.  One happy camper!

Convert a 5 (or 7) gallon bucket into a toilet!  I use this product in my truck camper, which doesn't have a built in toilet.  It sure beats the heck out of trekking to a port-a-potty or campground bathroom in the middle of the night (safer too).  Not to mention, much better privacy!Stupendous!

The concept of an emergency use toilet at a reasonable price sounded great. The product took over a week to be delivered and is made for Tinkerbell's Butt.  It is built from very cheap plastic and the lid will not open all the way, so you have to crouch at a very uncomfortable angle or break the lid off the hinge...which I am sure will happen in its first use.There are better products out there...Skip this one unless it is a backup for your real backup.

A great addition to my emergency kit or when camping. A must have. better then sitting on just a bucket. Sets up nicely. Haven't used it just yet but been there done that out on the shore fshing and no place to go.
summary: A loo go seat a must have

reviewText: Wanted to have this on hand incase ever needed...and after reading reviews knew this was "the one" since it snaps onto the bucket (more secure than some) and will work with any 5 gallon bucket.  Having young kids in the house, we wanted it incase the power ever goes out for an extended time. Also would be handy camping

OK, so the title of my review may sound a bit odd - I agree.  I car camp extensively all over New York State and also fly to the National Parks and am able to take almost all of the gear that I use when car camping in NYS except for a porta-toilet.  I am a very active above knee amputee (with prosthesis) and probably do more than most people with 2 legs.  That being said, I don't sleep with my prosthesis on and if I need to use the facilities during the night it can be a pain to carry a flashlight while using crutches at 3 a.m.  I've always had to get the site right next to the facilities when I fly to my camping destination because of this.  These sites aren't always the best sites with regard to privacy and noise level due to the in and out traffic.  This eliminates (no pun intended) that problem.Since it's just the cover and is totally flat I can easily pack this (wrapped in a basic plastic shopping bag) into my 27" pullman with my tent and other gear.  Or if I choose to send a box to the hotel I'm at for a night or two before heading to the campground I can ship it there easily along with other gear in a 14x14x14 box.  My favorite National Park to camp at is Rocky Mtn. NP in Colorado.  I can land in Denver, get my food supplies and swing by a Lowe's or Home Depot to spend a whopping $3 on a 5 gallon bucket.  Now I can get a more private site or one with a nicer view that's further away from the facilities since I can just keep it in my tent and take care of it first thing in the morning after I put on my prosthesis.I (gratefully) realize that my needs for this product are a bit unusual compared to others, but I think most can agree that no one really wants to trapse out of their tent at 3 a.m. to walk 10 sites down to use the facilities, esp. if kids are with you.  During the day it's no big deal to take that walk and a good leg stretcher, but at night stay snug in your tent and have this along.  Just be sure to empty it and clean it with camp soap first thing in the morning.  If you don't want to have to clean the bucket you can also use the Reliance Double Doodie bags with this product.
summary: Outstanding for a camper who flies with gear

reviewText: my girlfriend insisted that i get one of these so she can go the bathroom on the boat when we go fishing and camping. i prefer to do things the old fashion way but understand that there are plenty of people that aren't comfortable with answering natures call the natural way.  fit on the first bucket i tried. not super high quality but it's cheap and fit the bucket and is good for doing the do.

Bought this to take to the hunting camp.  Have a 2 year old and it is tough to trek out to the outhouse at night and in the cold/snow in the winter.  Can use this in the camp.  It isn't really sturdy - dont' know how long it will last but for the price didnt' really expect a lot either.  It works as it is intended and has made our life easier with the kids.

If you are a small statured person, petite woman or girl or a teenager, then this seat is adequate to accomplish the necessary feat. However, if you are like me, 250lbs. 6' man... well, let's just say the hole is kinda small and the "seat" isn't as "beefy" as I would like - but it does the job.

Simply attach this seat cover to a 5 gallon(or smaller) plastic bucket and you have a perfectly fine toilet to sit on.  I recommend lining the bucket with a trash bag and adding some kind of absorbent i.e cat litter, wood shavings, especially if its expected to be used multiple times.  This is really great for boat owners who have an on-board head, but do not want to put up with the hassle of cleaning it.  I have to go on a boat so rarely, I do not feel too bad about washing my solid waste into the ocean so I just leave the bag out.  Also girls do not have the advantage of being able to pee off the side of the boat like men do, so having one of these for them is much appreciated.

Pros: For the ladies who hate to squat,better option than digging a cat hole if you believe the SHTF world.Great back up option if water goes out, busted pipe,well pump breaks, cheap.Cons: Not very sturdy, small target to hit, cheap

I bought 3 of these in case of an emergency. I have not had to use them but I did buy a 5 gallon bucked for each seat and they fit perfectly. I also bought a few bulk packs of  8 gallon garbage bags to make for easy cleanup if my kids and I ever have to use them. I gave them 4 stars because i have not actually put them to use, but so far they look like they are well made, and fit perfectly on the standard 5 gallon buckets.

If you fish out of a hard shanty or even a portable then all you need is a 5-gal pail and a garbage bag. Most fishermen already have the pail so just slide on the garbage bag (doubled is cool), put on the seat and do yer business. saves a long walk to shore clinching your knees!!!
summary: Gotta have it for the ice shanty.

reviewText: Don't drag your kids out of the tent at 2am and head to dark bathroom.  Having this handy was so much better.  I had a little trouble snapping the seat on with the bag attached but it was solid when in place.  It takes up so little space and their bags with the chemicals in it really works well too.  I carry tent stakes, etc... in the 5 gal bucket anyway so the only new addition is the seat (thin and light) and the bags.

Just as described. Bought my own bucket. Had a hard time getting it to fit on my bucket. I think others have also mentioned this problem. But, it will still serve the intended purpose in an emergency.

There are times when I need to find a quiet place to think, to relax, and to let it all out.  I grab my 5 gallon bucket, a note book, a pen, and the luggable loo.  I feel so much closer to nature when I am outside with these, doing my business while collecting my thoughts.This provides a way to escape to the outdoors, and feel closer to nature than ever before.
summary: I did some of my best thinking on one of these

reviewText: this rod is heavy to handle, the  rod's "ceramic guide inserts" easily break.the rod gets stuck when put together.needless to say save your money,pay a bit extra & get a better rod like the Daiwa beefstick.you don't need any rod longer than 11 or 12 ft. I ended up returning it to amazon after a nasty cut on my hand due to ceramic guides breaking.
not happy with it , I purchase two of this rods , reach scratched so its not the best deal I done here

I took this pole salmon fishing. It performed well. Cast very well. I have a glass blank by South Bend that I finally wore out the eyes.I have a Berkley glass trout rod in the same condition. Depending on how much it will be to strip, equip, tie and finish these poles is what determines if I will keep them. This Okuma advertises it is made of glass fiber. We will see. To me glass rods have greater casting distance, and unlike as advertised, all other constructions of blanks are not as sensitive to light bumps as the glass. Many of my acquaintances want to go back to glass only. They are looking at garage sales to find glass poles to rebuild. If this Okuma is truly glass construction maybe I will be wondering if I should rebuilt it in 25 years.Aug. 12 2011, I have fished this rod several times now on the Nestuca River in Oregon, and this is a great rod. I am VERY happy.

I love this rod! Like others have said, I had to sand down the butt end connections, the tip end connection was OK. When I received the package, the box was mashed and mangled and made me worry that the rod was broke, but upon opening and checking the rod from end to end, was OK. There could be some peanuts or scrap paper packed in around the rod to protect it in shipment. For those that don't know what peanuts I'm referring to is Styrofoam  pieces. Very good price and product seems to be made to last of good quality and would recommend to anyone that  is in the market for this type of rod.

I bought a 13' Tundra rod. It's big. I fished for a week in the Outer Banks, NC (in August, so not much action).  I am glad I brought a smaller rod- this one is big and heavy. If I caught a  big ole fish, I'd be glad I had it, but the truth is I'll probably end up using this monster very rarely- only when a LONG cast is necessary.I did catch a 6" Whiting. On a 13' rod... funny.Anyway about the rod- 13' 3 piece rod- I bought it because 3 pieces of less than 5ft will fit in the luggage box we have on top of the car. I think the tip is somewhat sensitive, but it's a long long way from the reel. It's stiff and not particularly light for its size. I am sure that's where the low cost comes in- a light and strong rod would cost 4x as much. I do think it's worth having around, though if you are fishing at the beach like did, you don't need a very long rod. (unless you catch a 12' fish). 6 or 7 feet of rod would have been plenty for me to catch what we did in the breaking surf.  Another thing to consider is this- I would hate to have to use this as a cast-and-retrieve rod. It's too heavy for that. You will get very tired.When I buy another surf rod, I'll probably spend a lot more on a much lighter weight rod- not necessarily a light-tackle rod, but made thinner and lighter out of more expensive material.I hope this review helps-

For the price the rod is worth it, but its a cheap rod that performs on par with its price. Not something I will be taking out fishing anytime soon. Barely flex the tip and you can hear it crack and pop.  Im afraid a decent size fish will destroy it. BTW, I ordered the 7' for channel cats. Ill keep it as a backup or loaner. But, if you buy it, you will get a rod that is worth exactly what you pay for it. Im going back to Ugly Stick Catfish rods.
summary: You get what you pay for

reviewText: Can't wait to get on the beach this year and give her a try! Great deal! I may grab me another!

Okuma Tundra Surf Glass Spinning Rod TU-120.  I have just used my Okuma Tundra Surf Glass Spinning Rod TU-120, the 12 foot rod for the first time pier fishing and here are my first impression pros and cons review.Pros  -good quality.  Great price.  double eyed ceramic guide inserts.  Strong.Good casting distance.  Agree with most of the reviews here.Looks better than the pictures.  Name brand you can trust.Everything you'd expected in Okuma.Cons  -heavy, by far the heaviest 12 foot rod in my collection.A bit too thick - overall, rod is thick, handle grip is nice and firm but too thick in my hands.When fish play, before the bite, a bit hard to feel in your hands.After the cast, end tip wobbles a bit longer than I would like.  Used 4oz sinker.It is a 2 piece rod.  I would like it more if it was 3 pieces.Made in China - nothing against them, just wondering how much led they used.This is my first impressions.  I will update as I find more to write about.  Overall I like the rod (4 stars).For a lot more money, Okuma Longitude Surf Graphite Rods fit my hands better.  This is a very good starter rod for those 15 to 20 times a year anglers.  Finicky anglers might fine this rod less sensitive and too bulky.

I like this rod for the price, I'm not up on fishing rods but for 30 bucks I couldnt pass it up! There is a 14' down the street for 70! And amazon gave me free shipping. I didnt find anything wrong with it I would buy it again.

I got the 10ft model---This is a throw away rod,it breaks,oh well,go buy a new one....except mine won't break,I treat it like a red-headed step child...So the guides are off,it sticks together sometimes and the craftmanship ain't all that great..IT'S 25 BUCKS!!!! Go buy a Croix or any other high end rod....500 BUCKS!!! Find the cheapest reel you can and put it on this rod and come over to Castle Island and we'll do some fishing
summary: The guides aren't lined up right,sometimes it sticks together..LOVE IT

reviewText: Worked great with our coleman grill :) - only wish i could store it in the grill as well, also watch while cooking bacon or other grease things on it as the grease puddles a bit
summary: works well :) great for camping- watch for grease tho

reviewText: I use the on the open flame of my bbq grill.  I cook with propane gas on high heat.  My favorite dish cooked on this pan is country fried steak aka cubed steak.  When I am in a hurry (that is always) I turn the gas on full throttle pour an ounce or two of cooking oil on the griddle.  Within a few minutes my griddle is at 450 to 500 degrees F.  Sometimes it flames up but that is fine.  The coating does not come off and shows no sign of damage.  I have repeated this process many times with great success.  If everyone wants to come over for a sample I will unwrap the other griddle.  I can cook at least four steaks at a time on one griddle.  If I put both griddles on the fire I could cook enough for a party.
summary: excellent for the grill or camp fire.

reviewText: I need a light griddle that would fit on my weber baby q, this fits almost perfectly, just a touch big, the top hangs open on weber. after 15 mins of heating on high, it works great for eggs, pancakes, hash, we made fish tacos also. this is a great buy.I did not want to deal with a heavy cast iron griddle.

This is a very nice little griddle---with a great price.  Given that I purchased it for camping, one of the benefits of this particular griddle is that it is lightweight!  It packed well, heated well, and had an easy-clean non-stick surface that made clean up breeze.  I appreciated the slightly curved edges, as that can trap any residiual grease or liquid that can accumulate when cooking.  This is a definate keeper!!
easy to use and clean ups is easy do to the non stick surface...food cooked on the surface slid right off without burning onto the surface

I've been camping for many years and the Coghlan's non-stick two burner griddle just plain works!  Many eggs, sausages, hashbrowns and pancakes have been cooked on mine over a two burner coleman liquid fuel stove and I've never had anything stick.  The only thing that could ever be improved with this basic design would be to add a grease sink on one side or a corner for bacon grease.  At times the bacon grease can get close to going overboard, so I have to periodically soak up some of the grease with paper towels while cooking bacon.  Cleanup is always easy and the aluminum griddle is easy to transport.  Just watch your heat and don't get carried away with over heating one side or the other or the aluminum may warp, but I have had no signs of warping with mine. Also be sure to use plastic spatulas to protect the non-stick coating.  The best part of the Cohlan griddle is that most of the ones I've seen say "Made in the USA" on them.  Coleman's version and some of the other off-brands are made in China, yet they are typically more money for the same basic design. I've seen these carried at my local Target and Fleet Farm.  For the price ($15 on Amazon) you can't go wrong with this Coghlan's.  I also have a Nordicware high-quality griddle... also non-stick, made in U.S.A. with a grease sink.  Not a bad griddle, but it cost more than twice the price. I still favor the Coghlan's griddle.
summary: No nonsense, no stick camp griddle

reviewText: A great non stick surface that works very well with my Coleman double burner camp stove.  It is a little flimsy, and can be a touch finicky to clean while camping (no metal brushes), but overall it is great for pancakes, eggs and sausage.
summary: Easy to cook and clean, slightly flimsy

reviewText: from reading some of the reviews i bought some "pam" cooking spray when i went camping just in case my pancakes stuck to the grill but it did not. the surface is non-stick and the was the case when i used it on my camping trip. i have also used it in my home and no problems with it sticking either. I did not peel and was super easy to clean. i will continue to use this at home and while out camping. the size is good. i can make about 6 small pancakes as shown in the product picture. I made bacon, sausage and scramble eggs (not all at the same time) on this griddle and had not problems. i recommend it.

Cooked breakfast camping on the beach for 4, people 3 mornings over a typical 2 burner propane stove. I'm sure there are nicer griddles, but for my camping purposes this works perfectly fine, and the price is right.
This worked perfectly for our coleman camping stove.  I made 6 pieces of french toast at a time and the non-stick surface was a dream to work with.  It is also very light weight.

Still waiing from the vendor the other item I ordered.  This is a big coil.  Don't knowmif itnis worth it but I do like the quick disconnect.  We'll see if my other item arrives then will add to this review

I picked up two of these for my two youngest sons.  They love paintball but they do not love lugging around a paintball gun with a large tank attached to it.  With these coiled remote hoses they can store the tank in their backpack and then only have to lug around the weight of the gun all day.  Makes a huge difference for them.  It also makes the guns much lighter so they can move faster with them and their target acquisition time is much quicker too.

so this remote is very affordable and does the job just fine. If you are a novice or beginner player to paintball than this is deffinetly the coil for you. There have been a couple of other different reviews on this item saying that it doesnt come with directions for the instal. well they are right but if you cant figure out which side is male and which side is female than you need to go back to school. as for why i rated this item a three star, the quick disconnct is good but it doesnt stop the air that may still be left in the tank from coming out and if you are a player outside of a course, this could become an expensive problem. the valve that attaches to your tank is supposed to decrease the air flow from the tank to your asa and well if you are using co2 then this is somewhat of a delema as co2 is stored in liquid form and has a phase change to become a gas. so once a co2 tank is on the valve does nothing for you. the coil itself, or the hose that connects the two ends is durable and hasnt had any problems with kinks durring my activity. i am 6'6" and when standing to fire it does create a little tension when i am sholdering my marker. every other position i am in, it is fine, and while running in the woods, it does keeps the compact coil shape. overall i think that this is a good buy for beginners but i am not so sure on the disconnect or the valve open and close and that is why i rated it three stars. hope this review helps, happy hunting!
I live in Colorado and even in the winter it is amazing I play woods ball and I even went under whater it is amazing

I needed a remote line for use on my pellet rifles when using an external CO2 paintball tank (instead of small powerlets).This fit the bill perfectly as I was able to remove the paintball fittings on the remote end and use the standard 1/8" NPT fitting as found and ndeeded on my pellet rifle.The hose is a bit stiff and short, but stretching it out overnight to 12' helped "memorize" the hose to a longer length.All in all, nothing wrong with this at all...it was exactly what I needed.
summary: Well done. Easily tears down for modified use!

reviewText: Leaked right from the start from around the valve on/off or the 1/8 fitting so back it goes. Looked well made and stout though !

Was not expecting to get a product of such good quality based on the price they are selling these.  With this line I can rest assured that it won't be breaking or start leaking air.  This is definitely a good bang for your buck.
Solid training device from a solid company.  The cost was very reasonable, and I anticipate using this during all of my triathlon training cycles.
It works not a lot to say pull floats are pretty standard. It looks nice good it has quality foam. I would buy it again if needed.
This is my 2nd TYR pull float, and it is perfection in the water.  Love working out with it and great price.
This makes a nice addition to your swim bag. Great for assisting in upper body conditioning. The compressed foam material seems to be holding up well. No complaints here.
Its your typical pull bouy, came quickly, smooth and is exactly what i needed for my swimming workouts like I had when I was in high school
great for swimming training, durable, easy to use and dry. i use it almost every day and is still as new

If I could give this zero stars I would.  The product looked unfinished and had a couple of gouges in it.  Not worth the hassle of returning it so I'll just use it as is.  It is possible that the product suffered the gouges during shipping but the rest of the defects can only be attributed to poor quality control.  Don't think I'll be buying anything from TYR again.

I got these to protect my wrist when i go rollerblading and it is exactly what i wanted.  Why I am exceptionally happy about this product is because I purchase these which were labled " used - like new" and it was only 11 bucks. When i got it, it is exactly like new and showed no signs of previous use.

Got these for my son to use when on his roller blades. Quality, wrist protection seem decent. He should be able to use on his scooter as well. A little piece of mind for that one hard fall? (knock on wood!)
summary: Must have for a young kid who's active on wheels

reviewText: I wore these for about 5 hours, even took them snowboarding and I did not have any issues with them. The only complain I have is that you cannot wear these under gloves unless your gloves are really big.
They fit well, protect from a hands-out fall very well and make my daughter feel like a warrior. What else could i ask for?Oh yeah, they arent made of cheap stuff, they look like they will last.

Product is very good will give a test later on when I go snowboarding.  Try it home did a couple of drops from the standing position held together good.  I didn't feel pain on my wrists .it's doing what it's supposed to do
Love them. I do roller derby and I fall *ahem* more than I care to say, haha, and I never end up getting hurt wrists.
Frame distorts, screws fall out, top lid won't lock (because frame is distorted), and the handles pop out or their attachment point.  What's not to like!
It's nice for picking up the balls but putting it stands is hard - you can not just push it to snap, you have to bend it and make it click for each legs - 4 times.
summary: Bit hard to stand and fold

reviewText: This ball holder was very easy to put together and it stands a few feet off the ground which helps prevent the constant bending down for a ball.  The closable, lockable lid keeps the balls from falling out, and the legs easily collapse for convenient travelling.Price matches the value so 5 stars.

pushers, get out there and make some moneyeasy to put together.  nice look.  Of course the stand never really works and will just get knocked down on the court the minute you try to set it up, but I already expected that.Nice looking, professional look.  Wilson impresses the kids.  Black is sleek.One thing.  I noticed that the bolts have a tendency to get loose over time and will fall off on the court if you are not careful and don't check every once in a while to make sure they are secure.  Otherwise, for $20 bucks with shipping, perfect.

Some other reviews say this is not a good hopper, but what can you really expect for around $20?  It works.  I am not nice to it.  I toss it in my trunk and pretty much manhandle it.  No screws have popped out, nothing weird happened.  Sometimes the top pops open in my trunk and a couple of balls fall out...It sits at a good height and makes transporting balls and practicing service very easy.Seriously... $20.  Worth every penny.

This product is excellent for anyone just getting into the game of tennis. For the price range, this hopper is a great option compared to what you'll find in most sporting good stores. I've seen some reviews say it isn't very durable, but I've been using mine for several months now without issue. It sits in the trunk of my car and I only bring it out when I'm using it.I imagine it's not built to withstand hours and hours of teaching lessons with everyday, but for the casual player it's more than fine.
This is the same one used by tennis instructors at the local courts. It works great and holds up well.

This is basically the same ball hopper I had 20 years ago with a few minor set backs.  The first issue was that 20 years ago, the basket was one piece, now the four sides are screwed together, so you constantly have to worry about the nuts getting loose and loosing them.  The other issue is that it takes a lot of muscle to get the legs into the notches to get it to stand up.  I can do it, but I'm pretty sure my wife would not be able to.  With the legs int he notches, it's pretty stable.  Once you do get the legs in the notches, it takes some more muscle to get them out.  Overall, I think it was a good choice.
summary: Works pretty well; need some muscle to work the stands

reviewText: This thing functions as described. It seems like it will hold about 75 balls. The legs/handles have a tendency to pop off too easily but overall it is very easy to use.

The Wilson Ball Pickup was easy to put together. It came with all the hardware and a little wrench. We put a little more than 50 balls in it, which was fine.Once up, the lid flips up to hold the balls inside, the legs come up to form a handle. We can hold it like that and punch the balls on the ground to pick them up without bending over.When ready to play, the handles fold down to become the legs of a stand. The legs don't snap into place very easily. My son and I both put our muscle into it and couldn't do it. I finally had to put it on its side and push with my feet. It's so hard to get in and out of the latch that we don't bother fold it back up during the practice to pick up balls. I hope that spring tension gets better over time.Also, when we haul it around by the handle, the handle occasionally falls out of the hinge, so that the whole thing topple out of our hands -- balls all over the ground, not a pretty sight.Overall, a clever design, but the details need improvement, or we got a defective one.

Hard to review a product like this... it's like reviewing a pencil, if it writes, it worked.In all seriousness this is a nice hopper, I like it better than the Gamma hoppers you see everyone walking around with if for no other reason than the clasping nub at the top of the handles that will "lock" the hopper closed, that's a nice touch.The metal used is on the thick side and the hopper has a perfectly sturdy feeling. You also assemble it by fastening 4 bolts that you can do up pretty tightly to give the thing a "never going to come apart" feel.The ONE thing I didn't like, is that the lid doesn't *latch* closed, it just lays closed. I think it's suppose to latch, but as you tighten said bolts during assembly, the metal flexes a bit and bows inward on the side just a hair, making the top stop snapping closed and only lay closed.I thought this would be a problem for me since I lay this thing down in the back of my car when I'm not using it, but because the top handles latch closed, they sort of keep the top flap from coming open, so I haven't really had any issues of the top popping open and balls emptying out into my trunk.The only modification I would have made to this hopper (and I've had a few hoppers) is to put a little metal knob on the top lid *just like* the metal one on the handles, so the top would snap closed... other than that I'm very happy with it, would definitely get it again as opposed to the Gamma one.One last note, the handles do come with rubber handle guards on them which is basically just some rubber hose (I noticed a lot of hoppers do this), I'd suggest taking this off... even though it makes the handles more comfortable to carry, when you flip the handles around and stand the hopper up on the handles, the little rubber guards can cause the legs to slowly spread out from under the hopper until it eventually falls over (sort of like someone on skates for the first time where their legs will slowly slide out from under them into the splits).If you never prop your hopper up like in the picture of this product, don't worry about it. Just wanted to give that heads up incase you do so you don't have to chase 75 balls around the court like I did during serve practice.

When I saw one of these at the court I just had to have one. It makes picking up a bunch of balls a snap and really saves your back. That said, it's kind of a pain to assemble, and you may have to do a little creative bending to make it easier to turn the handle into legs.
Great at carrying balls, the carry handles don't clip at the top - which would be nice to have, they are also a little awkward to put in the clips to make a stand as well.
but when I read the warning for some materials may cause cancer and defected birth , i scary because my wife pregnant ^_^

Great little unit, and LITTLE indeed!  Packs away so you hardly notice it, great to keep behind the truck seat for those unexpected 'stops'.  Not much room for gear, but again it's a back up type unit.  Haven't caught anything significant with it yet, just some small trout, panfish, etc. but good for a fun afternoon - or a spare combo for when you have a guest.  Treat it like the ultralight unit it is, the case makes it's a little bulky for small pole but protects it very well, keeps it organized.  Don't expect it to replace full sized gear, and it's a five star.  If its your only rig?  Eh, 3-4 star depending on what you fish.

had mine for about 5 years use it all the time at least once a month . if your only fishing in small lakes or ponds this is perfect you will not have miles of line with this pole it wasnt meant for that ive still managed to catch plenty of fish with mine and just recently broke a section (user error it was crushed by spare tire in the bed of my truck ) . it will catch respectable fish ive caught kokanee salmon walleye tons of rainbow and a few bass on this pole the case was the first thing to break no biggy it fits in my messanger bags spare compartment perfectly anyway . good product thinking of geting another one just to have around for freinds on hikeing trips etc

I adore this little lightweight rod and keep it in my car under my seat in case I get a free moment to cast out.  It's easy to put together, easy to string, casts smoothly and has a good feel to it.  I never felt like it was too flimsy or like it was going to collapse on me, which is always a plus for these collapsibles.

Update: It has worked like a champ. I fought a fair-sized northern pike for ten minutes with no problems. I caught a bunch of other trout, bass, and walleye pike with no trouble in the reel or rod.I just received the item. One of the closure snaps was broken, but the item was otherwise in good condition. The rod seems sufficiently well built for the kind of light fishing (trout, bass, panfish, etc.) I want to do on hikes. I bought this for a compact fishing kit for hiking, and it seems well-suited for it. The case is big enough to fit a significant amount of extra hooks, lures, a stringer, and even a scaler/hook remover. The case also has slots to insert nylon straps for attachment to a pack. I am glad I bought this.I will update this after I have taken it on a few trips.UPDATE: Took it to Canada twice, and it works really well. I caught a dozen fish with no quality problems at all. It is a nice setup and packs really well.
I love this setup,had one years ago that was stolen.The quality isnt as good as years past,but except for case hinges fading fast the rod and reel are holding up nicely.Still love this form factor.

This thing is really neat! It's way smaller than I thought it was going to be. I haven't gotten to use it yet, but the real spins nice and smoothly, and it was really easy to put together and to take back apart. I can't wait to go fishing and test it out!

The rod is very good quality, and I was even impressed with the reel. I don't really like the plastic storage case (it's quite large, and the hinge will likely break easily), but that isn't the reason I bought this set, so it doesn't warrant a lower star rating in my opinion. I caught a 2lb trout the first time I used it, and it performed very well. I think I'm going to pick up a 2nd one!

Haven't fished in many a year, now I'm prepared for any opportunity, got my fishing gear nicely packaged in a travel bag that I can take with me anywhere. The rod and reel are a quality product that will serve me for years to come on the lakes and rivers I visit in my retirement. The seller came through with a shipment right on time an affordable by any standards. I recommend them to anyone wishing to add to their sporting equipment.
I got this for my emergency kit. The plastic case came with broken corner and latch. The reel was hard to fit in case. Otherwise it will do just fine catching fish.

Great little rod/reel combo, my only gripe is you have to remove the crank to put it back into the carrying case, but as far as performance, works great.  I've not landed anything over 2 lbs with it yet, but it's done fine, and small enough to keep under your car seat, and it has a couple of small storage compartments for storing some tackle.  Not a bad setup.
This is a very nice rod and reel. It is very small would easily fit into a carryon bag to take with you. Only thing is wish it came with line already on.
We bought a new boat but we are not big into fishing.  My wife wanted to be able to fish so I got this.  It is God quality, and a very small package.  The size is perfect for stowing.
The size and weight of this kit make it easy to store in a backpack, and it's a classic Daiwa Ultralight that just works.
The item travels well; it is construction is good.  I use occationally use it but I suspect the reel will have a short life.

I would recommend this case and fishing rod to everyone, especially if your looking for one that is compact but can handle multiple type of fishing styles...one of the best put away fishing poles Ive seen so far...

Wow! The case is actually a great deal smaller than I had expected! This is a good thing! I haven't actually used it yet. However I have assembled it, it feels just as good as my ultralight 4' rod and reel. It seems to be a bit stiffer in action. But what would you expect from a tiny 4 pc rod? No lie..... I'll be buying two more!
summary: It's so tiny! (That's what she said)

reviewText: I am not an avid fisherman. That being said, I wanted something I could goof around with when car camping and on 4x4 trips near water. This little pole is well made and everything fits in a nice tight hardcase. Perfect for my needs.

I read most of the reviews prior to buying this combo. Yes it is small but has a great feel to it. As far as being a pain to replace in the hard case I'd suggest some patience. Worked for me.My complaint is the anti-reverse isn't working. I gave it a 3 star because Amazon jumped right on the defect and hopefully the next reel works like it should. The reel is actually a "sweepfire 10002B"made in Viet Nam. I can't wait to hook a shell fish on this light action rod. If the next one doesn't work I'll trash it. Have a good un.07 Aug update. Received my replacement kit and this time the reel works just fine. The only problem was one of the dividers in the case was broken. The package did not appear damaged so I figure it happened at the factory. Case still works fine so no biggy.

Bought this for a backpacking trip and had no problems with it. Only problem I did have was from putting too much line on the reel. Had no problem with the pole coming apart when casting or anything like that that I read in other reviews. I just made sure to put it together tight and firm. The carry case is a bit heavy, so I chose to hike with out the case, but the rod and reel are very light and packable. I'd buy again.

Great rod to use if you're just looking to fish off the dock or on land.  I wouldn't use it deep-sea fishing though.  The combo is meant for a maximum of 4 pound testline.  I have used it the whole summer and haven't had any issues with it.  I've put alot of force on the rod trying to break loose of many snags and the rod hasn't broken yet.  The Reel has 3 setting:1st setting - Left - allows the reel to spin in either direction (reel-in or let out more line)2nd setting - Center - allows the reel to make a clicking sound when something is pulling your line3rd setting - Right - one way reeling that locks doesn't let the fish get away unless it breaks your line.

these poles don't stay together, in order for them to be able to come apart --- they come apart when fishing too....I need to find a collapsible pole -- not this one =0(  the reel was descent though =0)
summary: I was sad when we actually finally went fishing

reviewText: I've received my rod on time. well few days after I got it, I went to fish for some panfish, and what I can say about the reel is that works very good even for casting I've tried some spoons and it worth, and about the rod, it is very flexible I caught 2 largemouth bass of about 6 pounds ea. it bended like if will break down, but finally nothing bad happened,I totaly recomend this kit,it came with out line but is good after all.
it is too hard to put together each time you need to use itnice case...however hard to get everything back in it
summary: too hard to put together each time

reviewText: Great little box for creek fishing.

If you're ever concerned about having a little fishing kit for your survival gear, I'd suggest this one.  It's large enough to carry many lure, hooks, fishing line, weights, etc yet small enough to fit into your pants pocket.  Note, the box comes empty!
Not much to say about this other than it's a nice sturdy little pocket tackle to take with you if you don't want to bring your bigger tackle.

I've used these little boxes over the years, but haven't bought new ones for a while. It seems that the manufacturing of the older, small boxes are much better than the new ones. I bought a couple of the larger boxes also and their quality seems to be as good as the older ones that I have.
summary: Okay, but could be a little tougher

reviewText: I've managed to stuff a Rapala Minnow Rap, a small popper, a Mepps Aglia Streamer, and a small square bill crank in the largest compartment, soft plastics (crappie tubes, small grubs etc), hooks, split shot and swivels in one of the small compartments, and a mess of panfish flies in the other.  For an angler that is either kayak fishing, or shore fishing and needs to walk a lot, space is premium.  This well made case will work well.  I had a nearly identical product called Hot Lids which was the same size and shape, only the shade of blue was different.  You "could" clip this to a caribiner, but with the risk of it possibly opening up and spilling the contents, I'd recommend keeping it in a jacket, jeans, or vest pocket.  I nearly exclusively bank fish, so having a few go-to baits in my pocket is perfect for a quick excursion.
the tackle box its great, I ordered to put in inside a Khaki/Olive Chinook Flotation Fishing Vest PFD - Large/X-Large]]=1317055100&sr=8-1
These lanyards look strong and long-lasting. Buy to use and give as simple gifts; they will do the job. There are 12 here, more than enough to go around.

I'm not sure if these lanyards should be used for this, but I use them on my cordless tools.  There are instances where I'm on a ladder or working in an open wall and I no longer have to be concerned with dropping my tools.  They have paid for themselves because there are a few incidents where they saved my tools!  If they can hold a drill, the can definitely handle an ID.
My review heading says it all.  I purchased a 12 pack to check quality and will now order more as I've been very satisfied wit the first batch.
summary: I use alot of lanyards for tech toys, flashlights, whistles, and small tools.  These are great and a very reasonable price!

reviewText: Just what i needed nd 12 of them too. good Deal for the price..... the quality was up to the task

It seems that you are required to have an emergency whistle close at hand will boating, kayaking, or canoeing.  A neck lanyard works well.  This one is thick enough to be comfortable.  It has a very positive clasp that will accommodate most whistles and is very secure.  Well made.  Probably last for decades.
Very nice lanyards at a good price! I will try to give some away. The colors look very nice also.

Exactly what I was looking for to hang my duck calls.  Well made and tough enough that I probably won't need to purchase another one for quite a number of years unless I decide I need additional duck calls and as any duck hunter will tell you,"You can never have too many duck calls".

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: These converter kits for mold based ear/Nostril plugs have devout followers in Russia where the crops are said to stink of "one hundred corpses" after fermenting. They can be used for the ears and nose, thereby effectively eliminating any source for bacterial congestion. Developed by a Prussian doctor who had constant to moderate sinus infections.

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: These converter kits for mold based ear/Nostril plugs have devout followers in Russia where the crops are said to stink of "one hundred corpses" after fermenting. They can be used for the ears and nose, thereby effectively eliminating any source for bacterial congestion. Developed by a Prussian doctor who had constant to moderate sinus infections.

I use this when working in the attic and under the house, and it works very well. The housing is pliable rubber that does a good job conforming to the face, and though I have a beard it still manages to seal. It is also comfortable breathing through it, because it has separate exhale valves. A great product!

The fit is good (feels good on my flat, hairless face) and it functions well.  The straps aren't the best and can slip a bit with use, but you can make your own or use a set you like from another/other mask.  In the deep south heat it can get pretty wet inside the mask, but it won't effect the mask to much (and it is the same for all masks).  Can't beat it for the price.  Cheaper than the big box AO paint masks, or 3M masks, but you can't find replacement filters as easily either.

reviewerName: J. Nowicki "The Boss and  Mrs. B."
reviewText: Who is that masked man? That's what my granddaughter wanted to know after seeing me wearing the AO Safety Woodworker's Respirator. It has worked fine for me thus far. I experienced no fogging and no face or head discomfort. I agree with another reviewer who stated he didn't have the desire to take it off and burn it like some other masks. Well put! After using a few at home as well as in the USMC, I know exactly what he means. This one is lightweight and as comfortable as you're going to get wearing this type. I haven't had mine on for longer than 30 minutes in mild temperatures. I can't say it would never get annoying if worn for an extended period of time in hot weather because, frankly in my experience, they all do. Don't forget to order yourself extraAO Safety Replacement Filters. ~ The Boss
This mask is very comfortable for long wear. Its designed so that the bottom rests just below your lip. Testing the seal on this yields excellent results. Filters are easy to replace.

the mask is fairly small, appears to be cheaply made especially the rubber strap - this strap will not stand the test of time. had i actually seen it in the hardware store i never would have bought, particularly at the near to $15 price. To me, the price/value would be more apt in the $8 range. It certainly does not look like the pic on amazon - the pic makes it appear larger than it is, the surface area of the filter hence will be limited in it's ability to handle larger volumnes of air over time- but then they want you to buy replacement filters faster.
summary: cheaply made, small, not worth the price

reviewText: Small plastic whistle.  Very loud.  Well made.  Works great. It is just what I was hoping it would be when I ordered.  It was shipped quickly and was well packaged.
summary: Just what I had hoped for.

reviewText: These whistles are very loud, compact and lightweight for easy carry. They are all made of black plastic. They seem durable. There is a ball within each whistle. This deal currently can't be beat for the price.
summary: Great product at a great price

reviewText: I bought this because I train my dog on a whistle. I have lost several whistles so far. It is cheaper to buy this pack then paying a few dollars a piece at the sporting goods store every time I loose one.

I was fooled by all the good reviews.  Perhaps the seller has changed this product just for my order. I got a dozen cheap Chinese knock-offs.  For reference, I own about 20 different kinds of other whistles.PRO:  It makes a whistling sound when you blow into it.CONS:  The plastic is cheap.  It feels like it will shatter if I drop it from 10 feet or so.  The pea inside is cheap plastic, not natural cork like the description says.  When I shake it, the whistle makes a cheap, plastic-on-plastic, rattling sound.  Compared to the Acme Thunderer 660, it's not that loud and more difficult to blow.  It's possible to over-blow this whistle.  There is no "MacGregor" symbol on mine, unlike what another reviewer has received.  There is not even a "Made in China" or "Made in Taiwan" label.  This whistle reminds me of a generic kid's toy you might get from a dollar machine.  To add insult to injury, the shipping took a long time.I'm going to give these to somebody I don't like and buy the real thing.  If you go cheap, you'll get burned eventually like I did.

I purchased these for my kids and for handing out to my son's scout troop.  The intention is that these be used as safety devices so that if they are lost or in trouble they can blow the whistles instead of yelling.The whistles are black with a ring that can be hung on a backpack, or which can be strung on a cord.  They are loud enough to hear from a pretty good distance, without breaking eardrums.Definitely recommend.  The price I bought them at made the whistles about 70 cents each.

These little whistles make a lot of noise and are great for hiking bags, cars and bug-out bags. If you had to get noticed you cannot yell very loud and these whistles make a lot of racket to get noticed- with very little energy expended.  At the very affordable prices stick em in your car and everywhere else you can think of -1 dozen great price and they work very well. I bought an assortment of various types and these work very well I consider these the best that I could get. Some of the pricey ones do not work very well and are marginal and big bucks. GET THESE- THEY ARE GREAT and inexpensive and they all work great from a little puff to a loud blow a lot of ear piercing whistle tone. Stick them - with a lanyard-to the pepper spray and you have another self-defense tool to attract attention if the situation gets unsafe.
summary: Very Small Very Loud- Work Better Than The Expensive Ones

reviewText: You might as well buy the dozen and give them to other teachers. These are all high quality and each of them worked just fine. Solid purchase.
summary: Great quality for the price. Use for school recess

reviewText: I purchased this because we run a soccer camp every summer with hundreds of children. To get the attention of one or fifty, a whistle helps!Positives: Great price. Clear sound. Simple whistle.Negatives: just be aware that they don't come with lanyards (I prefer to hold mine in my hand anyway.)You will like this if you need to get the attention of any group of children, dogs, or unruly relatives at a family reunion.
It whistles and that is about it, however I did drop it a couple time and it still works. I have no idea how else to review a whistle...
Great wiffle bat. Not the giant one that is an easy home run, but this one reminds you of the old stick ball days. Little bit thinner and better to practice eye-hand coordination.

A wiffle bat is a wiffle bat. It is 32" long and works as promised :) We've had a blast with it so far with soft foam balls and the normal wiffle balls. The price is good and the product came well packaged.
This is the best bat to play Wiffle ball with, hands down. It doesn't bent or dent like some of the others do.
there is nothing more to say than a wiffle ball game is the best game ever and made in ct

This 32 inch yellow Wiffle Bat is the classic hard plastic Wiffle Bat going back many decades.  I started using this Wiffle Bat back in 1976 while playing backyard Wiffleball and I still use it to this day because it's irreplaceable.  In other words, a classic.  It is very durable.  I've only owned maybe three or four of them in my lifetime because they are durable.  In addition to using the regular standard size Wiffle balls, I also like to fool around with the plastic practice golf ball "Wiffle" balls.  It's more challenging to hit the smaller Wiffle balls.  All in all, a great product that will last.
It works well against wiffle balls. This four dollar yellow bat is perfect for the kids in the neighborhood, adults too. Buy two for the family picnic.

When my six year old entered T-Ball for the first time, I went out to get him one of my childhood favorites, the Wiffle ball and bat. Imagine my surprise when I saw on the package that this all-American toy is still made in the USA! I figured it to be good practice for his swinging and hitting. It brought back many great memories of my grandfather and I playing ball out in the yard. I hope my son has as much fun with his as I did with mine.
This is exactly what you're looking for if you're shopping for a wiffle bat. There are lots of imitators out there, but for a backyard game of wiffleball, nothing beats this bat.

Bought this for a film production involving blunt weapons... one being a bat.The plastic is firm all around, so it should definitely hold up whether under stress of sporting or, in my case, bashing in zombie heads.The base also has a hole in it... not sure why, but that shouldn't be any trouble. Like I said, the plastic is rather sturdy.

Great bat. Just like the one I had when I was a kid. Terrific training tool which helps to develop hand-eye coordination. Saves your kids from the bumps and bruises of learning to hit a ball. Saves you form broken windows and dents in the cars.

Durable, bouncy, bright color...  all the hallmarks of a good tennis bowl.  These are great on concrete, clay, composite.  They're even great on a racquet ball court.  Just the kind of quality you would expect from Penn.

What can you really say about a tennis ball?  It's bouncy?  Well this one is and my dog loves to chase it.  I have another set of three I throw in with my down coat when I wash it so it doesn't get ruined.  Nice balls.

Have been looking for cheap tennis balls for use for games of fetch with my dog. I have a pitbull who makes quick work of the balls just with playing fetch. These balls hold up to a couple of sessions which is much better. With other balls, I would have to switch to a new ball half way through. These balls have a great bounce to them and are a great value.

This container of 3 Penn Championship tennis balls is exactly the one my parents bought for me one Christmas several years ago, and you know, the reason they bought them was very simple- tennis balls are soft, they bounce, and you can even throw them pretty far.  During my ball fascination, this is *exactly* what I wanted (and my parents liked the fact that a tennis ball sometimes hitting the side of a house or especially a window by mistake would likely NOT cause any damage!)  Truthfully, I've only ever played actual tennis with these balls on a couple occasions, but they worked pretty darn well.  I recommend them.  In fact, these are the only type of tennis balls outside the internet I've ever seen.  Maybe there's other brands but they aren't nearly as well-known.
Not really much to review besides the fact that these are some pretty solid tennis balls and that I plan on buying more when needed.I would recommend to someone else.
This was a great filler item, as I play tennis and needed a couple more bucks to use Super Saver Shipping. The balls are excellent quality, as expected.

$2.47 with Free Prime shipping when placed as an add on item.  That makes them about the same, or even a little less than I can find them at Dick's, Sports Authority, and other stores.  And I don't have to go shopping at the terror that is the mall to get to Dick's.I like the Penn Extra Duty.  They are ideal for hard courts and keep their bounce a nice long while.  Great for practice or training.  The only balls I like as much, maybe slightly better are the Wilson US Open Extra Duty.  But they aren't found cheaply on Amazon like these.  So Penn gets the nod.
summary: As an Amazon add on item, the price is right ~

reviewText: I don't play tennis.  I can't comment on how these would be on the court.  I bought them to be used in a hand held ball-chucker that I also bought on Amazon.  They fit in the chucker just as nicely as the one that originally came with it (different color, though).  I CAN for sure say that my dog loves to retrieve them!  I asked him if he had any comment but he just looked at me so I guess that means he agrees.  Enjoy!
I typically rate a tennis ball on two standards: how long it maintains its bounce and how long before the fuzz is off the ball. This ball is average.
Most people have probably used these. They're good tennis balls. Match quality. Just be careful not to cut your finger when opening the can :)
