Can't review for use for Tennis, but can say they are durable and my dogs loved chasing and retrieving them.
What can you say about a tennis ball but they work as designed and came in on time.

I have to confess, I got these for my dogs.  I needed a few more dollars to get free shipping, so I bought them.  They are well made, durable and clean up easily.  I have large dogs and they can shred things with ease.  The felt is of good quality and stand up to their teeth.  I bet they are good for tennis, too.
summary: I got them for my dog

reviewText: I suppose a tennis pro would feel differently, what I wanted was a ball that would bounce normally for my dog.  The dog toy tennis balls don't bounce worth a damn and the bell inside annoyed me. Finally, the price was right and I didn't need to by a large volume of balls.
summary: It's a tennis ball - how good can it be?

reviewText: I'm a tennis fan, always have been.  I've used these tennis balls many a time and they are indeed "extra duty".  They are durable, easy to see, and overall good quality.When I was a kid we used to play baseball in the backyard.  When we first started, we used a hardball.  However, there were too many close calls where somebody would hit a home run into the neighbor's backyard across the street and the ball would bounce and hit their sliding glass door.  So, we quit using hardballs and began using tennis balls.  So, baseball became tennisball.  We used to also stand in the middle of the street and toss the tennis ball up in the air and hit it with a tennis racket as far as we could.  The ball would often sail through the neighbor's trees, knocking off a lot of leaves, much to the dismay of the neighbors.  So, these Penn tennis balls can serve multiple purposes should you so desire.I've been watching the U.S. Open and what I absolutely HATE is on-net advertising.  There's a Mercedes-Benz logo on the far end of each side of the net.  I thought it was bad enough when the NHL began to allow on-ice advertising.  Now tennis has been allowing on-net advertising for some time now.  I swear, everything is a commercial nowadays.  I can't even watch a short video on YouTube without an advertisement popping up immediately.  I can't even watch a video on Comcast Internet without hearing, "The following is brought to you with limited commercial interruption by (fill in the blank)."  Then I have to wait for anywhere from 15-40 seconds before the commercial ends and I get to see the video.Anyway, I recommend these Penn Extra Duty tennis balls.
At this price, buy more than you need. Try and get them local - you will pay 4-10 times as much money! For the quality, they're balls. 'nuff said.
nice ball tube, the balls look a biy cheap on quality, they bounce just ok but have rubber imperfections on all of them (on the rubber lines)
summary: short hair, looks a bit cheap

reviewText: My dog loves these balls so much, he tells me every day. He says, "I just love these balls in my mouth, thank you so much!"

The tennis balls are good quality, but this is price gouging by Amazon.  I bought these balls on 2/10/14 for $2.19.  What happened in 2 1/2 weeks for the price to be tripled at $6.58/can on 3/2/14.  If you want to purchase these online go to Midwest Sports and order them for $2.99/ can or less if you buy a case.
These seem to be the same quality as the tennis balls of this type that I buy from the stores. No complaints.
These are playground quality swings. I only wish they came in a matte white Colorado - the dark glossy plastic gets hot in a hurry when the sun hits it.

Excellent swing seat. Heavy duty enough to last, but won't seriously injure if it swings up and hits someone. Just what I wanted.Never thought about swing seats until I put one up for my kids, but now I notice this exact model everywhere on public playgrounds.

I bought three.Don't be fooled into buying a cheaper product that includes plastic coated chains and hooks- they are crap and will last 6 months.  This swing is of a build quality you'll find at the finest outdoor park.  Swing seat is THICK 6" black rubber attached to heady duty welded triangles riveted solidly to the swing seat.  After 8 months outdoors with heavy use (several birthday parties, multiple kids/adults at a time etc), these show no noticeable sign of wear or quitting.Buy these, and you can expect your grand-kids to be swinging from them one day.
Just as good as the seats on swings at the park. Seems like it will last forever. Great product at a good price.

These are heavy duty playground quality swings.  I installed 2 of them for the kids and they love them.  They are super strong and long/wide so they wrap the kids firmly and safely.  Highly recommend.
Ok product, it delivers what it was offered on the product description.
Daughters basketball coach recommended she put some black tape on some glasses to improve her dribbling.  Looked kind of silly but worked.  Found these online and she likes them much better.

But, again, they seem to do what they're supposed to do.  I am hesitant to wear them outside while dribbling, already getting enough looks from my neighbors by doing my jogging while dribbling a basketball with Naypalm hand grips on, but these do indeed work.  At the same time, though, couldn't you just close your eyes?  Still for the price, worth the purchase, just don't expect to make a fashion statement or anything!!  LOL!!

My son ordered these to help with his dribbling skills.  He says they work well as they don't allow you to look down at the ball when dribbling--you have to keep your eyes forward.  I think they were a little expensive as they are just made of plastic.  But they have stood up to lots of use and sweat.
summary: My son says they work well

reviewText: i think its better for basketball but not for soccer. uncomfortable for kids that need to wear glasses with it.

Middle school BB coach suggested these to get my daughter out of the habit of looking at the ball while dribbling.They really do help and are made of flexible plastic so you do not have to worry about the glasses breaking if they get hit.
summary: Coach suggested these, they really do help.

reviewText: If you're buying the cheap chalk ball linked here, know that the ball comes with chalk already that will last you quite a while. You don't need to invest in this yet. That said, this came in the mail packaged well and now I have enough chalk for years of strength training.

There is a ton of this stuff, and it lasts a long time. I'm still on my first half block, using it three times a week for several lifts. I have pretty sweaty hands, but rubbing this in allows me to grip it and rip it on my lifts. Make sure you have a spare container to keep this in. I'm using a bagel-sized plastic storage container, which is great for allowing you to scoop out a pinch without making a huge mess. That said, this stuff will leave a powdery mess.

It's chalk, can't really go wrong with that. Got this box for cheap and each block lasts me a year or more (keep it in a ziploc container in the block form, its much less messy and easier to use, and it'll last longer). I use this for lifting and its indispensable for me.

This is exactly what I expected when ordering this chalk. I used it for my dead lifts last night and it worked just as good as other chalk I have used in the past. The price is great and it only took 2 days to get to my door!

I used this product all the time, and the amount they send you is great. I was worried it might be too small of an amount, but since the chalk is such high quality you don't need as much as other brands to get the same grip.  I would suggest this chalk to anyone looking for good gymnastic or weightlifting chalk
Great value for the price, these really helped with the grip issues I was having with deadlifts/rows/pull ups, the shipping and everything was great too.

I was a bit hesitant to spend $12 on chalk, especially on so much of it--I'm ocd when it comes to trying many different things first before buying in bulk, but I have no regrets here.The blocks are sturdy enough to not make a mess, and fragile enough that the chalk easily rubs into your palms. Three weeks of using this four times a week, and I can tell that my first block of eight from the package will probably last me six months, at least.

Ive used only 1 block of Chalk in a ziplock bag for months now lifting almost every day..... and its still got plenty in there!You will prolly never use the whole box of them!Unless....... you're one of those Gym idiots who doesnt know how to actually chalk their hands by making a huge mess of chalk everywhere wasting it.....Throw a block in a big ziplock bag and put it in your GYM BAG!I love this Chalk!!!Great Deal!
I use this chalk for my gymnasts. It works really well on bars! It is easy to use and easy to store.

I've pretty much tried it all before this. Liquid grip, sidewalk chalk, etc. Nothing gives me the same grip as GSC chalk, and they give you a bunch of bricks for what you're paying. Just don't walk by any cops.

Give me a break, this is chalk, I rub it on my hands, the powder stays on my hands and I can do pull ups, and my hands don't slide. That is the intention of this product. And as far as my experience goes it does what it was designed to do.
Its chalk, if you need it you know what to expect all probably comes from the same place, jsut good to have a lot around

Works great!  My grip has drastically improved. I won't be lifting without this chalk.  It is ground very fine and gives your hands a lot more friction. Makes lifting so much easier. It is messy of course, but easily washes out of your clothes.
chalk comes in boxesI use it for weightlifitingno frills no bull crapthis chalk will help with grip a lot
Works like chalk.  Good for gripping a barbell.  Also good for making your dog's head white when you pet him.
Great fix for a slippery Oly bar.  Just broke apart and threw some of this chalk in a little plastic cup and use it to help grip the bar and works great!

I put a block in a tupperware box and first use the dust that knocks off transporting it to and from the gym. This allows me to pull heavier without straps or mixing my grip. Be neat using this so that the gym doesn't ban its use!
If you work out at home or in a gym that allows chalk, this is a great buy for anyone that goes heavy or has sweaty palms.  I even use it with my gym cloves to a little extra stick.
too much for the money. If all my family work out everyday, then maybe we can use it all by 2100. If you need it buy it.
Great buy. Great price for the amount it brings. Cant ask for anything more from chalk. Buying  more soon to fill my bucket.
I use this product for power lifting and although I leave a mess in the gym when I'm done, it is easy to clean.

My deadlift had gotten to the point that "grip it and rip it" was no longer cutting it, thanks to my grip slipping/rolling out.This chalk was a VERY good way to help with that problem. One block broken up makes a surprising amount of chalk and should last a long time.The only con I've noticed with it is that it dries out your hands like you wouldn't believe. (Which IS kind of the point.) Have some lotion or something handy for after workouts and you'll be fine, though.

It's chalk.  It helps you hold on to stuff even when you're sweaty.  I use it for weightlifting.  What else do you need to know about gym chalk?  Nothing.  That's what.  I buy the stuff by the pound and bring a block to the gym every couple of weeks because, without chalk, I may as well skip the gym and go to Starbucks.
What can you dislike about a curl bar, does what I expected it to do. Not much else to say about a piece of bent steel.

Solid bar, good weight to it. The knurls are a little sharp but don't hurt. First time I used a curl bar, started out by adding 10lbs and ended up doing an extra 2 reps no sweat. Also is good on the back, I did not do any big bends backward. The bar is extremely comfortable on the wrists. I use it also for bench press, the middle curve lets me lower the bar down to the neck and drop arms below chest. It is also good for squats but I do front squats with straight bar, at least for now. There seemed to be a thin film of oil on the bar to stop rust, so I washed it with some 409, to help keep the clips in place. Two spring clips were included. The picture here shows flat spot in the middle, there is no flat spot, it is U shape in the center. The width is overall 47", straight line, curves not measured. This is a great bar, using short dumb bells for curls is horrible on the elbow, I had elbowitis for a year.
My husband really likes this bar. he says it is easier to hold and safer then the straight bars. Good for strength training
What can I say?  It's solid and well-made.  As far as I can tell, it's just like the one at my local gym, but for standard weight plates (1") rather than olympic.
summary: Good quality at a great price

reviewText: It does what it's supposed to do!  Excellent wrist angles, good weight, chrome...what else do you want?  Recommend to anyone.
summary: Champion Barbell 47 x 1-Inch Chrome E-Z Curl Bar

reviewText: Awesome product. I was debating about getting something a little bit more expensive because you tend to get what you pay for, but not in this case. This is one of the more sturdy 1 inch bars that I've seen and the price was well within reason. I couldn't leave my local Dick's or Sports Authority with the same quality for the price plus shipping. Showed up at my door within 2 days of ordering!
Wasn't sure if I was going to get a cheap tube curl bar etc, but this is a nice solid bar.  Mine came with 2 squeeze clamps to hold the weights on that I was not expecting.  Nice bar, buy it.
summary: Nice curl bar, 1" solid steel, weighs 10#

reviewText: Good bar to use with your home gym. I found it to be of excellent quality at a decent price, (plus amazon prime shipping) which is nice as I grow my home gym.

This is a solid bar at a good price. It has the revolving attachment that is nice. It is about what I expected and the price was fair. The only thing I am slightly disappointed with is the angle where it attaches to the cable. It is kind of hard to describe, but when I use it on my low cable doing rows the bars are not perpendicular to the cable. I think this is because the swivel part is not centered between the handles. I'm not sure if other bars are like this or centered more. It's not a deal breaker but if I was making one I'd look into this. I'd give it 3.5 stars. Hope this helps.
summary: Solid bar at a good price!

reviewText: Received item on time, and as described.  Very satisfied with the quality as it is a very solid piece of equipment

I was surprised at how heavy this was, yaaay. I was not sure of the quality to expect but, i am pleased. It should last for ...well, for ever. Its size is just perfect to draw my hands up to my sides on rows - for reference. Connector is smooth, comes with a little bit of grease already in it/on it. Finish is pretty decent.UPDATE; reduced rating, tried using this for triceps and its unusable for any amount of weight due to the curve not being a good stop for your hands and the almost 90degree downward bend. your hands end up buckling upward, half on the straight portion and half on the 90 degree bend of the bar. Sucks for this use, and is now overpriced for being a single use(for rows only) item.
This is as heavy duty as they come and is commercial gym quality.  Center swivel piece came well lubricated.  I used it with low pulley row for wider grip.

This is the best bang for your buck as far as exercise equipment goes.  When I first got this I could barely do five on my knees.  Now a few months later I can do actual full roll outs in push up position but have to take a break after 10 or 15 because my abs are burning.

I almost didn't get this ab wheel because it looked cheap. But, I didn't want to spend something on this for what it does.. its a dam wheel. Why should you pay for something higher than this? This is why I bought this. And I did not make the wrong choice. Solid built, seems like it can take a beating. I weigh 240lbs and this thing is durable. Will not break at all. Strong plastic indeed. The put together thing was easy, no manual is even needed. Just slide the sides together, snap and push in for sturdy tightening. After that, it's all you. It is tougher than what anyone would expect. So be careful. This requires a lot of back strength to push up and down. You can already feel the abs burning on the first couple strokes. I had to take a break. Do warm ups for your body prior to using this even simple stretches. The key to this is correct posture. Youtube has tons of tutorials on how to do them right. Over all. I'm happy. The picture doesn't show, but when you assemble this it comes with this nice durable foam cover for the handles. Its very comfortable and grip. A plus. :)
summary: Build solid for heavy use.. monster with a nice price tag

reviewText: I love this ab wheel because of the results I get.  I even travel with it.  Handle breaks down and the wheel is two part--two wheels put together so it's thinner to pack.  Price is great too!

This is the best piece of equipment for working your abs. It makes crunches a sissy exercise. It may be tough to use at first, but keep using it and I am sure you will be satisfied with your progress. Pick one of these up; they're dirt cheap.

Great tool for an overall upperbody workout.  Take it slow at first, cause you will feel it the next day.  I cycle, run, and lift weights almost daily.  But I was only able to do 5 wheels the first day I got it, and it felt like my abs were going to rip apart. :)  But after just a couple of weeks, I am up to 30 at a time.  Love it.  I can feel it working shoulders, abs, upper and lower back, biceps, triceps, and lats.  Great complement to any workout routine.  A good way to "top-off" after lifting weights.
The material of the strap is not rigid enough for putting the watch on your arm easily.Once it's on it look and works well.

I've had this for a few days so far. Fairly easy to install, seems about as durable as the original Casio strap (i.e. it should last for a few years and then break, just as all my Casio straps have). It's a good match for the Casio watch. Good thing it came with spring bars, since this watch has solid non-spring bars. One oddity - the strap is slightly wider than the inside of the buckle, so it's a bit hard to pull through.
I think this is a great watch strap for tough outside use, where leather or fancy straps don't do well,,,for the price, it's a good value...this strap lasts me about a year of tough use...Dave Murray
summary: I think this is a great watch strap for tough outside use

reviewText: Nothing fancy, but a quality lightweight black rubber strap for 19mm watches. Worth the $4.95 "add on" price I was offered, combined with free Prime shipping, how could you go wrong?

The band material is very thin.  This could be good or bad depending on your expectations.  To me, it is bad as I expected a heavier weight thicker material for a "sport" band.  The band is very comfortable as the material is very soft and pliable.The included spring pins are terrible.  I used them initially and my watch fell off!  Fortunately it fell onto my car seat and not onto the ground where it would have had the pins fails only seconds earlier.  Yes, I correctly installed the pins.  The stayed in place for several hours and then suddenly popped out.  I switched out the included pins for the ones that came with my original band.  The original pins that came with my watch are a full 3mm longer than the ones included with this band.I have since ordered a Spiedel band in the same 19mm size and it came with double telescoping pins even longer than my original ones.  The pins for the Spiedel band locks in extremely tight and feels very secure.This band is OK, I would have given the band alone 4/5 stars if they had not sent the crappy pins.  But since they were included and clearly either defective or the wrong size I give this 2/5.  Better to not include anything extra rather than including something potentially defective.
summary: band comfortable but included spring pins are useless

reviewText: I agree that the material is flimsy and very lightweight. Think about silicone cellphone cases as comparison. This can be a bad or good trait depending on your use. For me, I broke my other band long ago and wanted to use my Casio sports watch again for outdoor water activities. Having something lightweight on my wrist was ideal. When strapped on, the band feels very comfortable. I can't vouch for durability yet, but I don't think it will stay flexible for too long. But at this price, it's a good buy in my opinion, and besides it includes the spring bars to attach to the watch unlike some other bands. To see if 19mm is right for you, measure with a ruler the inside part between where the springs bars would go. In inches, 19mm is .748, or very close to 3/4 inch. Hope this helps, goodluck!
summary: Price is indicative of its quality

reviewText: Five stars since for the price this is a good quality replacement band. None of these plastic bands last forever but I have been using this on my workout (jogging) watch for several months and it is holding up just fine.
summary: Voguestrap TX1951 Allstrap 19mm Black Regular-Length Fits Casio and Other...

reviewText: Does not hold the ammo locked in place so you can load it, we don't even use it any more, this was a waist

This "speed loader" does not seem to be very speedy if you have to wiggle it to get the rounds in the cylinder.  When I tried just putting it in straight, it didn't work.  If I wasn't doing it right and have to wiggle it to get it in, then it's really not much of a "speed loader".  It's suppose to be fast, but it doesn't seem that fast to me.  Maybe I just need some practice with it, but it's not what I thought it would be.  Maybe it's better than just using your hands to put the rounds in one by one, especially in an emergency, but it's still too slow if you needed the rounds in in a split life-saving second.  Plus, an accidental inadvertent twist of the knob and you lose all your rounds.  Maybe I'll stick with my failure-proof semi-automatic pistol with spare 10-round magazines in a real emergency.

Using this speedloader is definitely faster than loading rounds one by one, but it takes a little practice.  And on my comp0act revolver, it's a pretty tight fit between the loader and the grip, making release a little sticky sometimes.
summary: does what it's intended to do

reviewText: I got two of these for my Rossi 38 Special. They hold the shells very well. They release the shells easily, but not too easy. I would highly recommend this product to somebody with a revolver.

This is a 5 shot speed loader, or atleast the two I recived.  however when i went to return the item amazon gave me a refund with no return nessisary. Thanks! I am sure i have a friend who will put them to use.
Well made product!  sure my wife will like them once she gets use to them.  Practice, practice, practice.  off to the range!
Does the work just right and the price is great. Good product. I will not hesitate to buy this product again if need it.

Doesn't fit the SP101 very well, but it will still work - it just doesn't go all the way in to the cylinder.  Overall good quality, and functions well.  Will probably fit and work fine on other revolvers.
summary: Works great, but doesn't fit Ruger SP101 very well

reviewText: Finally... found a site that sells the 5 shot speedloader for my 38 Tararus Titanium. I was concerned that I could not find another one to fit my gun.
Nice, well constructed and easy to use.  You just need holders to clip them to your belt, otherwise they are clunky to carry around.

Perfect for my 38. Holds tight and the release is quick and easy but not so easy you drop the bullets. Only issue I have is that it catches against the gun due to the tight fit of the cylinder but that is more a gun issue. You can easily compensate for it and with a little practice you can get pretty fast at it.

I got this speedloader  for my Charter Arms 38 "undercover" (which I love) and I had to use a dremmel tool to cut a scallop in the grip; quick easy project. The sppedloader works excellent now. Lines up perfectly with the five chambers in the cylinder. I'm buying another!
summary: fits my Charter Arms Undercover 38 with grip modification

reviewText: This speedloader works on my Tarus p85 snubbie revolver. It takes a bit of practice to clear the grip but once you figure it out it is good.

I just bought two of these at a local gun shop for my Ruger GP100 after comparing it to the Safariland loader which baffled even the sales rep in loading it. The Safariland loader also felt cheaply made and the HKS knurled knob makes it less slick to handle than the Safariland.

I haven't used it in the field yet but it seems to be what I wanted. The rounds stay in the loader and don't jiggle at all. My Smith is small and other loaders won't even go all the way into the cylinder. This has no problem. You stick it in and hit the release and the rounds fall in. I will be buying more.
Works great for my ultra-lite Taurus .38 special. Even though they are plastic, they seem tough and hold up well. The lock is tight and the bullets don't jingle even when in my pocket.I'm happy.
summary: Just what I was looking for

reviewText: It's a little hard to reload, but, I think that may be due to the Hogue grip that comes on it getting in the way vs the loader itself.  May be do issue if using the bantam grip or one similar.
I had to alter my grip to make this work for me. I have a model 642 with rubber grip. the wood grip models would work unmodified.
Good for the price, cheaper than I can buy local but if you drop it into your pocket, it loosens just enough that the rounds rattle (not enough that they release, though).

The small frame 5 shot .38 snubbie is still a very valid option for personal defense.  The biggest objection everyone seems to have with them is the small ammunition capacity.  The 36-A speed loader fits these little guns and provides a quick reload.  A couple of these can greatly enhance the capability of a pocket revolver and simplify carrying spare ammunition.The HKS 36-A is a well made product.  While these loaders are somewhat bulky compared to an automatic magazine, they are much tougher and less prone to failure from breakage or dirt.  They are small enough to drop in your pocket and durable enough to stand up to being sat on or dropped.  They hold ammunition securely and quickly reload your revolver with the twist of a knob.If you want your 5 shot snubbie to be a valid weapon system, buy a couple of these and carry them.  I own 6 of them.  Two of them I have carried for nearly 20 years with numerous trips to the range and they are still like new.  If one of mine ever breaks or wears out, I will gladly replace it.
summary: HKS is the standard for revolver speed loaders

reviewText: The HKS 36-A speedloader for S&W is NOT for a RUGER LCR! No way no how will it work. I've read a post that claimed it worked but the handle was to wide to allow a better fit. That is not true......won't work on that handgun!
summary: HKS 36-A speedloader for S&W NOT RUGER LCR

reviewText: This speed loader works just fine.  Many of the low ratings are people who have grip interference.  If your grip sticks out where the cylinder is when open, any speed loader is going to catch on it, that's just how it is.  You either need to trim/change your grips, or accept speed loaders won't be ideal for you.This worked fine with my SP101, though the grip does prevent it from seating fully.  But just turn the knob and the rounds will all drop in fine.It also works, or at least can be used, with my LCR.  It will not fit all the way in, but you can nose the rounds in, turn the knob, and they drop in fine.  You do have to be careful not to push them too far or it will bind.  It isn't ideal, but HKS does not state or claim that this speed loader will work with the LCR.  And if you look at an LCR and an SP101, the cylinders are not the same size.  So it's not that surprising that it binds on an LCR.I initially had a bit of trouble with one of the slots.  The "catch" wouldn't swing out to lock when a round was in place.  I pushed the cartridge lip into the loader a bit, while pushing the knob in at the same time, and it locked over it.  I haven't had any subsequent issue loading it.  And you don't fill a speed loader in a critical situation, you empty it.  So I'm not too concerned.  But that's why it is only 4 stars.
summary: Does what it is supposed to.

reviewText: Perhaps not the best that money can buy but an excellent loader for the price.  It all depends on whether you are going to place your life in the hands of a speedloader.  It is a matter of what you get used to, this one does work.  This one was for Ruger  LCR and fits just right.
Very functional and light when filled. Give them to my wife for Christmas and she is fully loaded  and pleased !
summary: Nothing says Merry Christmas like a Speedloader!

reviewText: Does NOT fit a Taurus Protector Pro polymer Model 85! Otherwise the quality seemed good, and the price point was fine.
summary: Does not fit ALL Taurus models

reviewText: This speed loader works great with my 2" snub nose .38.  It won't work with long nosed target ammo.  However, when you place quality defensive hollowpoint ammo into the speed loader, I found it very each and quick to reload my gun.

The speed loader is great, but my wife's Taurus 85 cylinder will not swing-out far enough for proper operation without hanging on the cylinder release lever.  This was listed for my wife's gun, but will not work with it, unless you get used to dropping the rounds into the cylinder at an angle.  Very klutzy operation.  Useless, really.

This HKS Revolver Speedloader works well on the Charter Arms Undercover and "Pink Lady" 5-shot .38Spl models. These are reasonably well made and significantly speed up the realoading process with just a little bit of practice. I have used HKS brand speedloaders for most of my wheel guns and have always found them to work as expected.These initially feel light weight and fragile since they are mostly plastic and aluminum (I think), but have found that they are plenty durable for range use and concealed carry backup.Recommended!CFH
summary: Works Well On Charter Arms 5-Shot Revolver - Recommended

reviewText: I got this for my girlfriends Charter Arms Pink Lady 38spc revolver. It works great and would definitely recommend it.
This works just like other speed loaders I have had in the past.  I only wish I could get faster.
Works great on Rossi M68 38 special. I have the Hogue mono grip and there is no interference in loading.
Perfect addition to my carry gun. A little tight on a small frame revolver, but it still fits the bill
I was skeptical about this purchase, however, I am now certain that this was a very good purchase.  practice the speedloaders and they become second nature.

These work just fine with my S&W revolver.  I have the M&P 340 with some aftermarket VZ grips which are a little thicker than the stock boot grip that comes on the 340.  The speed loaders fits just fine between the VZ grips and the cylinder face, and I haven't experienced any binding of the rounds as I load them.  I also carry .357 Mag rounds instead of .38 Spl.  Even with the extra length of the 357 casings I still have no binding problems.  These loaders hold the rounds in there tight and the the rounds themselves don't giggle around once they are locked into the loader.  These are really reliable loaders... IMHO.
summary: Works with my Smith & Wesson M&P 340 with aftermarket grips

reviewText: this is a great little loader, simple, light weight and works perfectly. I bought a second one and plan to buy a few more to stash them here and there

I purchased 3 different pairs of speed loaders for 3 different revolvers.  This one and the 6 round speed loaders work perfectly, but the 7 round one is difficult to lock the rounds in place.That being said, this is a beautiful speed loader.  The rounds lock in with a light twist and fall out just as easily.  This one is also the easiest to load fast in practice, most likely due to only having to get 5 rounds in the cylinder holes instead of 6 or 7 but it's still very easy to use fast.As easy as it locks the rounds in place it unfortunately opens just as easily.  Tried carrying it a bunch of different ways, and so far I had one release the bullets when being carried inside a vest pocket.  That's a major bummer, but carrying in a side speed loader pouch or even inside my pants pocket seems to work just fine.
summary: This is the BEST Speed Loader out of the sets I purchased.

reviewText: I have used these for years and the quality, usefulness is always there  regardless of model. Good job HKS, keep it up.

The speedloader works great. It locks the ammo securely and is easy to use. I purchased 2 for reloads for my carry gun a Ruger SP101 357 magnum. With practice you can reload very quickly with these. Word of advice/warning with the compact revolvers the cartridges only go about half way in before you hit the grip. This is not an issue in my opinion it's due to the compact nature of the revolver. Just drop the loaded speedloader in and twist the knob and let gravity do the rest. A must have for a revolver owner in my opinion.
I never used one of these before but I am glad I finally got one.  It is so easy, dump spent brass and shove new ones in.  Great.  Darrell

These speed loaders do the job nicely.  I really like this one which you twist the top to release the rounds into the cylinder.  It works great and holds the rounds securely until it is time to reload.

This is a really great item to have at the range. Its simple to use and cuts down on the reloading time. It is very well made and should last a very very long time. I would recommend this to my freinds.
This product is solid and works flawlessly easy to use and great to carry a few extra rounds. Would buy again!
Bought this (two actually) for my Ruger SP101. They hold the rounds well, load smooth and quickly, and do pretty much exactly what they are designed to do. And ........ they do it well.

If you are using this on a Ruger LCR 357/38 you should keep in mind this will load MUCH SMOOTHER with 38 rounds because of its bulky design. it is meant to hold both 357 and 38 rounds but for a smaller gun the 38 rounds work and load better.

I'm speaking only for using for Ruger SP 101 . It works perfect & flawlessly.I recommend for SP101 users to go with "Star shape" one.A little more expensive but those cut out groves on "Star style" will help to not get engaged with the grip when it's in use.HKS 36 does the work if you know how use them .If you try the HKS and the Star style,you'll get the point.I do have them both styles and use them all time.Satisfied after all.DT
summary: Good enough for SP 101 but not Great.

reviewText: I own several HKS speedloaders and they all work well, this one is no exception. They are made of sturdy material and require little to no maintenance.

I have a Taurus 605 Stainless 357 Magnum and Ruger SP 101 357 Magnum with 2.25" barrels.  These guns serve as my concealed carry weapons.  Being armed with a 5 shot capacity and backup gun, also with 5 shots, I need a speed efficient method of reloading.  This speedloader works for both of my guns that were supplied with the factory grips.  However, I have switched to the Pachmyr grips.  This speedloader, holds 5 bullets and is secured by turning the metallic knob on the other side.  A small wedge stabilizes the bullets in the speedloader.  I have had 2 speedloaders which still work since 1993.  In the current craze of semiautomatic weapons, I will probably carry 6 speedloaders to ensure that I have enough ammunition.Constructed of plastic and aluminum knob, this is lightweight, even when loaded with 357 or 38 + P Jacketed Hollopoints.Use is simple.  Just empty the spent cartridges from your barrel, align the bullets and turn the knob.  This process does take about 4-5 seconds, which gives the advantage to my Glock 23 and ParaOrdnance P-14 (winter carry).  However, in sunny Florida, it's hard to conceal a full sized service weapon in shorts and a T-shirt.This is a great tool for any shooter with a revolver.  I have 4 for the guns that I carry.
Works great.Needed extra speedloaders and this works just as good as the other one that my wife have. Yes, I would recommend it.
So far so good. They do the job. I have not used any other type to compare them with but they have not fail me .
These are great for carrying and loading your revolver.  There is no problems to the item and everything is nice.
summary: These are great for speed-loading and conceal carry.

reviewText: Works well with my Ruger LCR .357.  Seems to be decent quality and easy to use.  Looking forward to see how will it holds up over time.  will update my review after a few months of use.
It holds the rounds for loading. It really makes loading my revolver easier. Perfect fit for my Charter Arms Bulldog. Not much more to be said.

This product is about what I expected. Kind of clunky and unnatural for me. It will take some getting use to.it holds the ammo berry well and fits into the cylinder easily. It is big enouph to fit larger hands and is great for storing backup ammo in the glovebox. Quick and easy to retrieve.

These are really great for my Ruger Sp 101.  The .357 are sometimes a bit long for these, but .38 special work great.  I bought some speed strips also, but like these better.  Quicker to drop in the revolver.  I would definitely but a couple more of these if I needed them.
Its relatively inexpensive and works as intended with most revolvers. Overall I'm satisfied with my purchase because it was so cheap.

The speedloader is okay, being that this is my first speedloader purchase.  I expected something that I wouldn't have to twist to release the bullets, I thought it was going to get a press to release.  I don't know if that type is available out there so I'm happy with the product.

I got 2 of these for my Model 36 S&W revolver along with the leather holder for my belt.  These are great quality and work well to decrease reloading time and work well with the Packmayr grips that I also purchased.
Pro'sHolds bullets.In expensive.fast shippingcon'sCheap plasticdoes not fully insert into my S&W; .38 featherweightbullets wobble around worry about them coming dislodged in pocket.
summary: Plastic and does not fit my S&W .38 featherweight.

reviewText: After looking around and by reading other reviews I established that the HKS 36-A is the one for my 5-shooter Ruger SP-101Amazon copies the description that HKS has and those descriptions needs some major review and corrections.- like showing and saying it is a 6-shot speedloader, when the SP-101 is a five shot gun!It feels a little chintzy (that;s why the 4 stars) but it works. I tried it many times by now and I can work it without any problems with my SP-101 (with original grips - I hear/read that the Hogue grips get in the way).

Works perfectly with Ruger LCR .357 with Hogue Tamer grip.  I gave 4 stars rather than 5 because I would prefer all metal rather than any plastic parts.  It does appear to be well made, and I have not had any problems using.

First off, I love these in the 6-shot versions.  They seat all the way in & does its job well.  Great for nightstand...In the 5-shot version, I read that Ruger LCR with Hogue tamer grips don't work well.  I have a Ruger LCR with the Boot grip.  There are no issues with the loader getting hung-up on the grip (like the Tamers).  The problem is that the 5-shot spacing is not identical to the Ruger.  Thus, the further the speedloader is seated, the results are your casings getting wedged in the cylinder.  For best results, seat the ammo about 1/3 of the way down -- anything further & you can really get wedged in.  To simulate a stress situation, I pushed the loader in deeper... the results were that when I twisted the release knob, the rounds did not drop in the cylinder... & I had to finesse the loader off the wedged rounds.  If you force the loader free, a couple rounds could easily come back out & drop (leaving you with a randomly filled cylinder).While these work well enough for range time, beware of its limitations for CC use or other stressful fire situations.  On the plus side, I've become much faster & comfortable with my Bianchi Speedstrips ;)P.S. If you are looking for Ruger LCR speedloaders, be aware that these are the SAME ones that Ruger currently sells on their own website.  I recommend waiting (& hoping) that some manufacturer makes a better fitting loader.
summary: Does not work well with ANY Ruger LCR...

reviewText: Some things are amazing to look at and see the time and thought it took to come up with the idea and manufacture it.

This is a good alternative to carrying loose rounds in your pocket, especially if you are using this for "concealed carry".  Reloading quickly is made much easier with this product.  I plan to purchase more of these in the future.
These work really well on model 36 and 60s,have not tried them on a Rossi of Taurus. See no reason why they shouldn't work. They are also quiet, that is don't rattle as some do.
Great product, cheaper than anywhere else. I figured for the price it would be a knockoff but it isnt. I will definately buy another one.
summary: it is a true HKS speedloader not a knockoff.

reviewText: With this handy gadget, reload one round manually, or 5 rounds simultaneously, in the same amount of time.  Remember to load, holding the larger black cylinder, rather than the silvery knob, to avoid dropping rounds before they're chambered properly.

This speed loader is ok but to me it seems a bit cheap.  Once the bullets are in the loader correctly and you lock them in ( I use the work LOCK with some reserve) they seem to be fine.  However, I have my doubts as to weather that lock will stay locked if I put them in my coat pocket or pant pocket.Perhaps it's just me, but I though it was a bit high priced for the quality it appears to be.If you're wondering, no I've never carried it to prove if what I'm saying, instead I bought a pouch with two strip loaders to carry instead.If I was just going to use them at the range and carry them in a container loaded I'm sure the loaders would work fine, but at $10 a piece, how many are you going to buy?

As much as I love HKS Speedloaders, I do have one or two minor complaints about them. The first time or two you use the speedloaders they lock nice and tight. I wish it would stay this way through their entire lives. But they do loosen up after a few times. They still work good though. Also, I wish they held the rounds better in a snug pocket. Before I received my speed strips I would toss a speedloader in my pocket and sometimes within a few minutes the rounds were loose in my pocket. But that is more of just bad planing instead of a bad product.

I recently bought a Ruger LCR 357 and replaced the Hoag grips with Crimson Trace grips.I have seen several reviews where people have had trouble using the 36-A with the LCR. While the loader is a little tight, I've been using them to compete without an issue; it just takes a bit of practice. After about 500 rounds you get used to it and it's a non-issue and definitely better than using strips or manual loading.The only thing better would be moon clips for the LCR but so far no one makes them.

I bought 3 of these HKS speedloaders for my S&W; 60-14 "Ladysmith" in .357 Magnum, which I conceal-carry.The speedloaders, like all HKS speedloaders need a bit of cycling before they break in. At first they are very stiff, making it difficult to engage and release the rounds into your revolver's cylinder. After a few cycles of locking/unlocking them using the rounds you plan on carrying, they loosen up enough that they'll hold the rounds firm until you twist the knob, but when you do twist, the rounds will drop free quickly.I also own a pair of 5-Star Firearms' speedloaders, and those work much better right out of the box, and are built tougher... but the HKS speedloaders are 1/3 of the price and 90% as good (10% less cool because of the break-in tinkering required, but in the end they both do the same task well and reliably). I like HKS products and own their speedloaders for 6 and 7 shot .357 Magnum revolvers, and would buy these again.

This is an inexpensive speedloader made for several versions of revolver. This was supposed to fit my S&W 637..and it almost does. Fits into cylinder about 70% but not completly. If you find the correct angle you can get it to work...but this does work...
Works, but just a bit flimsy, but I guess you can't beat the price.  Holds rounds securely without too much movement.
Its a nice simple speed loader, however it do not fit my Taurus 605 very well. I don't think it would be easy in an emergency situation to reload. Hope my aim is good :)
summary: doesnt really work with my weapon

reviewText: This is a necessaity to have with your revolver.  It only takes a few seconds to load my revolver with this speedloader.

I ended up buying a second one of these when I noticed how reliable and quick/easy to use. I timed it with a friend and it shortens the reload time by 5-6 seconds. I use a .38 S&W bodyguard as a CCW, these go nicely with it.

This works okay, but like other have said, not a perfect fit.  A good fit though.  I like it and I actually ordered two to put in a pouch and I think I will like them.  I just give it 4 stars because it's not like the bullets slip right in easily and off you go.  They fit alright about halfway in then you must release them and shake it a little to get them in.  I am sure this speedloader works perfect with other guns.  Mine is a Ruger LCR 357 mag.  Just not a perfect fit for this 5 shot cylinder.  Mostly fits though.So, I have come back to update my review.  If you own the Ruger LCR 357 do not buy this item!  Buy the J2 speedloader from Five Star Firearms (or anywhere else you can find it).  I still give this one 4 stars because it works (kind of) but the J2 is made for the LCR and works perfectly, and is made of high grade aluminum.  It is more substantial, it fits the LCR with the hogue grip or the crimson trace grip and it is 10X faster.  The cost is 19.95 each, so it is more, but well worth it if you want a product that works absolutely perfectly.
good takes skill to operate quickly
works great good qaulity

I purchased two HKS 36-A Revolver Speedloaders for my newly purchased Ruger LCR .38 Special +p revolver.  The pistol holds only five rounds of .38s since it is rather small and the rounds are rather large, a compromise in both directions.  Still I wanted the additional confidence of have extra rounds at my disposal (this comes from years of owning a Glock 23 .40 cal that my magazines held a maximum of 13 rounds each and 5 just made me uncomfortable).  With the additional purchase of the HKS 203M-P Plain Double Speedloader Case, Black, Medium, I am now back up to being able to have 15 rounds, only with the additional time needed to empty the cylinder of the five casings at a time and quick load five fresh rounds.  Good product at a very good price.
It works and she likes it. Also got some snap caps so she could practice. Proficiency is a good thing!

Great speedloader. There is a bit of a break-in period where you have to place the bullets in them perfectly to get the loader to lock up tight, but after a couple of uses the plastic clasps wear down from a fine point to a rounded edge, and you'll find it's a lot quicker to load them up and lock them down without having to be super precise. I would recommend this product.

I carry dual 642's for personal protection and one thing I hate is i am limited to 5rds each, well not anymore! these are absolutely amazing, and very easy to use. Holds the ammo securely and is very concealable in the uncle mikes holster
Got this for my S&W 442... It works well but it is very very tight fitting the ammo its the cylinder. Just got this to have and I hope I never have to reload that fast....

I bought this for my 38.SP and it holds the rounds nice, i did a speed test on my self and noticed that without a speed loader and under stress from a possible gun fight or worse it would take me some 10 seconds or more to fully load 5 rounds, and some got dropped. Also i must say i am not a professional gun shooter so im sure there are a lot of people that can do it better then i can, but i am just speaking as an Avg gun user. Now with this speed loader my best time under stress was about 3-5 seconds or better, which is or could be life or death. So yes i do suggest this item to everyone that needs it!

These are plastic and don't seem very durable. And, they don't really align very well with my 5 shot ruger. Overall they will suit my purpose but I think in the future I would upgrade to metal loaders.
Revolvers are making a comeback. This fits a five shot Charter Arms .357 Mag Pug ported. Purchase two and feel confident you'll have the rounds you need when or if needed.

I do not carry a CCW revolver without at least one of these with me someplace.  They are really fast reloads if you practice with them, if you don't you might jam up your gun.  But they are the best I have used.  Just insert bullets in about 1/3 and twist the dial, close the cylinder and BANG your back in business.  A must for those of us who still believe a .357 snubby is better than a 9mm pocket piece.
summary: Check your grips to be sure they won't get in the way.

reviewText: Does exactly what I need, which is keep some extra rounds handy.  The speed loading isn't quite as speedy as I might like, but it's better than fiddling with the individual rounds.
every revolver owner should have 2 of these. faster loading at the range and easy to keep ready in your pistol case. It was a Smart person who designed this time saver.

I own a S&W 642 J frame. This speed loader fails to do its job.  While the literature states that it fits my weapon, this is entirely false.  I have the factory stock grips on the weapon, and the speed loader gets jammed against the grips.  It is anything but a speedy load.  In fact, it will get you dead.  I have unfortunately found that the fiddling with this speed loader to extract it after loading takes substantially longer than simply loading in five shells into the cylinder by hand.  I am trying out some Bianchi Speed Strips (also sold here on Amazon) and will rate those soon. But in the meantime, do not expect this speed loader to work with the 642 or any other J frame.  It will not, and if you take your safety and that of your family seriously, please do not purchase this product.
summary: Does not do what it is supposed to with S&W J frame

reviewText: Fits great, works perfect in my S&W Bodyguuard 5-shot .38 SPL revolver.  Body is rigid plastic, knob and locking mechanism is metal.  When the rounds are locked in it feels very secure.  Knob requires a firm twist to release the rounds, I have never had these come loose in a pocket when I used to carry them that way.  i have since bought a case to hold 2x of them in, safer that way.

Great concept, and it probably works good with a j-frame no problem.  I have a Taurus version, and it kinda catches on the grip, but a little wiggling gets the load in the cylinder.  Probably not the best in a high stress situation, but easier than fumbling for individual rounds in your pocket.
One of, if not the most common 5 shot/.357 speed loader. works well, requires some amount of practice to use it reliably. Seems to be made reasonably solid, no wiggle once the bullets are locked in.

just what I ordered !fits A-Zoom snap caps and .38 special ammo  fits in pistol perfect and great for training on how to use snap caps/ speedloaderI would recommend this to any one who needs to learn how to load faster

People be advised. This speedloader is good. Price is also attractive. But speedloader didn work with the both grip paanels a had for my taurus 85. original wood panels as well as hogue monogrip where too thick for reloading using hks speedloader. I had to cut off a peace on my Hogue grip to allow reloading. also be advised that you need to rotate the knob to release rounds, it means you have to fix cilinder with your finger while reloading and this might be a tricky thing to do.product itself works great but 4 stars only because of rotating knob.nevertheless reloading is waaaaaay faster than reloading rounds one by one.
summary: item is good but will it work with the gun?

reviewText: I bought this for my wife S & W .38 Special Pistol Model 637 and it works great. I wanted her to have an extra five rounds to load. I would recommend this to all my friends.
I am not an expert, but this is working exactly how I expected with my Ruger SP101. I am going to buy a couple of more.
summary: Works fine with my Ruger SP101

reviewText: These speedloaders fit great with the HKS case and the Loaders provide you with a secure fit and quick release into cylinders..Well made!.. No regrets. I purchased 2 so im well equipped with 15 shots...Dont mind puting away the Glock when I have these babies...lol

I have bought these same speedloaders in the past. When I decided that I needed more speedloaders buying more of the exact same ones made sense. They real simple to use and easy to familiarize yourself with. i have never had a prblem with them and they have been bounced around in my truck for almost a year now with no problems. I can always trust that they will be ready when I need them most.

Good price,  works  alright  with a Ruger LCR,  but casings only go in about half way before they bind up.  Would have given 5 stars if this was all metal ( black portion is  decent plastic,  knob is metal )  and if it worked better with my gun.
I bought this for a S&W; a Airweight. it is a VERY tight fit.Recommend QuickStrip 5 round for S&W; Airweight

Tried this guy out to fit on my S&W .38 Airweight, model 637. The cylinder on the revolver doesn't swing out far enough for the loader to clear it. You can still use it but it's very awkward. The loader itself seems great, releases and holds fine.
summary: Does not fit on S&W Airweight

reviewText: I was in a class, and I did not have these, I will be ready for the next class for sure.
summary: What a big help these will be.

reviewText: I like shooting my revolver because I don't have to chase the brass, like I do with my semi-automatic pistols. The downside is the awkwardness of the reload process.This device removes that awkwardness. Just open and drop my old brass into a bag or bucket then seat all 5 bullets at once with this device and I'm off again.For the range I can pre-load these and set them on the bench in front of me. For carrying, couple this with the speed loader case and you are prepared for whatever comes.This is an ingenious little device!
summary: Very handy for reloading my revolver

reviewText: Fast shipping exact order and hks just the way I remember. Loads in my smith body guard as fast as a mag... Used these things for thirty years. Practice and you will be fast!

I ordered two of these speed loaders from buck n doe. I was very impressed with the fast and free shipping. The speed loaders do exactly what they should and work like a champ in my charter arms .357 pug. They securely hold both .38special & .357Magnum. they are made of light weight plastic but for the price I wouln't mind having a few more.

The speedloader seems like a good product in terms of quality and function, but it does not fit my revolver.  The website does not specify which models this speedloader does and does not fit.  I purchased this speedloader for my standard .38 S&W; Model 442 Airweight.  The gun is plain old normal factory specs from the manufacturer, no after market parts, no customization, etc.  The speedloader doesn't even feed in half way to the cylinder before it gets  stuck.  You may want to do some research on this item to fitting your gun before you go through the hassle of ordering and returning.The ad on the website does not provide the information, but now that I have the item in front of me, I can tell you what is says.  This item on amazon is for a:  HKS Speedloader, model 36-A.  The packaging says it fits 5 shot, .38 Special, S&W; models 36, 37, 38, 40, 42, 49, 60 // Charter Arms // Taurus 85.

I use my S&W; 38 special body guard for home defense and because it only has 5 rounds I wanted to get a speedloader to quickly reload in the case that I needed to.  This speedloader works great and has no problems with jamming against the grip like in other reviews.The knob works by being set in 2 positions.  Load the ammunition while in the open position, the bullets will be loose until you screw the knob counter clockwise to the left.  Once the knob is clicked into place in the closed position the bullets will be securely held.  It will take a little bit of force to turn the knob into the closed position.I find that it is easiest to hold the revolver with the cylinder open with your left hand (thumb on one side of the cylinder and finger on the other to keep it from moving while releasing the ammo from the closed position.  If you don't hold it down in this manner your cylinder may move when trying to load the gun.Unlike locking the ammo into place it takes a lot less effort to release the bullets.  It fits perfectly inside the cylinder and releases the ammo smoothly.  Just turn the knob clockwise to the right and the ammo slides into place.There is a warning on the back that mentions that it may get jammed against over sized grips so if you have one on your firearm this may not be the speedloader for you.These are the firearms it lists that it is compatible with:.38 and .357  - S&W; 36, 37, 38, 40, 42, 49, 60, 640 Charter Arms, Taurus 85, 605, Rossi 68, Ruger SP101.
summary: Speed loader a must for revolvers in HD

reviewText: I did not have any problems using this with my Ruger LCR in 38spl.  Some people mentioned that it doesn't work properly but I didn't have a problem.  I practiced using the loader (whithout shooting) so I don't even have to put any thought to it anymore.

Asked for HKS 10-A but the one that was displayed was the HKS 36-A.HKS 10-A fits S&W; 10, 12, 13, 14, 15, 19, 64, 65, 66, 67, Dan Wesson, Carter Arms*,Taurus 65, 66, 80, 82, Rossi**HKS 36-A fits S&W; 36, 37, 38, 40, 42, 49, 60, 640 Charter Arms*, 342, 342PDTaurus 85, 605, Rossi** 68,Ruger SP101Note to Amazon:HKS makes at least 7 different speedloaders for .357 Magnum.  Do not attempt to use a loader with a revolver for which it was not intended.

Bought this for a S&W bodyguard. The fit is real tight. By that I mean when you use it, the speedloader will rub against the frame of the revolver. Its still an improvement over a pocket full of loose rounds though.

A must have for revolver owners. Fit is a bit tight on five shot revolvers and you should consider the size of your grip when purchasing as it can get in the way.Positive cartridge retention and easy to grip and turn knob.

I have a Smith and Wesson 38 Special Model 37 that I inherited.  It came with one HKS Speedloader and I thought it would be handy to have another.  Speedloader makes reloads speedier.  Great at the range.  Works just like it should.

I purchased 2 of these for my Cobra Shadow. The lightweight revolver is chambered for 38+p and this 36-A fits it perfectly. There is a little contact with the cylinder release but it doesn't interfere with operation. The only part I don't much care for is that the cartridge holder part of the 36-A is made of polymer. It is durable but I'd still prefer aluminum.

Bought a couple of these for my wife's 38 pink lady. She loves them especially when we are target practicing. She can load quickly and shoot and while I am shooting she reloads her gun and both speed-loaders. She wants me to buy her two more. :)

i bought this to reload my taurus 5 shot .357. it works well. it holds the bullets very tight so they don't wiggle around. it is a little tricky to get them out because the rubber overmold grip is so big... but it just takes an extra second (or replacing the overmold grip which i plan to go with a crimson trace laser grip). good purchase. good price.
I will be purchasing another one, didn't want to buy two from the start but after using this for a while I want another. Loads easilyand fits my pistol properly, it's easy to load.

Nice speedloader; works great and seems to be manufactured well. HEADS UP TO CONCEAL CARRY REVOLVER OWNERS. I own a Smith & Wesson .38 Special +P Hamerless Airweight and this speedloader did not work well with it. With the right amount of wiggling and twisting it you could get the bullets to all fall out into the cylinder but I would never recommend relying on that in a firefight. The reason for this happening is because the Airweight pistol's cylinder does not open away from the frame far enough and the black plastic from the speedloader rubs against the frame when trying to insert the bullets. Works well on a full sized frame.
summary: Not For Smith and Wesson Airweight .38 special +P

reviewText: purchase this speed loader for my 357 snub nose, works great will be purchasing more to keep handy for home and at the range

At first I couldn't get these to work on my S&W; 38 Airweight. The grips on the pistol were too thick. I contacted S&W; and explained the problem. They sent me the old style grips at no charge and that fixed the problem. The speed loaders work great. I have had no problems with them.Thank you Smith & Wesson for your great service.

Even though this states it works on Taurus Model 85, the cylinder really does not swing out enough for this to be useful. I can load manually much faster. Also, I found the mechanism that locks the rounds in place is hard to use and awkward. For 5 round cylinders, I say you are better manually loading.
this are quality reloaderswork for 38sp and 357M;I use them for LCR 357of course bulkythey do their job......hope never to need them under fire.......but I am sure they will work

The Ruger .357 SP101 is a great little revolver but the cylinder only holds five shots.  A couple of these HKS 36As will significantly improve the firepower of the weapon.  I use HKS speedloaders in many of my revolvers of different configurations and they never let me down.  RJB.
and it works....What can be said about something as simple as this.  It works!  And its not that expensive!Thats all I can think of...
summary: Its what you think it is

reviewText: This speedloader has great quality, holds the shells firmly, releases them easily, and works as advertised.  Note that it doesn't quite fit perfectly with the Ruger LCR with standard Hogue grips, as the grips get in the way of it lining up perfectly. So you have to load them at an ever-so-slight angle (and can't put any more than the tips of the bullets in the cylinder) rather than loading them all the way in before releasing them.  The LCR is super compact (but with relatively wide grips), however, and I don't think you'd have that problem with most revolvers listed as working with it.
summary: Good quality, great price, does the trick

reviewText: However, I purchased the wrong one for my gun, the loader catches on my revolvers cylinder latch stopping me from pushing the whole thing in like I would like.
If you have a 5 shot revolver, this is a must have.  No loose flopping rounds.  They drop right in. FAST and works great.

The speedloader works well but it does take some practice. Because the small cylinder does not allow the cartridges to be inserted straight in before releasing them, you have to be careful to not insert them too far. If you do, they can bind up and become very difficult to release. I have to insert them just slightly then turn to release. I'm not sure what can be done about that. It is still handy but requires caution.

it's a little touchy as in: when your putting the bullets in and trying to turn it to lock it you have to mess with it for a second, maybe it will wear in with use  like my old ones did but then again I remember them being perfect right outta the box so who knows I'll keep using it at the range and give it a lot of use but if it keeps acting up I'll just go with a different brand... So right out of the box it's not perfect "atleast the one I've got but I'll write a follow up down the road on how it's doing...

I bought this speed loader for my Ruger LCR .38 Special. I was a bit hesitant after reading some reviews but it works great. It does take a little wiggle to lock the rounds in place but no more than I have seen with other models. Dropping the rounds out is simple and efficient. The casing of the speed loader does touch the housing of the firearm when loading but it does not impede upon the loading process. Also, it does feel a little cheap in its construction but I will see if it holds up to the test of time.I am pleased overall and will be buying a second.
summary: Great speedloader for my Ruger .38 Special

reviewText: This speedloader is great for all 38 special ammo, snap caps, or the deal deal.  One small turn (about 1/16th of a rotation) locks them, and an equally small rotation the other way releases them with no snag.  When they are locked in, lock-up is secure, and the rounds will not wiggle at all.  When you release the rounds in your revolver, they slide right in effortlessly.  These are great for storing defensive rounds, or practicing with snap caps.  My local pawnshops all want $20+ for these with all this gun ban mess going on, so not only is this a great product, but a pretty good price as well.Do I recommend it?  If you have a 38 or 357, this is a must have accessory.

I have used these speed loaders for years with a Taurus 851 concealed hammer and stock rubber grips.  The rounds go in smoothly, but need a little jiggle to shake them down into the cylinder.  They are what they are for the money.  A little practice with them and you can get reasonably quick.  I have never had a problem with them and I routinely carry two of them loose in a pocket.  If you carry them loose in a pocket, make sure to check the pocket you carry them in for lint and foreign matter, as well as the speed loaders.  If you want competition fast, this one isn't it.  But it is an inexpensive tool for reloading a revolver faster than 1 round at a time.
summary: Good Speedloader For Taurus 851 Concealed Hammer

reviewText: I read many reviews and watched YouTube videos about quick loaders before buying 4 of this one.  While the 5Star product appeared to be perfect for the Ruger LCR 38 Special I have, I opted for this one based on price.  The comments about this product not fitting perfectly with a Ruger LCR .38 Special are true, but the imperfection is not so bad that it makes reloading a hassle ... after a few trial reloads, you figure out how to operate it so that you get the fastest reload.  This one gets the job done.  I load all 4 and put them in a small clutch purse I have ... the fit is perfect, so I don't have any problems with carrying them.
works great! it is plastic but serves its purpose.I ordered 2 and am not disappointed at all, make sure you know what your getting...plastic but its worth the price.
Got this for my S&W J-frame.  It is my first speed loader so I don't have much to compare to.  It is well made and locks in the ammo securely.  Is what I expected.

If you use this speedloader on the lcr 357 the only way it works at all is with .38 spl loads. The problem is the extra length of the case on a .357 mag round makes it bind with the grip so just carry .38 spl+p and youll be fine.
summary: Works ok on ruger lcr357 but!

reviewText: As others have noted (and I should have paid attention to...) the grips on the LCR make using the speed loader less than optimal.  You can only fit the nose of the bullets in the cylinder at an awkward angle.  Doable with practice, but not particularly speedy.
summary: Solid, but is NOT completely compatible with the Ruger LCR with Hogue grips

reviewText: As have many, I ordered without reading the reviews, so I ended up with a five shot speedloader for my S&W; 66-1However, I was happy to find that it will work with the 66-1, if you don't mind leaving a chamber empty.I'll keep it and use it.
I bought several for my S&W .38SPL and Ruger LCR .357 revolvers.  They work great, saves time reloading compared to loaded 1 bullet at a time.
Great product - loads all five rounds as quickly as just loading one - Easy to carry in either a nylon or leather speedloader case
summary: Loads all five-rounds as quickly as loading just one

reviewText: Used them a couple of times, seems to work flawlessly with our revolver. just put the bullets in as directed on the instructions, load and go.

Got 2 of these in a package deal for a relative that uses a S&W; .357 "J" Frame.I've used HKS Speedloaders for S&W; K and N framed revolvers for years. I've never had a problem due to fault of the loader. Pretty simple to operate, to install rounds & to reload the weapon. Some of the older S&W; revolvers had issues with the Magnum Grips interfering with the loader. This was remedied later by S&W; or installation of after market grips. Get some dummy rounds for your revolver & practice loading. There are pretty good instructions on back of the loader package. YouTube has a couple of good instruction vids. Back in the day, this was the most commonly endorsed loader by Law Enforcement that carried duty revolvers. For me, this is one of the better & economical loaders out there. Most of all, BE SAFE!Note: When you are finished training/practicing with the dummy rounds, lock them away. I've seen some that left the dummy rounds installed & placed the loader back into the carry pouch & go on duty.
I thought it was made completely of aluminum. But it is part plastic. Not that bad of an item, but it is a little stiff in releasing the ammo. It may free up after some use.

This is a good speedloader, I've had one for several years now and just bought another to have a pair.  I'm not a match shooter, so don't know how it would compare to higher-end products, but for casual range use or having a speedloader loaded up with snakeshot in my pocket while out in the field, it does its job.  I'm still learning how to use it, I have a little trouble lining up the ammunition with their corresponding hole in the cylinder, so definitely won't be participating in any speed-shooting competitions, but I like having 5 rounds ready to go instead of loading individual rounds each time.
I use the HKs no problem. I know some people have a die hard preference between this style and the Safariland style of speed loaders. Personally, I use them both and I like them both.
If you want to be able to Speed Load your 5 Shot .357 Revolver This is the Perfect product...Quick Simple and Easy...Same Reason you use a Revolver....
summary: This is Perfect for a Taurus 605 Protector

reviewText: I'm a new shooter and also have my first revolver (Ruger SP101 with 3" barrel). I got this because everyone else with a semi-automatic has their extra magazines, and I wanted extra ready ammo also. The local gun stores sell this same HKS item for $12 and up; I paid less than $10 here on Amazon. I plan to buy one or two more. Of course, I can't find .38 Special ammo anywhere in my area to load it with... (and I'm too small to even want to try .357 if I can even find it). Recommended!
Very simple: the product does exactly what it is advertised to do--and at a very reasonable price. I am very pleased with my purchase, and would buy this product again.
Its a Speedloader, what can I say , it speed loads .38 special, 357, .38 rounds into a revolver instead of loading them one at a time. It does that, it doesn't do anything else !!!!

I would give this a 5star but to release the bullets it turns opposite compared to my first speed loader so one can get confused when one is in a hurry but with enough practice and presence of mind it really isn't a big of a deal.

I had no issues using it with my S&W 340 with Crimson Trace LG 305 Lasergrips.  I noted many posts said the grip got in the way, but it works for me.  I must hold the speedloader right against the grip, but once released, the rounds just slide in the way they should.

reviewText: This works perfectly with the Armscor M206.  I strongly recommend purchasing this product for anyone who owns a Colt D model or cloned revolver, the reloading time for revolvers needs to be at a minimum.  I even installed a Pachmayr grip on the Armscor and it doesn't get in the way either.  I'm going to be buying more of these soon.

If you carry a revolver, be it for work or self defense, then you know that while you may have a time tested and proven weapon, you have limited capacity, and that's why having access to quick reloads is absolutely vital.  Speed loaders require a little bit of practice to get exactly right, but once you've put in a bit of range time with them, you'll be reloading faster than you could ever do manually.  At the range, using these I can reload faster than my semi-auto shooting friend.These speed loaders are themselves easy to load.  Just twist the knob to the open position, drop six rounds in, and twist it back closed.  The springs hold the rounds securely until you're ready to drop them into the cylinder.  To load the gun, just open the cylinder, hold the cylinder securely with your left hand, use your right hand to drop the speed loader into place, give a quick twist to release the rounds, drop the speed loader, close the cylinder, and you're back in action.This particular speed loader is for .38 special, and .357 magnum, and while designated for the Colt detective special, I've found does just fine for reloading most any 6 shot revolver in the same caliber.  I don't carry the Detective Special anymore, but I still use this speed loader for the gun that replaced it.Be it on the range, in self defense, or on the job for those of us in the security industry, if you prefer the simple reliability of revolvers, you need speed loaders.  To a revolver shooter not having a speed loader is like a semi-auto shooter not having a spare magazine.
maybe its me but once I put the ammo in and lock it sometimes the ammo comes out, i kept it but may not use it that much

This speedloader works as advertized. I do believe that it could be made from sturdier material, however it hasn't dropped a round yet unless I wanted it to. Overall, a good speedloader that works for my .45 LC and .454 Casull rounds.

No, 410 shells and 45 ACP rounds will not work in this speed loader. Only 45 colt. I have several speed loaders for different calibers by this company and have never had any issues.

Although it doesn't specifically list it, I found that this speedloader works almost perfectly with my Taurus Night Court Judge (2.5" cylinder) in .45 Colt.  I have tested it with Ultramax, Winchester SuperX and Winchester Supreme Elite ammo.  The cartridges are a bit loose, but that's the way they're supposed to be; if they were tight it would be harder to load.  The clearance between the cylinder and grip is rather close, so it might not work with other models or with aftermarket grips.  It also works with A-Zoom snap-caps, so you can practice using the speedloader with complete safety.It does not work at all with .410 shotshells; the rims are just too large.  I also had a slight problem with the speedloader getting stuck while loading .45 rounds from Blazer, but they can be a bit tricky to load individually as well, so it's probably not the speedloader's fault.For only $10, it's a great alternative to speedloaders made specifically for the Judge (which can cost $25-50).

reviewText: As speed loaders go, this is not a mercedes, but it works well.  Great for range use, everyday speed loading.  The construction is a plastic outer guard (the black area) and aluminum clip and knurl.  For the price the quality is excellent, and a great addition to a shooter's bag for the range.  Although it's plastic, it is well made and sturdy, but I would recommend a full aluminum construction loader for professional service use.Pros:-Inexpensive, lighweight, easy to load.Cons:-Low cost material, not recommended for service use.A simple 'click to turn' locks loaded rounds in place, and a quick opposite turn drops them in.  If you haven't used a speed loader before, this unit will drop the shells about 1/3 of the way into the cylinder, where you will twist to release them and then using gravity, allow the rounds to drop the remaining distance into the cylinder.Overall:HKS makes great products at an affordable price.  At under $10 you can't go wrong with this addition to your shooting accessory bag.
It is definitely a speedloader, what else can I say? The typical quality you'd expect from HKS and I'm sure it will last for many years. Yep...

I picked up a few of these for my EAA Windicator since other reviewers had mentioned they fit. The EAA is my first revolver so I didn't know what to expect with these.They fit the cylinder perfectly, are easy to load 38 special and 357 magnum and hold both shells firmly.Initially 38's locked in place a bit more easily than 357s but after loading and unloading 357s 10 or 15 times there is little difference when locking in either round. I found it is easier to load the 357s if I put my finger in the middle and pushed the rounds toward the outer edge while turning the knob to lock them in place.I also found it was very easy to disengage the locking mechanism while loading the gun, about 1/8 of a turn.They seem well made and like they will last a while. The part that the shells sit in is plastic but it seems strong and wouldn't flex when I tried.I will definitely be picking up a few more of these for the Windicator and will buy them for whatever revolver I buy next.

With a little figuring out, a little practice of how to hold the loader and twist the nob one-handed, I can easily load without taking my trigger hand out of position.Loader fits past my Mono Grip and cylinder release on my S&W; 586 L-frame with no rubbing, this makes me happy.However, do not apply to much pressure when turning the nob, they are not ment to be cranked on. My fist order I accidentaly ordered the 5-shot loader. almost right out of the package the spring loaded ball bearing shot out when i twisted the nob the wrong way (not hard enough to break it, but just enough to alow that bearing to escape.) Very small bearing, imposible to find in carpet, renders the loader useless.That being said I have not had one issue with any of the 4 loaders pictured above that I own.I was not pleased with how Amazon sent my first Loaders UPS (allowing it to be delivered to my front door), then sends my second order USPS (TO MY SHIPPING ADDRESS NOT MY BILLING ADDRESS.) I then had to work with the post office in my town to have them intercept the package since it was deemed Un-deliverable. Luckily I had a nice Post Worker because normally they will not do that for you.Great product got hear fast, Bad customer service... who knows how they will try and send my next package.
