reviewText: HKS makes the best speedloaders I have used so far. The great part is that they fit so many different types of guns, so in my case I can use these for my GP100, my S&W 686, and my Chiappa Rhino(not advertised but it works!).
I use these for my S&W 686, its a perfect fit. Easy and smooth to reload quickly. Probably buy more.

I could give this product 5 stars,if the black surface was textured so it could be gripped with no slipping. It does what it suppose to do,well.It has good quality and seems like it will last a long time.
I use this with a GP100 6" model. Rounds hold tight, and fall right into the cylinder, great product, I will buy again!
It works great on my GP100. It's cheaper than I can find locally and seems to be great quality just like all other HKS products I have bought.
Bought this to use with my S&W 686. Works well with it. Need to practice with it to get quicker, but the speedloader works as advertised.

I later walked into my local gun store and noticed about 30 of these on the wall, all for a couple bucks cheaper than what I bought. So I would check my local gun dealer first, just because of pricing. Don't get me wrong they're worth every penny and would definitely recommend them to anyone with a revolver!!
Nice quality and light weight.

I've never had a problem with HKS speedloaders, and this one is no exception. Maybe not as high tech as some others, but it works for me. This is used on a S&W 686.

Have other HKS speedloaders.  amazing how slight the differences are between cylinders, but that difference increases loading times when speed might be of the essence.  speedloaders take some getting used to, and while loading them might be as long as hand loading the revolver, when you want to change over quickly, these are the way to go.

Excellent product.  I have these for all my revolvers.  With a little practice a very speedy reload is possible.  Well made and seem to be bullet proof, short of running over them.  If taken care of I feel these will last many years.  I used these loaders in the old days for competition when revolvers were still king.  Never a problem
this is a pretty descent product. works ok. good for the money. i bought this for use with my smith and wesson 686.

I do wish the notch that keeps the bullets locked into the loader was a little stiffer but if your not rough with it when pulling out of a side speed loader holster it works fine.

I ordered this due to the fact that my local cabelas didnt have one for the model of gun I needed, Rugar GP100 .357, and it works perfect, no issues, no complaints, great price, I plan to order more. If you need one, do not hesitate to get this one.
Well made and and easy to load. Works great with 38 special and 357 for my GP100 Wiley Clapp. Will be buying more of these.

These loaders are a little to big to work with stock grips on a rossi 972, however using a sander, you can bevel the back edge, and they will work.  This is far from a perfect solution, but I've tried safariland comp II, and they won't work on this model at all.  I doubt Comp I would work, but I don't know about comp IIIIf I get free time, I'll upload some pics of the mods.  Go slowly, test fit frequently -- you probably don't want to over-do it.  I also sanded down the rubber grips at the interference point a little (Remove the grips from the gun first, duh).When finished, best operation comes from inserting the ammo just past the crimp line, then releasing.  It's not perfect -- sometimes it kinda binds, but it's faster than loading individually or with speed-strips.Primarily used with 38 spl, The longer 357 rounds increase the difficulty of using these.

reviewText: These speedloaders hold ammunition securely and eliminate fumbling with loose rounds during reloads.  They work very well with my GP100.

it came in in a timely fashion, i was worried because of the low price that it would be cheap quality but i was suprised it is good quality and definetly makes reloading a whole lot easier versus fumbling around for rounds in your pocket. overall im very satisfied.

Because of the turn to release design of this, it just falls way short compared to my Safariland Comp II's that were only a dollar or so more. Because the cylinder wants to spin when twisting the loader to release, this loader requires more thought and focus, holding the cylinder as well, vs. push in, done.
Love my speedloader- I practice weekly using my revolver speedloader and it works great- a small twist of the wrist and a new set of cartridges are in the cylinder.

These are my first use of speedloaders so am not positive if how these work are how they should work.  Cartridges lock securely but wiggle slightly.  This is probably normal as the cartridges load and release as expected.
This was an excellent product. But, I could not use it on my 5 shot revolver., This speed-loiader is only for 6 shot models. If you have a Tarsus Judge, I recommend the STAR Speed-Loader.

With HKS speed loaders, one drops the bases of however many cartridges into the holes, then turns the knob a click so that metal pins roll into place, holding the rims in place.  Then all one must do is align the cartridges with a cylinder, turn the knob in reverse, and let the rounds drop into the cylinder.  It's quick and easy, and the loaders are high quality while still being much cheaper than just about any auto-loader magazine.As a tip: adding glow-in-the-dark or high-visibility paint to the end of the knob can make finding a speed-loader in darkness or low-light conditions easier.If there's one bad thing about speed-loaders, it's that they must be as large as a corresponding cylinder.  So for anyone using one as a reload to a concealed-carry revolver, you're basically having to hide the width of two guns when you carry a speed loader.  For this reason, the slower-to-use "speed strips" might be a better option in some cases.  But if carrying open, being used as by a police officer (I'm sure SOME cops still use revolvers, right? somewhere?) or at the range, speed loaders are great and the ones by HKS are very serviceable.

Never owned a speedloader before but I decided to purchase a few for my GP100 .357 Magnum revolver. At the tiime, I didn't know of any other make but the HKS seemed to be a quality product. I haven't changed my mind about that after using this product for some time now. Simplicity itself and they work beautifully. i now know there are "other" speedloaders out there but you would be hard pressed to beat the HKS for reliability and, almost impossible to beat the product for the price.
summary: Speed loaders are a quick sell

reviewText: It's a little on the cheap feeling side. Although I don't think it's cheaply made. I'd prefer the locking mechanism to be a little more positive. I've actually grabbed it up and accidentally turned the release knob and dumped all my bullets out on the ground. So a little stiffer lock might help with that. But it was probably a compromise of ease of storage and quickness of loading, which is does well. I'l buy more for my other calibers and recommend them.

I was looking at these and the Model 29 for .44 mag and meant to get the speedloader for the .44 Mag but.... oh well it's a good thing I got them despite ordering the unintended loader. I will get plenty of use out of them, perks of being a gun nut... I have a GP100 .357 Mag they will work just fine with and they are built just as tough as the .44 Mag loaders.price is always a plus  and great quality seems to be standard from HKS.
Holds the rounds tight and works great when speed loading. I have dropped these all over the range in testing and have not broken one yet! I highly recommend!
Works fine, no problems. Makes it very fast to reload my revolver (Ruger gp100). I'd recommend it especially for the price.

I decided to purchase two for my GP100 .357 Magnum revolver.  I carry extra pistol mags, why not some extra for the wheel gun?Well made, easy to use and holds the rounds securely.  I bought one of theseHKS Cordura Double Speedloader Caseto store and carry the speedloaders.

I got several of these speedloaders for my Ruger GP100 and I can say this:  They make for a WAY better shooting experience than hand loading one cartridge at a time.  I've put them to the test in many environments, from relaxed to stressed, and with many brands of ammunition and they've yet to break, fail, or degrade.  Here are highlights of my experience with these excellent speedloaders:*  Quality - Every HKS speedloader I've ever had has worked the first time, every time, in every condition.  Simple in design, the speedloader has few moving parts so there is little to break or go wrong.  They are made of high quality materials that have stood up to many uses over time.*  Durable - I've never had one of these break or fail on me, despite frequent use and dropping plenty of them on the concrete, dirt, and sand.  They are rugged and have stood up to use and abuse and continue to work perfectly.*  Reliable - This is critical for those who really need to reload as if there life (or stopwatch) depended on it, and these units have never failed or stuck.*  Simple to Use - Easy to load, these speedloaders make redoading a snap.  Release the spent casings, insert speedloader, and with a twist you are good to go.*  Fast - These are much faster than reloading by hand, but it also takes practice and technique.  Under stress, I'm not sure these would be a benefit to someone who really needed to reload very quickly unless they were well-practiced - see comments below.Cons:*  Fiddly - In theory, these pop in six (in my model) rounds relatively quickly, but here's the thing:  Releasing the cartridges takes a twist of the knob.  That same twist of the knob will also want to rotate the cylinder of your handgun, so you've got to keep the cylinder from spinning with a finger from your other hand.  No big deal, you say?  No, it's not when you are sitting on your couch watching your favorite spaghetti western.  But what about in competition?  What about when you are being timed?  What about in the dark?  Under stress?  My point is this:  While it's not a complicated or lengthy process, using a speedloader quickly and effectively is still a process, one over and above the act of popping open your cylinder and shoving rounds in by hand.  It takes some practice to do it quickly, without binding the cylinder, or accidentally twisting the knob too early and spilling all your cartridges at your feet.  For those of you who started out with a semiautomatic handgun where you just slap a magazine in, you may be surprised at how fiddly these are in comparison.Other Thoughts:Here's where I give the product four stars rather than five.  Up until fairly recently, these speedloaders were the best.  A new design is out there now where the cartridges are released with a press of the knob rather than a twist - I do believe that to be a better design if time proves the design to be equally reliable.  Pushing the knob precludes the cylinder from turning, removing a step from the process (holding the cylinder), making it - theoretically - simpler, easier, faster, and safer.  I've yet to use that other design, so I'll withhold judgement for now and stick with what I know works every time, time after time:  HKSOne would do well to try both designs to see which one works best for them, but in the meantime I can easily recommend these reliable, tough units that take the chore out of reloading wheelguns.

Got two of this to use with my GP100 and they work very well. Now I have 18 .357 rounds I can throw down range very quickly. If you are using a wheel gun I high recommend getting a speedloader. And the HKS work very well.
Best speedloader I've had EASY and QUICK. Had another brand for my D. Wesson 715 worked maybe not speedy not easy

These are great.  They work fast and quickly.  Just make sure you tighten it correctly because the rounds will fall out.  Putting the rounds into a revolver are quick and easy with these.  Get the HKS holders to store these on  your belt.
This is a good product at  a good price, and it works as intended.  I would refer this product to others.

Great product but it makes shooting more fun. Also great for real life when you need extra firepower fast. Cheap, rugged, and work well. I've had mine for over a year now and they work just as well as they did on the day I first used them.
Quality product, works very well.  Does exactly what it is supposed to do.  I got these for my Ruger GP100 6'' Stainless.

While the HKS may not be the "fastest" speed loader out there, it is a very solid and reliable unit.  That goes a long way in my book, and is the reason why this is my go-to choice for revolver ammunition carry.

This little speed loader is a very nice accessory for most standard six-shooter .38/.357 Magnum revolvers such as the Ruger GP100 and comparable pieces.  A speedloader functions something like a magazine for a pistol--carry several of them and you can re-load in a hurry.  No doubt this is very important to a law enforcement officer or security person who carries a revolver.  For us ordinary civilians, a speed loader is great for going to the range and expediting reloading, thereby maximizing shooting time over reloading time.  Just swing out the cylinder of the revolver, tilt the barrel down, align the tips of the bullets to the inside of the cylinder, and then twist the knob on the speedloader. The rounds will drop into the cylinder.  Close the cylinder and you are ready to go.  Practiced a few times, anyone can use this speedloader to great advantage in expediting the re-loading process.This unit appears to be well-made, and for the price it cannot be beat.  Highly recommended as an accessory to the 38/357 six-shooter Magnum revolver.  I have picked up several of these to maximize my shooting time at the range.  Recommended.  RJB.
summary: Dandy little speed loader for Ruger GP100 or similar six-shooter revolver

reviewText: What can be said about something as simple as this.  It works!  And its not that expensive!Thats all I can think of...

As the title says, this is a great speedloader. The only thing is that it takes two hands to operate, so you need to take your hand off of the grip, hold the cylinder in place, and use your other hand to operate the release on the speedloader to operate it. Not difficult but it does take some getting used to.

I had used a different speedloader in the past but the manufacture has changed the device from all metal to plastic and the device didn't work.  The S&W speedloader is built out of metal and plastic it worked well the first time I used it.  I purchased 2 of the devices and both of them worked well I am not sure how long they will last but so far I am happy with the way they have performed.

summary: This speedloader is a great value!

reviewText: Never had a speedloader before this one.  It is easy to use and as compact as it can be.  Simply put six rounds in and twist...they are held firmly in place and ready to go.  The knob feels like it would "untwist" and release the rounds on its own, but that hasn't happened.  When you're ready to load, just pop out the cylinder on your revolver, use the plunger to expel the spent casings, push the new rounds in with the speedloader, then twist the knob to release.One caveat...loading is definitely a two-handed operation.  You have to hold the gun's cylinder in place, or when you rotate the knob, the cylinder will rotate with it, and nothing will happen.  So, it is necessary to hold the cylinder or the black plastic part of the speed loader in place before you rotate the knob.  Kinda fiddly, but with practice it isn't hard...certainly easier than loading six rounds by hand.So far, the unit seems solid and it works great.  The price is right, too.  I only wish I had gotten more than one.

Only thing you have to be careful of is, don't turn the lock to hard.  It holds the rounds just fine without "Hulking" the knob.  If you do "Hulk" the knob the small bearing will pop out and you'll spend all day crawling on the floor trying to find it.

I have been using HKS speedloaders for over 30 years and recently purchased two HKS-586-A's to fit a revolver I just purchased.  What a disappontment I received.  They were much lighter in weight than my older models, and the signature "click" that assured me that my rounds were firmly secure in the loader was pathetically anemic at best, and THAT was after I had to jiggle the rounds just to get the casings to secure with the holding teeth.  When I twisted the securing knob, it would just jam with the shell casings and not smoothly lock the rounds in place.  I tried the second speedloader to see if perhaps I had just received a lemon, and sure enough, the other loader was no better. So here I am with two speedloaders that bind with my rounds while trying to secure them in place, and once I jiggle them and do get them secured, the weak tension from the ball bearing that secures them, leaves me feeling less than confident that the slightest bump of the knob wouldn't send my rounds cascading to the floor, and probably at a most inopportune time.  Very disappointed HKS.  You really cheaped out what was a great design.  Guess I will have to re-think the Safariland II loaders.  I would return these two POS's but it is not worth the effort.  I am going to send this evaluation to HKS and see if or how they respond.  Interestingly enough, for a company that prides themself on customer satifaction and quality, they have not means to contact them.  Their home pages just says: "Contact your retailer." Thanks HKS for dodging the feedback bullet from a loyal customer.
summary: Seems like HKS has gone CHEAP on their Speedloaders.

I can flip the cylinder out of my 686 with my right hand and push the empties while I grab a new set and drop them in with my left in about two and a half seconds. I normally set the flaps so that they're only holding on by about an eight of an inch.

eCop never even sent the items and had the nerve to have me start the process through 'UPS' for the lost items that they never sent! I won't lie for them or anyone else, the nerve! After a few months they wrote me to say they can't and won't start the paperwork with UPS because it would be harder for me to get a refund from UPS using a 'lost' shipping item. Pockets are a little deep but useable.  Velcro on the covers, belt attachment. Miss ok, wish they had a multicam one.  Fits the hks-587A seven round speed clip fine.
Slides on belt for easy access. Good Velcro closures, adjustable from 38 wadcutters to 357 FMJs. Soft black cloth is flexible and not very obvious.

The belt loop is way too big for the average belt size in my opinion. If you wear a 2 inch duty belt it will fit fine but on smaller belts its a bit loose. This is just a personal opinion. Overall the pouch works well and seems durable.

The case seems well made though the material is a bit lightweight for the purpose intended.  I intended this for a concealed carry application but I think I will keep looking for something a bit stronger.
It's OK for the price. Won't fit a belt more than 1 1/4" wide or so. ...............more words required is BS

reviewText: Hello,I bought this speed loader case so I could alter it somewhat so my star 45Long Colt / 410, speed loaders would have a home.  As most folks would understand and be able to visualize the length of 410 shot gun shells approximately 2-1/2" long, and consequently no one has made a speed  loader to acomodate these shells used in my Taurus Judge 45LC/410.As my son suggested the simple but well thought out solution, we'll give him the credit. I was going to punch a hole in the center of the velcro flap above the center allowing the speed loader handle to pop through.As I stated above my son asked me the obvious question; "why not add a strip of velcro to the speed loader strap?"  Indeed, I said...  I have strips of velcro that are 1", 2", and 3", wide in various lengths.  So a pair of scissors 2 pieces of velcro and my 410 shotgun shells have a comfortable home.In addition, the speed loader case is extremely flexible that gave me concern. To resolve this issue I took a Bayer Aspirin Bottle and cut it off to the heights of the 410 gauge speed loader and the second bottle to the height of the 45 caliber speed loader to make them more rigid. This resolved the lack of rigidness and unsightly (rumpled) appearance.What is interesting about these types of pouches or cases is the fact that they can be altered for a specific use. I know I would have butchered up a leather speed loader case, so all went well.Great product, great price, all in all a great buy...Douglas Page Chapman Sr.

These little pouches are great. I've bought 5 so far. I use them for every size speed loader, and also for my little bitty North American Arms .22 revolver extra cylinders. The pouches are a little tight for the aluminum 5-Star speed loaders for my Taurus 608's 8 shot .357 Magnum. [But they fit.] And the pouches were way loose for my NAA spare cylinders. [I just took a piece of round wooden dowel material that fit the pouch, cut it to the correct length, and drilled a hole down the middle the appropriate size for the cylinders and I was in business.] The pouches aren't particularly "dressy" like a leather one would be, but I take them to the range and they are very functional for my purposes.
summary: I just love these little buggers!!!!

reviewText: Let me start by saying that I do not actually wear this case on my person, though it seems well suited for that. My goal was to keep the speed-loaders from rolling around in my glove box, and it works great for that. Quality product for the price.
It is functional but a bit sloppy when carrying 22 speed loaders.  Works better with 38s and 357s.  I use it for all three.  Not very sturdy material.
the speed loader case works just fine ... as advertised. meets expectations. very good quality.  I may pick up a few more.
I love having this speedloader case, this makes it easier to carry my speedloader. This is a great item for the price.
Well made and just the right size.It will probably last me forever since it's just an occasional item to use.

reviewText: Fit my two speedloaders well. Only concern may be wear and tear in the future and material seems thin. Have not had a chance to get any wear on them so will have to wait and see. Good item though for the price.

I Carry  Revolver's for hunt and also for Self Defense as my back up and it is not the best it works asy to conceal with a least 2 layers ,and easy to withdraw Speed loaders ,but not recommended  for Competition !

reviewText: Fits 5 and 6 shot compact speed loaders, .38 spc, .357 mag and .45 colt. All fit after letting a full speed loader sit in it over night. This is especially true for a 6 shot .45 colt. Only issues I see at this point are first it has to be a compact speed loader (meaning it can only have the small knob on the top as a release mechanism), anything larger won't allow the top flap to close. Second, the velcro on the top flap that serves as the retention device, does not always feel very secure. It may be just me, but I don't want a speed loader falling to the floor any more tthan I want my handgun falling. However, I did give this item 4 stars based on the price and capacity.
For the limited use, I give it, this is a good purchase.

Fits on the belt, does not move around. The material is not rigid, so when you try to quickly extract the speed loader, the soft sides flex and slow the retrieval. So, it does work, but not as well as it could. This is with a 5 shot speed loader, a larger speed loader might fit tighter and not be slowed on retrieval. I still use this to hold speed loaders, but only at the range, not for carry.
summary: Ok, but not the best design.

reviewText: I always carry fully-loaded in the woods. This helps me tote 12 extra, easily reloadable rounds for emergencies. Or in case the excitement of startling an aggressive bear makes me shoot a little high.

reviewText: It's a good item. The material is just a bit thin. I wouldn't take it anywhere it would see abuse, but for short trips to the range, it's good.
Works for what I wanted.  Price is fair.  Keeps the speedloaders handy.  And I need more words to even be allowed to submit this

I got this just to store speedloaders in and it fills that role just fine.  If I was going to carry a revolver I would probably get a leather or kydex holder but this meets my needs and was inexpensive.
This case works well on the offhand side to provide additional rounds for my Ruger LCR. The case is easy to position and remains securely closed during everyday activity.

Maybe it's just my personal preference, but I found this holder is way too light to be used easily.  The nylon is very thin, and has no rigidity to it whatsoever.  As a result, the upper edge will collapse over top the speed loader and make it more difficult to grab rapidly.  Ok for recreational use, but I certainly wouldn't want to have my life depend on it...

This HKS cordura nylon speedloader case is decent quality for a light-duty case, but if you are looking for a case to put on a duty belt or on a stiff gun belt for home defense, it is not the best choice. It has no internal stiffeners to keep the case open for inserting the loaders, and the Velcro closures are not as secure as a snap closure. However, it may be a good option for concealed carry because, unlike the rigid duty belt cases, it doesn't stick out much from the belt.This case holds two speedloaders.  It is 3-1/2" wide and it has one full-length belt loop that will slide on belts up to 2-1/4" wide.  For use on a narrower belt, it is possible to sew a line of stitching through the belt loop (on the top side), so the belt loop will not be as loose.The main advantage this nylon case has over a rigid speedloader case is that it can be flattened or folded over with a rubber band for storage to take up very little space - and not look like an ammo case.  With the speedloaders inserted, it also sticks out a  less from your belt than a rigid case, if that is a concealed carry concern.The only other advantage might be an application where you would want to wear the case unloaded, rolled over inside a casual belt so it just looks like a small flat belt case.  Then it can be quickly rotated to accept the speedloaders.The semi-rigid HKS Hytrel plastic cases or leather cases from other manufacturers are much better if you are going to keep the case permanently on a duty belt or a gun belt.  The snap closure on the rigid case is more secure than the Velcro on the nylon case.  For self-defense, inserting & removing the loaders is also easier with the rigid case.The nylon case only comes in one size to fit all size HKS speedloaders, so it is loose when holding the medium HKS speedloaders, such as those for 5-shot 38 Special or .357 Mag.  However, this can be fixed by sewing a line of stitching on either side of the fuzzy Velcro to take them in about 1/8" on both sides of the Velcro.One other tip to improve these soft nylon speedloader cases: You can buy one of those plastic containers that hold little tubs of  friut drink mixes; then cut out about a 1-1/2" strip from the top of the container, and roll it up inside the case to make a rigid tube around the speedloader.  This keeps the case open for inserting the speedloaders.In contrast, the HKS rigid Hytrel cases come in two sizes, medium and large, and the medium is supposed to fit the five-shot loaders and other even smaller loaders for 22LR. The Hytrel case costs about $5 more than this nylon case, and is available in smooth finish or basket-weave.Galco and some other holster companies make nice small single leather speedloader cases that wrap around a regular pants belt and snap closed (brown and black color).  They are very nice leather, but expensive.By the way, an alternative case option for the medium size speedloaders from HKS is to use one of the  leather cell phone cases (for the older "candy bar" size cell phones). Many of these  have a spring steel belt clip, elastic on the sides, and a full velcro cover flap. You can stack two medium loaded speedloaders in these, and they are discreet for concealed carry defense.On some of these cell phone cases, the elastic doesn't go all the way to the to the bottom, so the bullets in the ends of the bottom cartridges are just a bit noticeable on the sides.  However, this can be fixed by fashioning a small piece of bent black plastic (or even cardboard blackened with a marker) to hide them.  It would be shaped like a tall "U" in the  bottom of the case.
summary: Fair speedloader case, but big for the HKS medium loaders

reviewText: I have another speedloader case bought from MidwayUSA and the quality difference was vast but the price was not. Very cheaply made out of substandard material. I'll never buy another one, that's for sure. I'd rather take my chances on carrying my speedloaders in my pocket than wear something this trashy on my belt.
HKS products have always been top notch in my book.  Have a LOT of their products and will continue to buy as their stuff just lasts.  I have holsters that still look new after 20 plus years.

I use this in combination with the Safariland J-C7 speed loader.These are cheaply priced.  The downside is material.  There is obviously no stiffness which can make getting at your speed loaders somewhat clumsy.  I was fumbling with this a bit at the range while practicing fast reloads with my .38.  The tricky part is getting your fingers on the speed loader without pushing the sides down onto the loader.  On the plus side, they will accommodate different brands and you could probably even fit a spare black powder cylinder in them if you are a cap and ball enthusiast.All in all they are a good buy.  They are cheaper than the leather versions.  But it would be nice to see the same product with some sort of reinforcement stitched into the sides of the speed loader compartment.
This holds my 5 shot loaded speed loaders (38 spl+p) with no problem.  I was able to wear them on my belt and the fit was nice.  Great price too!

Although the description says "One size case fits all speed loaders" it should say that "one size case fits all HKS speed loaders".  Other than that caveat, the product does just what it promised to do.  If you have a different brand speed loader, then you might not be able to use this case.  Since HKS makes speed loaders for almost every caliber, this should not be an issue.  I have both HKS speed loaders and non-HKS speed loaders so I won't be able to universally use this.
I bought this for my twoHKS Revolver Speedloader for S&W; 586, 686, 581, 681/Ruger GP100for when I carry my GP100.It holds them securely.  Nice wide belt loop.

Better quality than I expected and holds two speed-loaders with 38 special rounds snugly while still allowing easy removal. I believe these are going to hold up well over the long term so we are pleased with them.
Bought this along with 2 of the HKS 7 shot .357 speedloaders and they fit perfectly inside and dont wiggle. The fabric feels thin but I think its nylon an should last a while.
I found the pouches to be a bit difficult sometimes when trying to load on the move. They need to be a little more stiff for easy removal. They are fine if you just need to carry extra loads.
Need it for my two speedloaders . Makes it easy to carryand quick to get to. Recommand to anyone who hasa S&W; 66-7 or any all handgun that requires a speedloader.

These work for their intended purpose. I carry them on the belt with my S&W 357. Others have said that they don't have the form that the leather does, but once they are loaded and put on the belt, a little cheap hair spray will stiffen them right up. Besides, loading the speed loaders and putting them in the pouches isn't exactly where time is a factor. What counts is when you drop the empty cartridges on the ground and reach for the speed loader that matters. In that fashion, the velcrow works just fine.
It's just fine for every day use for your speed loaders it even fit my older slightly bigger speed loader so I'm happy with it I may even order some more just for faster reloads at the range...
I love this product,,,, hold my loaders nice and tight....no worries of them falling out.I carry them with no problems
I would have liked it better if it had some type of stiff backing so it didn't sag on my belt.
This item was just what was ordered and holds 2 speed-loaders for a revolver (needs more words to complete box

reviewText: I have had a couple speed loader for a few years.  This gives me a case for them.  This is great.  I would recommend it to anyone that has speed loaders.

reviewText: This product is what it is.  It will hold your speed loaders.  The pouches are not "formed" and will crush when empty...but I would have paid a lot more for something like that.

If you carry a revolver, this is a good case for your speedloaders that won't take up much space, stick out, or be uncomfortable.  I've used hard cases that are quicker, but those are too bulky, and tend to jab me when I sit down.  This is more comfortable and doesn't look like it's carrying ammo.  The single layer material is strong enough, and makes it more compact than bulkier padded nylon cases.  It is a little floppy though, so it's not going to offer you the fastest access to your reloads, but it makes for a good compromise between big stiff cases, and fumbling around in your pockets.
I like these but wish I had gotten the ones with the snap to make them more secure. They work but if it is a treck thru the woods or a brisk run I would not trust them.
Outstanding for my vest as a backup..fit right on the existing straps..Good deal not junk at all Thank you .
Some items you get what you pay for and this is one of those items. The price was low and the quality is too.

Ordered this to replace the one that was "accidently" taken at my last range outing. I was hoping this would work w/ Glock magazines. Granted it does, but not as well as the GL-940 HKS loader. But his one works better for 9mm mags. So its basically a toss-up. If you run more 9mm than 40 S&W, like me, then you're better off with this unit.

Love these type of magazine speedloaders!  Very easy to use and saves my fingers and hands from cuts and pain!  Very quick loading...even my husband (macho man) now uses the HKS speedloader for his magazines!!!!  A MUST BUY!!!!

This HKS Speedloader works wonderfully well with my Browning High Power magazine, saving both time and wear on your thumbs. We spend a lot of time at the range and enjoy most aspects, except the reloading of hi-cap mags. This speedloader fits over around the magazine and makes inserting rounds almost effortless.This just works like it should and would make a great gift for the shooter in your life.Highly Recommended!CFH

reviewText: This is an HKS adjustable mag loader for single stack mags. This product works really well and is well made. It will adjust from 7rd mags to 12rd mags that are single stack. Great product and well built.
When you're using this loader, it is a bit difficult to keep it in place on top of the magazine while loading (tends to shift a bit).  However, I'd have to say that it works very well overall.

Worked great for the Browning Hi-power but not so great on the single-stack mags for my Ruger LC9. I did have to remove the bottom plate protectors on my Hi-power mags to make it sit right though. Definitely easier on the thumbs.

Bought this mag loader for my son to use with is S&W .40 M&P because he was too macho to buy one himself. He loves it and is very happy with how much faster he can load those double stack magazines now. It is super simple to use and is much better than the more expensive ones that you need a table or some kind of support to use. It is made of durable plastic and feels like it will last.
I bought this to use with my s&w sd40ve and all I have too say is no more hurting my fingers,  works perfectly....

reviewText: Hercules had it so easy.Humans do not.This device will save your fingers from going to Hades.Anyone who has loaded clips will testify.How much do you want to pay to save your fingers?It is worth it, believe me.

reviewText: Get this set and forget those whimpy plastic jags that you have to feed with your fingers, and even then they bend over. This brass set covers about all the guns I own. The case is nice quality too so you won't be loosing the jags. This is another upgrade to the cleaning kit I should have done long ago. The seem to clean a lot better  to boot. It is a good set for a good price.
These are really nice jags and you get a great deal and a storage case.  If you need more than a couple of jags, buy the set.

I got tired of plastic jags breaking off in my rods so I bought these and I have never been happier. Made of brass these things work like a charm and they should last a lifetime. This set had all the jags I would ever need for all my rifles, shotguns, and pistols. Definatley worth the money of not having to hassel with cheap plastic jags anymore.
These things are awesome. Fit great in the bore, only complaint is the 17 cal one snapped off at the threads. Its a shame but the rest are really top notch

The set I received actually contains twelve very well made and finished brass jags in an upright standing opaque plastic box roughly 4"W x 1"D x 2"H with a continuous hinged snap-close lid.  The jags range from .17 to .45 caliber.  They are far superior to the plastic jags included with an otherwise fine universal cleaning kit, and fit the sectional cleaning rod supplied with that kit well.  Price seemed to me quite reasonable for the finish, caliber range, weight and convenient, durable packaging of this product.  If, as I expect, it survives three years of use in good condition, then I would raise the rating to five stars.I regret this is not a US source product.
summary: Comprehensive jag set in durable box

reviewText: I was using the old pin the cloth through the eye hole set before buying this, and I wish I knew years ago I was doing it wrong. With the old eyehole set it would take about 6 patches to really clean the bore due to the limited *star shaped* surface area of the patch, the older/people who have used this before know what I am talking about. With this Jag set, the entire patch is touching the bore, and it only took 4 patches to come back with a clean cotton. More efficient, and a small money saver, a definite must have.

This is a very good and complete set of jags. The best thing is that the set cost much less then buying the individual jag, plus you get a very nice storage case which seems to be holding up better than I expected and I use it a lot.
Never will need another jag again. Great set. But for about 2x the price you can get the nickel jag set and ultimate bore brush set. So it may be better value to get that if also getting brushes.

reviewerName: Cypress Green "She Who Has a Book in Hand Eve...
reviewText: I bought these jags for three main reasons:1. They come in their own box with labeled chambers for each jag.2. I wanted to replace all my plastic and loose jags.3. I needed some jags for new guns that I recently bought.Tipton products have been very good to me. I love their one piece carbon fiber rods and I love the jags and phosphor bronze brushes. These jags are as good as advertised. They have the spear on the tip to hold your wads in place and they have plenty of surface area to push the wads against the bore when you push them through the barrel. The threads are clean and crisp. They screw into standard cleaning rods very smoothly. Yes I tried them on a 3 piece aluminum rod and a one piece tipton rod. The jags screwed into both very easily with the exception of the .17 cal. It's made for a smaller rod and I don't have a gun that small anyway. In any case the threads are in industry standards. I will say that if you are cleaning a 44 and a 45 at the same time, you have to be careful to keep them seperate. The individual jags are not labeled with their size. Each bay though is fitted to a jag.Pros:The case keeps them organized.Each chamber in the case is labeled.Each bay is sized according to the jag that fits it.The case can be mounted on a wall.The lid fits very well and is easy to open and close.Each bay has a snug fit to hold the jags in place so they don't come loose.Cons:The jags are not labeled with their sizes so be careful you don't confuse them.The jags have a very tight fit in their bays. People with weak grips or arthritis in their hands may have difficulty.The labels on the bay are hard to read. They are simply raised numbers and there isn't any contrast to them. Maybe a sharpe would help with that.
summary: No more loose jags floating around in mixed kits, drawers, or on shelves.

reviewText: Well machined set, definitely not flimsy.  Points are sharp.  Does a decent job of hanging on to the patch but if you go a wee bit too far through the barrel, the return trip will be sans patch.  MUCH better than the plastic variety that seem prone to break

The set of jags is well marked which was one of my primary gripes with other sets.  My old eyes really appreciate that now-a-days!  The set does come with pretty much a full set of calibers, although I'd imagine that you'll wear out the .30 caliber and .22 calibers the fastest.  The keyholes for mounting are a nice touch too if you want to keep them out in your shop.  When you first get them they are quite difficult to pry out of the holder since the plastic is pretty firm.  Give it some time and they'll be your go to set.
Bought these mainly for my Colt 6920 AR 15 and my Smith and Wesson MP 40c. Won't use the other caliber a but was a good price and quality set.
Work very well.  I have used other jags that broke easily in the smaller calibers such as 22, but these jags are holding up just fine.

Sometimes it's nice to have the right tool for the job.  This set has a nice plastic case to keep them all in one place instead of rolling around the bottom of your toolbox.  They do fit a bit tight in the case, so it takes some working to get them loosened up.  Decent quality.  It says "Rifle Brass Jag Set" but I use them on my pistols.
summary: The right tool for the job

reviewText: If you never used these to clean your guns then you have worked too hard. These make very quick work of cleaning your barrels and they are well made precision jags! I bought some, then went back and bought anothet set for a friend!

I use these all the time when cleaning my pistols and rifles.  They work great with the rods I already had from a winchester cleaning kit I bought at academy I think.  They come in a nice storage case and are easy to identify which caliber is which.
Nylon jags break, brass jags can scratch rifling.....
Did not work on 223/556 AR for me. All other cleaning jags/rods etc... I've used a .22 will clean a 223/556. Not this one.
summary: Did not work with a 223/556 AR platform for me

reviewText: Excellent Tipton quality jag set.Brass so you won't have to worry about your barrel if the jag wears through the patch (or catches a corner)Sizes are just right but you have to make sure the patch isn't too large (I find round patches work just the same as the square, as long as you don't have them too big)I think the thread size must be standard for all but the .17 which is the finer thread size.If you catch this set on sale (under thirteen for me) you're getting a great deal.
summary: Great jag set at a very reasonable price.

reviewText: Very impressed - used it to clean 6 guns today - all the sizes you need and fits standard little cleaning rod ends (not the shotgun kind of course).  Well machined, no burrs, no weird threading.
Plenty of Jags for every rifle made. Good quality, hard to get out of the case. Finger buster case, but the product is good.
these are very nice, they will come in handy thet have all the units that i need to do the job

You can clean just about any centerfire/rimfire cartridge with this kit. The storage case is very convenient for organization, and if you've never cleaned with a jag before, it's well worth the low price tag.

Fantastic.  These work so much better than the plastic cheapo ones you get in kits.  These jags hold onto the patches through the bore.  The case is very nice to keeping everything organized in my range box.

The Tipton 12 Piece Brass Jag Set is totally awesome. I use them on all my handguns, they are portable so I can use them at home after shooting or at the range to clean my guns. The box helps organize and label each jag...a must in your work shop or in your gun bag.

Was exactly what i expected and needed for my pistols. If you have never used jags before give these a try, they work a lot better than the plastic ones. Just make sure you have a strong rod as when ya put the pressure on it the rod will be your weakest link.

This set includes a nice fitted hard case.  I didn't see this in the description if it was there.  This is a huge plus to me.  Makes them easy to find and not get lost.  They were a great deal already and Tipton is usually good stuff.  I have learned over the years a good case makes a good tool a great tool.  I hope this helps you.
summary: Includes a nice fitted hard case

reviewText: Great Kit with Great Price!  It has all sizes you may need for proper cleaning of your barrels.  Very good construction and quality

Patches work better for me with a jag than using using the loop that was almost the only thing commonly available years ago. Using a loop end there's a tight place on opposing sides of the loop and a patch fits loose everyplace else. I thought the price was excellent also.
summary: Never used jags before, but I Like'em.

reviewText: The product was in new codition, came on time and recieved at a good price. They work well a were a good fit for the bore of the rifle.
These work much better than the ones with the rubber O-rings. I haven't had any problems at all using Tipton products.

Each jag does what they are designed for. My only issue is the red plastic container holding them into place, the numeric designation for each jag can hardly be seen. The company should have used a contrasting color (white, black, yellow) telling me which is a jag for a .45, .380, 9mm, etc.  It's a nice set but more thought into design is necessary regarding the labeling of each jag.
A person cannot go wrong with tipton products these work great have used them and will continue using them they work as designed
Nice set of jags.  I have not used them yet, but seem like great quality.  Nice case was a bonus.

For the price of this set, everyone should buy one.  Seriously - this is a great deal.  The jags or good quality and they get the job done.  The fact that it all comes in a nice little case is SUPER nice.

HKS products are good and this one seems to be nicely made however it does not seems to work as well as I hoped with my .380 magazines. It may work fine with other caliber magazines. I have several HKS revolver speed loaders and they work great. The item arrived on the date promised, good job Amazon.
I gave it 4 stars cause its plastic steel would be a lot sturdier like my others. I will still recommend cause it does do what you wanted for.
Great little speedloader....however it is suppose to work in my 9mm also and it is too small....as far as 380..works great...

It came without the pin required to hold the magazine in place, so I made one.  Now it works just fine.  Saves a lot of time and sore fingers.Thanks,John

I would suggest that they simply post a picture of the back of the packaging, it shows which magazines each model made by HKS will accommodate.

Works great on the standard clip w/o the extension.  It works OK with that one but not as well.  For a trip to the rangeit's indispensable especially when it's a cold day and your hands are already cold.  It just speeds up the process giving youa little more time to shoot and enjoy your gun.  I would recommend it and it's more affordable than some of the others.
Fits my Bersa Thunder380 like a glove.Bottom tab adjusts for different magazine lengths.It’s not a must, but definitely nice for a longer day at the range.
This is a super loader for my wife's Walther PK380. You need to have a magazine with a simple-flat base to use this effectively.

I got mine today and after figuring out how to set the rotating stop to fit my particular mag (mine has two mag settings available: .380 and 9mm), the only other simple thing to do was find the most comfortable and natural position to hold the HKS so feeding was smooth and effortless.  I know the HKS only cost about a third the price of the lula but if others believe that cost is the one qualifying factor to gauge an equipment's effectiveness, I say more power to them--have at it.  I don't expect my HKS to last forever but, for price and sheer functionality, I'll stick with it any day.  My next speedloader for the other hand cannon will be an HKS, as well.  =))

reviewText: This thing makes loading mags a breeze. I use it for my Kahr CM9 9mm. If there's any drawback, it's that it will allow you to shoot off all your expensive ammo a lot faster.
Nothing special about this loader other than it saves your fingers from trying to load into a new magazine. I am using it with a Ruger ACP magazine.
Since it is difficult to load the 380 magazines the traditional way, this speedloader makes it so much easier.  It is adjustable to fit several different magazine sizes.
This product makes it real easy to load magazines.  Product is a finger tip saver and does what it is suppose to do.  Gets magazines loaded quickly.
wife bought a Ruger lc380 and once set it did stick on first couple rounds, but then worked very well. She likes it way better than hurting her fingers. Great buy for this magazine.
I like this speedloader. It's all plastic, but it fits every mag. I have in 9mm. I still prefer hand loading, but if your hand strength isn't great this product will definitely help make it easier.
Just adding my 5 stars to the bunch already here.  Works well with my Ruger LC9 magazine. Sturdy construction. Would purchase this brand of products again.
Made loading my Hi-Point 9MM much faster. Great little device for the money. I would  highly recommend  this speed loader.
