IT WORKS ... and it works great... no more chopped up thumbs, and I can load all 7 rounds in each mag lickety-split where on the Bersa 380's mag, depending on the ammunition, I could load only six rounds, and with much difficulty.Longevity?? Who cares. For 12 bucks just buy another one down the road in a few years.Oh, and by the way, the instructions are a little vague; but if you cannot figure out how this thing works in less than a minute, you probably should not be owning a semi-automatic weapon to begin with, let alone being allowed to reproduce.

Well I have to say that at first when I was reading about it in AMAZON and checking them out YOUTUBE I was like "yeah right" but I have to say this works great.  I used it several time at home before I take it with me to the range & I have to say it works great!!!!  Makes reloading the magazines easy & fast.  Using them at the range is perfect plus it doesn't hurt my fingers from reloading the mags at the range & it makes target practice more fun.

This loader sure saves your fingers, with not having to hold down on the bullets while loading magazine. This will work on single stack magazines only. I have a HI Point 380, 9mm , 40 S&W , 45 ACP that are all single stack mags. This will work on the 380 and 9mm but not on the 40 or 45 , because the magazines are to long to fit in the speedloader for them. This was shipped very fast.
This is a great product, I know people who have them, but this one did not fit my Smith &Wesson SD9VE. The magazine is to thick for this HK model, I will return and order a different size

I was doubius about buying this do to the weird looks,however having good luck with other HKS products i gave it a shot, this ammo loader does what my hands cant, and does it well. at first it was a pain because it comes set on 9MM, once I, turned it to .380 it worked perfictly-read directions again-as far as people worrier about it being made out of plastic, don't worry its high grade stuff,dont forget your car bumper is plastic.(HUMM).

This thing works well on single stack 380s.  You do need to adjust a couple of places, but once you do it is a champ.  It needs better instructions, but I saw a video on U-tube comparing it to a more expensive model and they showed how to adjust it.  Once it is adjusted it is easy to hold the magazine and add ammo till the magazine is filled.  It does feel like the plastic won't last forever but if it breaks, I can afford another one.  It works easier than the one in the box that came with my double stack pistol .Great product.

I purchased this item for use with my Beretta Nano, which uses both six and 8 round single stack magazines.  This device functions well once a magazine is loaded into the device, but for me, it takes far longer to mount the magazine into the device and then place the rounds in the magazine, than it does to just load the rounds by hand into a magazine.  What good is a “speed loader” if the overall result is that it slows you down?
summary: It takes too long to mount the magazine in the device

reviewText: one of the best speed loaders I have ever used for a single stack magazine and its adjustable so you can use it on others
This is a good product, although I dont use it very often.  I've given up using it since not using my carbine as much as intended.  It works well though.
summary: Good product, not stoked about plastic though

reviewText: it works very well. saves wear and tear on your fingers. puts the fun back into shooting. I have one for the various calibers I use

I can see how this would be a big help to anyone who has problems getting enough downward pressure to load new stiff 7 round magazines. But its not ideal...I ordered this to reload Bersa Thunder 380 magazines. The construction of the loader is about what you'd expect for 12 bucks ! Cheesy! Its made from cheap injection molded plastic parts. Its held together by a thin metal clip/ring which is held on by tiny serrations.The "instructions" , printed on the back of the wrapper, are literally  incomprehensible. Parts and places are referred to but there is no diagram identifying them, just a teeny illustration about 1/2 inch square.HKS dont bother to print separate instructions to match the model you purchased. So until you notice that , you are trying to decode and follow the wrong set of incomprehensible instructions.You eventually will divine what you are supposed to do, and  loader does work. The  function of the loader is to allow you to hold the magazine and exert downward pressure on the cartridges already in the magazine with one hand while you use your other hand to slip another cartridge into the loading ramp. When you get the hang of it, you can slip new cartridges in effortlessly and without any resistance from the spring in the magazine.*********************************************************************************Hints:Its best to insert the first cartridge by hand before you put the magazine in the loader.Adjust the front retaining bar and the lower retaining bar on the loader to hold the magazine snugly.Grasp the loader and magazine like a gun.Press the lever on the loader with your thumb to push the arm of the loader down on the top cartridge. You dont push down on the "follower" itself.The technique is to use the leverage of the loader to push down the top cartridge just enough to slide in the next cartridge without pressure from below.Use your free hand to slide the new cartridge in about half way along the length of the cartridge below. Do NOT leave enough space for the new cartridges to drop down into the magazine.When the skirt of the new cartridge reaches the lips of the magazine,you release the arm on the loader.THIS makes room for the cartridge to be seated all the way to the rear of the magazine... using your thumb.Then you lower the loader arm back onto the new top cartridge.Shampoo . Rinse . Repeat.Sounds really complicated but its pretty simple after you see how it works.********************************************************************************Some of my factory Bersa Thunder 380 mags are the single stack 9 round version, with an extended "toe". They dont fit in the loader because the toe sticks out too far. That is a disappointment, since I only really wanted "help" loading the higher capacity magazines which have proportionally more resistance than the smaller magazines.Five stars for function, price and to get you to read the hints!
summary: Learn from my mistakes..read these hints!

reviewText: i think for many single stack magazines this would be helpful, but for the beretta nano, it just wasn't working for me. and it wont fit the extended magazine properly. the grip required to use with the regular magazine was worse for me than unassisted hand loading. but i also felt the load assist that came with the new glock 23 was more awkward for me than standard hand loading. it could just be me.
Purchased this for my wifes 380 and she has used it a few times to try to get used to it but essentially it has proved worthless.
Very simple and easy to use. Wish I had thought of it first. Adjusts for 9mm and 380 ammo with the flick of a switch.

When I think of all the thumb cramps and lacerations I have sustained, I can't believe it took this long for someone to develop this obvious answer to such a universal problem.  It works as advertised. Simple and effective.

I purchased this for a Springfield XDs 9mm.  I have a similar one for another model and love it. This one is adjustable, and would be great if it fit my mag. Does not work with XDs 9mm, it is too narrow. So the statement that it would work with almost all single stacks is not accurate. But the concept and design worked great overall, and deserves a good rating for the mags it does fit.I love this brand and approach for fast range reloading, and have used it in the past. Saves my thumb!I ordered a different model for a replacement. HKS451 and am hopeful because comments indicate it should work with my mag.Would have given 5 stars if it fit mine, but went with 4 due to lack of specifics in the description.
summary: It is good if it fits your mag!

reviewText: It is nice if you have two shooters at a range, one reloads the speedloader the other shoots. Then they can switch.
These are great loaders for a Taurus 990 22lr.  They are simple to use, well made and at a great price too!
Fits my model 94 just fine.  A  lot better that having a bunch of loos shells banging around in the glove compartment.
Cool.  It got here pretty quick and does what it is supposed to.  Now the rounds do not fall in the dirt while trying to load them.
Quick delivery, good price, well made.  Fits gun great, little jiggling needed, but that's normal. Used on my Taurus 9 shot target pistol, would recommend. Thanks.
Works well in a JC Higgins (High Standard) 9 shot .22 revolver. Its nice to have these on hand to avoid loading the cylinder one at a time.

I have other HKS Speed loaders Simple and well constructed ! buy them at all cost I have better constructed (heavy duty for shooting contest)ones but the cost and HKS is well constructed and cost less if they wear out but all mine are still working you have to purposely abuse them to do so!

this works great....makes plinking more fun........especially paired with a 4 banger speed block........one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen, fifteen, sixteen, seventeen, eighteen, since they need more words...
Replacing 9 spent .22 rounds can be time consuming, especially in low light conditions. This speedloader has made the job much simpler.
I bought 3 of these for my 9 shot H&R sportsman pistol and they work flawlessly in the .22 revolver
if you have a breech loading 22 this is a must have. makes reloads quick and easy after a little  practice
Works great on Taurus 992.  I only wish someone would make a speed loader for the Taurus for 22 Mag.  The Taurus Tracker 992 has both 22lr and 22Mag cylinders.
This item works great.  Rounds load fine, load fine into revolver (Taurus 94).  Good product, I would definitely buy again.

reviewerName: mike h. (this i no i spelt rite)
reviewText: after 35 years of gun ownership, i've not seen it all but i know what i know and i like what i like. this was the right speedloader for my .44 mag. and the right one for my mother, i bought 3. they are law enforcment quality, they truly complement any revolver that hks makes one to fit.
summary: actually, my mother is the one who loves it

reviewText: While familiar with speed loaders for larger calibers, this one took a little time to adjust to.  Unlike my other speed loaders, this one does not fully seat the rounds in the cylinder of my two year old Taurus 94.  Using R******** 22 long rifle brass-plated hollow point rounds, the speed loader easily allowed the bullet to enter the cylinders but not the casing.  The knurled aluminum knob is secured on the underside in such a way as to prevent the speed loader from sitting flush on the cylinder. I spoke with HKS about this and was assured that the one I was using was not an outlier.Once that is recognized, you can adjust your technique.  When used with the Speedbeez 4 banger 9 shot Speed Block (sold by Amazon), it makes reloading fast and reliable - no more dropped rounds.There are other speed loaders available that may operate without this issue but they are far pricier and hopefully I can adapt to the restriction.
This product works extremly well all you need to do when you use it is Jiggle the Loader a little when you release the cartriges into the cylinder. It is very inexspensive also.
Got this along with a 10 place otter box and love them both. The otter box makes using my favorite trusty revolver for competition shooting almost equal with the semi auto folks. Almost!!!
Got this for my H&R 903. Functions great. Very light.Holds bullets pretty securely, a little bit of a wiggle, but not substantial. Easy to load and to release. At the price, you canlt beat it.
summary: Excellent speed loader for H&R 9 shot

reviewText: My gym has a few of these jump ropes with the plastic tube sections on a rope. This is a cheap knockoff, not the quality of the other jump ropes that I've used. I'm disappointed in it, sending it back. Sigh....

This rope is definitely nothing fancy nor is that what it is intended to be. This is the traditional style rope that most of us grew up with. It is functional, smooth, and serves its purpose well. For $6 you can't go wrong with this product. But, for any more serious jumpers I would suggest a speed rope by Everlast. Overall, I would recommend this product.
This is a great jump rope to work out with. Used it for several months now. Still holding up extremely well.
Your average "school" jump rope.  A bit lighter than I would have hoped for, but otherwise...it is what it is.

This is the genuine article, the same old school jump ropes you use in the schools growing up.  I bought one for my six year old, and she loves it!  Great price, and a very quick ship!  Cant' go worng.
No complaints. this product is pretty much the same jump rope I used in gradeschool gym class and does what I needed it to do.
My kids love balls and these ones works great for outdoors.  I like nice quality stuff that lasts and these balls hit the spot.
My 4th graders try to destroy it playing wallball every day. It's held up very well for over a month. Hope it gets another couple months.

Took me back to grade school again.  Felt like I was on the playground playing kickball when I received this.  The size is perfect for my 3 yr old because she can kick it without a problem and bounce it should she feel like doing so.  It is also completely round and rolls straight so that is always a plus.
Good Quality! Rubbery Undisciplined Justice upon a Textured Surface.  When Kicked Revengefully by Little Sister, it Rebounded Joyfully from Older Sister's Face.  Harmony Returns-
Kids loved this for a Christmas Present.  Another outdoor toy.  All kids need more exercise and this is a good ball.

These playground kick balls seem to be all the same.  Don't inflate them too much.  Don't throw them into the saga palm branches.  They usually last a couple of months around our place.  Just find the cheapest one you can and maybe keep a spare on hand.  :-)
It is a fine ball but if you leave it outside in the sun it will crack and start loosing its air. It happened to ours in a couple of months.
summary: JUST DON'T LEAVE IT IN THE SUN

reviewText: This ball appears to be well constructed with good, durable material.  Others have commented that the ball seemed out of round, but mine looks just fine.  It has been through several rounds of four square as well as a few games of kick ball and has stood up to the punishment.  It holds air well, so I don't have to top it off before putting it into action.  Overall, I am very happy with this purchase.

I have this on my range.  It works great.  Shoot it with 9mm from AR-15 or handgun.  38 special, you name it.  The only issue I had is I can't get it in the ground (it's hard ground).  My solution was to get plastic tupperware tray a few inches deep and fill it with quickcrete.  Then, set this in there.  Now I can move it and it never gets knocked over.  I own a ton of steel targest and I highly recommend this one....
This is a great product at a great price.  No complaints about the shipping.  I enjoy the audible feedback that metal targets provide.  Always be safe.

I purchased four of these for our "mini" range in the back pasture. I installed them on 4x4 posts (strung together) at different heights using straps and screws. These spinner targets have held up to 9mm, .357, 45 Auto, 44-40, and 45 Colt rounds without any problems. After  the paper targets fell off, I purchased a can of fluorescent orange spray paint for those that want the visibility when practicing.
summary: Well Made and Handles High Caliber Rounds

reviewText: This target is well constructed and lasted a few outings of heavy shooting. Until some moron started to hit it with 308 rounds. For pistol and small caliber rifle a fun target.

I'm shooting this target with a 9mm and it has zero trouble withstanding those rounds.  I'm ordering a second so that I can go back and forth between them as it takes a few seconds for the plates to stop spinning.  I just spray them with orange paint once the color has been sufficiently blasted off.  My target range is on my personal property and is a narrow lane cut into dense thicket, so I have angled slightly to ensure any bullet splatter will ricochet to the side (which also goes into a hill) instead of back at me.  I don't have any worries about standing at 15-20 yards or using FMJ.  Wear your shooting glasses and have fun.
I have two of these (different sizes) and like both equally as well. They "ring" when hit so they provide that audio feedback that seem so rewarding.

I bought this cleaning rod to use on my .22LR caliber rifles. It does work okay on them but I think it is really designed to work best with 22 caliber centerfire rifles like .223 or 22-250, etc. It is a tight fit when using it with a .22LR caliber rifle. But it does work and I still use it on my .22LR rifles. I thought the coating on the rod would be great to help protect the bore of the rifles but it seems to chip and scrape off easily on contact with sharp edges so I am not sure the coating is really needed. Other than that it is a good quality cleaning rod that I use often.
summary: good cleaning rod that I use often

reviewText: But the outer protective coating is coming off. I have read other reviews about this and I thought I could treat it better and it would not do that. WRONG!! You can't help rub it up against the breach or stock or work bench and it is made of steel underneath. I bought a stainless steel solid rod (little more expense) but I don't have to worry about the coating anymore.
Compared to the absolute junk most cleaning rods are, this one gets a 5.If you can afford a Tipton or a Dewey, by all means get it. Otherwise this one will do.
This is a good cleaning rod.  Nice long length makes easy work of cleaning long rifles.  Heavy duty.. works perfect.

I got this "one-piece" coated cleaning rod to help protect the bore during cleaning but the coating is starting to flake off near the patch-holder and at the screw joint.  It's really not "one-piece" because the patch holder screws onto the rod.  I don't know if the one I got just had a poor coating job or if the solvents are just too much for the coating.  I think I'll go with a carbon fiber rod in the future.  I also thought the 33" length would be plenty long but with at least one brand of bore guide in my Weatherby Vanguard S2 .30-06 the patch will not fully clear the end of the muzzle - works okay with another shorter brand of bore guide though.

After snapping the connecting ends off the cheap cleaning kit rod ends I got tired and just got a solid one for cleaning my rifle . I know I will not have to tilt my rifle to wiggle out the broken section of the cleaning rod out the end of the rifle ever again .  I bought 2 one to replace the one I broke at a friends house and one for myself . Great investment so far and it fits all of my bore brushes and mops except for my shotgun which uses bigger threads . I may have to get an adapter but that is neither here or there .

After the first few passes using a synthetic patch I was starting to think the jag was undersized.... Switched to a cotton/flannel patch and that did the trick making for a snug and solid cleaning pass.. Worth a try and a solid and decent investment if you shoot quite a lot....

This product makes quick work of cleaning my 12 g shotgun.  It is simple to use with some Hoppe #9 solvent to simply and quickly remove copper and dirt from the inside of the barrel.  It pushes all of the gunk and grim out the barrel end.  I run it a few time with a clean patch after that to make sure I removed the solvent, and finish with CLP to finish cleaning, lubricating and protecting my shotgun.  I like this product a lot.

I learned that there is a difference between the short jags and the long jags.  The long ones were too tight to fit in my barrel, so I had to switch to the short ones.  The jag is sized correctly, the problem is that the patch you put around it will have some folds in it.  On these long jags, those folds increase the overall thickness too much.  You could probably cut the patches so they fit better, but that's a lot more trouble than just switching to a short jag.However, I discovered that these longer jags are just what the Dr ordered for cleaning the magazine tube.  So it wasn't a waste of money or anything.
The only problem with this product is that it will not hold the patch , you have to hold the patch while starting it into the barrel.Otherwise it is fine.
This is listed as being made from brass. It is not, it's aluminum.The bid true shows the true color, but the description says brass.
Inexpensive and simple are two words that best describe this case. If you need a case for your handgun and are on a limited budget, this will probably be your best bet.

In the past few weeks before I got this from Amazon, I was looking for a case or cases to store what I needed to store, I finally found it in Amazon. The product bought is very durable and strong. Makes a perfect fit for what I needed it for. Great product. Will need more in the future

Case was mislead because the picture does not show the clips. The case so far has no technical problems, it is however just not what I expected. It's small, but cheaply made, the clip mechanism is a snap-like action with no folds, so it reminds me of how ammo cases are folded. The package also took long to arrive. The case is overpriced for the quality, but nonetheless it hasn't broke down yetEDIT: after a year of using this case.  I regret buying it. and should've coughed up 2 extra dollars for a much better, more durable and reliable case. this case dries up my pistol, so do not use this if you have a metal frame gun.  i hate this case and have been using it to hold my art supplies instead.
summary: You get what you pay for, but in this case... you overpaid.

reviewText: This case is a great item. Perfectly holds my Ruger SR-22 and spare clip. It is a little smaller than you might think though. Has a lock hole perfect for transporting. Padding is nice and keeps everything in place.
I just needed an inexpensive case for a small gun.  This item filled the bill exactly.  You would pay more at any local gun shop.

plastic hinge and case lock tabs are very thinmay be good for weekend use but every day use is not a good betget one with sliding locks and a wire - cylinder hingereturned for one that has above and was less expensive
summary: may be good for weekend use

reviewText: I recently purchased a Bersa Thunder 380 and needed a lockable hard case for it.  Looked at a few options on Amazon and selected this case because of price and it had the Amazon Prime shipping option.  It actually arrived the next afternoon and I was able to fit the Bersa and two additional magazines in it (I attached a photo to the listing).  It is a sturdy case that closes easy and stays closed (I intentionally dropped it to see).  The pistol stays snug with the foam inserts.  Also the holes for the lock are in a good spot, easily accessible but not in the way.  If you are looking for a good case at a great price...this is the one.  My Taurus PT111 and one additional magazine fits (but I have another case for that one).

I bought this case for my new Ruger 1911 pistol.  The Ruger comes with a nice cloth carrying case with Ruger logo, but I wanted a hard case that would lock. I did not want to have to use the mandatory lock that is shipped with all firearms.  The case is too small for the Ruger 1911 which is the same size as any 1911 series pistol.  I have four magazines for the 1911 (after all the magazines that come with the pistol are only 8 rounds and 7 rounds).  The case would not close unless one pushed hard to close it with only one magazine in the pistol.  With three other magazines, it cannot close.  As for the product, it is OK.  It looks well made and it is Made in America.  I gave it three stars because it might work for smaller pistols, but not the 1911.  For a small pistol like a Ruger SR22, it would work great.

I keep my S&W MP40 Shield in this case, and it is the perfect size for the loaded pistol with one spare magazine. I like that it has a hole through which I can thread my lock if I need to. Perfect little case for traveling to the range, storing a collectible, or even just a number of spare magazines.
summary: Perfect for my S&W MP40 Shield

reviewText: This case works as described. I would purchase again if I had another 1911! You cannot beat the price (I have checked).

First off, I am NOT using this to store a gun.  I'm using it to store a shaver.  Regardless, I find the case quality lacking a bit. The latches are cheap feeling and don't have a positive action to them, and the "hinge" is not a hinge but rather a thin piece of plastic that WILL break after enough open/close cycles.  Comparing this to a Plano case, it's a night and day difference.  This will do OK storing my shaver but it's really rather disappointing considering similar offerings by Plano.  The reason I did not get the Plano (aside from the fact that I didn't expect the poor quality), is that I needed something smaller than their cases.

I use this to hold my flare gun and four 12 gauge flares on my boat.  It is a tight fit but I was able to squeeze everything in there and close the case securely.  The foam is soft enough to accommodate everything, yet firm enough to keep it from moving around.  Overall, it is a simple, yet effective design...  I wouldn't call it a heavy duty case as the plastic is a bit thin, but it suits my purpose just fine.
summary: Great Little Case for the Price

reviewText: When I received the case it was a bit smaller than I expected but very accomodating. I fit my M&P; 22 which is the size of a standard M&P; pistol. My 1911 suprizingly also fit. They just fit nicely, no waisted space as shown in the description photo. I was very pleased.Outside 9.5" X 6.5" approximately, and inside 8.75" X 5.5" useable space. An additional magazine probably wouldn't fit with one of these larger guns however. A smaller pocket type pistol (Sig P238) would fit easy with an extra mag. Nice foam inside and secure latches.

I bought this for my Ruger SR22 and it fits perfectly along with two magazine cartridges.The two tabs lock down the top very nicely and it stores easily with its smaller size.The egg crate foam makes for a nice protective pad for the handgun while stored.

THE PICTURE SHOWS A 1911 IN THE CASE.  IT WIL FIT A 1911 BUT IT IS A BOOGER TO GET THE MAGAZINE IN AND CLOSE THE CASE.  I WOULD HAVE RETURNED THE PRODUCTS (I BOUGHT TWO) BUT IT IS TOO MUCH OF A HASSLE.  I'LL USE THEM FOR SOMETHING.

I wanted a spare Fobus paddle for my Glock 19.  Sometimes I leave one in the car, and wanted one to have in my range bag.  Opted for the compact for the car so it took up less room and wanted to try something new.The original paddle is honestly a bit better IMHO.  It does not cover the mag release like the compact does which can limit your ability to do administrative magazine loads at the range.  This doesn't bother me however, as I chose this one for car carry.All of the Fobus paddles are great!  They come on and off the belt with little or no effort and stay on as long as you are wearing the proper gun belt.  If you wear a paddle without a belt it will come off and stay on the gun which would seem like a no-brainer.  However, I have read a few reviews where people complain about this I guess they don't understand the design (to put it nicely).For the money, this is the best OWB holster you can buy.  If you have a blued finish on your gun it can in time wear at points so I suggest using a silicon gun cloth on your gun to ever so lightly lube it up.  My Glock finish has not worn at all, and my Kel-Tec's are both chromed so no wear there either.  I have seen minor wear on blued guns so either get a better finish or use a gun cloth.These holsters are great for CCW permit holders, the holster works well but comes off with little fuss when you need to leave it in the car.

Chances are if you are considering this you have heard the good (cheap, reliable, durable) and the bad (cheap, rough on the finish, unreliable). I will simply say that this holster fit the frame perfectly and provides a great level of retention while still allowing for a rapid draw. I have several other pieces of Fobus gear that have a few years on them and no wear can be noticed even after plenty of outdoor use.
summary: Great no frills holster, fast shipping once again from Amazon

reviewText: Gun fits well in the holster.  The price is right.  The quality seems high.  The gun does "click" into place, which is a nice little bit of feedback to let you know it's secure.  You can't go wrong here.
I have several holsters for different dress. This one works great for me as I typically do not wear a belt. Works as advertised and I am very pleased.
summary: Comfrotable OWB carry with no belt.

reviewText: I have a ridiculous collection of expensive holsters that just gather dust in the closet. This $20 holster is all I use for my EDC.
they are what I expected and no problems with them, but the snake bore is the way to go, for sure.
I forgot the fine job done by this these patches.. The go to place for gun cleaning tools. Thank you very much.

I've been using Hoppe's products for more years that I will admit and have always been pleased with them. Of course their #9 is a classic, but their brushes, jags, rods and patches are all top quality as well. Sure other companies make good stuff too, but I know I'm not ever going to be disappointed with anything made by Hoppe's. Check out their new Viper bore snake, by the way. Just when you thought there wasn't anything new in gun-cleaning technology!
Item was as described in listing.
quantity was well worth the price, hoppe's brand stands behind the quality product it puts out.  I just picked up larger quantity as I will use it regularly.

These work very well for cleaning my shotguns, and I am overall pleased with them.  They seem to hold up well during use. They do tend to leave behind fibers after using them to wipe parts down, but that seems to be the norm for cleaning patches.  After cleaning, I use a silicon rag to wipe the firearm down, which gets rid of the leftover fibers.
I like cloth cleaning patches because they hold up so much better than the old fiber ones. These are the best.

Daryl is most correct, cloth works much better than Hoppes synthetic.  Good cloth patches save time and you use less than you would of the synthetic ones.Years ago Hoppes use to be a terry cloth and they worked very well.  I still have some I purchased in the 1980's that were from the 1950's I found in a small hardware store with some new old stock cloth patches.  I purchased the Hoppes before I knew aboutButch's 3-Inch Square-10,12,16 Gauge Triple Twill Cleaning PatchesThese are the ones I use the most:Butch'S Twill Cleaning Patches (Bag Of 500) (2-1/4-Inch)The Hoppes are cheap in bulk and I now use them to clean the sound tube on Edison Model L M and A cylinder record player sound tubes, the Hoppes work well as you only need to remove dirt and oil.  At least they will not go to waste.
summary: Years ago Hoppes used to be cloth

reviewText: What can I say? They're cotton patches and they didn't lie about the quantity. Good deal, would buy again for sure.
the material seems to be like a nylon or something that isnt very soft so i cant imagine it cleans as good as softer cloth ones, i wont be buying them again.

I bought these to replace some that came with a NRA cleaning kit that just leave my parts covered in lint. These patches hold together much better. If you use the same patch over and over, sure it will start to lose some fibers, but overall a very good patch for my .22 and .223 rifles.
summary: Good patches that don't leave a lot of lint/fibers behind

reviewText: item was accurate and was shipped quickly the price was affordable and works really good have been using this product for a while and works really well
summary: hoppes gun cleaning patch for 22-270 500 pack

reviewText: This a large amount of patches for the cost. I have had far less absorbent patches, and far more absorbent.For bulk patches in a great price range, I would recommend these.
Good product, these are the patches I use most often.  I bought them here at amazon because the price was good.
Industry standard, works very well. just the right size to fit the bore size.You can cut old T-shirt and do the same job, but how much is your time worth ? For 500 patches ?

I like these patches.  Very thin but strong material.  I agree with other reviewers that they are smaller than needed.  I use the .38-.45 size patches all the time for my .22 and prefer the larger size.  They will fit the .22 cal barrel no problem.

reviewerName: Darth Mortis "Dark Lord of the Sith"
reviewText: I've used Hoppe's patches for awhile. I bought these for my wife after she got a .22 Ruger. My patches were too big for a .22 caliber so I needed these. They're the same as other Hoppe's gun patches, only smaller for the smaller barrel. I've used Break Free CLP and Rem Oil and both work well with these patches.

Bought these for my father for Xmas along with other gun cleaning supplies. I use these to clean all my firearms and have never had a problem with them. Has multiple sizes for whatever you are cleaning.

Can't beat Hoppe's quality. You might think "a patch is a patch." The last batch I bought were from another company and cheaper. "Good enough," I thought. Wrong. They were irregular in size and apparently made of varying rag stock. Some were soft and fluffy, others hard and not absorbent. Some had regular edges, others were frayed. This time, I spent a little more and got a consistent, high quality product. The Hoppe's patches are uniform, of good absorbency and of good firmness. That is elementary, but you get what you pay for, and the cheap patches were an annoyance and a poor pursuit of economy. Hoppe's patches do the job perfectly, and I don't notice them any more. I don't think that I am supposed to notice them.

These are okay.  There is a tendency for the patches to shred and to leave particles in the gun.  The patches do not all do this, but enough to be a problem.  Okay product, but I will not buy these patches again.

I mostly use the spear type jags, as opposed to the slotted ones, and find that thicker patches are too tight fitting. For slotted jags, a bigger thicker patch is good. I've found that it's good to have an assortment of patches for different purposes. These are good for cleaning the bore with a spear type jag. Twill is strong and good for scrubbing internal parts. Flannel is soft and absorbent but can leave lint behind and is good for external parts. Anyway, that's how I use them.
summary: Thin, good for bore cleaning with spear type jag

reviewText: Perfect size for my 22's. Have no complaints. Use lots of these for barrel cleaning and it certainly does the job!
These are some type of polyester(?) they just don't work as well as cotton. It's nice having the patches cut to size but the bulk cotton patches work much better.
summary: Don't clean as well as cotton

reviewText: The reviews here seem to be written by kind gentlemen who don't wish to sound harsh. But what they do say is quite a problem. These Hoppe's patches are way too small for the bores they say they are deigned for. These Hoppe's patches look like the same as the  "Outers" brand 17/.22 caliber patches but Hoppe's must be much thinner. I needed THREE .22/.270 caliber Hoppe's patches for each pass in my .223 caliber rifle. And I needed two and one half patches of the Hoppe's .270/.38 caliber patches to fit my .308 rifle. These tiny patches will cost you much more in the long run than the superior cotton patches from "Pro-Shot" that are sold here. If the Amazon word search here for "gun patches" (?) had shown the available Pro-Shot brands, I definitely would have ordered them and been very happy. As it is, I am not that pleased. Go for the Outers (better) or ProShot (best) brands.

And I'm not sure what more you could praise or damn them with. They fit in a patch holder and clean things up and apply lubrication where you can't reach. YA GOTTA HAVE 'EM. If you can find .22L ammunition,  you'll want to be able to clean your hardware after visiting the range.
summary: They're little white squares of cloth

reviewText: I seem to buy allot of stuff from Amazon, either for myself or for friends. This was another gift and "she" said it was better than getting perfume ... if you can believe that.

I use two patches to go down the bore of a .22 pistol. I'd prefer to use just one patch at a swipe, but one patch just doesn't fill the hole well enough to do a good job. Other than that, they do a good job.

You are better off getting the .38-.45 Caliber patches instead.  These are just WAY too small (50% larger than a postage stamp?) to be of any effective use for your .22.  If you double-up on them it's a bit better, but you run through them faster.  Save yourself the stress and get the .38-.45's

These patches are way too thin.  I even doubled up with two patches and goes through the barrel too easily.  You'll end up using more patches than the cloth type patches so you're not saving any money and spend more time and effort to clean your .223/5.56 rifle.  I do not recommend these patches.
summary: Patches are too small for a .223/5.56 barrel

reviewText: They're cheap and they work. What more could one ask for? If you have a .22 bolt or an AR or anything within that caliber range pick some up.
summary: What more is there to say? They work.

reviewText: These patches are definitely uniform in size. I have to use 2 at a time because once on a cleaning rod one slides a little to easy and won't pick up dirt. Using two at a time is fine because the price is right. Much better then cutting your own.
summary: Does what it is supposed to

reviewText: These are not my cup of tea, but it might be your's.  It just doesn't seem to do the job or the way I like to do it with cotton or flannel patches.  To me it seems too thin to do a good job.
I needed some smaller patches for my 22 and these are just too small to be effective for cleaning the barrel because they slide right through.  I would not purchase again.
I found these ok for the use of helping me to clean my gun. But I also had to buy cuesticks and bigger patch to help wipe donwn the outside of my gun.

I use these with a piece of yard trimmer string to clean out my air rifle barrel, and it works great. Cut a few feet of the yard trimmer string, melt one end lat to prevent the patch coming off, and the other pointing to poke through the patch. Works like a charm.

The patch material is excellent, the absorbtion rate is very good. However, I find it to be a bit on the thin side.I have to use 2 patches everytime I run the patches down the barrel of my .223. So in essence I'm actually gettin half the amountof usage
Very flimsy.  Requires dozens for one cleaning.  Very loose in the barrel of my 5.56.  These are also not very absorbent.
These patches are a bit small. even for a .22 cal bore.  But they do the job OK.  Material quality is fine.

4 of 5 stars.  Good patches but I think they are too thin and/or lack substance.  To clean the barrel of my Ruger Mark III, I put two through a loop.  One patch just doesn't seem to get all sides of the barrel no matter which solvent I use.
They work, but the patches stick to each other, and seem kind of small even for my .22. The price was right, so I'm OK with them.
These work well without leaving any fibers.  Sometimes I double them up on my AR15 if I soak them in CLP first.  Standard mil-spec product.
summary: Good value, works well on AR-15

reviewText: I purchased a bad of patches from walmart and used those for a while. Then I found these on amazon and ordered them as a backup. They ended up being much cheaper in price, and far better quality than those I got from walmart. They're an excellent size too.

With the hoppes name, you get the hoppes quality, even for patches like these. I've used these for a few years now and have no complaints. They are made well for very minor scrubbing/polishing and/or lubricating.  Worth the money in my opinion, especially because they don't shred or tear off like other patches when you start using them.

I overpaid where I shoot for a much smaller pack of these patches and I couldn't wait for my Amazon order to arrive. With this many patches I can more effectively clean my weapons without worrying I'll run out of cleaning supplies. I have come to the conclusion that if Amazon doesn't sell it it's not worth buying. Oh' guys if your going to use this for your future infomercials/commercials send me my cut $$$. LOL
patches are not patches. These seem to hold up better than most, and get the job done. What more can you ask, and the price is right
These are good patches, but, you can't over use them. They start to leave little fibers on your parts. Just use them to wipe 2-3 times and toss it.  Other than that, they are good.
These are very thin.  They are half the thickness of the patches in my Kleen Bore kit.  I often have to double up on them to fill the gaps.
The synthetic fibers here don't seem to hold much cleaner/oil, and I don't care for the feel of the patches at all. I'll use these for a while, but won't buy more.
They are exactly what expected, I use these to clean my weapons after every range session they work perfect !
summary: Never can go wrong with Hoppe's

reviewText: These patches work just fine. They aren't cotton but they work. The .38-.45 patches work on my 9mm, 40 S&W, and .308 rifle. I had to cut one in quarters to use on my .223 and .22. It's pretty nice when one bag will clean all your firearms.
I went through all the patches that came with the kit while learning to clean, so I was glad to have these extra on hand.
works great... and its going to last me some time and I shoot  and clear my rifles on a reg...
These patches are thin and shed and tear easily. If I would have known what I have know now I would have spent my money the first time on the Allen Patches. AVOID

These gun patches do what you expect them to do.  They tend to fray a bit after a few swipes but cotton patches do the same.  These last a bit longer than cotton patches do before fraying.  These work great with jags in the barrel for cleaning and lubricating your gun barrels.
summary: This is what it looks like

reviewText: Lots of patches for a good price. My local shops do not carry bulk packages. This was a great price and Hoppes quality.

I will no longer buy gun patches from Hoppes. The patches they sell are almost like synthetic toilet or tissue paper. They are thin, almost transparent. I prefer cotton patches, not this synthetic, or whatever material it is that Hoppes now uses. Go elsewhere and buy 100% cotton patches, not this junk.
Industry standard for decades, works great and better than your old T shirt.500 patches in one bag, how long will it take for you to cut 500 patches ? If your time worth that ?
Great price, service, product! They are gun cleaning patches, that's about all that can be said. They are as good as any that I've used.

Just what I expected. Fits well in my 9mm. Able to use both sides of the patch before discarding. Nice tension through the bore. Not the largest, but that's what I was looking for. Should work well with .45, but I can't guarantee since I haven't tired. Price is right for 500.
Not too much to say except its nice to have a bunch of these to keep a responsibly handled firearm properly maintained.
summary: A bunch of them and great price

reviewText: Great product for the price.  Large 500 pack and of course it carries the Hoppe's label so you know it is good quality.

reviewerName: Darth Mortis "Dark Lord of the Sith"
reviewText: This is the way to buy these patches when you like to go to the range a lot: bulk. The patches work great in a 9mm and don't rip apart. Depending on how much you shoot, you may have to use several in one cleaning, which is a good reason to get them in this bulk package. It's also a great price.
Really like this product, have used these for many years' and will keep using.Yes I would recommend to all gun owners
Don't bother with the other, cheaper, patches. This are great, and lint free. Well worth the money for the better quality. Hoppe's products are always worth the $.
Hoppe's has always been a well known cleaning product. Good quality , reasonable price. Not available locally in my area.
I used this to clean my m and p 15's and I can write no bad word.They do what they suppose to do and I also use them on my m and p .40.

Its obviously some synthetic material, not cotton.  It does fray if you catch it on something, then it just starts to fall apart.  It is also very thin.  Barely put a drop of CLP on it and it soaks the entire patch.  Not a huge fan of these.  Ended up buying these:Butch'S Twill Cleaning Patches (Bag Of 375)(2-1/2-Inch).Now I only use these to wrap it around a nylon brush when I scrub down the inside of the bolt area of the rifle (when the BCG is removed).  Works ok for that.
summary: Too thin and it does fray

reviewText: hey for the money this is perfect. i keep reading about people making their own patches for cleaning but to be honest i do not have any time for that . and for spending couple bucks on this, is absolutely worth it :)
Good old Hoppe's brand can not do without !

Otis, Hoppe’s, Kleenbore, and M-Pro 7 best names in the business for cleaning your handguns and long rifles.They make brushes, mops, patches, lead cloths, silicon cloths, and cleaners.Amazon has great prices.Here are my general steps every 250 rounds or so:I would use the M-Pro 7 cleaner and the brushes to loosen the gunk/lead from inside your barrel and other areas i.e. slide, gas piston...Then I use the the patches and mops to remove the gunk/lead from your gunI repeat the above steps  till spic n span.I might need the help of lead patches for those stubborn spots.I add a few tiny drop of lubricating oil (check your manual)Then I use your silicon cloth to clean the outside of the gun which adds a coat of silicone to prevent rust (check the finish of your gun first)
summary: Must have in your gun cleaning kit

reviewText: This a great value. Get plenty of patches and leaves plenty for future use. Can go wrong with this perchase if you are a avid shooter.
Pros:These have been good patches for cleaning my pistols--a Glock 19 9mm and a Ruger LCP .380.Cons:None.

These patches work and that's what there suppose to do. Unlike other, cheap, thin, flimsy patches these patches are consistently excellent performers. Hoppe' s does it again. Well packaged and quick delivery makes this product a winner.

These are pretty good cleaning patches, but you really need something a little larger for the .45.  These are just about right for 9mm and 38, but I have to double up to get any kind of friction pressure in my 45's.  One good thing that I noticed is that they have dropped in price since I ordered back in July.  They are now $2.50 cheaper.  I paid $7.49.
Does the job, but I've used much better patches. They fray and leave strands behind very easily. T-shirt like patches are far superior in every way.
summary: Better than licking it clean I guess.

reviewText: I received the package without any problems but when using the patches there was a lot of lint residue left
I'm not sure what kind of material these patches are made of but they don't seem to clean as well as the t-shirt type.
This pads make cleaning easy, they leave no scratches  on dust or anythig. very usefull to clean weapons or metal surfaces.
These are as advertised.  What's not to like.  Standard gun cleaning patches from Hoppes.  I think you get a good quantity for the price and this is my second bundle to buy.

While I have not used the Hoppe's .38-.45 caliber patches yet, I just finished using the .22-.270 caliber size in my .223 rifle and the .270-.38 caliber size in my .308. THEY ARE REDICULOUSLY SMALL AND THEREFORE WASTEFUL. I needed 3 patches to feel any correct resistance in my .223, and 2.5 of the .270/.38 patches in my .308! Stick with the Pro-Shot cotton patches, also sold here as well. They will be far cheaper in the long run because you only need one patch per swipe instead of three.  Pro-Shot is best.....Outers is acceptable.....Hoppe's fail the test.
I use several different sizes of these and they all seem to do a nice job.  They clean without leaving a lot of lint behind.  They are a little thin but work great for me.
Recommended by many users on YouTube, so I thought I'd give it a try. Great for cleaning my Glock. Good product & I'll buy again.

reviewText: Needed some new patches so I decided to purchase these. I put oil on them and then clean my guns.

Just like anything else Hoppe's this is great for cleaning, I have a Mosin and an AR and use these patches with my Hoppe snake to clean. The pre cut helps to focus on cleaning and are easier to discard once done with them.
summary: Good Quality and pre cut patches

reviewText: I use these with No.9 cleaning solvent, as they don't degrade like paper towel or napkins might. If you have a bore threader that you can use to push these through your bore, they are perfect.
summary: Perfect for use with No.9 Gun Bore Cleaning Solvent

reviewText: These are not the softer more absorbent type of patch I was expecting.  I find I have to double up to get enough friction to clean my M&P 9mm barrel.  Otherwise an OK product.

I bought these because they were cheap and being Hoppe's brand, I thought they would be good.  I personally don't like them.  They are a fiber-like material and they don't hold much liquid.  I prefer cotton or flannel.
Hoppe's Gun Cleaning Patch for .38 - .45 Caliber 500 Pack, Poly Bag  they work great and good absorbent patch
summary: Hoppe's Gun Cleaning Patch for .38 - .45 Caliber 500 Pack, Poly Bag

reviewText: Hoppes 9. The name says all you need to know, good patches. It works well cleaning every gun I have.

Almost everything in life is a trade-off of some sort. These Hoppe's patches are no exception. Honestly, I find that one needs to have several types of cleaning products around, different tools for different purposes. If you agree with that general philosophy, then you won't mind that these patches are not necessarily the only patch or cleaning cloth you'll need on the bench.- Less absorbent than traditional cotton patches. Unlike the cotton patches I'm used to, these are thinner and less soft. They don't absorb as well, which can be either a good thing or a bad thing - or irrelevant. Depends on your needs and preferences.- Stronger than cotton or flanel fabric. These patches don't tear or peel apart like cotton. That is generally a good thing.- Does not leave lint behind. Perhaps the best quality of these patches is that they do not leave fibers behind like cotton/flanel type patches tend to do.- Good size patch. Can be used not only for bore cleaning, but also for general cleaning and the size is nice. I use a small screwdriver blade with patches to get into nooks and crannies and clean. These are great for that.Good patches. I recommend.
summary: Less absorbent, but leaves no lint behind

reviewText: Yeah, you could spend an hour cutting up old t-shirts and save some money.  And end up with irregular shapes, loose strings, etc.  For a few bucks, you get a supply that will last a lifetime for some folks.  Even if you shoot often, 500 patches is going to last you a LONG time.  You could pay this much for a tiny bag of patches at a sporting goods store.  Good deal, exp. coming from the iconic name in gun cleaning.
These patches are so convenient when cleaning your gun.  The amount that come in this pack for the money is a good deal

I have purchased these a while ago for my smalls caliber arms, and they work great!These are not cotton, as many reviewers have notes, however I like them better - all the cotton ones leave lint and these do not!From a cleaning stand point, they work as well as any, they are cheap, and they are a good size for up to 9mm - they are a little small for a .45 - for my liking. They still do the job, however they just look like they don't provide as good coverage in the bigger barrel....and the reason I would buy locally next time is that my local store chain of popular supermarkets in the northeast (starts with M) has the $1-2 dollars cheaper. Felt really silly when I went in for something else and noticed them on the shelf, without a week of waiting and cheaper.Cheers!K.
summary: Good cleaning patches, would buy locally next time!

reviewText: I believe these are synthetic and I prefer the Outer's patches for their softness and absorbency. They have always worked well and are easy to find in almost any sporting goods store. I wouldn't hesitate to use them if it were all I had handy.
How can you bad mouth a company that's been around forever and knows what your shooting needs are better than most gun shops?
can't beat the price for a proven brand of patches and cleaning products. I have enough patches to last a long time
Cleaning a gun can be a messy job so why not have more than you need.  for the price you can't beat having this many cleaning patches.  They do the job!

So what can I say.  They are cotton pads for cleaning my bore.  I use them on my 556 AR-15 and my 9mm pistol.  Absorbs oil and dirt like it should.  I would recommend these because they are cheap but made with quality cotton.  Good buy!
I got these and have been really satisfied, I use them for my .22lr all the way up to my 12 Gauge.
rating is cause it takes two to clean rifle, perfect for the intended use, which is cleaning pistols.  Overall good value
summary: good cleaning patches for the money and right size

reviewText: Hoppe's is an over-rated product line. Do yourself a favor and try something else. These patches are thin and rip too easily.

reviewText: I like a good deal just like anyone else out there.  So now I have plenty of pistol patches for these and some other calibers as well.But here's a bigger savings tip.  Own a 22LR, 22 Magnum or an AR15?  A pair of scissors and you've just come out Way Ahead on Savings. Safe and Happy Shooting to you.

Hoppe's cleaning patches have always been a mainstay in my weapons cleaning kits.  I cannot say how much better they are than other patches, because I have never used anything but Hoppe's, and never will.  Exceptional quality!  And, last but not least, the price is right!  They're a "great bang for your buck!"

reviewText: I find these patches to be very good, unlike other products on the market that are too thick or leave lots of lint behind.

Great for fast cleaning of gun after use at the range. A couple drops of solvent and run through the barrel two to three times and set for next time. After cleaning apply a light coat of gun oil with swabs.  Use in between real thorough cleanings.

These are the best patches.  Highly recommend using flannel patches versus these synthetic types.  It's just a night and day difference in cleaning.  Yes, the synthetic don't break down as easy but who cares.  You get plenty of patches for a decent price.

reviewText: Not made of cotton. Very thin and roof. Def looking into another cleaning patch for handgun. I wish I would have read more reviews. Lesson learned

Have not had the chance to use the product but it looks like it will do the job without leaving residue or lint behind.  Arrived as advertised and will probably meet my needs (based upon inspection, although not testing).

These are the exact same ones as come in them boxes with the cleaning kits, or if you purchase separately. If you are buying these, you know what you are getting. They are NOT cloth, they are the fiber patches.

reviewText: great value for the amount you get. double up and you can clean a larger bore rifle.Grabs all the junk out

reviewText: Gotta have cleaning patches.  These are some kind of fiber, not cotton.  Not quite as absorbent as cotton but they don't fray or get fuzzy - I like 'em.  They do a good cleaning job with a patch jag or a loop.
Don't need oil or cleaning fluid then this is the best way to get more patch instead of purchasing a entire cleaning kit or cutting up t-shirts.

This bag of patches are good for the price. What more can I say, It's a bag of patches. The patches are not cotton. they are a type of...  I don't know. They feel like the Bounce clothes dryer softeners, but they do the job well.

these are a great price for how many you get and they work perfectly for cleaning all of my guns.

reviewText: But actually recently ran out and used brake cleaner. Works just as good for cleaning gun action. So won't buy again. But good stuff.

reviewText: This is my go-to lube for the two Remmingtion 740 30-06 auto loaders I have.  Keeps the slides and actions smooth and free from binding, even in below freezing temps of the Wisconsin late November deer hunting season.  I also use this on my various auto pistols and small caliber rifles.  Reliable stuff.

reviewText: I use this stuff on my ruger 10/22 and my saiga 7.62. This stuff works perfect. Keeps the actions lubed nicely. Makes my gun cleaning easy. But it does smell like any othergun lube or cleaner.  You should use it outdoors if possible.
This works for ALL types of remington rifles and shotguns. Its a must for warranties on both..Works great and enjoy!

I like to clean up my Glock 21 4th generation and spray this stuff on the bottom of the slide and barrel assembly, and get a small squirt in the trigger group.  It sprays on wet, and blows out loose crap, but dries to a white finish.  The white finish is the dry lubricant, and it works well.  I treated my squeaky door hinges on my Jeep with this stuff and the squeaks went away.  Can't beat that.  And since it's a dry lube, it won't attract dust and dirt like wet lubricants will.  Best to stock up on this stuff because you never know when it's gonna be gone.
summary: Dry Lube - Perfect for my Glock

reviewText: Does not leave residue, easy to clean, cleans and lubricates. Especially good for semi automatic shotguns. Easy to apply and use
summary: Goes on dry, lubes and stays dry

reviewText: I don't see much difference between this product and regular Rem oil. I thought it would be more of a dry lubricant that would stay where you spray it but it really isn't. Good lube but really not dry.
Recieved on time from Amazon and worked as advertized in the Speedloader. The only non-oil product from Remmingtonas recommended by the loader maker..

I've been working on guns a long time now, and have tried almost every "gun oil" out there on the market... This is all I use now on all of my guns for short term and long term care... It's just a nice oil that does it all, and I haven't heard anything negative at all.

I use these wipes whenever I get home from the range and finish cleaning up all my guns. I like to wipe down the exterior parts of my guns with this, as it keeps the metal protected and nicely lubricated. Much easier than dabbing some lubricant from a bottle onto some gun patches. They're like anti bacterial wipes, but for your guns, keep them nice and healthy!

This stuff is the bomb. I use after cleaning my guns and putting them away. It leaves a protective oil on the gun which protects against rust. Your firearm will look like new after you use it. Also safe on polymer, plastic, and wood. One wipe will clean about 6-8 handguns or 2 rifles. My only complaint would be the price. Remington sells the same stuff in an aerosol spray which can be applied to a lint free cloth for a fraction of the cost.  But I also buy these wipes for portability and convince.
summary: Awesome way to finish cleaning your firearms

reviewText: I purchased this product primarily because Remington recommends it (duh, I know!) for their model 870 20-gauge shotgun that I own.  I like the Rem Oil.  It seems to work quite well cleaning the shotgun.  I'm not crazy about the fact that the product is "EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE" and calls for wearing "impermeable gloves".  Translation?  Toxic stuff!For my other firearms, I use the M-Pro 7 line of firearms cleaner and lubricant.  It is all inflammable and non-toxic.  So, that is the standard that I am personally measuring against.But as I wrote, the Rem Oil seems just fine for my Remington shotgun so all good there.
summary: Works fine on my Remington 870 shotgun but is extremely flammable and toxic

reviewText: I like to use them after my range time to give a quick wipe to the pistol so it doesn't go in the bag totally dirty. When I do the strip cleaning and further clean the gun, it leaves the Teflon coat on the finish and don't quite like the look on the black so I further wipe with a blue towel or a micro fiber cloth before I put the weapon away. I'm going to buy the other brand just to compare.  I'll post my review when I'm ready.
it does what it is suppose to, which is to lubricate and help maintain the moving parts of the weapon.
I've used these for years to clean my pistol.  One patch is more than enough to take care of it.  These are great for quick cleanings after some time at the range.
I really like these for cleaning my handguns.  Works well, not to oily, just enough oil on the wipes to be effective.  Highly recommended.

I use this on my Remington's (1911 R1 and 870 Express 12 gauge)It keeps em movin and working.  I've had no issues with my guns not cycling or any movement issues due to this lube not doing its job.  It was cheap, cheap ammo on the R1 that did that.
summary: Works well, classic lube and easy to apply

reviewText: These work well.  They're basically a soft, thin cloth material imbued with rem oil, the all-purpose cleaner/re-greaser from remington.  I'm not sure how much of a hit they take for cost-effectiveness versus a bottle of the stuff and your own wipes, but I feel they make up for it in convenience.  Also, easy to throw in a bag to take with for whatever reason.  They clean and grease well, and at the speed I work, generally stay moist/effective enough to clean one shotgun at a time.  I'm sure if you were more speed conscious you could fit in another long gun or handgun or two, but the grime does build up and you might want to switch anyway.  All-in-all I'm happy with these wipes and will probably purchase again.

I"v read many articles and checked blogs and there is a lot of talk about how easily the remington tactical contracts rust.  With pump type application I think you don't waist as much as using the spray can.  I have the remington cleaning towel and I use the pump bottle to add a little more rem oil to the towel.  I haven't noticed any rust at all,  yet.  I suppose I'm a remington fan and I like everything remington to far.  But I"m open minded to any product that does the job.
summary: If you own a Remington Tactical...

reviewText: It's been around for ages, and well liked.  There are a ton of oils to choose from.  I found this one to be a bit watery in consistency for my needs.  I prefer a bit of viscosity.
summary: A bit runny for my liking

reviewText: This is good stuff and allows one to put a light coat of oil on anything that needs it.  I use it on all of my weapons(I'm a WWI and II Collector) and it does a fine job of maintaining them without a messy buildup.  I recommend this product.
Remoil is great. I bought this because the price was super low at the time. Can never have too much of this around.
Easy to use oil pump and helps reduce the mess compared to the standard oil bottles. One pump is all you need to oil up a shotgun or rifle. Definitely recommend remington oil.

I have used several gun oils but I find this one to be the best. Months after storing several guns they look as if I just oiled them. I prefer the aerosol spray to the wipes personally. Will buy more when I run out!
summary: Best oil to use for guns

reviewText: This serves better as a cleaner than a lube in my opinion. There are better lubes out there. However, it's a fantastic cleaner and a more than decent lube. If you are on a budget and only want one product to serve both purposes, this is your product.
What can I say, it lubes, it works. I haven't done scientific testing vs. other brands, which I also own and use, but it seems quite good.
Get rem oil where you want when you need it. This is a very convenient spray bottle, and is great for your range bag as it won't spill.

Thank you for this much needed and impossible to aquire where I'm at product!I could'nt think of anything else to use on my Remington 870 12 gauge shotgun,keeping with factory specs in everything ordered for it when it comes to gun specific items.The price,the speed of shipping,and overall experience is nothing short of excellent!Kudos to all for the big help I've never gotten before there was Amazon!!
summary: The only oil for my Rem 870 shotgun

reviewText: Works perfectly for gun use.  I thought that spray oil would be messy or wasteful, but not so.  It lasts a very long time. You can spray oil on a single patch in a cleaning rod without overspray (although I use a mat on the table).  This stuff does a great job of lubricating and protecting from moisture.  It is far preferable to small cans of oil with spouts.
I use these wipes when cleaning at home.  The container is a little inconvenient to put in my range bag, so at the range I just use the pre-packedged wipes.
summary: Not just for the range anymore

reviewText: These are great, really handy. They're like baby wipes or "Wet Ones" except they're moist with Rem Oil. Ideal for cleaning and especially for a final wipe before storage. Convenient and worth the money.
This stuff is as good as advertised, it worked for me....I would tell my friends about this product...I'd buy it again.....
Excellent product I've been using for many years.Great protection.A lot better than buying the little bottles.This after Hoppes #9 and you can't get any better protection.
1 great, 2 great, 3 great, 4 great, 5 great,  6 great, 7 great, 8 great, 9 great,  10 great, 11 great, 12 great rem oil !!!!!

The rem oil wipes are pretty good for a quick wipe down of the gun, I dont use it as a bore cleaner only on outside as of now it does a nice job overall it should be oiled a little bit more. This is for use after the gun has been cleaned good in the past this is just a touch up job that will last till a good cleaning is due.
This is your basic, big box store lubricant. It is not the best on the market but it does it's job. No complaints with it, but there are better brands out there

speaking from years of experience with many oils this one is good for the money but nothing special.to further explain it is a thin low viscous oil, good for base lube on a gun or knife sharpening.it is not as good as a thicker oil for rust prevention or heavy lube.this stuff also smells awful no idea how toxic it is but it smells like a weak solvent, however does not work for cleaning very well.bottom line wd40 does the same thing better for less, and is easier to get.for a real gun enthusiast you need a 3 in 1 clean, lube, protect break free is what pros use, kleen bore 3 in 1 is also good.some of my teachers recommend Smith&Wesson; oil it is also very good.simply put water is not the only thing that will mar your gun, you gotta watch for sand, dirt and other stuff.

Rem oil is good stuff and protects the metal from rust.  It's okay as a solvent, although products that are designed for that purpose, Hoppes and Gunscrubber work better.  As a lubricant, I'm not sure because it dries so fast.  It's supposed to leave a teflon coating and probably does but I want to see some evidence that there is actually some lube on the parts that need it.

I was tired of breathing in the fumes from stuff like Ballistol, so when I was in my local firearms dealer, I picked up a couple of these to try out. It's really easy and I like the individually wrapped ones in addition to the pop-up container. You can throw the individual packets in your range bag for quick wipe-downs at the range.

I got a free sample of these with a firearm cleaning kit a while back, and I finally ran out, so time to get more.  They're great - reasonably strong material saturated with a nice lubricating oil, and more than enough to complete a job with one wipe.  They're good for much more than guns, though - anything that needs a light layer of oil to prevent rust and keep surfaces sliding smoothly against each other - hand tools, in particular seem to like these.  I'm still finding uses for them, and one wipe goes a long way.

I use this not only on the metal parts of my hand/long guns but also on the stock.  Gives it a nice coating.  I throw the presaturated wipes in my range bag so if needed I can wipe down the guns at the range.
summary: Use this along with the presaturated wipes.

reviewText: Arrived on time, great price, have used Rem Oil for years and love it.Will buy again from Interstate Arms.
Worked great on My Remington R1S .45. Rubbed down the .45 cleaned off all fingerprints and excess lube. Recommend it for Stainless guns.

These are a bit expensive compared to buying a bottle of oil and using your own rag, but you can't beat the convenience. One thing I noted with my first can of wipes is they start to dry out after a number of months. So don't open sealed containers until you need them. And then try to use them up within about a year.
summary: Very easy to use and work well

reviewText: A friend of mine who served in the Marines' Force Recon recommended this product to me.  This is a nice thin lubricant for one's firearm that will not turn into gunk and gum up the works.  You can use it for about everything in the gun cleaning process.  You can spray it directly onto your weapon, or do as I do and spray it onto a rag or bore cleaning patch, and then apply.  The product comes with a spray tube so that you can spray it very precisely, without making a mess.Guns require frequent cleaning and lubrication.  This product does the job, lubricates the moving parts, and really acts as a cleaner as well--apply and wipe off and the dirt and carbon is gone.  I will apply with a rag, or spray into difficult to reach areas such as slide rails, and then wipe with a Q-Tip to ensure that everything is clean.  Leave a little in the movement areas such as the slide rails to lubricate and reduce the wear on your semi-automatic.  Highly recommended.  RJB.
You can't beat an all in one cleaner and luber.  I have used many from outers to hoopies etc.  This one cleans well, lubs well nd has supperior protection.
Rem Oil, along with Hoppe's No. 9, have been staples in a gun cleaning arsenal for years and years. There is no need for me to review a long review, just buy it.  :)
SAME AS ALWAYS, IT IS A GREAT PRODUCT AND I HAVE USED IT BEFORE, I WISH THEY WOULD MAKE A JUMBO BOTTLE TO REFILL THIS LITTLE ONE AND CHEAPER
i am a shooter for a living! be it on the range on a sunday or the hills of afghanistan, this is the best oil out there!
Reminton is a very old company with a very great background! This guys know how to make great productsband this oil works great in the handguns!

This is a great cleaning solution (virtually the only brand I use now that I have started on it, compared to Hoppes and other similar brands) in a convenient pop-up can of impregnated wipes for quick cleans.  One of the best features of this product is that the solution is quick-drying, I've never had a problem of getting too much oil on the gun nor problems with "gooping."  I have no reason not to give this fine product an less than 5 stars!

This product is great! Does what it says and doesn't make a mess! It comes with a tube to fit on the spray nozzle so you can concentrate the Rem-Oil to your desired location! Rem-Oil will definitely decrease the wear on metal-to-metal contact.Pros:- Great cleaning and lubing solution!- Spray can comes with a plastic tube you can attach for more precise applications- You can use it for just about ANYTHING! (This product works so well, it will replace your WD-40!!!)Cons:- None (aside from price)Recommendation(s)/Suggestion(s):- Use this to lube just about everything! (No, not to be used on latex or humans (-_-"))In other words, this product is superb!

This is some good gun oil like most Remington products. It works real well with the Remington Flex Rod T-Handle with the Remington Rem Squeeg-e on the end of the cable. A++++ SellerHappy, Happy, Happy.

This was a great buy for the price. I have used this product since the 1970s. The oil will work on anything that needs preventative maintenance on metal surfaces. The oil is very thin and it will find its way to hard to get to places if needed.You can always trust Remington products.
summary: This oil is a must have item for gun maintenance.

reviewText: UPDATE:I have used Rem Oil on my Katana replica three times now.Here is the difference between using the sword maintenance kit and Rem Oil.Sword Maintenance kit.1. Check blade for rust spots.2. Wipe old oil off.3. Use powdered ball to clean the rest of the sword oil off and polish the blade.4. Apply new oil.After Rem Oil.1. Inspect the blade for rust; there is none.2 wipe off old oil.3. Apply new Rem Oil.Sword oil will never be applied to my Katana replica again.I am not saying not to get a sword maintenance kit. You will need it for the brass hammer, replacement bamboo pins, and the powdered ball to ultimately clean and polish the blade. I am only saying that you will not need to use the powdered ball anywhere as often.ORIGINAL REVIEWI used Rem Oil on my Colt .380 semi-automatic, and my Remington model 700 .243 caliber high powered rifle ages ago, and was always satisfied with it's performance.Then last month I was given a 1060 high carbon replica Katana as a combined birthday / Christmas present.At first I bought a sword maintenance/cleaning kit.The instructions said to clean and oil the blade monthly. I used the powder to clean and polish the blade, then the sword oil to oil the blade.Earlier in the season there was a problem with the A/C and I started checking the katana weekly instead of monthly, and after 1 week I was noticing tiny rust spots on the blade.Last week I had a squeaky hinge, and wanted to get some oil to lubricate it. I checked my katana and three tiny rust spots about 1/2 of a millimeter across.I got the idea to use Rem oil on the blade instead of the sword oil, and all I can say is WOW!!!The rust spots were gone in a few seconds, and the beauty of the folded steel came to life as never before!I have treated my katana only once with rem oil. But so far I am very pleased with the performance.I do notice one odd thing about Rem oil of today vs 30 years ago. 30 years ago rem oil looked like oil (the color of honey) today Rem oil is clear. I bought the 1 OZ squeeze bottle.I will post an update if necessary.

I now have bore snakes for every cal. I could never go back. They can be a little tough pulling through but thats why they work so good. F.Y.I. you should do a quick pre clean of bore so you do not have to clean bore snake as often.
Bore snakes are the best way to clean a bore in the field. If you have to clean on the go these are the best.
I have several of these in different calibers, it works very well.  Makes cleaning your weapon easier and faster.  Would recommend getting for all your weapons.

These Boresnakes are amazing, to put it simply. What used to take at least 30 minutes to an hour or so depending on the gun now only takes 5-10 minutes at most! The key is to make sure you get the cotton swab attachment that for some reason is not included with the Boresnake. That's the only downfall is the cotton swab attachment to finish up the cleaning. It does have the copper bristles to first scrub the barrel, then the entire length of the "snake" polishes, and the swab attached at the end with some lubricating oil finishes off the process. Do this two or three times, DONE! Even without the swab, it's an amazing item and a definite addition to you home or field cleaning kit.
summary: Why buy anything other than a Boresnake?

reviewText: Easy cleaning tool for any AR. Bought this on 12/28/11, made my gun cleaning very simple. Love product. Will buy more for other caliber guns.

Probably in every gunsmith or armorers tool box.... this is a great item to clean your AR.. and/or rifles. If you haven't used Hoppe's BoreSnake products, I would recommend it 100%. Cuts cleaning time in half if not more.

this was purchased mainly to clean a gamo .177 air rifle.  the barrel can get a good cleaning with the snake having access through the breach.  also handy to clean a 10/22 with access through the bolt.

Since getting my AR-15 last year, I've had several opportunities to clean it after shooting or (most recently) hunting.  I initially used the Remington Squee-Gee system, but there was no specific squeegee for my 6.8 SPC.  The first advantage of the Bore Snake is that it is a little more flexible with regards to use (OK for calibers from .270 to .284).Using the Bore Snake couldn't be simpler:  you drop the end with the weight through the barrel (breech to muzzle, same direction as the bullet would travel), and pull it through.  There is a brass brush embedded in the fabric to loosen any fouling or corrosion, and the fabric behind the brush cleans it out.  For good measure, I put some Hoppe's #9 cleaner in the fabric before the brush to assist with loosening any fouling, and some Rem-Oil in the fabric behind the brush, so I was able to clean and lubricate in a single pull.For a "white glove" cleaning, I could still see use for rods, patches, and soaking, but the Bore Snake is great for regular cleanings, and would be particularly great for quick cleaning immediately after a shooting/hunting session.  Does a great job and saves time—definitely a great product!
summary: THIS MAKES CLEANING YOUR RIFLE A WHOLE LOT EASIER

reviewText: I have purchased one of these for ever caliber of firearm that I own.  It almost feels like cheating it's so easy.  You almost think that there's no way it could be clean, but I've run patches down after using them and they came out clean.  Great product that is easy on your barrels and cuts down on time spent cleaning by a lot!
This boresnake cleaned out barrels of my AR15 and my Remington 10/22 perfectly! Never again will I use patches! If you have a rifle, you need this bore snake!

it doesent fit, or at least not thick enough to really clean the AK47 bore, even when fully soaking it in cleaner and fully dry it goes through but not tight enough feel to really clean or pull all the crap from the barrell, at least doesent feel that way, comes out very very easily.
summary: Doesent really fit an AK47 , 7.62x39 cal.

reviewText: Like many others, I don't feel like cleaning my stuff after the fun day. Then, most of us don't shoot corrosive, so the barrel is going to be fine without cleaning. I do however, spray some Hoppe's 9 and run boresnake every time after use. Thorough cleaning takes a back seat with this.

The Good:  I buy these by the bushel and give them out like candy.  There is no way to say enough about these bore brushes.
