I have been using them for over ten years, both in military and civilian capacities.  I recommend them 10/10 times.The Bad:  The only and very minor complaint is the wire brush part.  After prolonged usage, they can bend on you and become close to useless.  Unfortunately there is no real way to right them back up.  Regardless however, even with them slightly bent, the product works great.
Cleans a couple of .308 Rifles with ease. I've never had any problems with it and is a great reasonable price.

Couldn't be easier to clean your rifle after a trip to the range with this boresnake.  I use this for my Mini 30 which shoots the 7.62x39 AK round.  Those rounds are notoriously dirty and some can be corrosive so cleaning your barrell after each shooting trip is critical.  While you still need to do more thorough clenaings of the reciever, bolt, gas block etc. this really works well for ongoing maintentnace.  It takes roughly 30 seconds to clean you barrell.  With it being that quick and easy I'm guessing I'll be a lot more willing to stay on top of routine clenaing needs.

Great idea for other calibers but this caliber requires the snake to be too small and when pulling through the barrel... well the rope has a tendency to brake.  I broke two of these already in my .17 caliber  rifle.  I usually recommend these snakes but NOT FOR THIS CALIBER!
summary: Great idea but already broke 2of these  .17 cal boresnakes

reviewText: It makes cleaning my 30-30 Mossberg 464SPX easlier.  And it can be washed and reused many times. Give it 5 stars
The bore snake will put a mirror like clean finish on any bore. I highly recommend this cleaner in every mans gun cleaning kit.

I could not really figure out what to do with this, and it seemed to not fit my 22 lr barrel, I tried pulling it through and it would almost feel like it was stuck and I was afraid something would happen to my gun so I stopped trying.  However, if you can make it work, I think it would work well for a quick cleaning.
These boresnakes are a must have for every single caliber gun or shotgun gauge that you own.  It is so easy to clean your barrel with these.  My guns have never been cleaner.

I have several of these and do use them at the range for a "quick and dirty" barrel cleaning after firing.  However, your barrels will not be as clean as with jags and pads.  After running the BoreSnake I follow-up with a standard rod cleaning and get a LOT of dirt out of the barrel.  So, accept them for what they are which is a good field dressing but are not a replacement for regular cleaning.
Not sure why I waited so long to buy one of these.  It used to take 20 minutes to clean my guns after a trip to the range, now I can do a better job in half the time.  Brilliant idea.

What was I thinking?  Clean a gun with a rod, brush, and patch?  Did it this way for 40 years and then my 'Daughter' had me try a BoreSnake.  All I could think is, "this is THE only way to go".Must have enjoyed the reciprocating action ;)
summary: BoreSnake is the way to go!

reviewText: I bought this bore snake a few days ago. Went to clean my .17 rifle and it broke the first time I tried to use it. Wasted $18 on junk.Dont waste your money on this product buy something else to clean the bore of your rifle.

Wow, completely amazed!  I ran this through my wife's very dirty .243 three times, then ran a solvent patch through to see how dirty it would come out.  The patch was completely clean!!  I will be buying one of these for each of my calibers. I wish I would have discovered these years ago but now that I know about them,I can shoot until my heart is content without dreading the cleaning process.

If you haven't used a boresnake you should try it.  This product aids in cleaning your weapon quickly and easily.  The only drawback I saw is that the line itself is a little short for the barrel I'm using it to clean, making it somewhat difficult to grasp the tip.
Hard to find .177 size.  Got it for airguns with brush.  Wont use it often, perhaps only when new first cleaning.  Bore snakes way to go!!!

Great for cleaning in the field and at the end of the day.  I still use patches, bore cleaner, gun oil etc periodically as additional cleaning, but for small calibers (like my .17 HMR), the nylon tips are vary fragile, and break easily if the patch is not cut small enough.  Regardless, after a good bore cleaning, remember to clean the chamber.Many have reported that their bore snake cannot go down their barrel.  I had that problem with my .22 Long Rifle.  I could not draw the snake through the bore.  But after a few months I tried it again, it was snug, but nicely snug as opposed to too tight.  The problem seems to be that when these are packaged they are flattened and tightly bundled.  This seems to make the snake rather wide and flat and unable to properly compress as it is drawn through the rifle.  If you don't want to leave it out until it returns to round, you can work up and down the snake, squeezing the edges towards each other and forcing the snake back into a round shape.  Make sure you force the inner cords of the snake into round as you do this.  I did this for the snake I got with my new .17 HMR rifle.  Prior to squeezing, I could not pull it through and was afraid of tearing the snake or the lead cord.  After working over the snake, making it round, the snake was a little snug, but it went through.  Further passes went easier and now the snake is nicely snug.Extending this discovery  to storage, the last thing I want to do is wind it tightly and flatten it again.  I put it loosely in a small plastic watertight box that fits in a pocket of my range bag.  I hope this information  helps.
summary: Bore Snake great (after making it round)

reviewText: I don't think I've met anybody that wasn't impressed by the Boresnake. It will totally change the way you clean your firearm. It brushes and wipes your barrel clean in a few quick easy motions. It may not be the best product if your firearm is filthy. You will probably have to get an old fashioned brush to scrub the gunk out. However, it does replace patches. One scrub with a Boresnake is equivalent to 5-6 old fashioned patches. This is great for maintenance cleaning. Get one. You won't be sorry.
summary: Best Cleaning Product for Your Firearm

reviewText: I use this on my Mosin Nagant.  It's by far the easiest way to clean.  Although, I still use a rod w/ patches to get the heavy gunk out first, then the bore snake.
It's a tight fit. It takes a bit of tugging so make sure there's enough lubricant in the barrel. I have to over lubricate the barrel or I feel like I'll snap the cord.

This cleaning tool is awesome.  I don't bother with cleaning kits anymore and I just buy a boresnake in each caliber that I use.  It cleans quickly and well.  You can also machine wash it every few times to keep it clean!
This works great in my .22 rifle.  I spray a little cleaner on it and run it though the bore.... looks like new when done.
This is a great price for the boresnake. easy to use and one of the best cleaning product that any gun owner should have.

Works great.  Cuts down cleaning time on my Mosin Nagant tenfold. Just soak the part before the brush and pull through a few times. Clean as a whistle. Wash when it gets dirty. Easy peasy.  Took one star off as i hear there is a version that has a cotton swab at the end but i still love it.

I have one of these in every caliber for each of my rifles. I use them for a rapid clean in the field or at the range. They will never replace a good cleaning at home, but they are great, they get a lot of gunk and residue out quickly and easily. After a few trips to the range they can get dirty, so wash them, or as I do, wear some gloves.

I have used BoreSnakes and similar  on various calibers for many years. The idea is great but Hoppe's execution could be better.The pros: quick...washableinexpensivesmall package "easy to store in  range bag".can be used as an emergency tourniquet in a pinch {ok that's a stretch but hey innovation is a necessity}Cons:easy to break pull cordsame model doesn't necessarily mean it will fit (223/5.56) "perhaps quality control issue"easily jams in barrel.difficult if not impossible to clean  chamber to muzzle in AR platform, meaning your dragging particulate in to your receiver.As I said I have used and still use the BS in 223/5.56 and 308/7.62 as well as 45 & 9. The snakes for handguns and non AR platforms work well and with little issue. The caveat is the AR platforms, if your running a match grade barrel in 223 id recommend that you not use this BS. The lack of tactile feedback could leave your rifling damaged or a BS stuck in your barrel. Not to say the BS would cause the damage directly but more likely a large piece of particulate etc.. getting stuck in the snake and being raked down the barrel. For your average sportsman or tacticool user a BoreSnake is not a bad investment. They are really good at cleaning out the gunk left in your barrel when shooting steal case ammo like Wolf or Tula.My biggest complaint is the breaking of the pull cord. I am a moderate shooter, approximately 300 rds a month on my  5.56's and 200-300 rds on my 308 so I might use a snake  2-3 times a month. They average about 7-8 cleanings before the cord breaks.I have read a lot of reviews where users swear by these, I would as well for a quick clean however over time they just don't last making the bang for your buck rather underwhelming.  I do want to point out that I have used snake's on my 45's and 9mm well over 100 times, I have never had to replace either and I believe I have at least 100 more cleanings before I would even consider the need to replace. Your mileage may and probably will very.Austin{always watching your six}
summary: Quick way to field clean, bad design

reviewText: Great item for a quick bore cleaning.  You run the snake through the barrel once and you're good to go.  No more need to punch a rod down the barrel with a piece of cloth on the end of it.
Great product, simple design yet works flawlessly, just thread it through the barrel and pull it back through, cleans everything inside your barrel.

What guy doesn't like to play with a piece of string/rope that's designed to pull through your rifle's barrel for easy and fast cleaning? If I had invented this, I'd probably be sitting on a beach in Tahiti sipping a cold one right now, but I didn't - so I'm not.
summary: A snake that won't bite you in the wallet.

reviewText: what can i say other than ...it works as it should!!  :).... apparently there's a minimum word requirement when leaving feedback...this is to take up space
I love these bore snakes.  They do a mighty fine job cleaning the bores.  I do an initial brass scrub, then patches, and finish off with the bore snake.  Clean as a whistle.
Great product. Works as advertised. I use this as my last step cleaner though and run it through my barrel about 2-3 times and makes it squeaky clean.

Hoppe's Bore Snake is one of the best gun cleaning tools that I have used.  I have several calibers and they always do a better job than the good ol brush and swab.  I clean my guns after every use and this makes it soo much easier to do.  Great product for anyone that loves to clean their guns as much as they shoot them.
Best way to clean out the bore of a rifle. Much quicker and easier than the cloth squares that take several to get a good clean. This only takes 2 pull throughs to get a shiny looking bore!
I first bought one for my 40... Since then I have bought one for every caliber I own.This is a very fast and effective way to clean your weapons. Plus they can be washed and reused!!!!

I've been using Bore Snake products for 20+ years now and I've never been disappointed in any one of them, they always clean the barrel and leave it looking brand-new after you use them.  I have used them on shotguns, 22's, 9mm, .357, 8mm, and now on 223. Love'm and  won't use anything else.Big Jim
summary: Great Product to clean gun barrels

reviewText: I have the Hoppe cleaning kit, pouch, thingy, that has the spray and oil. I use this with my .22lr and .22mag rifles. it's a little tricky to get used to, and know where to put the cleaning spray and oil on the boresnake, but once you either figure it out (or follow the directions hehe) it works fine.
summary: works until you can get a detailed cleaning done

reviewText: I have Hoppes bore snakes in three different calibers. They work great. Stop reading now, do yourself a favor, and just buy it. You will love it..
As with my other review on the bore snake for my pistols it works very well to clean my rifles.

I am very meticulous when cleaning my weapons. A clean gun is a happy gun. And a happy gun is a fun gun! This product is so simple and quick todo. A procure that used to take eons with a rod and patches, now takes seconds with the bore snake. 5 STARS and standing ovation. Price is cheaper here than Sportmans and Gander Mtn
summary: Smartest and easiest way to clean your gun.

reviewText: It works. It's well built no problems with it so far. I use this when out in the field so I don't have to carry a cleaning rod.
I wanted a bore snake to clean my rifle and this fits the build. Simple to use, does a nice job cleaning the bore, and wasn't to expensive.
love it, easy to use!
Makes quick work of cleaning the rifle bore on my Smith and Wesson M&P 15.  Follow the directions and clean it with soap and water afterward and let it dry.

I accidentally ordered this when I actually wanted the pistol version, but I'm pleased to report that my Ruger SR22's barrel couldn't be any cleaner.  There's just a little bit more of leader (obviously, since this was made for long guns), but it works just fine. So if you order this by mistake like I did, it will still clean a pistol as well as a rifle.  Just wish I could find a Viper version of this...

I've got 4 of these now for various calipers. Really good cleaning tools. I generally drop the brass all the way through the barrel and then apply oil or solvent in small doses to the checkered part as I pull it through the barrel.

My dad was a firearms dealer so I've been shooting 50+ years. I was raised to never put a firearm away until it was cleaned and lightly oiled even if only one round had been fired through it so I'm a bit OCD in this area. This Hoppe's BoreSnake is a great tool for cleaning my AR. It's compact and light weight so I can put it in a backpack or BOB for field cleaning without the need for all the rods and brushes. This is definately a must have tool for cleaning your firearms. As for my hand guns I still prefer to use rods and brushes because I actually enjoy taking my time cleaning them. It can be just as therapeutic as gardening.
summary: You CAN teach an old dog new tricks!

reviewText: Got this for my AI sniper rifle and Damn, just hose it down and about 5 yanks and the gun barrel was clean.  Nice!

It is pretty tight pulling this bore snake through a .22 rifle barrel, but it works.  I would expect that it needs to be tight to really get down into the rifling.  I did really have to force it, though, which was a bit of a pain.  It may begin to be easier the more I use it, so we'll see.  Other than that, i love the bore snakes.  i have one for my hunting rifle as well, and it really beats slamming the rods and patches down the barrel over and over to get it clean.  Great tool, very useful.
summary: Very tight for a .22, but it works

reviewText: I bought the Hoppe's 24015 cos I needed something to clean for this caliber.  This beats patches in the barrel but if you're really devoted I suppose you could do both.  Expect it to be a tight fit, which is desired.  Most importantly make sure you take the time to pick the right caliber of bore snake, when ordering, or you may order the wrong thing but that's on you!  Great product, timely service!  I'd recommend to a friend :)
summary: Bore Snake is the way to go!

reviewText: I have used BoreSnakes for the past 3 years.  These are great for at the range or home cleaning sessions.  Super easy to use.  When you want to clean them I recommend putting it/them into a mesh bag and washing them separate from clothes.  I usually wash them with my shop towels.  They don't really need to be washed often.  Can't say enough about how much I like these.
I dont know how I ever cleaned guns without these things.I only use these for all my guns now.Less mess and less cost!
Great product for thorough swipe cleaning in the field.Mine have lasted for years and still perform the same as when they were new.I have one for each of my rifles and stored in grips or stocks
summary: Great product for thorough swipe cleaning in the field.

reviewText: This boresnake makes cleaning a breeze! Super simple and the integrated brushes definitely do the deed.I can clean my rifle way more quickly with this than standard rod and patches, and the result comes out just as clean. Everyone should have one.

Very happy with this purchase, fast and easy to clean any gun bore with the snake.  I apply a little oil at the last part of the bore.  At first, I was worried the stitching wouldn't be strong enough, since it was very hard to pull it through the bore, but soon enough I started trusting the stitching.
It's a bore snake and it does what it is supposed to do. Use it to clean the bore after shooting. I use this one for my .308win Savage PC and my 7.62x54R Mosin 91/30.
summary: Does what it's supposed to do...

reviewText: I bought a couple of this bore snakes I have others for other fire arms good product all went well . Thank You

I have spent many hours cleaning barrels over the years.  The Bore Snake makes cleaning out the barrel much easier and saves allot of time.  No more 15-20 swabs down the inside of the barrel with the ramrod.  In my opinion, the product is well priced and allot of value for ~$10.
summary: Excellent Cleaning Tool - REAL time saver

reviewText: This is a great, inexpensive procurement in keeping your firearm clean and ready in a wink!  I got this one for my dad.
For something quick and easy, especially for someone who doesn't fire a lot of rounds, this bore snake does a good job with minimal effort and time. Good product.
summary: Easy to use and does a good job of cleaning the bore.

reviewText: Works great.  Portable and easy to use.  Good for the field to initially get rid of corrosive residue.  Part of my range kit.

Boresnakes are great for a quick pass through to get the big chunks but nothing beats an old fashioned cleaning. I tested this theory and still have plenty to clean out after using the boresnake. I now knock the big nasty chunks with my cleaning kit then the bore snake to get more out in a faster fashion than patches then I finish with my cleaning kit. Saves me time but it is not the end all magic cleaning kit.  I might be doing it wrong but I doubt it.
summary: Great for a quick pass through

reviewText: Lost my old bore cleaner and haven't cleaned my gun in months. Used this thing and was really surprised to see so much stuff come out my gun.

These Hoppe's "BoreSnakes" are wonderful for quick cleaning rifles! I have two of these (.22 and .30) that work in several different rifles, covering most of the calibers we shoot.These are so easy to use! I usually run some oil down the barrel and then just pass the snake through it after returning from the range. Every third time out I do a more vigorous cleaning of the firearms, but this does a great job in between those.Highly Recommended!CFH
summary: Great For Quick Cleaning - Highly Recommended

reviewText: Fantastic!! This is the best & easiest method for cleaning a rifle that I have ever used. I wish I had bought one of these years ago. You will not be disappointed!
great for initial clean and then use the pads.  This gets the heavy stuff, and keeps you from using so many pads.
Very handy tool will last a long time be careful not to get too much oil on it. Really makes cleaning a breeze.
I want get the easy way to clean my rifle. my it is too small for 7.62 / 303 and 308
highly recommend. works as promised. time is money. im glad I got this product. buy it. it works, no regrets

Short and sweet. Nothing beats the Boresnake hen it comes to ease of use, and efficacy, when it comes to cleaning the barrel. Good cleaner, 3-5 pulls through (from chamber to muzzle), a couple patch pass thrus, and a barrel with even 2000 rds fired through is mirror bright and residue/copper/lead free. Wish I had used one yrs ago!
summary: A must use for your Arms

reviewText: every one who has a rifle should have one of these. it makes cleaning your gun sooo easy. it takes litteraly like two seconds to clean the bore of your rifle. I love this thing and im ordering one for all my rifles.
summary: every gun owner should have one.

reviewText: I love my AR, but the only pain is cleaning out the barrel. The small caliber makes it extremely difficult to get a perfectly sized cotton swab through the bore.Using this makes it a 1 minute job without any stress or headaches. I like that I can re-use it instead of wasting q-tips or buying more cotton swabs. Well thought out product that works great.
summary: No more shoving balls of paper down the barrell

reviewText: If you have never got a bore snake then stop waiting they are amazing you will get the bore and chamber very clean very quickly. I just pair it up with a patch soaked in hoppes 9 and then run the snake and let it work!!!!
Very fast method to clean and lube. I use it in addition to other cleaning kits. It should last for many cleanings.

There is no better way to show your rifle how much you appreciate it, then to buy it a friendship bracelet. This amazing friendship bracelet will cut down cleaning time so you can do more important things,  like hugging.
This product has been doing its job just fine for some time now.  It seems like it wants to break sometimes, but it is still working like a champ.
These bore snakes are the best answer to gun cleaning since Hoppe's powder solvent was discovered.  Thanks for a great product.

I ended up sending this product back because it felt cheap. And I did not want this cheap thing breaking off in the barrel of my AR-15. I ended up buying a cable style cleaning kit from Otis instead. Thanks Amazon for the quick return!
summary: Did not like the quality of this bore cleaner!

reviewText: High-quality. Makes it very easy to clean the bore. I bought two of them just in case if one does break or wear. Better than buying the gun kids

This is a review of bore snakes in general... though I have them in every caliber I own, I first started using them with my .22 (including .223/5.56) guns.  This is small enough to keep in any range bag or back pack.  I keep it in a Ziploc with a silicon cloth (also Hoppe's) a toothbrush and some CLP.  This is enough to do a good basic cleaning on any gun.  You may want to do better when you get home with a proper rod, brush and jag.  But, I only do this about every third range trip with my ARs and maybe once a year with my rimfire rifles.  I don't like the pistol ones as much, simply because a short rod is easier to use than a bore snake, but a long rod?  Bore snakes win hands down.  I also don't like the kits that Hoppe's sell as you end up adding stuff and there isn't room in the kit.Also beware of imitations, get a real Hoppe's.  One will last me a year or so- that's 100s of trips down the bore- I had an imitator break off on its second use.  You can find the Hoppe's cheaper though.
summary: Everyone that owns a rifle should have one.  Make that two.

reviewText: So yeah, this item works just as expected, and is pretty snug in the barrel of my Ruger 10/22! Nice to have for when I eventually get a .223.

I am somewhat disappointed. The diameter of the actual rope (snake)seems to be very tight trying to pull it through a .22 cal. Henry. Maybe itwill loosen at some point. If you only fire a few rounds through a cleaned rifleit should do an adequate job. I do not think this will replace a thorough rodcleaning and did not expect it to. Appears to be a very well constructed item.Probably will buy another for larger cal. rifles.
I use this product with some hoppes elite bore cleaner and it works.  With a single pass this boresnake with clean my stainless barrel spotless every single time.

Bore snakes are fantastic. I have one in every caliber I shoot, and even a couple I don't. They are great for a quick clean in between shooting sessions when I don't want to break out the hoppes and patches. I use it every time I shoot my milsurp rifles soaked in windex, as the primers in surplus ammo are often corrisive. If it gets too dirty I just throw them in a laundry bag along with some dirty rags and my mechanic gloves in a small wash cycle. Well worth the small cost for the great utility.

This would be a must have for any rifle other than a corrosive firing non chromed barrel Mosin Nagant.  I religiously clean the barrels after shooting my Mosin's and it takes forever.  So I bought this to cheat and save a ton of time.It partially worked, cleaning out the barrels pretty decently.  BUT after a week I went back and checked, sure enough it does not get very single bit of grime out of the barrel and they had a light coating or rust starting.Now I used it initially to get the majority of the crud out of the barrel then run a few patches down after words.  It DOES cut down on cleaning time and would be all you need for a chromed lined modern rifle. But with the old WW-2 Era bolt rifles without a chromed barrel, make sure you check a few days later that you do not have rust forming.
summary: Works great for a light cleaning between heavy cleaning.

reviewText: I ordered this for a 22/223 and it works great. It is a little hard to pull through the barrel, but it makes cleaning the barrel basically a one or two step process. Good product and good idea.
One pull through a solvent soaked barrel is all it takes. I put a few patches through after using it and there was virtually nothing left. Highly recommended.

Bought this to use in my Mosin and wasn't disappointed. I have multiple others for my Ar's and hand guns. Quality products with zero problems and failures. This is the best and easiest way to do the final clean on the barrel. If you don't have one you're wasting patches, time and effort!

These are a time saver than trying to get into your bore with a jag and patches.  I put a little solvent like m-pro 7 or something on the brass brush portion of the boresnake before I run it through and it cleans up in a jiffy.  You can throw these into the wash, just make sure you use a delicates type bag to put it in.
summary: Easy to use, makes life simple on cleaning your bore.

reviewText: This bore cleaner is very well constructed and looks like it will stand up to a lot of use - which you would expect from a Hoppes brand product.  The materials used are high quality and the product works very well.  Makes the chore of cleaning the barrel a quick and easy task.  A weighted tip pulls the cord down the barrel making getting the cleaner in place very easy.  The cord is plenty long and the loop in the opposite end of the cleaner makes it very easy to draw the cleaner back and forth through the barrel for a thorough cleaning.  Only complaint is that the instructions are nonexistent.  If you do not know how to use a bore snake you will be in the dark. I would definitely purchase this product again.

I have a 1934 Mosin Nagant that I regularly shoot surplus corrosive ammo. You MUST clean the gun after shooting to save the bore and mine has about the nicest I have seen ever for an old surplus gun. It used to take me hours, cleaning the bore and the chamber with a brush and patches, but now I just yank the bolt, use a mop on the chamber and bore, let it soak for a minute, brush the chamber, run the snake down the bore twice, patch once to check everything and I am DONE. Saves me at least 1/2 hour (I keep my guns very clean and happy)

read the other bad reviews on here and decided to take a chance on this. they were right not the one pictured.....it was a different color, and i don't care what color it is as long as it works great.......IT WORKS GREAT. i was worried at first because i bought it for the 7.62 and it didn't say it on the package but still works. love the Bore Snakes and would recommend them to any gun owner.
summary: not the same as pictured but works great.

reviewText: This thing is one of the best cleaning products I have ever used. works like a dream to keep em clean. thanks

I use these before shooting and just after shooting in all of my firearms. These are great product and I wish that they had come around sooner.For my Mosin Nagant, and when firing corrosive ammunition, I normally use two of these immediately after a shooting session; one is soaked in Windex with ammonia to saturate the barrel and neutralize the corrosive residue and a second soaked in Ballistol to help protect the barrel until I can get it a more thorough cleaning. I keep them in my shooting bags so that I always have them with me for a shooting session.I can throw them in a sock and toss them into the washer for cleaning. If you own a firearm, you really need this product.

I purchased this to clean my ruger 10/22 since it can only be cleaned from the muzzle end. I apply solvent, in this case Hoppes 9, let it sit for 5 minutes while I service the rest of the weapon then I run this bore snake through two times, then apply more solvent and run it through again twice.You take the brass weight and drop it through wherever you wish to clean, and pull the snake through.Good product, I wish it were US made, it is made in China.
summary: Used in a Ruger 10/22, Made in China

reviewText: Many reviewers made this seem like a bloody miracle.  It may just be that we're shooting completely different stuff.  I shoot a lot of older stuff (91/30 Mosin Nagant, VZ.24 Mauser, Type 99 Arisaka) and I love this because it is so compact I can take it in my range bag and run it through a few times right after shooting.  I do not see a specific patch section of the bore snake, though perhaps they are counting the rest of the body of the snake for that.  I may tie in a couple of strips of cloth to get a tighter fit for that function.I still use my Dewey rods on the barrel and do a full break down and cleaning (I'm shooting corrosive ammo) when I get home, but this does a great job for an initial cleaning.
summary: Super convenient, glad to have it

reviewText: I bought two snakes.  One for a .17 and another for a .22.  The .17 works fine,however, the one for the .22 would not fit my rifle.  I use the .17 for both rifles.

Really quick an easy way to get your bore clean when heavy lead/copper deposits are not present. If the bore has those type of problems you need to use more elbow grease but for normal dirty bores this is the ticket. They hold up well an are washable an inexpensive.
This bore snake fits my AR barrel perfectly and saves a ton of time cleaning compared to using patches. If you don't have one already, just buy one.
Boresnakes are the best, they make cleaning barrels SO MUCH EASIER.  1 pass to lube, 2 passes to clean and polish, barrel will look like new.  Also, machine washable!!! :)

It's only a bore snake....  No need to get excited about it.  I do like Hoppe's to clean my guns!  They always have quality products.  I find myself window shopping at different stores to see what I want to buy and then buying it on Amazon because the price is always better!
This should be used all the time, it's makes clean so much more faster and fun!!!! Awesome, I recommend it to anyone!!!
works very well. Cleans bore from muzzle easily
Not to be used in anything but a break-barrel, and I sold mine because with time they loose accuracy due to barrel droop.

This is a must have to make cleaning your fire arms quick and easy.  My nephew, who just got back from 2 tours in Afghanistan, cringed how I cleaned my AR15s after we returned from the range.  He broke out his kit he used while in Afghanistan and made quick work of both of my ARs and his own.  I new I had to have one.  I went ahead and got one for my other rifle calibers too.  These things are crazy simple to use.
summary: Makes cleaning your AR quick and easy

reviewText: Just drop a little frog lube on my snake and run it through barrel. Cleans real well and leaves frog lube in barrel of my Colt 6920.

Used on 22 rifles & pistols.  The BoreSnake works great, leaves a clean bright bore, and is built very well.  Still a good idead to use solvant every now & then, but this saves a bunch of time when you need a quick scrubbing.

This product is great. It is a must have for anyone who shoots a lot. I can use this at the range to keep proper function and tight groups. It really cuts down on cleaning time.I know others have stated that they don't think it scrubs the bore good enough, I do agree with that after a long shooting session. But what I do is use a regular bore brush if it needs it and the boresnake as well in place of patches.  The boresnake works much better than any patch I have ever used and it is reusable. It is great to have for hunting when a shot may not be taken or only a couple shots are down the barrel.For the price amazon is selling them for it is worth having around even if you do want to keep your old bore brush as well. I don't have to worry about running out of patches, having to find or cut the right patch size, or taking more than a mInute to maintain a unfired or slightly dirty firearm.

I fed the weight into the bore and it dropped through no problemo!! then I went to the pullin through dang was it tight. Even though I had some bore cleaner on the snake it was still hard. Well let me clue you in it was gooten tight. boy was it ever. That barrel was also clean as could be.I likkem like that.dray
summary: I wish every bore snake I had was this tight!!!!!:------

reviewText: another great Hoppe's product. These snakes just simply work. they clean the bore of a gun and they do it well

I was very afraid that I was going to break it the first time through, but the second run through was alot easier. My .22 barel has never been cleaner. If the gun is really dirty, put some #9 on the top of the boresnake and a little bit of oil at the bottom if it's going to be stored.
summary: quickest gun cleaning I have ever done

reviewText: works great and is just what I expected from this tool, these things are always good to go, grea tool
Absolutely a must if you put many rounds downrange.  This product saves time while cleaning and does a great job.

This is a simple and very fast way of cleaning a rifle.  Cleans my rifles in just two passes. Unlike using a cleaning rod which requires one to change from brush attachment, the rifle barrel is brushed and wiped down in a single pass.

Excellent way to clean the bore of a rifle or shotgun without field stripping the weapon.  I have used the .22 version for several years.  I use it for a quick cleaning especially for those rifles that are not easily cleaned from the chamber end with a cleaning rod, jag, patches and bore brush.  Simply moisten the first 6" or so with solvent and pull through the bore of a rifle pistol or shotgun.  @-3 passes later you have a reasonably clean bore.

If you dont have a bore snake for every caliber of gun you shoot, you are missing out.  Jags and patches can not compete here.  This cleans a bore so much better, and faster, than any other method.  Must have item for anyone that owns a gun.
Great product for a really easy quick clean. Just put some cleaner and/or oil and run it through. Careful will snag.

What a great invention these things are.  Feed the weighted tip in and pull through -- pull back and forth like floss !! So much less mess than running rods and patches soaked in bore cleaner.  Great product; great price !!!  Highly recommend !!!!!!!

Cleaning rods and brushes can destroy the crown on your barrel, making the gun less accurate. These, on the other hand, can be threaded in from the back, leaving your barrel's crown in pristine condition. They're also super easy to use and seem to last a long time.
summary: best way to clean your barrel

reviewText: Purchased two of these. Very impressed. Quality is very good. Does its job efficiently and above expectations. Cuts cleaning time down, and seems to do a better job than the old traditional method. I would definitely recommend this product.
Lets see, what can I say about this... well the price isn't much more different than at your local gun store, but other than price, it works really well
Exactly was I was looking for. Easy to use at a great price and does the job well. I would recommend this item.
This make it easier to clean my gun after hunting just run it down the bore after every trip out to prevent rust it works awesome cleaned more than the rods and patches could.
What a pleasure to use , it's easy , can be stored in the gun case , no mess , no bending cleaning rods , no assembly , it just does not get any better !
summary: Sliced bread get out of the way !  It's the better thing since !

reviewText: I have used this several times now since I've received it and it is fantastic. What a time saver and you no longer have to tear an automatic apart just to clean the barrel.
Makes cleaning the bore pretty easy.  I would buy this again.  Seems well made.  Price is about right for the product

I was reluctant to try a boresnake - I'm thorougly "old-school" when it comes to cleaning and maintaining a firearm.  But I couldn't find a long rod small enough to fit my new .22 rifle.  At a friend's suggestion, I bought a bore snake and I was truly impressed.  I've bought Hoppe's bore snakes for every firearm I own.
summary: BoreSnakes beat cleaning rods - hands down!

reviewText: These boresnakes are the handiest most painless way to keep your firearms clean. You just run them through the barrel and pull them out of the breach and your firearm is clean just like that, then you just throw it in the washing machine to be reused forever.

Well this is the way i will clean all my rifles from now on. I have to go now, lots off them to purchase for all my other rifles. This bore-snake is quite effective for cleaning a barrel. It is  hard to pull through the barrel. Don't just wrap the end around your finger to pull it through or you might cut yourself. I wrap it around the outside of my hand for a lot of leverage to pull it through without it cutting me.
perfect for my AK...highly recommended.  it even fits in the hallow Tapco pistol grip. wont have to worry about field cleaning.

I always use this for my final push through the bore, so it cleans any dust from the cotton patches out. I usually start by running it through a few times, them use a cotton patch with cleaner on it, then several more cotton patches, then if its still dirty I'll run a brush through it and repeat. To finish I run the bore snake through it again.
Using this to clean my Ruger 10/22 and it's doing a perfect job, no complaints! Would definitely recommend to others!

I've purchased several of these for the different caliber firearms I have in my safe.  So much nicer and easier to use than the old rod and brush system.  These do an excellent job.  You won't be disappointed.
I have  a BoreSnake in each caliber I shoot. They are good for cleaning after each session; still need to do a thorough traditional cleaning every once in a while.
best invention ever for cleaning rifles.  i do not have to worry about rod guides or anything, i can pull this through several times and it is clean and shiney.

Hoppe's makes the best boresnake on the market, bar none. I had a snake made by another company, whose name I will not mention, that did not a terrible job of removing fouling. I now use it solely to apply lubricant to the barrel. A few run throughs with the Hoppe's boresnake, however, and the black crap came right out of my Mosin with no fuss. It's the brass bristles that make the difference, they really grip and scrub out lead and carbon fouling without damaging the barrel. The wide cloth end for soaking up solvent (I use Hoppe's No. 9) wipes the scrubbed out gunk out and leaves the bore nice and shiny. I will buy one of these for my shooting buddy come Christmas.
This is a great tool. Use it on both my AR and .22 bolt action. It does it's task wonderfully and is small and easy to carry compared to have specific rods, brushes, and clothes.
well i have been cleaning guns for 40 years now and this is my first bore snake.boy i wish i had tried this years ago when they first came out

This is great to use to clean break barrel air rifles. Just one pass, and you are good. I usually do two passes just to be safe.This doesn't fit in the breech for my PCP rifle, so I use a crown saver for that.A great item to keep for cleaning.

Get this and your wife or hubby will appreciate how much less time you spend cleaning your rifle(s).A great gun cleaning tool.I was skeptical at first, took me a year to purchase, but boy what a time saver.Get it, it's low-priced and you will not regret it. (even cheaper at Wawlmawrt)

And it works great, I figured I could overlook the 0.3 difference. Boresnakes are great, somebody had a great idea and I wish it had been me. Makes cleaning barrels incredibly fast and easy. I'll use a boresnake and then clean the barrel again with a patch or vice versa, just because I enjoy cleaning up at the end of the day, but this has everything you'd want or need in one pass through the barrel. Very clever and efficient. Gotta admire that. It takes longer to gather this thing up to put it away than it does to use it, really.

Not much to write about this item. I purchased to try it out against my normal cleaning rod, but I have not used it yet.Seems to be a good product for the price and I will see how good it is on my next clean.
What can one say - it's an item that works, and works very well.  6 more words required to post.

stop pissing around with a cleaning rod that busts off in your barrel.  one pass of this baby get's it sparkling.  a tight fit though, thought the cord was going to bust when i was pulling it through the bore.dang'ed expensive though for a piece of string, but it works well.
Make a great field expedient cleaning accessory.  I found that it does such a fast and great job that I quit using the cleaning rod.
This takes cleaning simplicity to a whole new level!  Buy this now and save youself the hastle of the old 'patch and rod' technique!!

This is s snake that bites. It bites the barrel of my AR15 clean. I mean two passes and you can see it shine. It is so easy to use and makes it fast to clean your weapon. You can clean your weapon in the field in just seconds. Love it.

I got this for my Mosin Nagant 1891/30 and Model 44. After my trip to the range today I used it to clean both rifles. Quickest I've ever gotten them clean.I also have the one sized for my 10/22.Love 'em!

Works great, has a built in brass brush, which I didn't notice in the description. Plenty long enough for just about every rifle with a .22-.223 barrel. Easy to clean off and wash. Great little tool for quick cleaning!
If you want a easy barrel cleaner for your 10/22 or AR in general, get this BoreSnake. It's cheap, but works...

I purchased this boresnake for my 5.56 AR-15 to clean and lube the barrel bore. This is a very good way to clean and oil the bore of any .22 cal rifle. I highly recommend the Hoppe's Boresnake to anyone that prides themselves with a well cleaned and oiled firearm. Very easy to use, just drop the leader into the breach, drop down and out of the muzzle, and pull the boresnake out of the muzzle.
This boresnake used with CLP or Froglube, will clean your rifle barrel to a mirror finish with just 2 or 3 passes. Great product! No more hassle using multiple patches.

Makes cleaning a .22 rifle sooo much easier. Run it through a few time (with a lcp or cleaning solvent on it) and it will be ready for shooting/storing just like that. Really recommend for ruger .22 rifles.
The bore snake is far superior to the traditional rod and patch method. Just a couple drops of ctp on the fat end and pull it through. Easy as that.

I have two of these and much less $$ than I have found at gun shows and local shops...including Walmart!!  When the SHTF and all you have is your rifle, make sure you can keep it clean!!  Not to many cleaning benches in the great outdoors!
summary: Handy tool I keep in the grip of my AK and FAL!!

reviewText: it is a good bore snake ... I use it and makes life easier... cuts down on the time needed to clean your AR

This cleaner can't be beat for a quick and easy cleaning at the range or in the field. It is thorough enough to clean and protect the bore. Nothing is better than a good cleaning session on a bench rest, but this will keep you shooting and give you peace of mind. You won't feel like you are abusing your rifle and even feel like you might be pampering it a bit.
This is the third bore snake I've purchased.  I've got two other calibers that work perfectly.  Make gun cleaning simple and every bit as good as patches.
Sure makes cleaning easier and faster. Doesn't take much room in the cleaning kit. I bet this little guy cut my cleaning time in half or better.
dont know how i got around without it .... .... ..... ..... ...... ..... .... ... .. .. . ..
summary: im gonna get another one for the sks

reviewText: i am extremely detailed in cleaning guns, with that being said, this is not an alterative to cleaning your weapon. I bought this to do a quick clean at the range before i can get it comepletely stripped down and cleaned properly. great for the range, or for hunting. highly recommend.
and I am sure my kids will thank me for it one day. This works like a charm and does the job well of cleaning the barrel. A must have in your cleaning kit.
summary: I use this for my AR

reviewText: Very easy to use and never a problem.  HAve used it for over a month now and it makes cleaning my rifle very easy.  I am planning on ordering other sizes!
2 swipes and my AR and 10-22 are clean. I recommend treating bore with your favorite solvent, but you do not have to if you're in the field.
buy a boresnake! A quick and easy to clean your firearms without a mess. This works great in all .223 and .22 weapons

My son has been trying to get me to buy one of these for a long time but I am an old rod and patch person and thought there was no other way to completely clean the bore of a gun.  I finally purchased one of these and I am impressed.  It really does the job, especially out in the field when you need to do a quick cleaning and caint carry all the accessories needed to do it right.  I also use this in conjunction with wetting down the bore with solvent and soaking, then use the bore snake to remove the fouling.  It works like a dream.  I have one of these for every caliber now.
summary: Why havent I got one of these earlier

reviewText: I'm actually a little saddened by these bore snakes. One of my favorite things to do was clean my guns after a day of shooting. These Boresnakes have cut my cleaning time from nearly 2 hours, to just a few minutes. I purchased .17, .22, .308, and 12ga.

If you own a 10/22, 795, 597, Sav Mod 64 and other 22semi, you need this device to clean your barrel. You do not need to break down your gun to clean you barrel. Does a great job. Don,t say I didn't tell you about this when you ruin your crown trying to put a rod down the muzzle end. Or all that barrel crud goes into your actions. Merry Christmas.
great product and speedy delivery , really makes the bores on my old mosin nagants shine like new, will buy more for my other firearms
I wish I would have had one of these when I was in the Army. Makes cleaning the barrel easy.
You can't go wrong with bore snakes... these things are awesome! I have gotten one for every caliber I own... fast and easy! Can't beat that!

This is the second one of these I have ordered.  I know they work really well, and make clean the bore of your rifle very easy and fast.  I have purchased one of these for every caliber of firearm that I own, and would strongly recommed this product to anyone who wants to clean there firearms.

Quick and simple cleaning, in the field or at home.  I use this for rifles and pistols.  If you've never used one of these you need to try one. When you don't have time to tear-down and lubricate your gun, this will at least give you confidence that your bore is clean with less than a minute of effort.  Highly recommended!
summary: Got a gun? You need one of these...

reviewText: Great tool for maintaining your bore.  Seems to work just fine.  Tough to find this caliber locally, so had to order it.
Bought these in every caliber that I have.....  along with Frog Lube.  On the brass tip of each, there is a stamp so you know what caliber it is so that they do not get mixed up.

I am used to the old style GI issue cleaning rod kit that I use for 20+ years in the Army.  This is easier to use as there is no assembly required. I would be hesitant to use it if you are shooting cast bullets tho.  I just don't think it would remove the lead as well as the old style bore brush.
Instead of patching over and over again, I probably pull 2-3 times through my AR and its clean as can be
this is the best way I have found to clean ar-15s as well as your 22LR rifles..  simple and can be cleaned in washer

These are good for cleaning your barrel right after you shoot.  Dont expect them to get all of the carbon out of a barrel though if you let your gun sit for a while, to get a barrel really clean you will have to run a brass barrel brush though it and some patches with cleaner, then follow up with this thing afterwards.  Overall a good product, easy to use and 80% affective at removing debris/carbon buildup in a barrel.
As usual a Hoppe's product performs well.  Using this bore snake with the hoppe's venom is a great combination.  Easy gun cleaning.

I use to have somewhat of a difficult time cleaning my .17 HMR due to the fact you usually have to buy specific cleaning kits for them. However, with this rope you can clean and maintain you firearm! Just be sure to pull the black rope as gentle as possible. I had a .22 cal rope where the black string broke off due to my ignorance, but this is a great item and I highly recommend it!
Since I discovered BORESNAKE, would never be without one.

This little boresnake is great for .22lr rifles, especially the Ruger 10/22.  With that rifle, you must clean from the muzzle to the receiver when using a traditional rod and patch.  This is not ideal as you can damage the crown of the muzzle.With a boresnake, however, you can clean from the receiver and exit the muzzle.  Quick, easy, and does the job on the Ruger 10/22.I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 simply because I think this should sell for approximately $12.

I should have bought a rod and brush. The snake cannot be used on my pump air rifle because you can not remove or insert the long weight through the breach opening. On my break barrel air rifle, it is so tight that I am afraid the string attaching the weight to the snake is going to break off. I used it (.177) on my 22 rim fire long rifle and pistol. It was snug and cleaned those well.

This Bore Snake has a sort of nylon brush in the center rather then the brass on used on fire arms. It does a great job and much easer to use then cleaning pellets. No chance of scratching the barrel, works much better then a rod.Air Gun barrels are made of a softer metal then Fire Arms so using a conventional boar snake is not a good idea for air guns. This is a great solution.I also use this in my .22 air rifle as it seems to do a good job with them also.
summary: Bore Snake for Air Gun - Neat

reviewText: This is really a good product, the only thing is the instructions are not that good.  So go to youtube for the best way to use.

I use bore snakes for both pistols and long rifles...After forty years of using the "classic" rod, brush, patch system of cleaning 1911 .45s, M-16s, M-60s, .22 rifle, 9 mm pistols, .308 and 30-06 rifles, using ANY other method is simply a non starter...  The bore snake is simple, reliable, and much less hassle for routine cleaning.One thing that is different about the bore snake is that it is a bit messy to handle during and after use, so I use rubber gloves when cleaning weapons, and store the bore snake in a Ziploc bag....
summary: The simplest way to clean a weapon!

reviewText: I like these things, I got six, one for each of my calibers. I put cleaner on the first part, then oil on the end so as it pulls through the cleaner hit the barrel first then the bristles then the oil. They work good for me.

As far back as I can remember, I used a set of rods that one screwed together with fitting for the end for a wire brush or a swab.  The Hoppe's BoreSnake does all the cleaning in one easy step.  One just opens the breach or locks the slide in the open position, dangles the weight down the bore and then pulls it though.  The snake is fitted based on caliber, so be certain to purchase the correct one.  The snake has the wire brush built in, so it drags our the burnt power and barrel debris while buffing right behind it.  I will never use anything else.  It makes cleaning a breeze.  Back in the day, after a day of shooting, I might clean all my guns a day or two later.  With the Hoppe's BoreSnake, I take the snakes with me in my gun box and clean them on site before I go home.  the BoreSnake makes cleaning pistols and rifles a breeze.  No regrets other than I wish they had come up with this 25 years ago!
I love these things. I bought a new .17 and have been using this after every shot works like a charm.

This is a very good product,  I can clean a 22 cal. bore in seconds.  One of the best gun cleaning products to hit the market!  If I wanted this quality of cleaning it would require many patches to equal it, and on 223 cal. You should use a chamber brush once and a while anyway.

I use these for shotgun, rifles, and pistols of varying calibers. I shoot mostly jacketed ammo so I don't go to crazy with bore cleaning and these work quite well as a one-shot deal. Normally I make a few passes with bore cleaner and a snake, then some CLP and a snake and call it good.Get the .22 RIFLE version for a rifle as they're much longer and work better for cleaning a rifle. A vendor mixed them up on me once... (the pistol versions are shorter, obviously).They're a little tight sometimes to pull through but you'll manage. If not, you're probably a soft handed, wine-sipping Communist and don't need to own and operate firearms anyway. Get your girlfriend to finish the job for you, ya Nancy.I can't imagine you'd be able to break one, although someone's probably done it and blamed it on the product, not operator error. I can screw up an anvil with a banana but have never broken a boresnake (yet).The only failure I've encountered using a boresnake was when attempting to clean a heavily leaded 12-guage barrel, but that's understandable. That's a job for a stout cleaning rod, a cordless drill, a tornado bush, lots of bore cleaner, some four letter words, and a cold adult beverage or three anyway.A great item to stash in a range bag or hard case for quick swabbings. Stock up.
Great value and a wonderful product. You can't beat a bore snake. It is the best and most simple bore cleaner on the market. Fit and cleaned my 30/30 flawlessly.

BoreSnakes work great. I love them. For a fast, easy clean, just run it through with some cleaner. For an AR15 you'll still have some other cleaning to do, but this is the easiest way to clean the barrel.

I like the BoreSnake and think it does a good job, but I agree with some of the problems that are pointed out by others. Number one fault, the cheap nylon cord breaks. I have had it break on three others, but have not ried this out yet. With the others, I complained to Hoppe's and they sent me new ones. Keep complaining about this problem, maybe they will fix it (but probably not). Also, they do wear out. A brush on the end of a cleaning rod can be replaced for a couple of bucks, these, not so much. These are good for a quick run through cleaning out in the field, but should not be substituted for a proper cleaning.I hadn't bought any gun cleaning equipment in a number of years and when I started to get the stuff from Hoppe's, it all says made in China. Outers is still made in America, my local gun shop stopped carrying Outers because it was "more" expensive and we're not talking by a lot. All they stock now is Hoppe's. From now on I am going back to the old rod and brush style and buy caliber specific Gunslick kits from Outers. I would rather pay the little extra for a better product, and feel good about buying it. Yes, this (the BoreSnake) is easier to use, but sometimes "easy" isn't what your looking for.

Works great! after firing over 100 rounds through my 10/22 a little spray of bore cleaner two passes of the Bore snake and spotless. A brass weight on the feed end drops easily down and through the barrel to feed everything through. The first 4" of the snake has little brass bristles that gently scrub away lead and other buildup. The directions indicate the snake in hand or machine washable.

Bore snakes work so well!  I must have 10 of them around.  This price was way better than I could find locally.  Bore Snakes will make you pack all your bending/breaking/scratching metal cleaning rods up and put them in a box to be forgotten.  2 pulls of a bore snake is like monkeying around with dirty smelly patches and a metal rod that scratches your barrel's crown for an hour.  Dip the wire brush part at the front in Hoppe's bore solvent, put a few drops of Mobile 1 along the long fat swap part works great.  Mobile 1 works great and is much cheaper than tiny bottles of thin "magic potion" oil.
summary: I love the smell of Hoppe's in the morning! :)

reviewText: Bought this for my M1A.  Very easy to run thorough the gun but does not take out as much dirt as I thought it would, still a great tool for you cleaning kit.
I used this on my .223. Cleaned it well. Saves a lot of time if you shoot a lot. Especially if you shoot garbage ammo. =(

These BoreSnakes have been around for a while now, and it's such a simple design.  It's an improvement on the old "pull-string" barrel cleaning methods that required the user to clean the barrel in separate steps RE pull-through the bore brush, then pull-through the cleaning patch.  This BoreSnake does it all at one time.  It's also good because it allows the user to clean his/her firearm from chamber-to-muzzle, which is preferable to cleaning from muzzle-to-chamber, which lessens the chances of pulling dirt/grime/etc. back into the chamber area.One note - if using this 5.56 BoreSnake in an AR type rifle, you'll still need to clean the locking-lug area with a military type chamber brush because the BoreSnake can't clean that particular area.  However, it does a fast and great job with the AR's chamber and barrel.  A very worthwhile purchase.
summary: Works great, and at an excellent price.

reviewText: A little frayed when it came in the mail..... Nothing a lighter couldnt take care of tho.... Works on both my .22 and .223 great!

I find that the boresnake makes cleaning the .17HMR the best way because I had a hard time finding a good bore brush for it that would fit my breach to muzzle kit. I was able to put some solvent in front of the brush part of the snake & behind, then oil with the tail end dry. 2 pulls and I'm done. Will buy other calibers..
this is a great product, i use it after every range trip, great design and quality. i would like to get one for my other cal. rifles
Makes cleaning my AR 15 very easy. And it's easy to use. Just put a few drops down the barrel and take your bore cleaner and go to town.
summary: Hoppe's 24011 BoreSnake Rifle Bore Cleaner, M-16, .22 - .223 Caliber

reviewText: We have used these boresnakes for years cleaning the many rifles we use in our Youth Hunts. They save time and do a great job cleaning the barrels.
summary: The best way to clean your barrel.

reviewText: I bought this product because of the hilarious review by Miker.  It's a must read and I identified with him --- a lot !  The product works great and I love it - although I enjoy cleaning guns I don't enjoy cleaning bores.
I have one for my 22LR guns and always satisfied with the job this product does. I would recommend this product to any serious gun collectors
I have a similar snake for my Mossberg shotgun.  This is the quickest way to get the barrel clean of residue.
summary: This Snake won't bite and it works

reviewText: hoppes always provide great products. Use it every time I go shooting. Bought them for every caliber I have. Use it all the time at the gun range. We have used Hoppes since late 1940s. Use on handguns and rifles.
Great design works perfect every time.
First time i used hoppe product and i am impressed by the how well this bore cleaner works. Quick and easy to used.
And as always, what a pleasure it was dealing with Amazon. BoreSnakes are great for cleaning barrels. They're quick and easy, and less clean up then a rod and cotton patch.
summary: Hoppe's BoreSnakes are great. You can't go wrong.

reviewText: Cleaned out my 16" AR in a matter of 3 pulls (it was dirty little girl) With the 3 pulls the barrel was as clean as it was when i bought it.
summary: Works great in half the time

reviewText: I have used Boresnakes for years for my handguns and rifles, of all calibers. Except, until now, .22LR.I managed to get it about 1/4 of the way into the bore, but it wouldn't budge any further. The nylon leader began to break, so I 'backed it out' and took it back to the vendor (not Amazon.com).You might have a different experience in .22LR, but this was just a tight squeeze, and I'll stick with the cleaning rod, pull through, jag and patches.In other calibers these work fine, but they should be thoroughly washed with every use, or else you're just dragging old junk through the barrel again.
Cleaning my Daniel Defense M4V5LW is a breeze when using this boresnake for its barrel. Extremely helpful and easy to wash after a number of cleanings. Good product.

Love this product; cheap and effective. Although the durability could be better, you can't really expect much from modern mass manufacturing. It does work though, at least on .22LR and other .22 caliber firearms which is what I use it for. Have NOT tested it on other 5.7mm caliber guns though (.223 Rem, 22-250, etc.)
summary: Good product! Cheap and does its job!

reviewText: Boresnakes are simply great. OK, OK, maybe they don't deep clean as well as a good brush and some elbow grease, but they do an awesome job for those "in-between" cleanings, where you don't have to get every little speck. A couple of pulls through and you're usually good to go. Once you go Boresnake, you never go back.

These bore snakes are much easier to use and cause much less damage to the barrel than your traditional push rod and brush. I find that I can spray in, or simply add a few drops of, bore cleaner into the barrel and allow it to soak in for a few minutes and then just pull this through a few times and the bore is clean.  An extra wet patch sometimes if I have gone a few days from when I last shot the gun. I have them in multiple calibers and they all seem to work equally well.

Cleaning guns is not the most-fun thing you can do with your firearm.  Bore snakes are about the greatest invention for guns since non-corrosive primers; especially if you're like me and your wife just refuses to do it for you.  I know, right?Anyways, good product.  Have had mine for about a year and haven't had any issues.  Two or three passes of this down the tube, then an oiled patch, and put away.
BoreSnakes are wonderful. I have three different ones for my pistols and rifles. Makes cleanup after the range a breeze.

I got this for my Ruger 10/22 and decided to use the Boresnake after firing about 300 (brass plated Federal Champion) rounds because there is no way to put a cleaning rod into the barrel's breech. I didn't want to put the cleaning rod with a bore brush into the end of the barrel because I don't want to take a chance of bending it or the rod and maybe screwing up the rifling.I read the instructions that came with it and they were pretty basic so I called up Hoppe's and asked if there was any more to it than what it said on the package.  I was told to put a "few drops of [what else] Hoppe's bore cleaner just below where the pull cord is attached to the wider portion, a "few drops" of oil at the end and run it through a couple times.  He also mentioned I could wash it in the washing machine if I put it in a mesh bag so the bristles wouldn't tear up the other clothes.  I don't generally put oily things from gun cleaning into the washing machine so I suppose I'll wash it by hand.I didn't have an eye dropper so I'm sure I put more than a few drops of bore cleaner and oil on it, but it wasn't soaked or dripping wet.  I ran it through the barrel two times.  My eyes aren't as good as they used to be so looking in the bore using a bore light wouldn't have done me much good to see if it was still dirty or not. To check to see how well it worked, I ran a clean dry patch into the end of the barrel through to the breech a couple of times. The only thing on the patch was a little bit of oil.Since I had the thing out I decided to use it to clean my new Ruger Mark III 22/45 that I had shot up a mixed bunch of brass plated and lead rounds, about 400 in all.  I used the Boresnake exactly as I used it with the 10/22 but it took four passes with it to get it clean, probably because of the lead bullets.  I put a dry, clean patch on a cleaning rod (from the barrel's breech) and got the same result, a clean patch with a little oil on it.As of now, I'm very pleased with the Boresnake and would recommend it.  I plan on getting Boresnakes for my .40 S&W; and .45. pistols.
summary: Works great! Here are tips from Hoppes.

reviewText: I bought this at the suggestion of a couple forum members I know. I'm using it to clean my .17 hmr and the bore looks great.
I ordered 1 and it won't fit any PCP rifle because the brass weight is too long and can't go in the chamber.
Why didn't I buy one of these years ago???? It makes cleaning my rifle so much easier! No more jamming cleaning swabs in with a rod the same size as the bore.
summary: Buy it and clean your gun more.

reviewText: Okay, I'll admit that there is still certainly a place for the ever-useful cleaning patch, but the bore snake is a huge time saver without sacrificing the quality of cleaning. In fact, it seems to me that the bore snake gets the bore cleaner than multiple patches ever did. These snakes are super easy to use, and provide the tightness and lots of surface to really scrub the bore clean. What's more, for rifles that don't allow access to the breech for a long cleaning rod - you can now properly clean them in the right direction (breech to muzzle). And, the snake is washable for a long life of continued use.
summary: Patches! We don't need no stinking patches!

reviewText: I am a trained military armorer, an NRA instructor, a military competition shooter and someone who just plain enjoys shooting guns. Not cleaning them so much, mostly shooting them. There are books written about different ways to clean guns and I won't go into that here.I am firmly in the 'clean the carbon leave the copper' camp. The Boresnake lets me do that and quickly. Its not a replacement for a actual stiff cleaning rode, which you should always have around for different reasons like stuck cases. But I can take a brake at a match or sniper course, run a Boresnake through my rifle and be ready to get back on line in minutes. They work great, take up no room and stow anywhere. When using one you should poor your cleaning solvent onto the forward part of the snake and not dig it to prevent contamination. That said it gets done what its made for, nothing fancy or super special. But its reliable, inexpensive and super easy to use. Every shooter should have one.
The product was as advertised and it looks great.  Colors, design, quality as pictured, as expected.  I would write less, but I have to meet the minimum amount of characters for a review.  Silly.
WHAT CAN I SAY, IT'S MADE BY HOPPE AND I HAVE PURCHASED THEIR PRODUCT'S FOR YEAR'S  WORKS EXCELLANT AND I WOULD BUY AGAIN FROM THE COMPANY AND AMAZON.
I used one of this to clean my AR bore and for my surprise the claims are true. It is truly amazing. One pass and the bore is mirror clean.

This works great for my Marlin Model 60.  Some people do not care for bore snakes, but I personally do not mind that they do not get my gun surgically clean.  The trade off for me is ease of use.  Dab some CLP or other solvent directly onto the snake above the bristle section and pull through three times, good to go.  When these things start to get filthy, you can either wash them by hand with soap and hot water, or put them in a sock and toss them in the washing machine.
I love this. its awesome for cleaning long guns that are a pain to clean... yeah I'm looking at you 10/22

Does a fine job and once one learns to lube the first foot of the tube as it enters the barrel with WD40 or similar rust preventive/lube.  The barrel is clean with two passes and none of the garbage ends up in the breech area.  I stand on the slug end after passing through the barrel and lift the gun away from my foot.  Works very well!

So why not have a BoreSnake for every caliber ?  No reason not to when the defacto standard of cleaning those nasty old bores has been revolutionized by Hoppe's. Got them for everything from a .22 on up to the .308 and I have no complaints.

I never liked using cleaning rods for fear of damaging the muzzle. BoreSnakes are a terrific solution, and easy to fit in a crowded range bag. One pass with solvent, another with gun oil after each firing session keeps the barrel (and muzzle) pristine.
summary: Efficient, Effective, Quick & Compact. Any Questions?

reviewText: I have one of these for each of the pistol and rifle calibers I have and swear by them. After range time I'll spray some Ballistol down the barrel and run this from the chamber end two or three times. It's a tight pull down a long barrel but the cord hold well and I expect this to last a while.
Works great, makes cleaning fast and efficient. Fits perfectly in a small pocket on the side of my 10/22 rifle case!
This works great. The first pull through is tough but after that, goes through smooth and cleans well. Excellent product.
BoreSnake is the best way to clean barrels, fast and efficient. Starting using them in the military, own one for every caliber weapon in the house now.

Works great to clean my Ruger 10/22 which can be a hassle. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to save some time. Remember to hand wash or laundry wash (in a bag) once in awhile to keep it clean.
summary: Save tons of time, Great product

reviewText: This should be in everyone's kit.

BoreSnakes are great, quick fixes.  I bought this to use on all my 30cal weapons (308 and 300WM) immediately after use.  I use the OTIS system when I get back home to clean the rest, more thoroughly.  It's a great intermediate cleaning.Great for hunters.  Great for bench shooting.  Great for anything, really.  In any caliber.Highly recommend !
summary: Obviously it works great, otherwise it wouldn't still be around !

reviewText: Really beats running a swab down on a pole. Just throw some cleaner on it and run it through once, or twice, and you're good to go.
This handi bore cleaner is easy to use and works quite well plus it reusable! I'm tired of running patch after patch to clean my bore.

all bore snakes work great. i have several in all the calibers. They will not clean as well as a rod and jag done the right way, but they will clean very well and 10x quicker than anything out there. spray the barrel and run the snake 2x. your barrel will be almost spotless.....just mad i didn't invent such a good idea
summary: fastest 95% bore cleaner you will ever buy

reviewText: I have multiple Boresnakes and as my title suggests they do work quite well and really help while at the range and want a quick spruce-up of your weapon.Now I have also bought a cleaning kit for each of my calibers as well, for nothing is quite as satisfying to my OCD with my firearms than a clean white patch coming out of the barrel.If you've only shot a few rounds at the range this thing is awesome, but if your gun is really soiled, you have a brass build-up, or you just want to zen out and clean your gun then go with regular kits.  It's hard to tell with a Boresnake if the barrel is clean or not, for they are usually a dark color.  But again, still a very good product and will continue to purchase them.
summary: Good for the time constrained or lazy.

reviewText: I have a whole bunch of these and wouldn't have a complete gun cleaning kit without them. Coupled with Hoppe's #9 solvent, your gun cleaning is a snap!
summary: I have a whole bunch of these

reviewText: Da best. Really has a snug feel going thru the barrel. You know that it's getting clean. Worth every dime.
summary: Da best. Really has a snug feel going thru the ...

reviewText: Hoppe's BoreSnake rifle bore cleaner. Excellent product, basically a one step bore cleaner. If you follow their instructional video on line on the use of the boresnake, you will find this works great

I got this to clean 30-06 and 30-30 caliber hunting rifles.If you haven't used a BoreSnake before, you are really missing out. The combination of brush and rope-patch section are just great. They are washable and reusable.I would really recommend these in all the calibers you shoot regularly. It makes cleaning a snap.If you are curious how it works, you simply drop the little weight on the end of the black cord through the throat of the rifle barrel and catch it as it exits the muzzle (put it in back by the trigger and pull it out where the bullets come out). You then just pull on that black chord and the brush will enter the barrel with the soft rope following. I was a bit worried about the toughness of this black cord, but I can really pull it without any worries. Pull it all the way through and you have made the equivalent of one brush and patch pass-through. Do that a few times and then run a clean patch through and you should be just about done.

We use Hoppe's No. 9, cloth patches and bronze brushes for the really deep cleanings before storage, but we use Hoppe's bore snakes for quick cleanings in between.  They are well made, fit in your pocket or gun kit, and last for years.  Each one is stamped with the proper caliber so you can grab the right one.  The weight on one end drops it down the barrel, and the handle on the other end gives you a firm grip when pulling it in and out.Using a bore snake polishes out gun powder residue, protecting your barrel from pitting, and improves your accuracy by removing any gunk that would interfere with the bullet trajectory.  When your bore snake gets dirty, just hand wash it, and you're good to go.Every gun enthusiast should have a Hoppe's bore snake for each caliber weapon he or she fires.
summary: Hoppe's quality, and a must for gun cleaning

reviewText: Have used the old solid or screw together cleaning rods for YEARS, and I finally broke down and purchased the ole' boresnake.  Finally see what I've been missing.  If you don't have these...buy them.  They're worth every penny, and reasonable in price.  If you're buying one for your 5.56 or .223, go ahead and get an extra one for your BOB.  Handy to not have to dig for it in an emergency.

I chose this product for the quality and tradition of the brand in the market.I recommend everyone to buy because besides come within the promised time, my expectations were confirmed with the quality of the piece.

These are just fantastic for cleaning the bore! I personally haven't had any of the issues others have listed yet.I use Ballistol, let it sit for a bit in my M4, and then run the Snake a few times...works great.

This makes cleaning up at the end of the day a snap!  This is all I use most routine days, and it quickly cleans the bore to a shine with one or two passes.  I washed it as per instructions once it got grungy and it came out sparkling as new.I don't think it completely replaces a good quality cleaning kit, but it certainly does a quick and efficient job for a routine clean of a service type plinker.

I don't like the viper version much, I think it's just inflated pricing.Anyway, I always use gun scrubber on my barrel, then I scrub (with bronze brush) my barrel vigorously.Then I use rem-oil, spray down my barrel (ensuring the gun scrubber stuff is washed out) and again scrub my barrel.Finally, i'll put a bit of Hoppe's elite gun oil on the bristle part of this product and run it through my barrel a few times.Lastly i'll inspect with a bore light, and repeat this process as necessary until I have a spotless barrel.That being said, a boresnake is an essential part of barrel cleaning nowadays and essentially replaces barrel cleaning cloths. Boresnakes also do a much better job at "detailing" a barrel, making it shiny (for chrome lined barrels) and spotless.This works on 7.62x39 barrels (i.e. AK barrels)
summary: Always end your barrel cleaning with this product

reviewText: Nice bore snake. Snug fit and bronze bristles on the snake ensure my bore is perfectly clean. Good price. Goes nicely with my Hoppe's cleaning pad.
Good cleaner

I use this for my Ruger 10/22 rifle, 22 inch barrel, my Ar-15's ( Colt and M&P Sport-15, 5.56) and my SR22 pistol. Com'on, it's a no brainer to clean with these snakes. It takes up to 30 seconds to scrub, clean and polish/ wipe dry your barrels. get rid of the cleaning rods. I am a consumer, not a dealer.  I have purchased 5 different caliber sizes including a 12 gauge shotgun. when you get it, you will no doubt see the huge advantage of having them.

handy for a quick clean of the bore while on a hunting trip or at the range. Use these for all my rifles and shotguns for a quick bore swap. Does a good job and cannot damage the muzzle crown or bore chamber. Add a bit of solvent to it and she is ready to go.
This item is a must for gun cleaning.  Something that is very effective and easy to use.  Washable once really dirty.  I have several and have given as gifts.

Shot 250 rounds of Federal Lake City (dirty) ammo.  Went home and disassembled the AR.  Looked down the barrel and checked for dirt and noticed a dirty barrel.  Ran the snake through 2 times and noticed the rifling was very clear and clean.  Used to run a half dozen patches to do the same thing.
summary: Super easy to use on my AR15

reviewText: An incredibly simple and useful tool.  In the time it used to take me to assemble a rod and put solvent on a patch, I am done.  The barrel is immaculate.I intend to by other BoreSnakes in additional calibers.
I get lazy cleaning my Tools. Guns are tools not Princess. This does a good job cleaning the .22LR. Its tight and it takes some muscles to run it though.
Works great. Just spray a little clp on it and run it through a half dozen times or so and your barrel will be clean as can be!Item was received on time as well
