So easy to clean your rifle with this bore snake. It works great! The first couple of times it is hard to get it through the barrel, but that means it is cleaning it! If you are like me, and don't really like taking the time to clean your gun, get this product.
summary: Greatest way to clean a rifle!

reviewText: I know Hoppe's aare the best bore cleaners around that why I ordered. Ran through my gun two-three time and it was PERFECTLY clean like it was brand new!
Works great for my Mosin Nagant! Brushes dont do anything compared to this thing. It cleaned out my barrel with little effort

I love boresnakes. They work great and I own about 8 of them (one for each caliber I own). I had to add this one to my collection because I didn't want to damage my air rifle with my other .17 caliber bore-snake that has the bronze brush embedded.

Not too sure why I haven't seen one before, but as soon as I did I got it on my Christmas list. I used it to break in a new .308 and it cut my break in period to about 1/2 the time. The biggest benefit is that my barrel is now broken in and not broken by traditional style "bore guides" or cleaning rods, cumbersome patches etc.After some research on barrel break in the No. 1 biggest problem is YOU, the person breaking the barrel in by beating scratches into it with a cleaning rod. The bore snake eliminates this and saves time doing it.Compare $25 for boresnake to $250-500 for a new barrel after your gunsmith tells you why you can't shoot under 1 moa because you screwed your barrel right up by banging it over the head with a cleaning rod 25 times.
summary: Feel Stupid for Not Using this Before

reviewText: great for general maint. on your rifle.  will not clean as good as the traditional style but will aid in the process of cleaning your rifle.

have 3 for different calibers. the easiest way to breach-clean your weapons. saves a lot of time and elbow grease, use it with Break-Free CLP-2 Cleaner Lubricant Preservative Aerosol, which is a great product in and of itself.

i couldn't find a .17 bore snake anywhere except amazon believe it or not, but i'm glad i got it. because it's smaller diameter, be very careful, no snap yet but i always feel like it will on first pull. not a manufacture flaw or anything just how it is. somewhat fraying, not alot, after  a few uses.

What can I say, it's a BoreSnake, it does the job. Not as thorough as a standard cleaning rod with patches but in most cases it is good enough for a light day at the range or a routine maintenance-cleaning of stored guns. If I have a heavy day at the range I usually run this BoreSnake through a couple times with CLP to get the big stuff and then finish-up with a standard cleaning rod. I would highly recommend. I also have these in 9mm and 12 gauge. (I will say that for some reason my 30 caliber BoreSnake is not as tight to the bore as my other ones)

Jamming a metal rod down your bore is the old fashioned way to clean a barrel.  The problem is that if you are not careful, you can mess up the crown which will in turn affect your accuracy downrange.Boresnakes are pretty awesome for cleaning purposes without the risk of messing up your barrel.  I will say this, make sure you use the right size snake in your barrel or risk getting it stuck to all heck.For me, I typically toss some Hoppes #9 on the copper brush, and some oil on the trailing side of the snake, and run it through a couple times.  Get it nice and clean and lubed in a couple of passes.Plus, I'm sure you can toss the snake in the wash.  I haven't yet though and after a dozen or more cleanings, it works just a nice as when new.
summary: I'll never use a rod again

reviewText: A great item for cleaning your rifle bore. You only need to pull it thur the rifle barrel once or twice. I recommend this item.

I might be biased toward this since I really like BoreSnakes. I have a snake for every caliber.They're really great for that 'at the range once through' or the anal-retentive once a month cleaning when you don't want to break out the rod and patches.After a few uses I put it inside a sock and throw the sock into the wash.
I have been using this product since I purchased my AR.  He has never failed me.  Not to mention how easy it is for me to use while on the range.
Great for a quick finish when cleaning, but if you use solvent in them or drag them through the bore prior to wiping out the heavy soot they gunk up
This is definitely a better cleaning tool for your ar15/m16 rifle than your typical rods and brush.  Just run it through a barrel 2 to 3 times and your done!
summary: Quick and easy for your ar15

reviewText: I love the boresnake. Much easier to clean my rifle than a patch and rod, in my experience they would always get stuck, but with this it's a lot easier and cleans it good.
I use these on all my guns.  Great for the field, simple to use.  They clean easy with Brake Kleen (clean).  I have a rod kit and an ultra sonic cleaner but I use the snakes 96% of the time.
This is the best price I have seen for bore snakes.  Fits and works just as described for my .223 rifle.

I have BoreSnakes for nearly all of my guns and absolutely love them.  Haven't bought one for my muzzleloader yet.  They get so filthy I may stick with patches.For all my regular rifles, shotguns and handguns they work great.  Some basic recommendations though.  Be sure to pull them from the chamber to the tip of the barrel so you don't deposit the gunk in the firing mechanism.  You also need to be careful needing them in until the bristles are inside the barrel so you don't scour and damage the outside finish.  I have a friend that sprays Rem Oil on the BoreSnake so it can clean and lube at the same time.  It works very well but I don't care for the overspray that gets on the table nor do I want the mess to carry around in the field.  If I thought ahead to take a baggie or was at home where I could wash it out it wouldn't be bad.These are excellent products!

I already had these for several pistol calibers, and I love them. After spending so much time cleaning my (5.56) rifles the old fashioned way, I decided it was time to get another Bore Snake. This product significantly cuts down on the time it takes to clean my rifles, and is very easy to use. They also do a GREAT job actually cleaning too.I would certainly recommend this to anyone looking for a easier, more efficient way of cleaning their firearms.
This is SO much better than a cleaning rod. Somebody recommended this to me a while ago, and I really wish I'd bought this thing sooner.
The first time I tried to put it through the barrel it wasn't going through at all. Added some CLP and its been flawless ever since.
if you can't operate this you're probably the type to get your you-know-what caught in the ceiling fan.  works very very well.
The shipping was very fast. This makes cleaning my rifles a whole lot easier then with a cleaning rod and pads. Works well on my 30/30 , 30-06, and 7.62x54 Mosin rifles.

you take one end of the bore snake and feed it into the barrel usually from the bolt side and down the barrel. feed the snake through 10-20 times or until clean. then make sure you clean all the moving parts of the gun and the exterior as well. with other stuff. oh what this is a boresnake review. WHAT ARE YOU LOOKING AT IT IS A BORESNAKE AND IT WORKS.
Cleans the gun well, easy to use, washes up well. Heavy and good quality, came very fast...........good shipper, easy to open as well
Got two:One for the pistolOne for the rifleWhy not make cleaning not easier but more thorough?Very Cool.

I have been cleaning firearms for over 40 years and have never had a better aid for doing it right than the Boresnake. I have an aversion to putting a firearm away without cleaning it if it's been fired, and sometimes it seems a bit of a bother. With this gadget, half the work is taken out of the equation, and with the proper lubes, brushes and an air compressor with a nozzle (my personal secret for getting grit and dust out of hard to reach places!) the rest of the job is easy.

I've tried other brands of these and they break.  NEVER had a Hoppe's break, ever.Run these through your gun right after every shoot while still at the range and you will never have to scrub another barrel.Usually less than $14 on Amazon.  Keep a little Rem Oil on 'em and they clean and oil in one.  Super easy.
I haven't had the need to use this yet but it appears it will do a fine job. I would recommend to others.
very effective product. I have one for each of my rifles and I love them. saves time cleaning your weapons.
works great. makes cleaning the bore on my 10 22 quick and easy. a must have in any gun cleanig kit.

After a range session I spray some M-Pro 7 on the snake and run it through the barrel a few times for both pistol and rifle.I have these is 7.62(.308), .22, .40, etc.I guess if you're really anal you might worry about eventually scratching the barrel, etc. but for me it's perfect.
Have these for all my guns. The first thing I did when I bought my .308 was order a bore snake. Thanks Amazon and Hoppes.
I use BoreSnakes for all of my rifles and pistols. I have 4 different sizes. They are so much faster and easier than using patches and the rod.
I use them quite often when target shooting.  The make it very easy to do a more complete clean when finished for the day.  Easy to pack and use.  It also works really well in a sand environment.

To start, the only reason I gave this 3 stars instead of 1 is because, like the boresnake I bought 3 years ago (same caliber), it cleans a gun barrel better than any other cleaning device I have used to date.  Now for the problem... This is for cleaning .22 caliber rifles.  I bought it for cleaning my AR's specifically.  The brass "weight" that they put on the end of the pull string was too big to slide through the barrel!  Thus, the product was useless in the condition it was delivered.  My first boresnake had a much smaller weight that easily slid down the barrel allowing me to quickly pull the snake through cleaning my barrel in seconds.  I figured out the problem (other than the obvious fact that the weight was too big)... The weight Hoppes is using has the caliber number stamped on it to identify which snake to use.  Great idea if you have multiple snakes, but the weight size needed to fit the stamp was too big to fit a .22 cal.  After squeezing the weight with pliers, I reshaped it enough to barely thread it down the barrel, which took longer than using a a rod and patch set.  In the end, I had to dremel the weight to make it useable.  Very frustrating.  I don't foresee this being a problem with calibers bigger than .22 though, because they probably use the same size weights on the other snakes.
summary: Disappointed in comparison to original boresnake.

reviewText: I love bore snakes after having been introduced to them at work.  They are easy to use and cut cleaning time way down.  Worth the money.
It was just as described on line.  Arrived as described.  Put to immediate use in my every day carry range bag
summary: It was just as described on line.  Arrived as described.  Put to immediate use.

reviewText: This has been extremely useful at the range. Its so quick and easy to use. I put a dab of Frog Lube on the end and pull it through a couple of times and I'm good to go. It fixes a lot of minor jamming issues you might have and allows for smooth ejections after a single pass. Love this thing, I use it every time!

When at the range, its great after every 500 rounds or so to keep your rifle functional and accurate in the field. However after you get home from the range and shot 5000+ rounds, it doesn't do that great of a job. Its best to clean you rifle the old fashion way with real cleaning tools.
summary: Perfect for a quick field clean

reviewText: This is by far the easiest way to clean your 22. Just spray your favorite cleaner/lube on the cloth near the metal brushes, pull through the barrel, and voila, clean bore. It's a pretty tight fit on my Ruger 10/22, and I have to yank pretty hard to get the snake through, but the string hasn't snapped yet. If it does, I'll come back and change my review, but until then, it's well deserving of it's 5 star rating.

this beats patches and brushes and all that stuff. I am as anal as it gets with my weapons as i clean them all after a day at the range. I put some CLP on the brushes and run the snake through the breach end of the barrel once or twice...job done. I do get a little more involved cleaning action,chamber and bolt on my ar-15s.Cleaning a remington 700 chambered in .223 or a s&w m&p 15-22 is a 2 minute job.This is a must for the person who shoots more than normal and hates cleaning his gun barrels when he or she gets home.shoot more and spend less time cleaning your weapons. I repeat try clp it is GREAT stuff.Very good investment ,inexpensive so buy more ammo!!!
Great for cleaning rifle bore. I have had one of these for each of several rifles for a long time and they work as advertised.

Love these things . Grteat item to add to your zombie survival kit. Compact effective cleaning tool for your bug-out bag. I use it all the time but a good old fashoned cleaning is good now and then too.
does what it's supposed to.  I've used it for a while now and anything different if just plain stupidity.  this product is the bee's knees.

OMG cleaning ALL my long guns was cut to a mere fraction ! Yeah I know, "Airsoft", BUT you'd might be surprised how dirty the barrels can get. Have a 600 $ Sniper Rifle and don't want to replace the inner barrel on that bad boy, due to dirt !
summary: Well worth the investment in preventive maintance

reviewText: I have hunted almost all of the big and small game in North America. I am also an extreme varmint shooter. I am fanatical about keeping guns meticulously clean, especially on the inside. In the past, I have kept an extremely comprehensive cleaning setup of chemicals, bench mounts, tools and supplies to carry this out. A few years ago, I learned about the Bore-Snake and purchased one (with much skepticism) to try out.I used a rifle on the firing line to get it user dirty inside. I then cleaned it's bore with the Bore-Snake, as instructed, and then ran my regular cleaning patches and solutions thru the bore to see what was left. I was amazed. The patches all came out clean and it was apparent that the bore snake did it's job as well as an array of rods, brushes and patches while setting on a cleaning bench. The only thing left to do was to swab the chamber and dry it. No more do I have to set up the cleaning bench to do the job!I will continue to test results with an occasional clean patch, but if all goes according to plan, all I need to do is wash the Bore-Snake in detergent and rinse it occasionally to keep it going.I purchased this particular Snake for my .22 rim-fires and expect that I will never even have to worry about chamber cleaning for it.
summary: Can't be beat for what it does.

reviewText: Many guns cannot be cleaned using a cleaning rod from the rear, and you should NEVER use a cleaning rod from the front.  The Boresnake drops in from the rear, gets pulled through, and the process can be repeated if needed.
summary: The best and easiest way to clean your bore!

reviewText: I got two of these and they work great I need to get one for my pistols just haven't ordered one yet but I will.

This is my first ever BoreSnake, so take this with a grain of salt.  It does what it's supposed to.  I love it, and will be purchasing more in different calibers.  I would recommend this item, and will buy more.

This does NOT fit the ruger 10/22 standard carbine barrel. I was excited to use this product as a way to field clean my 10/22 in case I needed, but it doesn't look like I'll be able to anyhow. Just be warned.
I have a couple of 22 rifles for which this was made.  Doesn't seem to fit in the barrels too well.  I guess I will stick to the patches.
If you haven't used one of these before then you should really spend the money and get one of these, will never use anything else again.

I recommend a bore snake for any regular shooter. One pass through while your gun barrel is still warm and clean up at home is much much easier. I've only ever had one rip on me and that is because it was super old.
High quality build in metal brush. Tight fit, cleans barrels great. Requires some extra strength to pull initially but goes through easy after.

This product was as described and shipped on time. The BoreSnake is easy to use and performed as claimed. I went with the original BoreSnake because the Viper version has a thinner pull cord that's more prone to breakage. I've been a longtime user of standard rod and patch systems of barrel maintenance but now I can say for the first time that I know that my barrel is clean after using the BoreSnake. I would buy again.
summary: The BoreSnake is a Great Invention

reviewText: Does exactly what it needs to do, cleans the barrel of 22's.  Thanks for a great product as always Hoppes

This things works great...great simple idea, worl great with the Hoppe's bore cleaner and oil, will buy more of these for my other pistols and rifles. Easy to use and cuts down on the mess and other stuff.
I have several of these in different calibers.  They cut down on cleaning time and energy.  I just added this to my cleaning kit.  First thing I use on my gun.

Works great in my .223/5.56 AR 15. How can you own a rifle & not have one of these? Do yourself a favor & get one. The price was reasonable, shipping was fast & the boresnake arrived in it's original packaging. Hoppe's is a very reputable name in the gun industry and this product is made of quality materials. That's why I consider it a "Must Have" for any gun owner.
After using this, I will never go back to a brush. It is much simpler and easier to clean with this. This is also a more consistant than a brush and does a better job.

I use this to clean my rifle at the range following the use of corrosive ammunition. Fits in a snack-sized ziploc for convenient, clean transport and does a good job of cleaning. In my opinion it does not replace a thorough cleaning with a rod, brush and patches but works nicely for a quick cleaning in the field.
Best and easiest way to clean your bore. Pair with a chamber brush, a bronze bristled "tooth brush," a small scraper, powder/copper solvent, and some oil for a compact cleaning kit.

been using bore snakes ever since they were invented. bought this one to replace my 30 cal that was worn completely out. this snake is LOOSE in the bore and will not clean. my worn out snake cleans a lot better.
summary: too small to clean a 30 cal

reviewText: I bought this for my rifle and pistol these make cleaning a breeze just pull through barrel and your done.

The BoreSnake makes cleaning a much faster task, and that's a good thing especially when not at home with my work bench and gear. The 'Snake goes in my range bag and heads out on trips with me to be the primary cleaner when away from home.I used this first on .223/5.56 AR-15 and must say that it was an extremely tight fit - so much so that I was worried about damage to the chrome lined barrel. After reading more on the 'net I put a ton more gun oil on and that helped a lot. Still have to give it a very strong pull through the barrel, but it seems to do a very good job.Still give my firearms a good rod & patch cleaning at home every once in a while, but the 'Snake will do in between those times.
summary: BoreSnake works well and does save a lot of time

reviewText: Everyone should have one of Hoppe's bore snakes for every long gun they own. IMHO, it is a piece of gear that is as essential as ammo. Period. Why? Because the risk of damaging a rifle bore, chamber or extractor is greatly reduced by using a boresnake over a cleaning rod and far easier to "pack out".
summary: Never disappointed with a Hoppe's bore snake

reviewText: Purchased for a Ruger 10/22. Just can't beat the convenience. I'm really picky with barrel cleaning and would spend an hour to get it right. This works just as well in 5 minutes.I have another for .38 cal which I didn't use often thinking it was a lazy way out. This performs so well with .22 I will be using the other for .38 .357 and 9mm.Great product. Not just for at the range use but for a good at home cleaning.

I have one for every caliber I own and just got one for my 5.56. Not a replacement for traditional cleaning but they are great when you are out and need a quick cleaning job. I highly recommend boreSnakes. Just put them in the washer when need to.
I love the boresnakes for my range bag  or camping trips it makes cleaning a gun while out in the field very efficient without having to lug all sorts of cleaning tools.

These are great for bringing to the range or periodic cleaning. You can use instead of rod, jag and brushes, however I still recommend using the "old" method for heavy firing. I still would not be without these and highly recommend.

I really like the Hoppe's Boresnakes for cleaning my guns.  I already had boresnakes for my shotguns and  pistols but this one is for my 22 rifle.  I expect it will do the same easy cleaning that is less messy and faster than any other cleaning method I've used.  There are no rods to attack together, no tips to change, no box of pads to use and dispose of after, none of the drips on the floor or other hassles that happen with cleaning rods.  You just drop in the brass weight and pull the rest of the snake through the barrel.  You can add oil to the tail of the snake and reoil  if you wish.  The built in brass brush cleans and the rest of the snake polishes.  It doesn't get easier.

Works great!  Using an aluminum rod leaves particles in the bore requiring swabbing.  This product works well, especially with the .17 HMR caliber due the very small bore.  No complaints and I hope it lasts a few years.
A fast, easy, and safe way to clean the bore of a gun! I bought one for each caliber gun I own.
This is good to clean a semi-auto rifle so you don't have to insert the rod from the muzzle, but a good old rod, brush and patch job is better. OK for a quick clean.
summary: Works OK for a quick clean, but rod and patch is better.

reviewText: As usual with any Hoppe's product no disappointments here. Great for range visists, this bore snake wipes and scrubs your barrel when you pull it throught and is washable. For the price it does the job.

A bore snake simplifies cleaning and makes the job quicker.  I have used this one on both .22LR and .223 Rem / 5.56 NATO rifles with great results.  Simply drop the weighted end through the bore, squirt some CLP or whatever you choose to clean the barrel, and pull it through.  Repeat a couple of times and the barrel is clean.When the bore snake is dirty, simply throw in the sink with hot water and gentle detergent, agitate briefly, and rinse with clean water.  Now it is ready for the next cleaning job.

I wet the section in front of the bristles with Hoppe's #9 and the tail section with CLP for a complete bore cleaning. I run it through 3-4 times and it scrubs out any leading or copper fouling and leaves the bore with a thin layer of oil when I'm done. I prefer this much more than a rigid rod that can cause damage to the breach. After 3-4 uses it gets washed in the washing machine and then hung over a closet door to dry and it's ready for service again.
This is so much better than running cotton patches through the barrel. It makes me want to clean my rifle because its easy and fast.
If you haven't used these you are missing out. They are great and easy to store. Easy to clean, machine washable. Don't think about it just buy it.

Purists would say to always have a one piece rod of the specific caliber, and made from some ultra-expensive material. However, if you bring this hunting, you can get your rifle (I have a variety for rifles and black powder) 95% clean in a few seconds. I saw the more complicated stuff for when I am at home.
Cleans and lubes in several trips through the barrel. You dont need harsh cleaners' I like break free or ballistol
summary: Great for pellet or BB guns

reviewText: This thing is the shizz for cleaning rifles, pistols all that.  I wish I would have known about bore snake a long time ago
I bought it for my M&P 15-22 , works good for me. Makes cleaning procedure easier. yes i would recommend it to my friends.
The snake beats a rod and patches (although I use them too), is easy to use, and makes cleanup after shooting a joy.
I always was going to try one of these, and I am glad I finely got one. Simple to use,good price,would recommend to everyone. As soon as I tried it,went out and got one for my other rifle.

Pros:- No more metal shavings from those cheap cleaning rods.- No more 100's of patches.- Easy to use, easy to clean.- Durable!Cons:- Alert family that this isn't a dog leash.I love this thing, I soon will be buying one for my 12 gauge shotgun.
I thought it was going to break when I was using it, but it's actually really solid. It took me all of 5 minutes to clean and oil the bore.Will buy more and for other calibers!

I have boresnakes for most calibers, if I'm out in the field running a lot of rounds for the day I like to shoot a health spray of breakfree down the bore and run the boresnake through a few times every 100-150 rounds. For cleaning your firearm they aren't so great, but for quick cleans in the field they are great to have in your bag.

This boresnake works as described.  It was very difficult to get the weighted end down the barrel of my rifle without removing the upper and lower bodies of the rifle.  Once I removed the upper I was better able to push the boresnake down the barrel.  Using this boresnake is much easier and faster than taking out and assembling my quide rod and patches to clean the rifle.

I've been using this on my 7.62x54 Mosin Nagant and it is amazing how much cleaner this gets the bore and how much faster.I am no longer putting 50 patches through the mosin to get it clean. Takes about 5 pass throughs and then the patches come out pretty damn clean.
summary: Absolutely amazing for the Mosin Nagant

reviewText: Easy to use, less hassle than rods and brushes. Get 2, soak one in solvent, the other in lubricant; keep them in plastic containers ready to use after shooting.
summary: Best way to clean a rifle.

reviewText: The BoreSnake gets the job cleaning your rifle done in half the time after a day of fun out at the range.

Works perfectly, looked down my 15-22 after taking it apart (before i even shot it), and saw dirt/stuff..., so ran this down it, spotless now.Used it in my old marlin and it almost felt like it got stuck, first time using one so I probably did something wrong, but its clean, so thats what matters.
Awsome , it's great, saves me tons of time just put oil on the bristles and slide it through the bore and your done nice product overall.

I bought this for my Ruger 10-22 and I bought one for my Glock 19. This is far and away the easiest way to do a quick barrel cleaning on your gun while using it. You still need to break down your gun for a proper cleaning after a day of use, but for getting the junk out of your barrel while in use, or to clean out your barrel while doing a cleaning this is way better than swabs.
I Got this for obvious reasons to clean my 22's, does exactly what it should and was a great price

Compared to more conventional methods of cleaning bores this is far better. The snake combines multiple steps in the cleaning process. It cuts a lot of time out of cleaning difficult to break down guns.

I use this snake for cleaning the bores on my VZ58 and Mosin, this are both 7.62 the .308 snake will work for these calibers.  This makes cleaing especially easy on the Mosin which was always hard with a wire brush just because the barrel is so long.

I was first introduced to this bad boy when I was in Iraq. My buddies Dad sent him one, and now I wouldn't do without one. Makes it super easy to clean your rifle and does a great job. I highly recommend one of these to anyone that shoots a lot.
summary: If you dont have one, get one

reviewText: Couple of pulls with this through my Remington 700 SPS DM and my bore and chamber are really clean.  Nothing to complain about at all.
summary: Better than cleaning rods for routine cleaning

reviewText: I use this to clean my bolt action rifles. A couple of passes with this and the barrel looks as good as new. A must have for any active shooter.

This is hands down the easiest and fastest way to clean a bore.  I still run a patch afterwards for good measure and it hardly comes out dirty.  The only issue I have with it is the first time of the cleaning season you try to thread it through the barrel it can take some doing, I assume this is cause by the friction and the small diameter of a 5.56 rifle.  The obvious solution to this would be to make the brass weight a little heavier.
I have yet to take mine out of the packaging.  Hoppe's a well known name in firearm cleaning components, so I'm very satisfied.
summary: Hoppe's 24010 BoreSnake Rife Bore Cleaner, .17 HMR

reviewText: I use these for shotgun, rifles, and pistols of varying calibers. I shoot mostly jacketed ammo so I don't go to crazy with bore cleaning and these work quite well as a one-shot deal. Normally I make a few passes with bore cleaner and a snake, then some CLP and a snake and call it good.
summary: Works great, and at an excellent price

reviewText: I don't use this bore snake much. Really, I just run it through if a barrel is really dirty to loosed up the big stuff.

They are popular, easy, and do a great job cleaning.I have several of these in different rifle, pistol, and shotgun calibers, and haven't -broken- one yet, though a few got to the end of their brass bristles life.This .308 - to 30cal (7.62) will fit the 7.62 bores of the Russian 7.62x39 and 54R.
summary: Hoppe's BoreSnake. Need I say more?

reviewText: I am not a professional gun person - I am rather new to the hobby and enjoy shooting!  But when it comes to cleaning my guns I have tried a few different tools and have mostly been disappointed.  Until now.  This is so easy to use, durable, cleans well and is just about perfect in my mind.  So very glad I made this investment!!!  I purchased different sizes for the different guns I have.  They are easy to store and easy to use.  Highly recommended.
summary: Nothing but praise for these tools!

reviewText: The bore snake is quality, easy to use and works. It doesn't get any more simple. Another successful product by hoppes. I have a couple of other for different calipers as well. Beats the heck out of using rods and patches.
Do not use wire brushes/brass brushes on your airgun barrel, it will damage them.  This is the perfect solution, cleans and lubricates the barrel awesome!

In my opinion, bore snakes are a must when cleaning.  I don't recommend this to be the ONLY method to cleaning but should be a supplement to the cleaning rod and patches.I typically use the bore snake after the rod and patches to make sure I really purge whatever junk is in the barrel.  Then I would run a light coat of oil afterwards.  That may seem excessive to some but with the possible threat to our gun rights nowdays, we must take good care of the wonderful firearms that we have!
summary: Slithers through my barrel like a champ

reviewText: I used to use the old brass cleaning rod for all of my guns. When I picked up my M16, I ended up buying the brass rod and a bore guide. I had a training class with some coworkers and noticed someone using one of these bore snakes. He was able to clean his rifle barrel far faster than anyone using the brass rod. At first I figured he just did a terrible job, but decided to look into these anyway.I ordered this to try out and I couldn't be happier with it. It's a much better alternative to the old way of cleaning. I ordered it in .223 and it was a perfect fit for my rifle. I'll definitely be ordering more of these in my other calibers.
summary: Far far better than what I used to use

reviewText: The idea of this is so simple but yet so effective.  It does everything I need in the barrel with one pull.  The only complaint I have is that I did not think of this!
summary: Only thing better would be the gun cleaning itself!

reviewText: they were selling it for a few bucks cheaper than the local walmart so i bought it and i really like it so far, espechally when compared to the old rod and swab method of cleaning.

Unbelievable.  I used it on my 5.56 NATO S&W; MP 15 and it went right through.  Many claim the weight on one end that you drop through chamber gets stuck or too snug,  but this is where it shines. Fits perfectly,  drop the weight,  catch it at the muzzle pull and then pull back from the chamber,  I only do it 3 times.  Snake has some serious little spikes.  See my review for CLP. Drop a few drops into :arrested,  work it.I love it,  no more greased fingers from patches.I have a Moss berg 500,. 410 and will look for snakes in those calibersNow,  I have to find something to do with the time I saved

I love these boresnakes, not sure what else there is to say.  I have one for each caliber I own, and use them regularly.  They are great for the field, and quick and easy to use for a field-strip cleaning.  Still need to do a thorough cleaning periodically, but this really takes a lot of stress out of a quick range day.  They also wash in the clothes washer (wouldn't suggest putting them in with any clothes), and the one I've had the longest has held up for several years of regular use.  Will continue to buy these products as needed.
Sure makes clean-up after a day on the range a lot smoother and faster than the old fashioned way. Packs away small in my range bag, and gets the job done in seconds.

I DON'T SHOOT THAT MUCH SO THIS THING WORKS GREAT!"Hoppes BoreSnake is the fastest bore cleaner on the planet. One pass loosens large particles, scrubs out the remaining residue with a bronze brush, then swabs it all spotless with a cleaning area 160x larger than a standard patch.""Add a few drops of Hoppe’s No 9 Lubricating Oil or Hoppe’s Elite Gun Oil and your gun’s ready for storage.""The world’s quickest, three-step bore shine.Extremely packable.Available for rifles, shotguns and pistols.Brass weight on the pull cord is stamped with the size.Machine washable.Patented one-piece design."

I use boresnakes for my handguns, so I naturally wanted one for my airgun too.  I have not tried to force the loop through the bore, and may need to cut that off in order to get a clean pull-through.  It does the job, though.
summary: Fastest way to clean a barrel

reviewText: Some people prefer the old bore punch method and think these are useless, but I think these are a great time saver. I usually go through 2-3 time with a snake, and then I switch to patches. I have definitely noticed a reduction in cleaning time when using boresnakes.
I started using a Hoppe's BoreSnake while siting in my rifle at the range. I found if I cleaned the bore after every clip my shots were more consistent.
summary: These are a must for any field bag

reviewText: I own these for every caliber pistol and rifle I own.  They are great and scrubbing your barrel, chamber, and feed ramp with minimal effort.  I carry them in my range bag for extended sessions.  Highly recommended for any firearm enthusiast.
Always works well -  very durable and easy to use it's self explanitory!!!  Great to place in your range bag or in a compartment on the actual firearm.

This works okay and its easy to carry - but it doesn't really get stuff as clean as a rod and a brush - good for getting the carbon out at the end of a day of shooting and putting a little oil in your bore. but its not the cleaning rod substitute they would like you to think it is.
What else you ask for, right? It's not AMAZING, but how could it really be? lol. It works well and the price was good. I'd recommend and I'd buy it again.
This method is way better then using patches.  You have to pull hard to get it through the bore so don't hesitate.
Two passes and my gun is clean! A little follow up and its ready for storage. Would like to have one for all my calibers.
summary: I love this rope. Two passes and my gun is clean! A little follow up and its ready for storage.

reviewText: Fits very tightly and does the job of cleaning the .223 and 5.56 barrel very well. Don't be scared to pull out the bore snake with force it's a very tight fit.
summary: Fits the 5.56 and .223 barrel like a glove

reviewText: Its very tight on a 22, but after pulling twice it became easier.. Had to get better leverage to pull it the first time. I tried it on a 9mm and its too skinny, when right thru with no effort. I'll be buying the 9mm version soon.

I have one of these for my AR15 5.56/.223 Bushmaster and cleaning the barrel is now quik and easy and no fear of scratching the chrome lined bore!!!  So I watched a youtube video on the same theory for cleaning by Ruger Black Hawk Elite .177/1200 fps break barrell, I used this awesome tool for my rifles first cleaning, ran it through three times, man it was so clean, after the first time the second and third time the bore litterally squeeked it was so clean, didn't have to use cleaning pellets or risk a solvent that could damage my rubber O-Ring in the breach!!  Get it for your air .177 air rifles or .22 rifles.  Saves time and bores!!!!
I've had these for years, so I must like 'em! They're Hoppe's bore snakes. Buy 'em use 'em!They simply do the job.
When you are in a hurry this speeds up the process, it won't be perfect but sometimes good enough is just...good enough.
summary: Clean my gun and head for Galveston

reviewText: Bore snake is a great invention, works great foba thorough cleaning. I run it through 1 time and the bore is clean very good product and highly recomend this in any cleaning kit.

I started using BoreSnake products many years ago while I was deployed to Iraq. BoreSnake does in one or two passes what used to take me painstaking effort to accomplish using brushes and cleaning patches separately. I usually put a little CLP on the front end of the BoreSnake for my final run through and I've never had any complaints about this product.
I have one for every gun I own nice to put it in my range bag and run it through rifle when done shooting.

This makes gun cleaning less of a chore. Has brass brushes built in so you have wet patch, brass brush and dry patch all in one pull of the bore snake. 2-3 passes and you are done. Wish I had one of these for all my guns.

I have always loved to clean my guns after a good day of shooting but I'm always on the look out for new and better methods.  A friend recommended the bore snake and it truly is a godsend.  I simply run solvent completely down the barrel and let it sit while I clean the rest of the weapon.  Then, I simply run the bore snake through the barrel toward the muzzle and pull through, it's really that simple.  Couldn't be happier and would definitely buy again.
This is pretty handy to carry for a quick cleaning.  I liked it enough to get one for a 12 GA also.

quick, easy, and thorough. strongly recommend to anyone. some people say they don't clean as well as using the "traditional" methods of cleaning with brushes etc... this product leaves nothing behind that i can see with my eyes. will be buying more of these for the rest of my guns without question.

I like the idea of the bore snake and it does a decent job as long as you're not expecting it to do the same job as a traditional cleaning. It's super fast and convenient to use and the barrel is nice and shiny after a single pass. A couple of passes with some CLP and it should be plenty clean enough if you're just going to turn around and shoot again in a few days. If you're cleaning it prior to longer term storage, etc. I'd highly recommend a traditional cleaning because the bore snake simply doesn't get all of the carbon gunk, etc. that a rod and pads will get. That's been my experience anyway. Great for what it does though.
...cleaning product since Hoppe's made their first solvent.  This is so easy that the newest shooter can use it to clean their weapon without worry of damaging anything.

This is my third bore snake. This is the easiest and fastest way to clean your bore. It's really handy for breaking in a new barrel, shoot once, run the bore snake through, shoot 3 times, run the snake through, shoot 5 times, run the snake through, shoot 500 more times as fast as you can then run it through again!

I keep this in my rifle case with a small can of gun cleaner.  Spray the cleaner in the barrel and run the BoreSnake through a couple of times gets some of the gunk out until I get home and do a proper cleaning.

I purchased this for my father for Father's Day. I already own this product in many calibers and I have always preached the merits of owning one to my father. Well, he never bought one, so I picked one up for him. The reason I mention my father at all is because he is a novice shooter with limited time and/experience taking apart guns and cleaning them after a shoot. Typically he would go shooting with me and then jam his handguns back into the cabinet without ever taking the time to clean them. So, in ten minutes time, I successfully showed him how to disassemble/reassemble and clean the weapon with the Hoppe's Bore Snake.He found this process to be so easy, compared to the old days of brass rod and threaded cleaning tips and all the extra swabs and steps.You see, with a Hoppe's Bore Snake, all you need to do is let the brass weight fall through the barrel, grab ahold of the string, and pull the swab through the entire length until is is free of the barrel. The swab has several brass wires built in, so you get scrubbing action to clean the stuck on powder/debris and the swab cleans the residue that remains. Its so easy, my 6 year old nephew can use it.A few squirts of Rem Oil and one or two passes through the barrel and you're home free. Why spend all day cleaning your guns when you don't have to?Saves TimeSaves Money by not having to purchase bags of swabs.The last gun cleaning kit you'll ever buy.
summary: Simply the best gun cleaning system on the market.

reviewText: Very sturdy and does a great job of getting lots of debris out.  Had a different one and the pullstring/weight broke off when I was pulling it through.
I haven't used one of these before until now and I must say they are way better than the old method of shoving a cloth down the barrel a hundred times.  Will see how long they last.
summary: Great way to clean your gun.

reviewText: This product is a little pricey but it works great so it is worth every cent. Has a great brass weight and this is free of hassle. All you need to do is put a cleaning solution near the front so it cleans and then takes it off throughout. (Might run it through twice if you shot a lot :))

I am a perfectionist, especially when it comes to firearms.  Maybe it's my military background, but I like my stuff clean after every use.  I enjoy cleaning and disassembling my weapons, and this just saves so much time.  I take a dry toothbrush and then a brush with rubbing alcohol to my weapons.  Then I soak the barrel in CLP.  While that works, I wipe down the rest of the firearm with rags and patches.  I've also recently started trying chamber stars, which fit in and behind the locking lugs - a bit expensive, but save time any clean places otherwise impossible to get to.  When thats done, I run the bore snake through the barrel about 10-15 times, in less than a minute.  I then reapply oil to the essential components and am all done.  The bore snake takes about 15mins less time than brushes and patches did.
summary: Get it for your AR, it does a great job and saves a ton of time

reviewText: A friend recommended these products to me, and I have to say he was absolutely right.  I use this on my Remington Model 597 plinker rifle and it just takes a few pulls with some oil and solvent to keep the bore sparkling clean and deposit free between firings.  I would recommend giving the bore a good scrubbing with a soft metal wire cleaning tool first, as the bristles on this aren't as densely placed.  You don't have to do this, but it reduces the number of pulls through the bore you'll need to clean the firearm.  I gave this model a 4/5 only because the fit is very snug for a .22 cal bore.  It feels like I have to put a lot more tension to draw this through the bore than I do for any other BoreSnake I own.  It may perhaps be better suited for .223/5.56 bores.
summary: Hoppe's BoreSnake for .22 cal rimfire rifle

reviewText: Makes barrel cleaning Fast and Easy. Just one pull of this down the barrel and it shines. Used this on my old mosin nagants. I have an old Chinese type 53 made in 1954 that came with a very dark barrel. Some barrel scrub spray and four pulls of this through and it is shinny again. It makes cleaning you rifles take minutes instead of hours.
summary: Makes barrel cleaning Fast and Easy

reviewText: They seem expensive, but BoreSnakes seriously cut down on time spent cleaning, as well as space taken up by a cleaning kit.I bought one, used it once, then immediately bought 3 more for other calibers.
I like the product. Fit on perfect with no issues on the swivel head.  The Screw I had to drill into the stock.  Wish there was a tool to twist in the screw. I just used a nail.

They do the of and mount easily. I do recommend using a pilot drill before drilling the large hole to mount the butt stock stud so as not to split the wood. Work slowly when drilling and you will have professional results. Do not over tighten on the stock. You can put just a dab of clear silicone on the threads before screwing it it to prevent moisture from getting into the screw hole plus it helps keep the stud from rusting over time.
The fit and finish of this is what you would expect and fit right onto the tube.  I have put these on two guns now and will not be going back.  Put them on any gun you do some walking with
summary: Does what its supposed to Do

reviewText: this is apparently only for some 870 models. the 870 express i have has the internal ratchet type magazine tube cover while this one is for the external type. a quality product as uncle mike's always is just make sure it is going to fit properly. incidentally, when you order the correct one from remington, also available here at amazon, it only comes with the cap and nothing else so you may need this set anyway.
Great product!! I would purchase again and I have! Quality is good. Uncle Mikes is pretty trusted around here. I would recommend

Well, I'd like to be able to say I installed these on my 870 with no problem, but I didn't verify what gauge I was ordering when I placed the order. I needed 12, but clicked on 20 like a dummy. So I'm returning these, and I'll be ordering the correct size. The parts looked great, sprung open and closed easily, but weren't "loose" so I'm pretty sure they would hold. We'll try again soon.
Great product screws onto magazine tube without a problem. Easy to install the screw in the butt stock . I'm good to go.

My first time attaching these swivels.  I did it!  They seem very well designed.  Since my sling had not arrived yet, I was worried for no reason if it would fit the sling.  My friend guaranteed they would fit and they did.  I definitely recommend.

Works great, it was a great price compared to the local stores.  Fits just fine on the Remington 870 20 gauge.  I didn't use the screw for the butt portion cause my buddies ripped out, but I did get the KZ Butt Stock Adapter which works great with it.  Very nice to have a strap for my shotgun.

Purchased one of these systems and it's great! I have had it on my shotgun for a few years (multiple turkey, squirrel, rabbit, and bird seasons) and I have zero complaints about it. Great quality product you would expect from Uncle Mike's.

i have this sling on a 10.5  pound rifle and it makes packing that beast a lot easier. i hunt hogs down here in Louisiana all year ,that means right now in this heat and this sling  packing my rifle through the swamps and woods a lot easier.

You only get the 1.25" wide sling, NO WIDE PAD! With that being said, it is a fine sling and thats why only four. WILL I DO BUSINESS WITH THESES FOLKS AGAIN, NO because of FALSE ADVERTISING- Now back to the sling, easily adjusts with one hand and the Talon fittings are great attacment points, quick, easy and solid. Would I buy this sling again, Most Definitely!!!!
summary: What you SEE is Not what you get!!!

reviewText: Very nice strap,  easy to use, easy to install.The strap is a little short, but usable.  This is more my fault than the vendor because it was clearly marked as to the length and I assumed it long enough.  (48 inches)Very impressed with the quality.
summary: Strap is a little short for my REM 870

reviewText: I have one on every long gun I own, from black powder to shotguns. They are fast and easy to use, one pull to extend and another to shorten. No buckle to mess with, it's adjusted to the length you want instantly.

This sling was too short for use with a Remington 870 home security model with the sling attachment on the mag tube cap. It was nice but when extended fully it is just to tight to serve any real purpose or sling the weapon over your shoulder.
I love this sling. I have 2 of them on Remington 700's and they work great. Looking to buy another one for my Mosin Nagant.
summary: Best sling on the market, period

reviewText: Good sling, although I had to take it apart and put it back together without one sling swivel because my rifle has a swivel on one end and a standard wide AR15 style sling opening on the other.Good product and solid construction.

I needed a sling for my Savage rifle and liked the looks of this unit.  I found it to be fast and EASY to install and quick to adjust to length I wanted.  An excellent sling for my purposes--- I really like it.

I like this sling a lot, and the quality is high but it's not as easy to adjust as they make it sound. I can make it longer with one hand but making it shorter takes two. Also, it would be nice if it was a little longer, and while they do give you instructions on how to lengthen it, it only adds about two inches. The attached swivels look well made and are easy to take on and off. Overall a nice sling, unless you're a big guy.
summary: Not as easy as it looks

reviewText: I have always appreciated this sling design. Simple, fast and strong. This sling will last many years. It is also a comfortable sling.
These patches are tough cloth material. They are not thin like the Hoppe brand. They are thicker but still absorbent.
I tried Hoppes and some other brands but Butch's works the best. It's soft and does not leave all that lint everywhere. I will only be buying these from now on.
These do what they say, they are substantial, seem to clean well and don't leave lint behind like the flannel patches.
Great product. Does one heck of a job. Just what I needed. Lasts a long time. Look no further. No surprise

as my title says, these patches are the best i've used to date and i've used many different brands over the years. wish i'd stumbled upon Butch's patches way sooner. absorbant and don't fray. lint free as advertised. the 2-1/2 inch size is great for most applications, big bore caliber that is. i cut them down for smaller calibers. highly recommend.

So I specifically purchased these patches to clean my guns after range use.  I paid more for these because I wanted an absolute lint free patch, that would not leave traces of lint on my gun after cleaning.  Well, I still havent found the right patch.  When I clean the outside of my black gun with oil, these patches leave lint on the gun.  I then have to get a microfiber cloth to wipe of the residue from the patches.  These dont absorb oil like other patches, but they are strong.
Way better than the paper ones.  Does a good job cleaning my pistols.  The size is great for my .45 and can be cut to size for my .380 & .22.  Priced right!

Many years ago Hoppe's patches were cotton flannel, then they went to this cheap synthetic material.  You have to use two patches at a time because they are thin and do not absorb very well.I was very thrilled to find Butch's, they work very well and you do not have to double them up like you do with the synthetic patches.  I only wish I had found them about ten years ago.Comparison with Hoppes Patches:First it takes 3 of theHoppe's Gun Cleaning Patch for .38 - .45 Caliber 500 Pack, Poly Bagpatches to have the same fit as one Butch's.  3 to 1.  The Hoppes patches do not clean, they only wipe.  Try the difference, even using 3 Hoppes patches the Hoppes does not remove the crud like the Butch's do.  I was amazed at all the black crap on the Butch's patch. You can see the difference in the barrel and on the patch.The only problem I have had is the patches are too thick for the 9mm and .223 brass jags I have.  Since I do not have access to a lathe I took an electric drill and 1500 grit sandpaper and reduced the diameter of the Pro-Shot brass jag I had until Butch's patches would fit, it took about 45 minutes of sanding and checking.  You must pierce the patch with the jag as that helps.  The work great but are too thick unless you use a smaller jag.The patches work so well I did not mind the extra effort.
summary: Hoppes used to be cloth as well.

reviewText: Love them...they do a great job cleaning. The texture of the patches really get the grime out. I would recommend and will be buying again.
Quality product!
Drop the brass weight through the breech, pull the snake out the muzzle, simple as that.  I lightly coat the tail end of the snake with my current lubricant of choice on the final pull through

I have this one, and a rifle one.  The rifle one I have makes it difficult to even use and I was afraid of damaging my gun so I have not used it since.  This shotgun one, however, is much better and upon one quick run-through, debris can be seen.  Very good for a quick cleaning if you use your gun a lot, however don't rely solely on a boresnake for cleaning.
That about sums it up- I would recommend this to anyone. It's really easy to use and you can keep it stored in the plastic packaging as well.This was a good deal in my opinion!
summary: Cheap, very easy to use, and works well!

reviewText: boresnakes are great for rifles and shotguns. I've even used this one to clean the gas chamber on my AK-47. Worked great.
These are great for cleaning the gun in the field, at the range or after a long day.  I put a little cleaner on it and run it thought the barrel, looks like new every time.

The first time I fed this thing through the barrel and started yanking on it, I really thought it was going to snap because it fit so tight.  But then I realized, if its not tight its not going to cleaning everything.  When out in the field, whether you are lazy or just did not bring all your cleaning gear, this BoreSnake and a small bottle of cleaning solution will get you through your day of shooting.  I will agree with the other reviewer that cleaning rods and patches do a better thorough job, however.
summary: Good for quick cleaning when you don't have all  your gear

reviewText: I would recommend. I use it. I got excellent results. practical and washable. copper brush is also necessary for clean of bore
I use it a lot while I'm out in the mountains. It's great for a quick clean.I was expecting it to be small, but it fit like a glove.
Perfect for range use. No need to break down gun, just swab between rounds. Gets a lot of stuff out of the barrel in the first pass.
There's not much to say about this one.  It's very snug and makes a much quicker job of cleaning than a traditional rod (albeit not quite as thorough)
It is always better to remove the barrel debris in the direction the blast travels. This item is a great inexensive procurement in keeping any firearm clean.

This Hoppe's Boresnake makes cleaning my 12g shotgun very quick and easy! I have boresnake for every caliber we shoot and absolutely find them indispensable for quick cleaning after a day at the range. As other reviewers have noted, using boresnakes do not negate the need to do an occasional thorough cleaning with a rod and patches.These are a great time saver and work very well in all of my 12g shotguns.Recommended!CFH
Fantastic!! This is the best & easiest method for cleaning a shotgun that I have ever used. I wish I had bought one of these years ago. You will not be disappointed!
Nice tool. makes quick reliable cleaning of my shotgun. No rods to put together and take apart and no patches or scrubbers to use. Its all in one on the snake. Awsome
I picked this up after getting a friend's recommendation. It's an easy way to clean my over-under barrels quickly. I recommend giving it a try!
summary: Great way to clean my over-under

reviewText: works well, get the barrel clean quickly not much else to say.  very durable and well constructed, will last quite a while.

I already own a Boresnake for the 9mm pistol and was completely sold on its performance. The 12 gauge versiondoes not disappoint at all.Keep in mind the Boresnake is not meant to replace a rod and barrel brush along witha reliable cleaner.I run it through the barrel 3 or 4 times then proceed with my regular cleaning routine(I follow itwith rod and brush with Mpro 7 and some Shooter's Choice).A must have for any cleaning kit.Best of all,once it gets excessivelysoiled, wash and reuse. Fabrics bag in the washer will get it done.Outstanding product.
summary: Excellent and necessary addition to any serious shooter's cleaning kit

reviewText: These bore snakes are so much better than the "old school" cleaning kits, and much easier on the guns.  Thanks

I have many these bore snakes. These are a savior. Fast and efficient. One or two swipes with this and your barrel is clean. Wish it could've been a darker color. Mine is mostly white with a little bit of green. Therefore it looks very nasty after use. However, The performance exceeds the appearance. These are a must-have for all gun calibers.
Hate using solvents and these work great for me. I do use the pads afterwords but no more smelly vapors from those solvents from Hoppe anymore for me.
I use this is my 870 Tactical after every use, and it's actually replacing a cheap one I had before that broke, but I should've known to just go with Hoppe's.
Nice to have in the go bag as they take up very little space.  Plus seems to clean as well as the "long" handle ones which take up a lot of room.
summary: Ordered one for each type of weapon

reviewText: been useing these things for years absolutly the best idea on the market for gun cleaning nothing else even close if i break the cord buy a new one however i get my use out of it i clean a lot of guns all the time might even still be married
summary: if you need to clean your guns this is it nobody does it better or faster just buy it

reviewText: boresnakes are great.  They are so great that i cannot write a review with just that first sentence, too short.
I used this product on my 12 Gauge and it worked as advertised.  Easy to use and store afterwards.  I recommend anybody to buy this as a very easy and thorough way to clean your shotgun.
Hoppe's makes great gun cleaning products and this is one of them. I have Hoppe's snakes for all of my guns and calibers.

My wingmaster's barrel has never been cleaner. Just put a little bit of oil around the diameter towards the end, and pull it through 2-3 times and you are DONE. Fast, cheap, and effective. Can't ask for more. I have one in .22 that was much harder to pull through the first time, but the 12 gauge one wasn't bad at all. I will keep buying these as I acquire new calibers.They also wash when dirty, just a little bit of soap and some hot water, then let them air dry and you are good to go.
summary: best gun cleaning tool I've found

reviewText: Boresnake>all.  If you are wondering how good this works, you have never used one.  You use a jag, or you use patches.  Well, this is better.  It cleans faster.  It cleans better.  Buy this now.
This is a fantastic product that is so easy I wish I would have thought of it. For a quick clean and lube just run it through. Just be careful, the material will catch and snag on obstructions..

The Boresnake is the greatest cleaning tool for firearms invented if you discount the cleaning fluids. Particularly for us lazy dudes who used to use a cleaning rod. It also reduces the amount of possible muzzle dings.

No better way to clean your shotgun !  Fast , easy , can store it anywhere , and no more having to clean when you get home . Store it in your gun case and clean as soon as you are finished shooting .  GET ONE !

The first time I ever used a bore snake, I had my doubts.  After all, I've been cleaning firearms (large and small) with a rod, for years.  But the first time I used a Hoppe's boresnake, I knew that I would never, ever go back to using a rod.  Boresnakes generally get the barrel clean with ONE PASS, don't scratch the bore, and are easy to clean and reuse.  And, as always, if it's says "HOPPE'S" on the label, there's quality to spare.
summary: I'll never go back to using a rod, ever!

reviewText: This thing works great.  It get the barrel clean in hurry.  I only give it 4 stars because the weight on the end of the string come off the first time I used it.  It still works fine, but I was a little annoyed that it broke so easy.
Forget about any other tool you might have. The result is amazing. Only one pass I got a super clean bore.
summary: best tool to clean the shotgun

reviewText: Quick and easy. Spray some cleaner into the barrel and pull this through a few times.No muss, no fuss.  Buy one for each size shotgun and you are set.
summary: The easiest way to clean your shotgun barrel

reviewText: This cleaner works on my 28" Rem 870 12Ga Barrel. Hoppe's has the quick gun cleaning method down and it cleans better than standard brushes and pads.
The boresnake is best thing second only to sliced bread ... I would recommend everyone to have one for every caliber you have ... It makes cleaning your weapon a breez

Because the shotgun is particularly dirty after firing, it takes a lot of scrubbing of the barrel to get it mirror clean. The boresnake cleans about 97% of the residue and really does a great job. I use it with Frog Lube and like the job it does. Sometimes additional scrubbing with the brass brush is required, though.
What's not to love! I had a 12ga bore-snake in the past that I lost and just replaced. Works great!
But not as good my normal rod and cleaning supplies.  Always seems to be some residue left in the barrel and this probably can only get my gun about 85% clean.

I know it's not the equivalent of a serious tear-down cleaning, but it doesn't seem to be all that far from it.  I have a short-barrel shotgun for home defense purposes which I fire infrequently, usually at a local range.  A good hose-down with an all purpose cleaner+protectant spray, followed by a pass through the barrel with this snake seems to clear the barrel of what little crud got deposited there during a practice session.  Those who use their shotguns a lot, say for hunting, will probably want to use more stringent methods from time to time, but this is great for a quick cleaning.
summary: I can't believe how easy and quick this is

reviewText: I consider this a must have. I use it for a quick cleaning, in between detailed cleanings . For washing, I just stick it in one of the wife's old lingerie bags..

Cleans out the bore while shooting. I use it in-between every 100-150 rounds and i find that when i get home and clean my firearms the patches have started to come out cleaner... i have one for every caliber its a must!!!
This is definitely easier & less messy to clean your gun. Packs well & takes up very little space in your bag.

I have Hoppe's boresnakes for several of my long and short barrel guns and they work well. Far faster and more thorough IMO than using patches. Let's face it, no one likes the (important) task of gun cleaning. Boresnakes give you one less excuse because of how easy they are to use.
Its a bore snake that works. Makes the job faster and better job in my opinion. What else can I say?
You probably already know what a boresnake is and what it is for. It does the job well and is the easiest way for a quick barrel clean without much of a mess.
Perfect with my Remington 870 Synthetic. I recommend these Snakes for all firearms. Easy to maintain and clean your firearm catalog.
i will never clean a gun without a boresnake ever again, it made it ten times easier than regular cleaning methods...
I have these for all of my firearms they are great for a quick clean after target practice or hunting.

I give the device 5 stars, I had two others before I got this one---and they are great.HOWEVER--I wanted to try the newer, Viper version for my 20 Gauges--(I have several)So I searched Amazon and found it in 12 gauge, but there was an option menu box, where I chose 20 gauge and placed order for what i assumed was the 20 gauge Viper version of the boresnake.When the unit arrived, it was just the standard version--not the Viper-- I like the piece and will use it, so I didn't return it---BUT it isn't what I thought I was getting.
summary: Fine, piece but not a Viper

reviewText: this boresnake makes cleaning my guns so much easier than a rod and patches. the inventor is a genious !!!

Exactly the quality I expected from a Boresnake.  If you aren't using a Borsesnake to clean your firearms that don't require more attention due to extreme fouling, you're missing out on easy cleaning.  WOW.  I own many different caliber sizes of the Boresnake.
summary: Exactly the quality I expected from a Boresnake

reviewText: Love BoreSnakes, they save time and are very affordable. Own half a dozen by now, have never had any break or not clean the barrel correctly after 2-3 passes.
I've use this brand of bore cleaner in other guns. They work exceptionally well - without all the bother and mess of rods and patches.
summary: It cleans .410 bore barrels as expected

reviewText: This is a great product.  Takes many minutes off your gun cleaning tasks.  Also saves on supplies, such as patches, solvents, and other cleaners/lubricants.  For people who shoot different guns and calibers the Boresnake makes cleaning a cinch.  I use the Boresnake and the Boresnake Viper for different guns.  The Boresnake Viper does provide better cleaning one the first couple of runs, but both are more than adequate.  I'm not sure how these work with "dirty ammo", but with range reloads and factory ammo, it works great!
summary: Great Product. Time and supply saving gun cleaning solution.

reviewText: My guns have never been cleaner..A gun cleaning kit isn't complete without boresnakes.. A little Hoppes #9 and you're good to go
This is the easiest way to clean my side by side! Works great and easy to clean the gun and the snake!

I got this to clean 12 gauge hunting shotguns.If you haven't used a BoreSnake before, you are really missing out. The combination of brush and rope-patch section are just great. They are washable and reusable.I would really recommend these in all the calibers you shoot regularly. It makes cleaning a snap.If you are curious how it works, you simply drop the little weight on the end of the black cord through the throat of the barrel and catch it as it exits the muzzle (put it in back by the trigger and pull it out where the shot comes out). You then just pull on that black chord and the brush will enter the barrel with the soft rope following. I was a bit worried about the toughness of this black cord, but I can really pull it without any worries. Pull it all the way through and you have made the equivalent of one brush and patch pass-through. Do that a few times and then run a clean patch through and you should be just about done. Don't forget theHoppe's No. 9 Powder Solvent, 5 Ounce Clam E/F.
This is by far the simplest way to whip down your 12g after a duck hunt.  Two or three quick swipes and its ready for tomorrows hunt.  Get on!  Give them as a gift.
Great cleaner
Much more efficient than the aluminum push rods.  Spray some cleaning solvent on the snake and give it a couple of run throughs- very nice.Cheers.

I have about 10+ boresnakes...I even have multiple in the same caliber because I use certain ones for specific firearms.These things are great, I have never used much else since finding these to clean my bores on handguns, shotguns and rifles.
summary: BoreSnakes are Awesome nuff said buy it

reviewText: This boresnake makes cleaning the barrel very easy. The shipping was very fast and arrived in a nice package. I really like this and ordered one for each caliber that I have.

looking for a quick cleaning method to aid in keeping your shotgun clean and in great working order, then this is the system for you.  with this boresnake i can clean the barrel of my shotgun clean in just a few passes of the snake.

What can I say, it's a BoreSnake, it does the job. Not as thorough as a standard cleaning rod with patches but in most cases it is good enough for a light day at the range or a routine maintenance-cleaning of stored guns. If I have a heavy day at the range I usually run this BoreSnake through a couple times with CLP to get the big stuff and then finish-up with a standard cleaning rod. I would highly recommend. I also have these in 9mm and 30 caliber.
You wont regret it! Never has it been easier to clean the barrel of your weapon, provides much more cleaning surface area than the standard patch.

Bought several of these, one for each different caliber. This tool is by far the easiest and best way to clean your weapon after a day at the range. Just pull it through from bach to front and the barrel is clean. Saves lots of time. Learned of these from a friend so have first hand knowledge. Highly recomment this cleaner!

i purchased two of these because the quality was outstanding. I keep one in my cleaning kit and the other goes in the duck blind with me. These keep my bores shiny and clean in no time at all. Pick up one or two yourself, today!
I use them quite often when target shooting. The make it very easy to do a more complete clean when finished for the day. Easy to pack and use. It also works really well in a sand environment.

I spray cleaner on my shotgun mechanisms, then put a couple drops of oil on the wear points.  Then I drop the brass section of the boresnake into some Hoppe's, and run it through the barrel twice.  DONE.  This makes cleaning your shotgun easy and fast.  I have them in all the storage bags of all my shotguns so I will always have them handy in the field if necessary.  Terrific invention.
This is simply a must have if you are a trap or skeet shooter. It makes cleaning of the barrel a breeze.

Thought this product was some kind of agimmick,but,for the price I'll give it a try.And I sure am glad that I did.This bore snake really does the job onmy 12 ga  20" barrel Maverick 88.Bottle of Hoppe's #9 & you're good to go.Try it, you'll like it.

If you value your time get this, especially if you don't shoot very often.  It makes cleaning the inside of the barrel a 2 minute job (pulling it out and putting it away included).  Then just swab down the outside of the barrel and action with light oil it's good to go.
summary: How did I go without this for so long

reviewText: This bore snake is the first one I've owned it works good on my old 410s. I would consider buying more for my other rifles..Worked great

reviewText: Great item..cleans and oils the barrel faster then anything else I have used, I also bought one for my 12 gauge shotgun, only issue is storing it, I keep it in a zip lock bag.

But this is a great additional tool that does a lot of that in one pass. It's very sturdy and well made. The brush part is exceptional. Plus you can put some oil on the end and lightly lubricate your barrel at the same time. I cleaned a 12-guage in no time with some foaming bore cleaner, a dab of CLP and this. Easy as can be.

reviewText: Makes clean-up very easy.  No more patches or rods in big boxes.  I have 6 other sizes that I use and taking them on the go is easy.

Why get huge kits when you can get one for each gauge. I have a Mossberg 500 and I will just run this one to three times depending on how much I fired. Easy to use means you will do it more and I say that is worth its weight in gold. It made sense to me especially since it is kinda like a paintball gun squeegee or on a paintball gun pushing paper towel through very tightly. I read a bunch of straight pipe loyalists. Maybe for marksmen and high end guns but for me and my brother, whom hunts around the country many different animals, uses many guns, and hardly ever cleans his guns............we will stick with this. Most important is to keep your gun dry off after use.

reviewText: I have an extensive gun cleaning kit but the Boresnake is well worth the investment !No need for a feed tube to protect the bore. With the exception of using a bore pad after cleaningto lube the bore, this eleminates a lot of time in the cleaning process. Great for getting ALL the fouling out.Great for removing copper as well as lead. I don't use it as a one step does it all cleaner.

I always clean my guns after shooting, but even with a wire brush and then a soft brush I always see some residue remaining in the barrel after cleaning, especially in the groves, the bore snake really does a good job of keeping the barrel clean, just using the directions on the packaging and run it through the bore, I use No. 9 cleaner with the snake which works well.

reviewText: This is the best way to clean any shotgun.  You can't go wrong with it.  I also got one for my 45 pistol

I dip the front of it in kerosene and run it through the barrel (always in the direction of the bullet/shot) and it leaves the bore with a mirrior finish. Shotgun brushes, rods, and patches are oversized and rather slow to change, like any rod kit.Being a boresnake, it works a hundred times better than patches since there is so much more contact with the bore. I wouldn't pack this into a field cleaning kit though, it's huge.Snags easier on parts inside the receiver than rifle boresnakes, especially a Saiga 12.Would recommend to anyone active with shotguns.

Cleans well and picks up 98% of leftover crud in your barrel. Washing Machine Safe. Must have for Bore care for your 12 ga shotgun. Using mine today with Frog Lube and all is good in my world of shooting/hunting.

reviewText: In my opinion, bore snakes are a must when cleaning.  I don't recommend this to be the only method to cleaning and should be a supplement to the cleaning rod and patches.I typically use the bore snake after the rod and patches to make sure I really purge whatever junk is in the barrel.  Then I would run a light coat of oil afterwards.  That may seem excessive to some but with the possible threat to our gun rights nowdays, we must take good care of the wonderful firearms that we have!

reviewText: I used this for the first time the other night and was pleased. It cleaned my barrel well after a few hours of trap and skeet. The barrel was spotless with the exception of a few areas around the choke which I had to clean with a brush, as expected. I recommend this product for before, during and after shooting.

I use the Boresnake Bore cleaner for all my firearms. They are durable effective and make cleaning out the bore super fast. A must have for my cleaning kit in each caliber I own, I always use these things. They are superb quality, I've never had a problem with them. I haven't worn one out yet.

reviewText: yep...it might not be the perfect tool for every cleaning, but it fits in my soft case and travels well on hunting trips.  Does a fine job.

reviewText: This snake is perfect for the job. It's a little tough to see from the photo but this snake has a section that is covered with brass wire brush which is ideal for scraping residue from the inside of the barrel. This was well worth the price. I would recommend this product.
I looked at all of the reviews and decided to give this a try.  It works great!  It leaves the bore cleaner than patches and is super simple to use.

reviewText: I have these for all of my rifles too. I use an armorers vise instead of trying to hold the gun with one hand and thread the weight with the other, then switch said other hand to the muzzle to grasp the weight and pull it through. The vise is a good investment and you can get one that will work fine for cleaning without going broke. These work great.
Used it to clean mine, my sons-in-laws and friend's shot-gun and it works just perfect. GreaT Stuff an d easy to use!
It makes cleaning the bore of my Mossberg 930 a breeze. I would buy this product again. I love it.

The Hoppe's Boresnake works quite well and it's very quick to use.  I have one of these in multiple gauge's for all of my firearms.  Nothing that I know of is going to clean your bore better and faster than these, without breaking your weapon down for cleaning.

I have several bore snakes and I love them all. It's an easy way to clean your barrel and I like that I'm always running the brush from the chamber towards the muzzle. If I were to make any changes to it I would like to see a couple more wire brushes built into it instead of only one. I guess they will come out with that idea in a "new and improved version" sometime in the future. I have three for each caliber. What I do is use one for applying a harsh cleaning solution, one for a less harsh solution and one for a light coat of oil. I saturate the last 3-4" of the snake and pull it slowly through the barrel to coat the inside before in storage..

It's nice you can wash these and use them again.  Just don't wash with anything nice.Great product not a great price.I recommend, but buy at Walmart for less.Vidimo Se!

The pull string is more than long enough to easily draw this through the 28 inch field barrel I use.
I have a  seven round Smith and Wesson 357..the 2 hks speedloaders fit perfectly..the case is sturdy..the speedloadersfit very well.

This speed loader pouch is tough, thick, and hard, perfect for reinsertion of spent speed loaders (which I don't see happening in a firefight). This strength is also its weak point. Other than this, it holds a six-round speed loader for a Ruger GP-100 perfectly well with no rattle. I tried a 5-round speed loader for my SP-101 and it rattles like a snake out in the desert. Other than these small issues, it is a great speed loader pouch.

I bought  this to hold HKS 36-A Speedloaders for my CCW. This works perfectly. With the rigid sides it is easy to get the loader in and out quickly without catching like the soft ones.
