Also it takes some getting use to since it is very stiff, I have trouble moving it around my belt to get a comfortable position when driving.

Very tight fit that will probably loosen with use.  Requires a bit of rotation of the loader to insert and remove.  Just remember that the loaders are a "rightee-loosee" so turn the knob counterclockwise as you insert/remove it, otherwise you will eject the shells in the process.

the snaps open easy and my speed 44 mag loaders are a good fit. granted it is not leather as stated but i do not have any problems it feels strong and secure. i have both the nylon and this product. i feel they both have a purpose. this does feel more secure but i like both. this speed loader case would be a good addition to the belt.

This is a very nice speedloader case and works geat for my needs. The only thing I wasn't too keen on is that when loaded up, it is very noisy. The speedloaders rattle around and negate any stealth approach whatsoever. I did fix that however, but putting a small piece of foam in the bottom of each "well". The rattle noise is gone!  I would definately buy more if needed..
Does what it is supposed to, and stays where you can find it... On your belt.  It got here pretty quick.
Nice and sturdy. Good quality. Bought for my daughter. She like it and fits the speedloaders for the GP100 just fine.
Stiff durable plastic that fits many different types of Speed Loaders.  I got this for my wife's 605 poly with 5-stary speed loaders and they fit perfect with enough room for quick access.

I bought the large one for my Safariland J-GL8C COMP II Speedloader (for my .357 MAG) and it couldn't fit better!!! It seems to be made of decent quality and looks pretty cool. Nothing bad to say and very happy!!!

I got this case in order to hold the HKS medium sized speed loaders for my Taurus .44 Tracker. reviewText: This HKS "Plain Double Speedloader Case" is very good quality and nicely holds two HKS Speedloader - Colt Python. Each of the two compartments securely shut but are still easy to flip open and attaches to belts up to 2.25" wide.Highly Recommended!CFH

reviewText: I'm pretty pleased with this. The leather is heavy duty and it hold 2 speed loaders for my Colt Anaconda.

very sturdy case.  Snaps hold tight but still are easy to open when you need too.  Fits a pair of loaded speed loaders very well.  Nice, snug fit.  A good buy.

reviewText: I have always like HKS products. It's a great value and fits the HKS speed loads too. Will last a long time.

The item arrived in great condition with packaging intact. I had also ordered HKS speedloader 10A from Amazon and it fits very well in the speedloader case. The case is durable and fits well on my belt. I recommend this product to anyone who needs a good durable case for their speedloaders.
Really nice case and does exactly what its supposed to do which is hold speedloaders.  Quality is decent and should last for as long as I need it.

Every day I carry my Ruger SP101 I carry my HK 36A Speedloaders in this case and it gets the job done. I wouldn't mind the carrier being a pinch smaller and holding the Speedloaders a bit more snug, but really I can't complain. :-)

I use this for my .357 rounds, the pouch is pretty well built and tough for leather. Though, it is leather so it will scratch pretty easily but that's not something I care about. I use this pouch when I dress for work.My Speedloaders are HKS made also, six-shot loaders. They don't rattle too much, if you were to run you'd hear them bounce around but if you're walking it won't annoy you. Also, the belt loop is very tight. The width that it allows for belts prevents it from moving up and down your belt. It's very comfortable even when you're sitting also (whether at work or driving).  Overall, this is a damn good speedloader pouch. I have no complaints so far.Just remember the part about the leather, they will get scuffed up eventually - just like good shoes. Polish!
The build quality on this speedloader case is very nicely crafted, as well as being rugged. I use this on my police issue patrol belt and holds .38 P+ x2 with no problems.
Good quality, especially for the price.  The Medium is a snug but good fit for the Ruger GP100 .357 HK speed loaders.  I think it would bounce around too much in the large.
I bought one for my S&W 637 .38 (Medium) and one for my S&W Governor (Large). The quality if good and looks nice. I would buy again.

works good, holds 2 speed loaders with .357 or .38 ammo........DOES rattle a bit if u move briskly .....which is true of most holders like this........can be fixed by putting a piece of cloth in bottom or even paper towel........and since this is duty-style rig.....would be adequate for duty use .....

Wad afraid the pseudo leather would be dubious, but this is solid and works well.  Holds Python speedloaders perfectly.  If you need to carry a pair of medium frame HKS 38/357 speedloaders this is a solid choice.  I do not know about other brands or calibers

Perfect case for the HKS speedloader.  Very good quality product and I highly recommend it when you buy the HKS speedloaders..  Makes reloading and shooting your revolver just as efficient as a semi auto pistol

This speedloader case is better than I expected.  It appears to be well made and should be durable for many years.  Even though I don't shoot in competition any more, it will fill my needs when fishing and in the high country.

reviewText: This HKS double Speedloader casse is major durable and a comfortable fit. Weather proof,Scratch proof,rip proof etc. You cant go wrong with this product. I prefer these over loader strips... I effectively reload in 4.5 seconds flat.

This HKS plastic double speedloader case with snap closures is rigid and secure. The speedloaders insert and pull out easily. It is designed to work on police duty belts as well as smaller width belts.  Since it is rigid and sticks out about 2" from your belt it isn't great for concealed carry unless you can cover them with a loose garment. Of course by law you probably don't have to cover them like your firearm.It has a rigid belt loop molded on to the back (without a snap), which will fit belts up to about 2-1/8" inches.  A 2-1/4" duty belt will also fit, but if the belt is over 3/16" thick it will be very tight pulling through the belt loop. Thinner belts will obviously work, but the case won't be held as securely. On a thin belt, it will obviously be able to slide back and forth.For street use, a stiff, thick 1-1/2" leather belt is a good compromise with this case. To use it with a 1-1/2 belt: Cut out a strip of 1/4" thick, 1/2" tall cardboard and insert into the bottom of the slot.  (Or glue two thinner pieces of cardboard together with Elmer's white glue.) This will keep the case from tilting as you draw out the speedloader. If you want a more permanent solution, wrap a couple of turns of 1/2" wide flat black nylon strap (or leather strip) though the bottom of the slot and sew the ends together with needle and thread.The case is actually made out of Dupont Hytrel, which is a quality textured polymer material that looks a lot like leather. This case is smooth black, although HKS also makes it in a molded basket-weave pattern.  According to the back of the HKS package, they also make this same Hytrel case in tan or brown color (though I have never seen those sold anywhere).I prefer this rigid case over the other one-size HKS speedloader case made out of flexible Cordura nylon, which just has Velcro cover flaps.  The HKS Cordura nylon case doesn't hold its shape well like this case for insertion of the speedloaders, and it doesn't hold them as securely.  However, the advantage of the Cordura nylon case is that it is more compact and sticks out from your belt less than this rigid case (especially if you sew it a little tighter around the speedloader), and it can be squashed flat with the speedloaders removed.  So the cordura nylon case is probably preferable to wear under a coat, vest, or loose shirt for concealed carry.I believe HKS used to make a similar leather case, but I haven't seen those at any stores lately.  There are similar leather cases available from other police duty belt makers, but they are about double the price.  Some of the other makers also have Cordura nylon covered duty belt speedloader cases with a rigid plastic frame.  They cost just a little more than this Hytrel case.  However, I think most of these other makers just make one size for six-shot revolvers.  The HKS comes in two sizes, with one for the smaller speedloaders (which they call medium).Galco and some other holster companies make nice small single leather speedloader cases for concealed carry that wrap around a regular pants belt and snap closed (brown and black color). They are very nice leather cases and much better for concealed carry than this HKS duty belt case, but they are expensive.The two sizes in this HKS case are designated large and medium.  The back of the package says large fits HKS speedloaders 27, 29, 25M, 25, 5, 57M,  and the medium fits speedloaders 10, 586, DS, M3, PY, CA44, 36, 22. (See hksspeedloaders dot com for a chart.)  There are actually smaller size HKS 22LR six-shot speedloaders, but I don't know if they make a small size case for these also.If you are using the medium case to hold the 36-A 5-round HKS speedloader for the Ruger SP101 and other small 5-shot revolvers, the speedloader is a little loose in this medium case and will rattle slightly if you walk briskly.  However, you can cut out a curved piece of plastic from a powdered drink mix container, which will curve around the speedloader in the case and hold it tighter and prevent it from rattling.By the way, an alternative case option for the medium size speedloaders from HKS is to use one of the leather cell phone cases (for the older "candy bar" size cell phones). Many of these have a spring steel belt clip, elastic on the sides, and a full velcro cover flap. You can stack two medium loaded speedloaders in these, and they are discreet for concealed carry defense.On some of these cell phone cases, the elastic doesn't go all the way to the to the bottom, so the bullets in the ends of the bottom cartridges are just a bit noticeable on the sides. However, this can be fixed by fashioning a piece of bent black plastic to hide them -  like from a plastic pocket folder (or even cardboard blackened with a marker). It would be shaped like a tall "U" in the bottom of the case.
summary: Secure speedloader case, but synthetic material, not leather.

reviewText: I love that I don't have to chase my brass when using a revolver, but the disadvantage is how awkward it is to reload. This fills the need nicely.The pouches are a bit bulky and make me feel like Batman or Luke Skywalker when I wear them on my belt, but they serve the purpose well.This allows me three full sets of ammunition before I have to find the box. Not quite as much as the magazines on my semi-automatic pistols, but good enough.

The fit is close, but there is room to spare.  I gather that the large size must be for .44 mags and larger.  The cylinder on the GP100 is pretty damn big for a 6 shot .357 mag and both this and the A-series HKS .38/.357 speed loaders work just fine.
summary: Medium is great for HKS .38/.357 A-series speed loaders

reviewText: I was raised on revolvers and recently returned to them. If anything this is a clear improvement over my last speed loader case. Don't be out off by synthetic . Leather scars and gets soft.I have jumped in a river with this on my belt and it dried perfectly. I expect years of service...
Product works great.  Speeloaders do rattle a bit but nothing too loud.  They come covered in oil so be careful.
This fit perfectly with the speed loaders I purchased. It has a smooth release for rapid deployment. Fits well with a variety of different belt sizes.
Fits the speedloaders for my .454 super red hawk PERFECT! easy to retrieve the loaders from the holster and the snaps hold sure on long trips.
Not happy with the product, going back to HKS. And Amazon needs to fix this min. word thing, it's annoying !
Work and function as it should. Looks and feel will last for a long time. Good to have to store speedloader.
Buy this and the HKS speedloaders and it fits perfectly.  Great thing to have if you're not into speed strips and want a quick access speed loader.

I was thinking about going leather on the carry case but since I got this one, now I am glad I didn't.  These can get wet and you just wipe them off and you are ready to go again.  They seem tough also..
Preferred type and brand for carrying extra ammo, whether on my belt or in my go bag. The belt loop seems to be designed for medium duty web belts (thinner than leather gun belt).

This is a great product, and, of course, it holds HKS speedloaders perfectly. It is tough and sturdy. The belt loop is also quite big and can accommodate almost any size belt. As an earlier review mentioned, this is case is not ideal for concealed carry, especially not without a jacket. But, overall this does the job!

I am in Alaska.  They say that the .44 mag is the perfect bear gun, but a lightweight revolver is darn near impossible to find. I went with the .44 special bulldog.  It's light and it may not be a mag, but it will work.  I bought two speed loader which gives me 15 rounds. These fit on my belt by my holster within easy reach and I have not bumped or brushed into them causing any problems when I motorcycle offroad. The snaps are solid but easy to pop.  This worked for me.

I used it last weekend for a 3 day in WA State. It fit my speed loaders for my S&W Governor perfectly. It was almost perfect. It is not tight at all and makes minimum noise when moving through the brush. Very sturdy construction, and easy to use. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a speed loader case for 45LC. This was a good buy!
High Quality HKS Gear. Snaps are easy to open / close yet are secure and stay put even with high activity level. Speed loaders fit perfectly. AAA+++

Not thrilled with how stiff it is, but that's just my opinion. The channel where the belt goes through is to big IMO.It allows for the pouch to ride up when you sit down, which then digs into you. Unless of course you have a very wide belt.
summary: Does what it is supposed to

reviewText: This case is well made and holds 2 of the 6 round 357 Mag Speedloaders.  I like the fit and finish of the case it feels well-made and fits the speedloaders perfect.
it will hold the speed loaders securely, however it is not completely made of leather there is more plastic involved than I would have liked but it will work good for the job.
very good quality items. Will probably order more later. Wish they had come in a different color but oh well. Win some lose some

...but material is a turn off since its all plastic but like I said, useful, does the job. not something that you can brag about while hanging on your belt but I don't do that.  I just use it to keep speed loaders  together and ready for use.

I really wasnt sure what to expect from this but 3 days after i ordered it i found it sitting on the front step. I cant say theres anything special about it but then again its a holder for speedloaders. Its not really supposed to be anything special. Good quality though and it holds my speedloaders just as it should. I will definately be picking up at least one more and would definately recomend this to anyone.

This double speed loader pouch is hard plastic, and the covers pop up when opened giving you fast access to your speed loaders.  On the range they're great for quickly reloading and getting more rounds off.  That said the case is bulky, hard, and will probably jab you when you sit down.  These are fine for going to the range, but too cumbersome for every day carry.  Still for the specific purpose of practice and competition shooting, these do their job well.
summary: Good but not for concealed carry.

reviewText: Great product! Fits my HKS 10 speed-loaders perfectly and stands up to rough use during training. Has been covered in dirt with no problems what-so-ever. I was nervous that the belt loop may be to large but when it is on the belt it does not move at all.
summary: Looks good and can hold up to abuse

reviewText: Needed something to hold two speed loaders for my 38 Spl. revolver. Does a good job. a little bit to big if you are using a 5 round speed loader. Works great to a 6 round speed loader.

If you need to carry two speedloaders securely, the HKS Plain Double Speedloader Case does it extremely well.  It is made of DuPont Hytrel, a strong, durable synthetic material that looks like leather, but is a lot less expensive than leather.  It is also much more rigid than the double Cordura fabric speedloader cases, which makes the HKS Speedloader Double  Case easier to use.  Plus, when the HKS Speedloader Case Hytrel tabs are unsnapped, they spring open and stay open, out of the way, which certainly can't be said of the Cordura material cases.  When empty, the HKS Double Speedloaders Case won't compress like the Cordura cases will, so the HKS Double Speedloader Case does create a slightly "bulkier" profile when used for concealed carry.  But if you're using a Ruger Security Six .357 Magnum Revolver for CC, I'm guessing you probably aren't that concerned about the slightly bulky profile your empty HKS Double Speedloader Case has, since it works so very well with the HKS MK3-A Speedloaders, which work so extraordinarily well with your Ruger Security Six .357 Magnum, when compared to any of those smushed down empty Cordura fabric cases.  But then, someone using a Ruger Security Six .357 Magnum for CC probably isn't concerned about too much.  If you need a double speedloader case, buy this excellent product from HKS, on Amazon.com.
summary: Looks Great . . . . Easy Filling . . . . and Unfilling

reviewText: Very nice for the price, it is not leather. Belt loops are wide 2 1/4. Snaps are secure enough I wont worry about loader coming out. Works well with HKS 36.

This thing is well made and accepts both my .38 and .357 caliber speed loaders.  It's light and durable.  The belt loop is very wide and would fit over a regular police service belt. It's a great buy.

I purchased this HKS case for concealed carry w/ HKS 586 speedloaders for a Ruger GP100 .357 mag. The fit and finish was perfect w/ little or no loose fit so as to allow rattling or excessive noise. Good strong and heavy duty snaps hold flaps securely. Solid 2.25" belt loop is full 3.5" across back of case. With the molded basketweave design it has a real leather look. Made pretty much "BULLET PROOF" to last!
Sure, it's plastic as opposed to leather, but it sure looks like leather and works great. I'm glad I bought it.
summary: Can't beat it for the price.

reviewText: This will hold two HKS speed-loaders. Fits both a SW Magnum Carry .357 (six round HKS) and a Charter Arms Mag Pug .357 (five round HKS) Just in case if you know what I mean.
My first non-leather pouch I've truly liked...  Bit of a snug fit on my safariland K speedloaders, but solid snap lets me know they are secure. I foresee many good years of use!
I use these for my 44. Keep two cylinder reloads at your fingertips. Well made as are all of HKS products. I am expecting years of service out of these.

I used the metal and wood kit on my Remington 740 and 742 deer rifles.  They look great.  I did some online research and took my time and didn't rush it.  Both my rifles turned out very well and it was my first time.

Start to finish this kit has all you need except for sand paper and steel wool. The stock finish I hand rubbed and turned out excellent. The bluing is deep gunmetal blue-black and looks great. Thanks.
Have not used this yet but it looks like it will do what I want it to do for my Type 53 Chinese Mosin to refinish the stock and rifle all in one kit.

Does exactly what it says ot does, took me about a week to refinish an old 1930's shotgun. Don't thin the walnut stain out too much, made that mistake but it was my fault. Your guns will only come out as well as you prep them, when you think your ready to clean prep some more. And when you think your ready to use the bluing, clean some more. Take your time!!!!!

I bought this to touch up a deer barrel, and if directions are followed, and I don't rush it, the results are very acceptable. I think you would get a little better job in a hot blue tank, but this is very nice especially for the buck (the $ not the animal)The results from the stock refinishing depends greatly on preparation, and patience. If you prepare the stock ahead, sand lightly, wet and resand to raise grain-dents-and the little burrs your results will be what you'd like. Again don't rush it, you'll only be dissappointed.I think their product does what it is designed to do very well. My old shotgun stock looks almost new, maybe better than new as the oil finish pleases more than the original finish. You moght want to get some more grades of paper, and steel wool as the supplied amount does not consider the fact one may mess up the first second or maybe third time because they rushed.It must have something going for it, Birchwood-Casey has been around as long as I remember, when my rememberer is working. Dan
Good for quick touch ups, won't work on all treated metals. The touch up temporary and will wear off after contact.

Birchwood Casey  makes some great products and this is one of them. great kit to re-do the finish on and old favorite. does a great job on bluing and will make the wood look really nice. just follow the directions and apply several coats and you will love the final product.

This does a great job. follow directions to the letter. It took me a few tries but got it looking good, You will be washing the barrel alot, make sure you oil the inside of the barrel often to keep it from rusting.
It is a great, do it yourself home kit for re-bluing your guns. I would buy it again. It's not bad for your everyday rifles and shotguns.
summary: Not bad for your everyday rifles and shotguns

reviewText: I blued an old 22 rifle that has been in my family for around 80 years. It did a fair job, nothing to write home about. It was a lot of trouble not to turn out better than it did.

used this to refinish a coldsteel tomahawk. The varnish remover is not strong enough to remove the original finish on the coldsteel. the stain and the bluing though worked great! the tomahawk has the look of a much more expensive piece now.

Using cold blue on a firearm you plan on using and taking in and out of pistol rugs and holsters is about useless. I applied 7 coats of cold blue to my firearm and it showed 'wear' nearly immediately with only a few of the above actions executed. If you wanted to cold blue a firearm for the wall as a display this would be excellent. The color was dark and looked great. Otherwise, if it is an 'in use' practical firearm, spend the money and take it to a gunsmith for proper blueing. I did not get to try the wood refinish yet.
Birchwood is one of the best out there. It does what it says it would do and then some. With this kit you can be a beginner or a expert and do a good job.

used these products on my winchester 94. the bluing came out beautiful it has an almost black finish and looks beautiful. i would recommend this product to anyone who wants to learn or even if you have re-blued before this product is excellent.
just what i needed to restore a couple of old antique guns.i also bought the swabs to help with the aplication.
I have used this bluing before and have always been satisfied with the results - great for touch up or bluing an entire gun

I am in the process of refinishing a double barrel 12 gauge that I sawed off at 18.25" and so far have only reblued the barrel and I am very happy with how it came out.  It looks like it is brand new, and the instructions were easy to follow.  I have not refinished the stock yet but I am expecting that part to go just as well as the blueing.  The only thing I would change is it would be nice if it came with some fine steel woal, but I got by just fine with a brass dish scrubbing pad.

If you're professionally blueing, this kit won't last long.  But if you're like me and it's touch-ups and minor jobs, then this is perfect.  The products are all top notch and easy to use.  The results are easily professional quality, as long as you follow all the directions (which are not hard to understand).  I'm pretty much a novice, but the one full pistol I re-blued looks absoulutely fantastic, and more than a few folks have asked me where I got it done.  I tell them I used this kit, and they were pretty impressed.  I'm really happy with it.

Used it on a 1933 M91/30 Mosin Nagant that was showing it's age.  I was using Powder Blaster to clean the barrel when I noticed the cleaner had leaked out of the chamber and had stripped a wide path off of the stock all the way down to the front of the barrel.  Broke it down to it's base components, finished stripping the stock and re-did the stock with the stock oil.  In my opinion the stock looks far better now than it did the dark  brown it use to be.Took awhile to figure out the bluing process the instructions are all there, guess I'm just a bit slow.  Tried re-bluing just the portions that needed it but soon found it was easier to strip the entire barrel and receiver and redo all of it.  Still haven't gotten the hang of it down quite right.  The inside of the chamber is more of a red color than it is black. Think I am going to have to try again or send it in for a professional to do it.

Ok so I gave this 4 stars only because I ran out of bluing to finish my project.  Itʻs a GOOD DECENT product, so good as a matter of fact that I bought a second kit, as well as an extra bottle of "Super Blue" along with it. My only complaint is that I ran out of bluing.With that being said...Iʻd recommend it to anyone looking to re-blue their gun.  Just be sure to buy another container of Super Blue. I think that works better than the Perma Blue they send in the package.I used this kit to re-blue a Mosin Nagant rifle.  The blue and rust remover worked incredibly well.  Degreaser was ok...I used brake cleaner and then wiped it all down with the degreaser, so I only used just a little bit.  The tru oil was good too.  I didnʻt use the stain at all, but I will on my next project gun. And I didnʻt use the wood conditioner either.  Instead I sanded the old finish off my gun, then used about 6 coats of the tru oil, and finished that off with about 6-8 coats of wood wax.  That worked out well.It was actually easier than I expected. Just take your time, and be ready for the smell!  Make sure you do this in a well ventilated area.  I did it in my garage, with the door open.  If youʻve been thinking about re-bluing your gun...go ahead and buy this kit and do it.  This kit makes it easy.
summary: Does a good job...not enough bluing

reviewText: We used this to hide some blemishes on a Goose Gun that had seen some rough treatment. It performs as advertised, and does a very nice job of blending with the existing factory bluing. However, even after letting the gun sit for a couple of weeks, the aroma still tends to transfer to your hands. so be advised!

Re-finishing an old .22 Remington Rifle. Followed instructions to the letter, and have a better blue job than I expected.  Blue, rivals factory finish. Could not be happier with my blue job. Rifle looks like new. I did use 2 cans of brake cleaner to clean the rifle and then followed instructions using denatured alcohol. Be sure to clean very well, and how well you prep the gun will determine your finish. Also be sure and use latex or rubber gloves. Remove all old blueing and rust then polish metal to shine using 400 or 600 grit sandpaper. You must get the final coating of oil on very quickly after blueing as the metal will rust almost immediately. Have your oil ready and soak it down, then let it cure for a day. I do not think this will hold up as well as factory or hot blueing, but is something you can do yourself fairly cheaply and if you take care to keep well oiled should last for years. I did this to this same rifle about 50 years ago and it held up well, turned brownish in a few areas over the years. Not sure which brand I used then but the same process.

I have used the BC normal blue, Brownells oxpho blue, and this stuff (super blue). This did better on harder metal and worked great on normal steel/iron as well. You MUST follow directions for it to work.Get some gun scrubber or brake cleaner. Use a whole crapload of q-tips or fresh cotton balls with a forcept. Spray it on the thing, clean the part, throw away the q-tip/cotton ball. Repeat but with WATER. Throw away swab. Use a FRESH AND CLEAN swab or a ball in a forcept dip it and use it, then if you need to re-dip use another FRESH one, don't contaminate the product. Wait THIRTY SECONDS. Rinse with a swab w water. Buff it with steel wool. REPEAT EVERYTHING AGAIN.That works. It is great for touch up, and I have blued larger parts this way with great results. Be patient, and do the above steps a lot of times until you get what you want. Perfection takes actual work people.
summary: Hey, if you follow directions it works. Other reviewers did not.

reviewText: this stuff works good!used it for light scratches here and there on a few of my guns.acts fast and looks great!
This stuff seemed to work on the steel of my AR-15, but after it sat for a day or so, it began to rust. Im not sure why because this stuff is supposed to stop rust??

Works great. Used it on an old cheap revolver I recently purchased, and it's given it a new life! Warning: won't blue stainless steel, aluminum or other non-ferrous metals. Also, if you don't know how to blue a gun then you should REALLY Google up some instructions or watch a video on Youtube. Blueing is essentially a controlled corrosion of the metal. You need to clean the area BEFORE you blue and then you need to clean and oil it AFTER the process or else the finished product is either going to look like crap... or your gun is going to rust the next day. You've been warned. Now, like I said, this is a good product and highly recommend it.

Worked fine on my steel weapons.  Bought it to touch up a lady Smith nicked front sight, no joy. As the the listing and direction said, "Not for Alloys or Composits.  Also read the directions, ya gotta wet it down to stop the blueing process.As I get older I get stupider..  Recommended.

I removed the rear sight from a Mosin-Nagant that I was sporterizing.  I had to file down the dovetail, sand down the metal, and reblue the barrel in that area.  It wasn't as good as a hot blue, but it certainly looks good enough.  The casual observer probably wouldn't notice any difference unless I pointed it out.
summary: Did a decent job on a patch job

reviewText: I used the Super Blue from Birchwood Casey to touch up the matte black Armory Kote on a pistol and it matched almost perfectly. I also used to it on a K98 german rifle and it was was pretty good there as well. Simple clean the surface, dab on Super Blue with a Q-Tip and let it sit for about 30 seconds and wipe off the excess. I applied several times to get a good color match.

This worked great. I used some rust remover which took the blue off. Dumb me. Ordered this, used the rust remover to remove all blue. I think you will be forced to do two coats for uniformity. As I recall I did three coats. No one could tell the guns have been re-blued. I bought a used gun with a rub mark. I know where it is so I can see it. You would not. Touch up is tricky so I could do better if I do it again but I was very pleased. I then touched up more of my guns.
I have clean and prepped area many times.  Used this several times. It has a blue color but never turns black.

I collect knifes and Tomahawks. Cold steel sells ugly Tomahawks I love to change because they are cheap. I tried vinegar and mustard for a forced Patina with lousy results. This worked great and did not stink up the house.

I followed the instructions and my mosin nagant came out looking good.It was very easy to use and flows like water onto the sponge.It is very thin and covers fast.I rinsed with water and buffed with metal pad to remove the white residue that appeared.Results metal was blued black and shiny.
Ive been looking for a while for something to mount my Gamo CFX with, these are absolutely PERFECT!! theyre well built, look nice and look like they are custom fit for my rifle.

I purchased this set of hangers to display an antique rifle in my office.  The installation was easy into a wood panelled wall.  I think installation into drywall would require special fasteners which do not come with the hangers.  The finish looks to be polished brass but not polished to a mirror finish.  They are thick material and very strong so that if they are fastened to the wall securely they should be able to hold significant weight.These hangers are attractive but do not overwhelm the object being displayed.  All in all, I'm quite satisfied with this purchase.
They look nice on our family room wall. The only issue I had was it was a little akward to install with the open screw slots.
They look great and keep the rifle up out of reach of the kids.  The brass finish goes with every decor.

I mounted a Mosin 91/30 (w/ bayonet) into drywall, which is a fairly hefty hang. I did not use anchors.  I have taken the rifle down and put it back up a few times and they are not showing any signs of coming loose, they seem very secure and not wiggly.  I would not try to use the rifle as a pullup bar, but that is not what I expected out of these things anyway.

These things are great. Very sturdy. They hold my SKS wonderfully, which is saying something because it's a particularly thick weapon and most hangers won't accommodate it. The leather inserts are also a nice touch.

I have now bought 5 sets of these hangers and they fit my cabin decor perfectly.  They have a quality look and are lined with leather to prevent scratching the guns.Only difficulty with the product is that the screws mount into slots on either side rather than into holes through the hanger.  It just makes it a little more difficult to mount trying to position the screws to either side properly.  Would have been much easier with a hole on either side rather than a slot.  That is a small inconvenience in the mounting and once mounted it is a handsome way to display your rifles or shotguns.

These Hoppes brass wall mounts worked great for displaying my Hawkens smokepole. the only critique would be to cast it with full wrap mounting holes( not adding that much more brass) and should be used with dry wall mollies if going to hang to drywall. Can not see using for anything like modern weapons, large forearm pumps and like weapons. The brass goes so well with the brass patch box in stock and double set trigger guard.Minus one star for mounting flaw in my opinion.

There is zero need for a sprayable form of Hoppe's #9, it is smelly and gets everywhere you don't want it. There is no applicator straw, you just get Hoppe's...everywhere. Buy a jar and you'll be happier.
summary: Why did I think this was a good idea?

reviewText: This product make gun cleaning much easier.  I use it all the time.  Works great. The Price is very reasonable.
Get solvent where you want when you need it. This is a very convenient spray bottle, and is great for your range bag as it won't spill.

This product is the best cleaning solvent you can get. Everything on the can is true, just follow the directions and you will be pleased with the results. No messy liquids, just spray and rub. It's easy and effective. I recommend this to anyone.
Target the hard to get areas easily with the aerosol spray.  You need to pick this product up and stop cleaning the messy way!
After heavy duck and range days, I simply spray a bit on the Boresnake and give the 870 express a couple run throughs.  Keeps her cycling and shooting like new!
Subject line says it all. I would not buy this again. It smells really bad. It's probably a good solvent, but...
i ordered the aerosol because its easier to spray into the trigger assembly, that's all i really use this for.  i like the whole oil better, but this helps with those tough to reach areas
Throw it in your gun bag for convenience, that's what I do. It's great for spraying on your bore snakes without the mess that goes with dipping.

I wanted to like this a lot.  Turns out it's merely ok.  When you push the button OMG HERE COMES HOPPES #9.  It's great for those hard to reach places when you don't mind a puddle of Hoppes.  But it's definitely not for precision work.  I'm puzzled by the reviewer who complained about the smell. It smells like Hoppes #9.  Works like Hoppes #9.  Three stars for function.  Five stars for the product that I've used forever.
summary: Lots comes out when you press the button

reviewText: I have been using this product for years. Keep it in my gun safe, on my cleaning table in the shop. You never know when I may need it.I will keep using it until I find something better.
Excellent for indoor or outdoor shooting as it makes it much easier to view hits without the need of spotting scope

i've tried several types of targets over the past year. these are without a doubt the best targets on the market today. great quality and good pricing through amazon. can't recommend them highly enough!

Makes a 50 cents large target at the range last several hundred rounds.  I have a CCW permit and use these to practice my 2 shot in 2 second draw at 7 ft.  These are also great for target longevity to break up larger targets into smaller sections.  Very easy to see at 7 yards and give a very noticeable color change for hits.  Good value and excellent training tool.
summary: great product to extend target life at the range

reviewText: A shooting buddy wanted a target like these but he couldn't find any. When I gave these to him he was a happy camper. He can now see his groups at 100 yds. with out making the trek down the range.

I have used these for a few months now and they are great.  The reactive targets are easy to see and fun to shoot.  I have used these up to 50 yards with no issues.  I like the size.  It is perfect for honing your skills.  Highly recommend product and eCop.
summary: Great targets and easy to see

reviewText: Very nice product, so many cool targets for a great price. Very easy to see even and longer ranges. I will definitely order some more.
Perfect for use at the 50 and 100 yard ranges.  Improved my shooting skill to the next level.  Shoot 'n c are great products.  I use several sizes for different distances - never disappointed.

I took these targets to the indoor range last weekend and they work great!  Bought them for my .22lr rifle.  I use up my large target then stick these all over it!  They are great for seeing your hits!  Even from 20 yards.  The stick easily and I really enjoy shooting them!  Of course Amazon delivered quickly!
I love these style targets. They are pricey, but at least you can see where your bullet hits at distances.

These shoot n c targets are just what I needed to help me get my grouping size smaller, with my pistols. I try to punch out the entire  one inch and two inch targets with my pistols at 20 ft.  Perfect will buy again.
These are great if you're shooting 22's especially if your eyes are old.  You can see where your shots are going.

Bought these for longer range shooting (200-300y) to see hits easily.  I don't use them often given the cost, and reserve them for sighting adjustments when mounting a new scope or iron sight.  Handy shooting target.
summary: Expensive, but useful at long ranges.

reviewText: I love the splatter targets for great visibility but they are not cheap.  These work great but there are others on Amazon at better prices.

These are the only paper targets I use at the range. No tape required as the entire thing is a huge sticker so you can just peel and paste it onto the target stand. I love that you can see where you hit as the impact point "explordes" a flourecant green. I dont have to use my spotting scope to see where I am hitting because of this. The smaller diamonds on the corners are 2" and the square grids are 1". Best target I have ever shot at.
summary: The best paper targets money can buy

reviewText: I love these targets. They are great for sighting in a scope, but they are also great just for target practice. My eyes are getting old and these targets provide great visual feedback on how close your shots are to where you're aiming.
I works and you can clearly see where you shot. I just wish they provide more of the blackout stickers.
These are great.  The design has a lot of contrast and the adhesive back is great for when the range runs out of staples.  :)
When shooting to adjust the back sight on a pistol (or sight-in a rifle), these target are a great aid to the process.  Self-adhevise and easy to see at a distance, they are perfect for this task.

These have become some of our favorite targets.  The bright ring around the whole after penetration makes it easy to see the shot from a distance.  The little stickers that come with it make the targets reusable as they too leave the bright ring if they are penetrated.  Once these are all used up we will be getting more of them.
summary: These have become our favorite targets

reviewText: These work great if you are shooting close or far. The adhesive works well and stays on a cardboard box. I was lucky enough that these came in a box from Amazon that was the perfect size. The 1" grid segments make it easy to sight in your new scope or whatever. The way these are made is they start with a green color and print the grid on top so when you shoot them the black wears off and you can see bright green around the entry whole.
summary: Great for practice and sighting in.

reviewText: I can see where I hit via my scope and do not need to use a spotting scope. A little costly but cheaper than the scope. These helped me sight my scope in in a short period of time.

Excellent value. Works as advertized. At 100 yds. could see where I had shot with 3x9 scope but recommend spotting scope. This particulair set is a bit 'busy" having the center bullseye and 4 smaller bullseyes which make initial sighting in bit more difficult. Is excellent for comparing differant ammo. At hint to extend use: after using color in yellow holes with a black sharpie and over the rear with tape. At 100 yds you cannot tell difrerance and chance of hitting same exact hole is small.

These are the best of all I have tried. The multiple squares are ideal for range use because you can reuse without having to patch it up so often. Also you can use the corner squares to practice moving between shots The grid squares are 1" so it's easy to measure your groups. The bullet holes are easy to see for a good distance even with a .22 caliber bullet (maybe 25 yards or more if you have good eyesight). Perhaps the only downside compared to others is the overall size, but its never an issue for me.I've seen these used in History channel's Top Shot show, so pros like em.

I always wondered why the self-adhesive back until I went to the range on a gusty day. Everyone with stapled targets had to replace them often due to the wind. The Shoot-N-C targets stayed in place. The color splash at the point of impact gives instant easy to see confirmation of each shot. The pasters work well and having 5 target areas per sheet reduces the need to replace targets all the time.

I like these target to sight in your new scope.  The target gives you 5 areas to aim at.  Start with the biggest and work your way to the corners.  Your gun is zeroed by the time you have hit each bull.
Nicer than the Glowshots and easy to see. I like that they put 5 targets on one and they stick to the cardboard backing. At 25 yards I can see where I hit no problem.
Very bright and you won't miss seeing where you hit with these.  The grid and multiple targets mean you can pretty much sight in your new scope without having to switch targets.
summary: Very good for sighting in Pellet Rifle

reviewText: These targets are a must have for sighting in a new scope or iron sights.  Depending on caliber you are not going to see the hits with the Mark 1 Eyeball at 100 yards.  Get a decent spotting scope or learn to use your rifle scope to see your hits.  Because I have a great spotting scope, I will not sight in a new scope with anything else.

When I started shooting at targets for more than a hundred yards to test the grouping of your rifle, this I found to be the best target to use.Depending on color of the foliage backdrop where you set up your target, time of day and level of dust and wind going around, some paper target hits get too hard to see from distance greater than 100 yards even with the spotting scope. These targets are awesome with the black on bright green. The hits are really clear but they don't bust out to wide to skew your grouping assessment.
summary: Great product for sighting in long range rifles!

reviewText: These targets make seeing where you hit from a distance a whole lot easier, especially if you're using a spotting scope. A little pricy though, but I guess that's to be expected with the way these are constructed.

These targets are ideal for sighting and general practice. I usually put up another target, shoot it up, then attach one or two of these on top of it and continue shooting. I like having more than 1 target on the paper so you can shoot it many times without having to change.

I shoot rifles scoped and these targets give me a slew of aiming points.  The center target and the four outlying diamonds make five, and the four squares above, below, left and right make four more for a total of 9 discrete targets on a single sheet.  On the four squares I like to affix a little red dot from a shoot-n-c refill (you always have more of those than you use) to give me clear bullseyes on each of the additional four squares.The 1-inch grid gives you precise information, and the multiple aim points give great value.  Its my favorite target regardless of whether my scope is sighted in or not.
summary: Best value of the splatter targets

reviewText: I use the Shoot-N-C targets every time I go to the shooting range. This particular type of target is excellent for sighting in a new scope. There is never any doubt of where the bullet hits the target. The peel off back it a nice feature also. There is no need to have a stapler to fasten the target to the back drop. Just peel off the back and stick it on.
always good to see your hits (or misses) and these targets are great!  good value considering walmart and most ranges sell them at much higher prices for less in the pkg.

I love being able to see bullet strikes without leaving the bench. This target works great for all calibers, but I appreciate it the most while shooting my .177 cal. air gun. The hits stand out great.

These are by far my favorite targets when shooting rifles & carbines at the range.  These are very handy for sighting in a rifle (as long as the rilfe has been bore sighted first).  The target is layed out with a 1" grid.  Many scope adjustment knobs are in 1 MOA clicks, which give you approximately 1/4" of movement at 100 yards at maximimum (or otherwise indicated) magnification.  By observing your point of impact (relative to your point of aim) and subdividing each grid into 1/4 intervals, you can figure out how many clicks left/right and up/down you need to zero your scope.  If you are shooting at less than 100 yards, you will need to do some relatively easy math.  For example, a 1 MOA click at 50 yards would give you 1/8" of movement on target.I would suggest shooting a 3 to 5 shot group initially to verify point of impact. Then I would make the necessary adjustments, followed by another 3 to 5 shot group, followed by fine tuning.  Keep in mind that different types of ammunition (and different bullet weights) will have different ballistic behavior.  So, zero your scope in with the type of ammo you plan to use for your hunt, or that you use most often at the range.  Try some other types of ammo after you have your scope zeroed to observe how the point of impact changes.  Record your findings on a note pad, and you can make scope adjustments in the field to bring your scope to zero if you need or want to change out ammunition.One nice thing about this target is the 5 bulls eyes to shoot at.  After I've shot these out, I pick out the 4 points formed by the "T" intersection of the 4 sets of bulls eyes (top 2 plus middle, left 2 plus middle, etc.).  Then I will start shooting at the points of each diamond.  You can get a lot of mileage out of one target.I purchase these targets at a local sport goods store.  They sell 4 targets for $6 and include a cardboard backer.  If you don't need the backer, the price on Amazon is fantastic.  I plan to order from Amazon when my supply runs low.
Best there is especially for seeing small calibers from a distance.  No spotting scope or spotter required. Worth the money.
Highly visible shots makes it easier to increase your accuracy.  I love these targets and being self adhesive makes them easy to setup for shooting.

These targets are awesome, they work great to site in your rifles at 100-300 yards, with out using a spotting scope.  Highly visible through the scope which allows for easy and quick adjustments. Will buy again
I like this type of targets. you just peel and stick and they stay put no staple gun. they are easy to see where you shot you can see the spots easy good value

I used this to sight in a few rifles at 100 and 200 yards. Almost don't need to use spotting scope at 100 yards. Using the scope, it's very easy to see where the shot hit and the 1 inch grid pattern helps make quick scope adjustments.
summary: Good value and higly visible shots

reviewText: Not much more to say; these are great targets at a good Amazon price, and the supplied overlay stickers let you get a few more rounds out of each target.
This target is absolutely great to sight in your rifle. So much easier to see where your bullet hit even with a spotting scope. I will definitely buy again.

These little brushes work great.  I haven't actually used the .22 cal yet but have used .40, .45, and 9mm and they all worked great.  You don't have to worry as much about pushing the brush all the way through before pulling it back since it doesn't bind like most brushes.

I thought I would try this item instead of a normal brass Hoppe's brush and here's my results.  The brush was very tight even with the Hoppe's fluid on it, it was very tough to push through a S&W m&p 15-22 bore. I planned on using this on a .223 chrome lined bore but will not attempt it because it was so tight. It did seem to clean fine and probably was a little quicker vs. the standard brass brush. Overall I wasn't too impressed and will stick with the normal and cheaper brass brushes from Hoppe's.
Doesn't clean all the powder residue out, however using in tandem with a wire brush first, then wrapping a cleaning patch around the Tornado Brush to clean up left over works quite well.
Great tool to have for cleaning the bore of your 22lr or 556 rifle.  Works great and simple to use.

Instead of pushing a cleaning rod with tip into your barrel for cleaning when the Hoppe's patch will cling to the brush for the perfect swipe on the barrel as not to scratch it. I us the brush to clean the barrel of my 12 and 20 guage shotguns. When you look down the barrel after placing a protective shim on it looks like a sheet of glass.
summary: Great tool to use to push patches in shotguns.

reviewText: The tornado brush design is a major improvement over the traditional loop, and jag cleaning tips.  The flexing of the spiral loops against the lands & grooves with a patch over it does an excellent job of removing lead & powder residue.  The cleaning patch sits nicely over the end loop and in larger calibers (e.g., 45ACP, 12 Gauge shot shell) the loop will penetrate the cotton patch helping to secure it as you push the brush through the bore.  I use the brush in only one direction, pushing from the breech to the muzzle whenever possible.  I then unscrew the brush, remove the cleaning rod and repeat the process until the patch comes out clean.  For difficult to clean deposits, I use Lead Away cloth that I have cut to the diameter of the patches (Pro shot Flannel Patches) that I like to use.

When I first got this, I almost sent it back thinking they sent the wrong item.  It was so small upon further investigation it was indeed a small (timy) 22 cal tornado brush.  I tried it out in my Ruger SR22 after using about 400 reloads and this little guy worked like a charm and held up for future use.I highly recommend the 22 cal tornado brush!Vidimo Se!
I really like this product, it keeps the rifle from sliding while walking and has a great grip to it. It feels great.
I read the reviews and got three of these for my rifles and shotgun. They all fit without any trouble. The hinges are quiet. I would solidly recommend them for your use.

I hunt in the california mountains for mule deer and the terrain is extremley steep and rough. Some hunts find me walking in 5 - 10 miles and you can not go wrong with this sling. It doesn't slip off your shoulder and is very comfortable to wear all day, even while glassing. I've taken many deer free standing and thhis sling allows you to steady your rifle perfectly for that 200 yard shot.I HIGLY RECCOMEND THIS SLING!!!

This product is exactly what I've been looking for. It works FANTASTIC for what I needed and wanted. Very fast shipper and excellent transaction. I would recommend this product to anyone for purchase. You can't go wrong with the amazing quality and craftsmanship. I will be buying this product and or from this seller again. I will continue to give this product and also the shipper and solid five stars every time.

This does not retain moisture, and It really does stay put on your shoulder. I put it on my 12Ga Mossberg 500.Of course this could fall off your shoulder if you leaned to the side more than 45 degrees.I am going to sew elastic to the bottom portion of the strapping to hold shotgun shells.

Very grippy sling that performed well in an extremely cold week long Idaho hunting trip with  zero complaints. Rifle had to be readjusted barely if at all after several 5+ mile hikes, and the included swivels seem well made and quiet.
summary: Best sling ive used so far!

reviewText: This sling will NOT slide off your shoulder until you're ready to take it off. I'm happy with this purchase. Too early to tell how well it will hold up in the field but it appears to be well made and should last for years.

This sling is intended for my backwoods shooter on our annual big game hunts in Manitoba which involves long days of humping th ewoods with a 9-pound rifle over the shoulder. This sling is amazing with the integrated rubber and woven nylon strap. One consideration for Blackpowder: while the detachable mounts and great, I would have preferred the option of attaching the slicng to my existing rings.

This strap in and of itself seems pretty good, please keep in mind thought you might need extra accessories. For example on a Remington 870' you need a mourning point in the front, such as a pin for the front magazine cap or a whole new cap in general that allows for the attachment of the front swivel.

The sling is comfortable and hold on your shoulder very nice.  I am actually using this sling on a crossbow and it works very well.  The little bit of spring to the sling does keep the crossbow from digging into your shoulder...
This sling is very well made and very comfortable. Have several of them on my rifles and haven't had an issue with them.
I used  it on my 12 ga hold snug to my shoulder with no slips and is comfortable.Worth the price.I will buy 2 more

This sling really sticks to your shoulder/jacket/coat/t-shirt/whatever. It's nice to walk through the woods to your favorite hunting spot and not have to keep adjusting the sling or god forbid...drop the gun. The strap is long enough and is easily adjustable. It's seems very well constructed. Very sturdy.

This is a excellent hunting sling. I have used this on many hunts and on several different rifles ranging from .22lr-.30-06. It worked well on all of them. The only problem I have with the sling is that it will not work with certain bi-pods. I have a shooters ridge bi-pod on my Ruger American rifle and the sling attachment will not allow the legs of the bi-pod fully deploy. If you want a great sling to use for hunting and you are not going to use a bi-pod then this is the way to go, but if your rifle has a bi-pod then you might want to get a more traditional sling.
summary: A great sling. Doesn't work with bi-pods

reviewText: Great gun sling. I had bought a claw for another gun that I have and love it. So I knew if I ever needed a sling for a gun again I would get a claw. It sticks to you shoulder and does slide all around like a normal sling. If you need a good sling this is the one for you. God bless!!
Overall its a awesome,great value and I will buy more again. I would definitely recommend this product. All the way five stars.
Good purchase.  The sling is durable and strong and the price is affordable. Works as advertised.  I would buy it again.
Does NOT fit my AR -  very made of very very cheap material.  Buy a 30-50 dollar sling if you want one that works well.

I've used many different slings over the years. Some of them prettier than this one, but none as practical. I love how well it grips your shoulder, no more slipping around as you're hiking. The plastic swivels are fantastic. I was at first skeptical of the durability of plastic swivels, but soon realized that they are well made and will not damage your stock or squeak like the metal ones sometimes can. This is the only one I'll buy in the future. I have  black one.

I bought this for a Remington 700 XCR Tactical with the Bell & Carlson green/black stock.  The green cammo sling color is identical to the stock color.  My stock comes with two mounting studs on the foregrip so I also have a Harris Bipod (3-9") mounted.  With the bipod mounted it doesn't give the sling much freedom of movement so I end up removing the bipod until I need it.  Like everyone else said, this sling doesn't slip.  Highly recommended!

I've purchased 4 of these slings from various places.  The only difference is the price.  So far, amazon's price was the lowest.  They also offered all the color combos, which I haven't seen at the stores.  It's a good, solid sling that doesn't slip.  Not the most comfortable, but for the money, you'll be hard pressed to find a better one.

A friend got one and showed me turkey hunting. I ordered mine and my only regret is I waited so long. Carries my shotgun perfectly, without slipping, regardless of terrain and I don't worry about it in the rain. Now I plan on ordering it for my treestand.
My only real gripe with this sling is you can't adjust the rubber padding in the front. But it's nice for a rifle as it stays in place on shoulder. Rubber padding feels nice too.

This sling is awesome, put it on my CQC Pump Shotgun and it holds it right to your shoulder, no issues with it trying to slip off like other slings that don't grab.  Well worth the money, highly recommend to anyone looking for a quality sling.
They are paper targets that are good for 50 yards with smaller caliber rifles. Exactly what they are supposed to do.
I really enjoy these targets. They arrived within a few days and the quality was perfect and undamaged. These are perfect for 22LR plinking and rifles siting.

It's a good value for the price.  Just be aware at how small this is, I use them for 25 and 50 yards only on the range.  Also they are not bleached white, they are unbleached brown paper if that matters to you.  I would recommend to a friend.
Great for the price I have used these paper targets be for and at 50 yards and 100 yards there great
When you need to sight in a rifle or handgun these are a must have they take the guess work out of adjustment of sights

These paper targets are the same ones used for police training and concealed carry qualification. The paper is a bit fragile so having a helper hold it in place while stapling it to the backing is helpful. I use 8 staples and that works in every windy situation I have encountered. When I am feeling thrifty I cut some black electricians tape into small squares to patch over the holes and get about three uses out of each target. That may be a false economy, since each target costs less than what two rounds of 9 mm or .40 cal ammo that I am shooting at it. There is a grid for recording the date and score. The targets come rolled up and are a little bulky to deal with when pulling one out. It helps to have a nice clean floor to roll them out then reroll what is left and return to the box they came in. So far I have been quite pleased with them.
summary: Standard police target at a good price

reviewText: As described. I have to add a color dot when I use black sights as it disappears on my old eyes but this is obviously not the target's fault. One good thing is that it perfectly fits the 2' hangers most indoor places use AND it does not curl up. I can see this being okay (without backing) for out door high wind use.

These targets are def life sized... and the price was perfect!!!... My friend purchased a similar target but failed to look at the size and it was way too small... and now he wants to trade with me ...

reviewerName: Chad M "If you're not having fun, you're doin...
reviewText: These are a good deal and make going to the range less expensive.  We like the splatter ones better, but when your on a budget these are the way to go.  We take a couple of each for variety and always start with one of these, good targets and good quality paper.  They hold up to all the guns quite well.

These Champion Silhouette Targets are exactly what we wanted for use at the ranges where we shoot. Bringing these to the indoor range is a lot less expensive than buying them on-site and they are printed on fairly heavy paper so they hold up well at our outdoor range, even when there is a strong breeze.I like that these are large since it makes getting "on paper" much easier when sighting in and will occasionally attach8" Round Birchwood Casey Shoot - N - C Self - Adhesive Targetswhen using smaller calibers or at long distances.These are also very good value for the overall quality and quantity.Recommended!CFH
Serves the purpose, which is practice for conceal carry qualifying, but awful expensive.  Wanted to be able to practice on what we would be tested on but in the end, they're just paper.

This is a large paper pistol target.  What's to say?  It is easily seen and relatively inexpensive.  Also easy to attach the orange self sticking Birchwood Casey target spots for more intensive practice.

Amazon is a great company to buy these targets from you can't beat the price, at the range you will pay between $1.75 and $2.00 each got them here for $0.40 each for a pack of 100 shooting at the range is fun but always save where you can.
summary: Champion LE B27 Black Police Silhouette Target

reviewText: The Target is what I was looking for. They are standard target and therefore there is very little to add.
summary: Love to have enough Target in my hand

reviewText: Green targets are better for immediately seeing shot placement, but for the price these are great. I guess you don't immediately see shot placement on a BG though..
Nice big targets and the same thing we used in the police department however they are really thin and easy to rip.
Want a great inexpensive practice target... this is it. Just what you need to hone your shooting skills. Great price and prompt delivery.
Considering how fast you can go through targets why spend a bunch of money on expensive targets when you can get 100 full size targets for a great price.  You won't be disappointed.
man this target is really life size  cheap price that will save me a lot of money when I go shooting.

They are what they are and are fine as targets.  But they come rolled up and are difficult to remove one or a few at a time.  Several have torn upon removal due to this packaging style.  Not enough tear to make them unusable but enough to be annoying.
Overall good quality. I do wish the paper was just a little thicker but its still a good product. Comes rolled nice and neat.

I bought these for practice qualification. They are slightly smaller than what we use but over all seem like a good practice target. They are made of a construction paper like material. They should hold up fine. The reason why I gave it three stars was because they seem a little flimsy.
These are fun targets to shoot at and the box they come rolled in is a good place to keep them stored.
They're paper!  They're silhouettes!  Bullets make holes in them EVERY TIME THEY HIT!  Incredible!(and they're less than half the price I was paying at the range...)
Have used these many times.  Decided to buy a large stock instead of paying a $1 per target at the gun range.  Love these targets!  You can't go wrong with the price on amazon and the free shipping

They are exactly as they propose to be.  Paper targets.  They aren't very good at showing the hits at a distance but unless you are willing to pay for shoot-n-see targets what is.  Also it comes with all the targets in a long narrow box as all the targets are rolled together.
summary: It is a target.  you shoot it and then throw them away.

reviewText: These are awesome targets for the range or outdoors. Buy these targets if you are tired of purchasing range targets marked up by 50% or so. Pack of 100? I purchased two packs of 100 and just to let you know, 100 of these targets roled up is like taking a phone book the size of a human torso and rolling them up. Each 100 target order is rolled up into their own box and the stack is huge. I love them, you should buy them.

I needed these because the range charges so much for targets.  I can only say one negative thing about this.  It may be beneficial if they came attached to each other somehow, now i have a huge mess in my office trying to split them up into groups for range visits.  I'd like to suggest somehow attaching them in groups of 10 when they are shipped out.  Other than that they are perfect and a money saver.
summary: Just What I needed only one complaint.

reviewText: Quality of printing is good. Four stars because the paper could be just a bit heavier. printed on a recycled type paper that's not bright white

These are not what I would call standard targets. Most indoor ranges would not allow me to use these without cutting them in half. Too long and low shots tend to ricochet off the floor. Will get smaller targets next time. Be sure to check dimensions before purchasing.

This allows you to hold the case in a drill, after de-capping, and spin the case against some steel wool instead of spending more money and buying a tumbler and media to clean the outside of the case. No chance of getting cleaning media trapped in the case when reloading and raising the pressure through the roof. It also allows you trim the case to the correct length, while that isn't needed so much in revolver cartridges like the 357 mag, it is needed in the automatics like the 9 mil and rifle cartridges.
The Lee Precision 9 mm gauge/shell holder worked perfectly each and every time it was used.  Just as promised all brass was trimmed to the exact length required.

Every shell case is identical to the one before!  I wish I'd have thought of this idea!  I now have a dozen of these for all of the calibers I use.  After trimming, I use 00 steel wool, and I polish the brass with the Zip Trim.  Well done, Lee!
It works great as should and could not be happy with it. If any one want 1 you should get it.
Just what you need to keep your cases trimmed to the right length for reloading. works especially well with the lee zip trim and a ball holder. easy to use and same results time after time.

I purchased a barrel "in the white" that needed to be blued to match the gun it was installed on.  I didn't have to deal with stripping an old finish that cut down on a few steps.  I simply degreased the barrel, and applied the bluing with a q-tip.  When I was done, I rinsed it off with water, then cleaned it with gun solvent.  I applied 2 coats in this manner.  It delivered a nice consistent bluing.  After the two coats I saturated it with gun oil and let it sit for a couple of days in case I missed any spots and rusting started back up.  With no issues I installed the barrel.  It still looks good, and was a simple process to apply.  I recommend this product.
summary: Simple to use, and delivers good quality

reviewText: I did have some doubts about this because it is made for blued guns and I was planning on using it on parkerized guns but it turns out that it you just leave it on a for a few seconds before rinsing it does a great job. It has paid for itself several times and I use such a small amount it will last a long time.

Like the title says, if you prep the gun metal properly with a good acetone clean of the area, this product will work wonders.Creates a visible chemical reaction, and you can do multiple coats to achieve a deeper colored blueing to match the rest of the metal, if need be.
summary: Worked well - must prep really well 1st as with all blueing

reviewText: Tried it for a full finish on a pellet gun barrel and receiver.  Learned that cold bluing rubs off pretty easily with use.  Have not tried other products.  Probably good for touch ups.  Need to neutralize it really good or rust will pop up over night.

This is a product I'm use to. I've used up 1 bottle and now I started on my second.  The cold bluing product is one of the better one's on the market. I would say 1 of the top 3 out there. Make sure you follow the instructions as written. Good preparation also makes this product work well. For the beginner cold bluing person, this is an excellent product to work with.

WITH THE HELP OF SOME ON LINERS THEY HELP ME PICK THIS BRAND OF TOUCH UP GUN PASTE AND THE COLOR WAS WRIGHT ON THE MONEY, IT CAME OUT JUST LIKE THEY SAID, NOT A BLACK SHINEY  FINISH  BUT A REAL NICE FLAT BLACK MATTE FINISH, IT COVERD THE MARKS ON THE BARREL SO WELL THAT I DIDN'T EVEN HAVE TO DO THE WHOLE RIFLE. GREAT PRODUCT, THE ONLY THING THAT HURTS WAS THE SHIPPING, BUT IT WAS WORTH IT SO I DON'T MIND PAYING EXTRA FOR SOME THING THAT WORKS GOOD !. SIGNED :  DETZY
All i can say is that this product is excelent ,i had used to give a better look to my guns and it really works. i would recomend to anyone.

This is a great cold gun blue. I received it within the time allotted, but when it arrived, I had no idea what it was. I have ordered several items, getting ready for hunting season, and several items are made by Safariland. When this bottle arrived, the supplier glued their own label across the bottle which covered the product information and the instructions. When I tried to remove their label to see if it was bluing or cleaner,  the original label tore off with added shipping label. I do not like chemicals on my gun shelf that are not properly labeled, for safety sake. I have compared the bottle with on line pictures and this is bluing, so I will relabel the bottle, but this should not of happened. I will order else where next time.
summary: Good product: order some where else

reviewText: I have an old 20 guage thats worth more in memories than actual value.  I've had it since I was 13 and I am 43 now.  Last December I hunted when it was snowing outside and got the gun wet so after the rabbit hunt I wiped it down and put it back in the case where I did not touch it again until this August.  Imagine my surprise when I looked at this totally rusted gun! I searched Amazon and found Black Magic, read the reviews and decided I would give a try.  The rust came off easily with steel wool and after I put the bluing on it looks as good as new.  I put two coats on according to the directions and couldn't be happier with the results.  If you screwed up like I did and left your gun in a case instead of taking it out you might want to try this product.  Just my two cents.

Works great on my Mosin Nagant barrel and receiver. I would recommend this anytime over any other bluing. I tried Birchwood Casey bluing and it sucked royally. Too many streaks and discoloration. Kleen Bore is the bluing to go with on any rifle or pistol that you want to re-blue.

Thought this would cure my problem of holster wear on my Colt Lawman MKIII barrel. I was so wrong. Followed the instructions to a "T". It did not come out shiny and blue. It did come out streaky and flat black. Not very happy with these results. Will not try this product on any of my other guns.

Followed the instructions to the letter.  Metal surface was clean, smooth & free of any solvents. Wiped it down several times with ethyl alcohol.  Applied Black Magic with a Qtip as recommended and got very uneven results over the area (about 2in long & .5in wide). Repeated it 2 more times with the same result - uneven bluing.  Yes, It does blueing but I can't recommend it if you want a quality appearance.
summary: It Won't Give You a Black Eye, but.....

reviewText: Works niceley. Re-blues scuffs and is simple to use. Would recommend for small scratches and scuffs to cover exposed metal.
A clean gun is a happy gun.  This is all you need to keep your 12ga clean and oiled. Comes with a case.
This is a great cleaning kit with all the parts you need. The carry case latches are flimsy and needs a rubber band to hold cover closed.  Would have given 5 stars if the case was better.
For the money, no complaints, I'd like to see a more sturdy case, but you do get what you pay for.  It has all that is needed for a long gun, or a pistol.

The materials used in this product feel cheap: 1) rod 2) bore brush is made of some polymer 3) case it comes inLiquids are great I would just buy the liquids from now on. And buy the accouterments separately.

It comes in a cardboard box and when you open that there is a plastic black-rectangular box which hold the Hoppes aluminum cleaning rods(3), patches, and patch attachment for rod, brush for 12 gauge, Hoppes 9, Hoppes lubricating oil. This case isnt great at all/weakly built and my two tabs that hold it together, wont stay and the thing that separates the items inside is a thin plastic mold that is as thick as paper. The patches and accessories are in separate cardboard box's. I recommend it if you need a easy one step shop to clean your gun and comes with all the materials you need to make a reliable/clean shotgun! I recommend getting a tackle box and if you get a different caliber, all you need to get is the brush and maybe patch attachment accessory which will usually be pretty cheap. Also a good tooth brush, nothing too rough(No wire brush or anything that could scratch/cause damage to get into hard spaces and gloves come in handy(no pun attended)lol so you dont leave moister and fingerprints that could possibly cause rust or make all your hard work worthless.
This is a great basic cleaning kit. The included sollutions are very good quality. You can keep your shotgun very clean for years with this.
This kit has everything that you need to clean your handgun thoroughly. I highly recommend it and the price is very much a value.

Contains the basics to clean your gun(s).  The tools are certainly adequate and perform as intended.  If you go to the range a 2 - 4 times a month and do a thorough job cleaning and lubing, you will run through the supplied pads and cleaner fairly quick (but don't over use the cleaner / lubricant).  The brush is a bit awkward for my little S&W Bodyguard .380, but it is functional and Q-tips work well of course.  For my 38 revolver and 40 S&W it is just fine.
Purchased this kit to clean my new XDM 9mm pistol. All the items i need are included brush, cleaning rod, patches cleaner lube, bore brush  and silicone wiping rag!

This item arrived looking exactly as it does in the photo. It has all of the things you need to take good care of your weapon. The only thing I'll be adding to it is a soft cloth. I haven't used it extensively yet; once I do, if my opinion changes, I'll update my review. So far so good though.

You will blow through the cleaning pads rather quickly, so be prepared to order more soon.  I'm guessing the solution will be the next item that needs to be replaced.  I'd recommend ordering the larger quart size and refilling this smaller bottle that this kit comes with.
summary: Comes with everything you need to begin cleaning your handgun.

reviewText: First of all, this item was received in a very timely manner. It also has everything you need to clean your gun except for Q-tips and a clean rag. I'm no expert but I share some of the concerns that other reviewers have mentioned with the solvent and lubricant being mixed in the same bottle.
I've used this kit since I got my first pistol and it has kept my gun nice and clean. Very functional and great value for the price point.
summary: great starter kit for pistol cleaning

reviewText: Great brand and the case will last. Easy to use and a great price for this product. Comes with enough to clean a gun many times. The liquid cleaner is a great brand as well. This wont let you down. I would recommend.
Good starter kit.. Has solid rods and a good handle. excellent value for the price. come with what you need minus a little oil.

CLP cleaner/lube is included with this kit and it does the job well. This is a simple kit and it has everything you need to keep your pistol looking and operating great. The case is also good and keeps the kit components safe and organized. I like it so much I bought my brother one too.
summary: All I need to clean my gun.

reviewText: Great product for the price. Just wish the plastic say down farther so parts would fall out when you opened it.

Good cleaning kit for starters. The tools are decent but the case is not built to last. The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 stars is I'm not used to the "all-in-one" cleaner and lube. I prefer Hoppes #9 for that. However, for this price, it's a decent starter kit. No issues with usage. I'd recommend getting more cotton cleaning patches (these won't last very long).
I got this kit for my 9mm and .357, since they both are so close it will clean both. The kit comes in a handy and sturdy plastic case that makes it easy to store it in. All around good kit!

Not a bad little cleaning kit for your handgun, however it leaves some to be desired.PROS:-Cleaning brushes are nice and convenient-Everything comes in one nice packageSemi- CONS (not big issues, but notes)-Cleaning/lubricating liquid is more of a lubricant than a cleaner.  I wouldn't recommend using this as an all in one as it will become over oiled which can cause damage to your firearm.-the cleaning pads are worthless, throw them away and get some that don't frey and leave cotton all over your weapon.

I bought this from local gun store for $19.98, wish I would have got it on Amazon. With that said it's got all you need. Recommend. However If I would do it all over,  I would go ala carte, meaning buy stuff separate.
