Since I bought the kit, I bought a can of Birchwood Gun Scrub (aerosol in can with straw), Mil-Comm Synthetic Lube grease to supplement my kit.The kit comes with (at least mine did) a small bottle of CLP gun cleaner, lubricant preservative in one small squeeze bottle. I tend to not lean towards one-in-all cleaner lubricant, but it's good stuff I am sure, 4.5 stars on amazon. I used it, seems to clean and lube just fine. Keep in mind most of ALL gun cleaning stuff like Hoppe's No. 9 and lubricants are petroleum distillate products of some kind. I tend to like one product to just clean and another separate product to just lube... seems the combo deals have to compromise somewhat? Maybe not. My preference really.With that said, the Kleenbore comes in a nice box, which is a good thing. It has a standard handle/rod tool, standard bristle BORE brush (brass) and cotton cleaning patches,  to shove through your barrel to apply cleaning solvent, clean and dry barrel bore.  Plus it has a two ended nylon brush, one small and one large. A tooth brush would work, but this is trick nylon brush.Most of cleaning is just wiping it down. DO NOT SLATHER your firearm with solvent. Second DO NOT OVER LUBE...Third people spend way too much time and money on cleaning their gun. If I had it to do over I'd buy a bore tool (the rod) and brush seperate, without solvent/lube or cleaning patches. I would buy everything else separate, a bag of cleaning patches, dedicated cleaner (like Hoppe's #9 or other like Birchwood) and dedicated lube (too many to mention but Mil-Comm synthetic or Hoppe's Precision Lube). I went with synthetic grease... The CLP it comes with is fine I am sure... It would cost more but you would get more...last a long long time.My last comment is most gun stores rip you off to some degree without some preferred customer discount. Walmart or on-line is best bet. Bottom line I recommend this kit, even though I personally might have bought my cleaning gear differently next time... If you are like me and end up buying different individual items, "ala carte", it would be better to skip the kit, just by the rod tool separate, along with buying separate cleaner, lube, cleaning brush (toothbrush) and cotton patches.
summary: Hey it's a 9MM Gun Cleaning Kit, What's To Say?

reviewText: I received the kit without any problems.This is a basic gun cleaning kit and it fits my use hands down

This is your basic handgun cleaning kit. The patches are a little too small and go quickly, so I bought a bag of cleaning patches after the first use. It comes with a cleaning/oil combination liquid, but I also purchased some Hoppes cleaning solution and used the liquid the kit came with just for oiling.It's a good cheap kit to get you started. I've used it to clean a 38special, 9mm, and a .380.

I bought this kit as a starter for my son. He has been using my cleaning supplies and surprised me by asking for his own. The best feature of this kit is the box to keep it in. The cheap plastic holder for patches was immediately thrown out and replaced with a brass jag. The number of patches included is basically enough to clean the firearm once or twice. The short rod is appropriate for clean hand guns.This is the type of kit that does the job and lets the user learn what works for him and what does not. He is also receiving a shotgun cleaning kit from the same manufacturer and the same comments apply there. To make the who thing usable I got him a 50 caliber ammo box that I have filled with much more useful goodies and supplies.If you are new to shooting, this kit will get you started in the basics of keeping your firearm clean. If you clean you gun every time you shoot it, it will probably last to pass down to your children and grandchildren. That is assuming the current government doesn't take them away from us.

There's not a whole lot of anything special going on here. You could spend a bunch of money and get a heavy duty set, but I only need this for occasional use and it does the job perfectly. Would recommend to any beginner-intermediate gun enthusiasts.

I like the tidiness of this kit and the completeness of the included items. Right out of the box I cleaned my Bersa 380 without problems and everything was as advertised. I now keep a larger bottle of the cleaning solution and refill the little one so I can clean when I'm out of town. Perfect.
This case is perfect for the casual shooter.  Only thing is that it doesn't come with a silicon towel.  But other than that works perfectly for me.  If you can get this, I recommend it.
summary: Kleenbore Gun Care Classic Handgun Kit

reviewText: Small kit w/case.  One of the only ones this size to include a "tooth" brush to clean forcing cone. Perfect for my wheel gun.

Excellent, you can't find any better gun Care Kits from Kleenbore. They're still making a great gun Care Kit, not like the many today, that are now where near the quality of this product. I'd highly recommend this  Kit.I'm ordering more, one for the .38, 357 and 9mm as well as, the .44-45 gun Care Kit form Kleenbore.

mine leaked during shipment, and caused a lot of oil spill in my box, the books that i ordered had oil stains in them now.other than that, the product is great :)  would order it again, although how do i tell Amazon to check if there's a spill, when that usually happens during transit.the plastic container holds nicely. so no real complaints other than the "gun conditioner" container.i also ordered the one for 9mm cleaning, but that one arrived perfectly.
summary: be cautious w the gun conditioner

reviewText: Good quality complete kit. Great Value. I would recommend this product. I'm glade it came with a high quality cleaner lube.
Product is compact and fits in my range bag nicely.  It has all the components to clean your weapons properly.

Kit for final cleaning prior to storage of devices.  It has what is necessary to meet the needs and not much more than that.  Arrived as required and I'm happy enough with the quality of this product.

Basic pistol cleaning kit for my semi-auto 9mm.  You'd better buy some extra cleaning patches because there's so few in the package.  No bore jag is included, and I prefer those to the included patch loop.  The CLP cleaning solution is just OK - you'll need some Hoppe's #9 for the breech ramp and the bolt face on your semi-auto.  The products are made of quality materials.

I think this is a great kit for the price. I originally ordered a cleaning kit of the berreta website. 10 days later they send me an email saying that the order has been cancelled because it was not in stock. That brought me to Amazon to order this kit and I am glad I did. It was cheaper than the other one I wanted to buy and I don't miss anything from the other one. I have not used to cleaner that comes with it because I prefer Hoppes 9 cleaner and Hoppes oil but a lot of people use the cleaner with good success. Just a personal preference for me. Everything else in the kit works great. I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 because the rod that it comes with does feel a little cheap. I do not think it will break but I wouldn't have minded it to be a little more sturdy. Still a great product for the money. My recomendation would be to buy it.
A very good pistol cleaning kit with a quality metal rod and cleaning jag. Everything you need is included, including a bore guide.
Cleaning rod handle allows shaft to rotate is a plus...and metal fittings thread into a metal shaft.  Come with a small dosage if CLP.
summary: Good value, metal fittings are confidence builders

reviewText: It is simple and a great price and does exactly what it says it does. I did buy another solution to clean the gun though. I like the solution that came with the kit for oiling better, but it does function as both a cleaner and oil.
This is my first gun care kit. I bought it for my G17 and it's perfect. I really love the carry case and this seems like everything I will need to maintain my weapon for the long term.

This is a great handgun cleaning kit and I use it on all of my 9mm semi-autos.  Comes with everything you would need and it all fits nicely in the case.  I only give it four stars because I wish it came with a jag patch holder versus the traditional patch holder.  That is more of a personal preference though.
Great cleaning kit, but i found it cheaper many places after I bought it. Thats the only reason for the 4 star rating.
I use FP10 to clean my GSG 1911 and Beretta M9. Works great! I mostly use it for the inside of the barrel (I use Ballistol on rest of the gun), and it works really good.
Very good oil, lasts a long time.  Not the cheapest, but it lasts for a few years, protects things, slippery.  Even seems to clean copper a little.
This was recommended to me by multiple other shooters and it gets the job done.  The tip is good about not putting out too much lube at once and it does what it was made to do.

This is the lubricant recommended by several high-end guns I own (Kimber and Dan Wesson), so I switched to it and have been very pleased with the results. It seems to be a slightly thicker oil than some other brands, and I think that improves performance.  Get a needle applicator for it.

Shooter's Choice Universal Gun Care Liquid Bore Cleaner, FP-10, Rust Prevent Clam Pack CLP01This oil goes into the pours of the metal and stays...Excellent for cross bow slides...A fine coat left in barrels for long storage or short...Very small amounts needed.
good enought for me....tolerances to minus 49 degress fahrenheit is excellent.....no horrible odor and cleans as well as lubricates.........will be loading on more.

Otis offers the breech to muzzle cleaning feature that's preferred along with the elimination of pushrods that can do damage to the gun itself.  It is comparable to the Boresnake with the difference that it uses disposable patches.  This allows a more thorough cleaning.

As a Soldier, I have come to appreciate this little item over the USGI issue rifle cleaning system.  This is smaller and can take a beating, unlike the USGI steel cleaning rods.  I have to admit that I have customized the factory item a wee bit to suit my needs but that does not detract from the value packed purchase available here.  If you are a hunter, you will appreciate it's light weight and modular nature as well.

i've compared this with my hoppes cleaning system and i like this much better for cleaning my (baby) pistol.  the brushes and the patches holder is much better designed.  the flexible cable to pull the brush through is better than using a rod to push the brush through.  personal preference.  the little carrying pouch makes it convenient to bring along.

Pros:Small overall package that cleans lots of popular gunsWell made components and clear instructionsPull only design is quick and easyPull only design follows the philosophy that the barrel should only be cleaned in the direction of bullet travelCons:Brass brushes are stiff and may be more aggressive than something like aHoppe's Tornado Brush for .45 Caliber PistolsPull only design will not allow aggressive scrubbing that a rod based system mightThe all in one cleaner/lube included is not my favorite - I preferHoppe's M-Pro 7 Gun Cleaner - 8 Ounce Spray BottleOverall:This is a great product that I would recommend to anyone.  Most of my cons are preferences and minor differences.  I really like that it stows to a very small package that will take up minimal closet/tub/pack space.  This is really nice if you often are cleaning in the field.  Give it a try, you will not be disappointed.
This gun cleaning kit is excellent and very compact for easy storage and use. I would definitely recommend this gun cleaning kit!

reviewerName: Altitude Junkie "Getting to the top is option...
reviewText: Perfect kit for any and all guns you may need to clean. Only complaint is that the kit is very small and is sometimes hard to get everything back in and closed properly.
summary: Kit bag is a bit tight, but contents are perfect

reviewText: it is a great kit for those who are looking for something simple to help with gun cleaning.  It has all the necessary tool you need to clean a rifle/shotgun/handgun.

I bought this kit for putting into a pack for with the intention of being able to clean multiple calibers. I used it today for the first time and clean an AR-15 (5.56), a 12-Gauge, a Marlin .22, and a .22 Sig Mosquito. This kit cleaned them all with ease. I got anywhere from 3-6 cleanings out of each patch without a problem depending on the severity of the "grime." I am now comtemplating buying the Elite Cleaning Kit as my primary cleaning kit instead of all of the miscellaneous. Greatly impressed.
summary: Bought for packable kit and love it.

reviewText: Everything is in the case you need except the 20 gauge. Which we bought one for the kit. Now we have everything to clean our guns with. We can take it with us to clean them where ever we Cowboy shoot.
Great to take out to the range for a quick cleanup or on a hunting trip and not take up a lot of space and is light to carry!

Well I bought and have used this kit to clean my Mini-14. The downside is that the packaging description and the Amazon description were both a little misleading. The reason I say this is because it "says" it can clean a rifle from .17 to 50 BMG. By contacting the company, I found out this was "partially" true. You can "patch clean" a rifle within those calibers... but you cannot brush clean a rifle in those calibers. For instance, the .223/5.56mm cleaning brush did not come with it. The company did correct this for me once I contacted them, which is the reason why I still highly suggest this kit! It cleans very well!!! It only comes with a very small tube of cleaning lube solution... and a handful of small and large cleaning patches. Everything in the kit is made of high quality parts though! I'd suggest this kit for your gun cleaning needs... just be sure you know if it can brush clean your gun or just patch clean it before buying.

I have seen these kits advertised for some time and I didn't know how good they might be or if it was all advertising hype.  I'm very happy with this product, I can just throw it in my range bag and go, everything I need to clean my firearm is in there, from brushes to patches.  I've used the bore snake in the past, and still use it, but this handy little kit really works well,  Only problem I've encountered is that the pieces are sometimes a bear to get back in the kit, but what else is new?  Everytime I take anything out of a package, I have problems getting it back together.  I've finally come to the realization, it's operator error!  I highly recommend the Otis cleaning system.
VERY nice basic kit that is small form factor but well equipped for the size.I really like this product and is fine for average user,non pro shooter.

The write-up on this product is somewhat conflicting and misleading.  First, it says "It has the essential tools to clean rifles 0.17 to 0.50 caliber, handguns 0.17 to 0.50 caliber, 410 to 12/10 gauge shotguns, and all in-line muzzleloaders."  further down you find "Contains the brushes needed to clean .22, .270, .30, .38, .45 cal. rifles/pistols and 12/10 ga. shotguns."  The later is the more important statement.  I have a .223 which according to Otis requires the .25 brush.  That caliber is well within the .17 to .50 initially described but that brush is not on the brush list.  Maybe they got me on a technicality and "tools" refers to the handles and cables, not the brushes.  This was my first cleaning kit so I didn't know better until it arrived and I looked at the included chart describing which brushes work with which calibers.  This is an awesome little kit but be sure to go to the Otis site first and see what brushes they recommend for you caliber(s) and compare them against the included brushes before assuming this kit will cover your needs out of the box.  I ordered the brush I need separately from Otis and just swapped out one of the other calibers I don't use with it and I'm happy but this would have been nice to know before I made the initial purchase.
summary: great kit but not as universal as it is described

reviewText: This unit resides in my back pack for use when on the road. Does everything and stays in small easy to transport pkg
summary: Otis what more needs to be said

reviewText: it has everything you need to clean your hand guns or rifle and in a compact package. the only thing better is to have a full size cleaning system if you own a lot of guns that need cleaning all at once.

I've owned Otis kits like this before, even military issued ones, but this kit is new and improved, at least from the ones I bought about 4 years ago. The old kits just set the tools in foam, which sucked because the foam would wear, or the item never fit correctly to begin with so every time you'd open it, a bunch of tools fell out, not so with this version. The tools are all secured in by rubber molding, which is great because I think the rubber grips better than plastic or foam, and the rubber won't break if stepped on by accident.As far as cleaning goes, it's good for the basics, but if you're looking for an all encompassing kit, I'd get the mega one Otis offers for $100, because you'll be needing to buy little different components to get into the nitty gritty of cleaning your rifle, like additional picks and receiver brushes. I would highly recommend this product, much improved, and that Otis rebate made up my mind.

I purchased this to replace an old aluminum rod kit that was pretty lame and left me uneasy about scraping the polygonal bore of my HK's and didn't really have any additional accessories beyond the absolute basics.  When I read the description and reviews here and on the Otis website it seemed like the product couldn't live up to the hype - I was wrong.  This is a fantastic kit that fills every current need, and, from what I can tell, will fulfill all my needs as I purchase additional toys in the future.  This compact, yet well-stocked, kit offers a wide array of quality tools for the job and I honestly cannot think of any additional accessory that I would need for cleaning.  I am amazed at how much stuff they could fit in a pouch that will fit on a belt or pack easily into any gun bag.  I particularly like the cleaning patches that are large enough and reversible so they can be used for multiple passes down the bore (FYI - I bought an extra tub of patches based on another reviewer's comment about the number contained in the initial pack being somewhat limited and recommend you do the same - just a thought).  I also combined a 3-pack of the Otis brushes into my purchase for the slide, rails, etc. so I am as ready to rock as I'll ever be.  Highly recommended!
summary: A lot of product for the money

reviewText: No Question about it. The OTIS TAC Cleaning system is just the best.Size, usability, simplicity, the system has no competitors.Simple to use even by novice and starters.NOTE: It bring most of the brushes for almost any available caliber. ALMOST.

After hearing so many good things about Otis kits I dropped (the not unsubstantial) $40 on this kit.  While it's a good idea, I really don't think it lives up to the hype.  The bore cleaning procedure is effective, probably about as good as using a proper rod, brush and jag.  But that's about all you can do with this kit.  There is no way to clean any complex chamber- the short wire tool is next to useless in an AR chamber.  There is no toothbrush, only enough oil for one or two cleanings, and no room to put a good rag in the pouch.  After one use I've gone back to keeping a bore-snake, toothbrush, bottle of CLP and rag in my field kit and keeping a proper cleaning kit at home.The Otis kit is not worth the money, or the hype.
When i seen this product i knew i had to try it out.Im so very glad i did,cause it has everything to clean all my wepons all in 1 little pouch!
summary: EVERYTHING YOU NEED IS RIGHT HERE!!

reviewText: I really like that I can toss this small cleaning kit into my jacket pocket and know that I'm good to go. The best part about Otis products is that you can pick and choose the tools you need and tweak your kit to your liking. I just recently assembled an AR, so I purchased their AR chamber brush and added to the kit.

Love this kit. Works as designed perfectly. I keep it in my range pack. It is compact yet holds all you need to maintain  your firearm(s). Perfect for field and home use. All components are superior in quality and easy to use. I have shown others how easy this kit is to use. Bought and gave two of them as gifts. Highly recommend this product.

I expected a big package but it's small and compact.  Inside there is an array of great items that will accomplish any/all of the gun cleaning projects you might have.  I like the "Pull Through" cable...it saves that barrel end.  Small package...powerful results.

I'm giving this 4 stars based on the quality of parts included, but was not satisfied with the purchase. I purchased this kit because I own multiple guns in various calibers and the statement that this kit will clean all calibers from .17 to .50.  Even on the box the label reads that it cleans all calibers from .17 to 10 gauge. When I opened it I was very disappointed to find that it did not include brushes that would clean 3 out of the 5 firearms that I purchased it for. Does not include brushes for .223, .243, .40, and about a dozen others I was going to return the kit but decided to call Otis to see what they say. The CSR that I spoke to explained that the statement on the box and in the ads meant that the kit would "patch" clean all calibers, and they were in the process of redoing their ads. She also apologized for the misunderstanding and told me she would send me the 2 brushes I needed to clean my guns. Because of the outstanding customer service, I decided to keep the kit. (see picture for included brushes)Also, as others have stated the case is tiny and getting the parts back in is tight. It also doesn't include picks and brushes that you will need to adequately clean your guns so you will need to have another case to hold everything.

That may seem Like over kill but take my word for it. Just about the time I say it then I need it again. just the same If I have I do not need it if I dont then all heck breaks loose just the same.dray
summary: I have bought and keep one of these Cleaning setups in Every Rifle Case I own!!!

reviewText: Otis products have impressed me very much. I've usually used the cheap products found at the local retailer and was disappointed with their quality. The Otis brand is well worth the money if you value your firearms like me.
I have many calibers, and I only have this kit for cleaning all of them. it can clean from handguns to rifles. Very compact. Worth every dollars
summary: The best cleaning kit to me

reviewText: I like this concept, and it is great for taking with you, but I prefer using a coated one piece cleaning rod for most applications.
summary: Good system, but don't throw away your cleaning rods

reviewText: Bought the OTIS because I like the chamber to muzzle cleaning system. It's nice and small and self contained so I can carry it with me just in case I need a cleaning in the field.

Sorry... I bought this kit as a gift for someone else, so I don't actually have an opinion on it.  However, I have other Otis gun-cleaning products, and they work well.  I do like the cable type design over the standard rod-style setup for cleaning long guns, but haven't tried it on hand guns yet.

i take this kit to the shooting range with me all the time and it never fails. love the compact aspect of it because I can just throw it in my rifle bag. Make sure to read the instruction closely or you will get your cleaning cloth stuck in your bore if you used the wrong size swaps. If you get your stuff stuck dont panic, just get a rifle rod and push it out.

In my opinion this system works much better than a rod based system (I have several of them).  This system allows for assembled cleaning of anything from my .223 RRA to my 12 gauge A400.  I gave it a quick test run out on the range earlier this week and while it worked well, I feel like my bore snakes are better for a quick on field clean.  They do not get it as clean but it is easier and quicker.The place this really stands out in my opinion is on a disassembled clean.  This system got my barrel looking amazing!  I found that pulling the system through was much much easier than pushing a rod through.  The several attachments for cotton pads makes sure they get a full 360 in the barrel, and anyone who says different needs to read the instructions again (or watch the videos on here).  I would highly recommend this, and will not be switching back anytime soon.Pros:-Can field clean, although not as easily as a bore snake-Easier to get brushes and pads through the bore then a rod system-Cleans just as well if not better than any of my older rod systems-Comes in a great easy packaging with good labels and instructionsCons:-Does not have any picks or brushes besides the bore brushes-The pads are expensive, although they do work very easily and wellOverall I would buy this again in a heartbeat, I am very pleased with it.5 Stars.
summary: Much better than a rod based system

reviewText: I bought this kit right after getting my Savage 64FXP, only to find that I couldn't completely use it due to the included .22 brush not fitting inside the rifle, it was just too long. Looking around Amazon I took a chance and purchased the Otis #21 brush (also for .22 caliber, just shorter) and it fit just fine. I may or may not be sure on this one either but the instructions say to use an adapter (the obstruction removal) along with the T-Handle to put out the cable, this adapter seems to be missing for the .22 cable or is not offered at all, I have 2 obstruction removals in the kit but neither will fit with the smaller cable for the .22, one is larger/thicker than the other but otherwise they are the same, even the threads that you would use to screw into the cable you would use it on.I also have a Savage Axis in 30-06 that I tried the kit on and while it was a better experience it did cause a scare. The sample patches worked just fine with the 30-06 but when it came time to use the included brush (specifically for 30-06), it got stuck! I pulled and pulled using the adapter and T-Handle on the larger cable with the brush not budging, so then I tried to push it back the other way but the cable wasn't stiff enough. Thankfully you're able to unscrew the cable by twisting it counterclockwise but that just left the brush stuck in the barrel.Thankfully I took a rod from my old kit (Wasn't I glad I didn't throw it away after "upgrading") slowly slid it in and gave it a few whacks hoping I wouldn't damage the crown, the reason why I got the Otis kit in the first place. This got the brush out but it amazes me that for a company that touts ease of their brush use by clearly indicating what brush is for what caliber they sure don't do a great at it.I then tried their 27 brush thinking perhaps they stamped both brushes wrong (I know that was a long shot, but still) and of course it would just slide around in there since it was so much skinnier. Begrudgingly I thought I'd give the 30 brush another shot and while I was still met with a bit of resistance after a few more tugs the brush finally started moving along until it came out the other end.Beside these small complaints though the kit serves it's purpose and is light, small and best of all portable, I'd definitely recommend it.

I was SO happily surprised when I received this kit! It is compact and and does not take up a lot of room in your bag. I use on .357's, .22's and may use on shotgun but primarily on my S&W .357's & .22 revolvers and my Ruger 10/22. Highly recommend for those looking for a well-organized, compact kit for these weapons. Wishing all the very best to you and yours.

The item doesn't come with a vise or armorer's block either.  But for field cleaning of lots of different calibers, this is the kit to buy.  I can't believe some of the negative reviews I read about this item.  Some folks would complain if they were given a 100 dollar bill and it was crumpled up.

What a great idea. The patches can be used as many as six times each. It takes a little practice to get the hang of where to pinch the patch, but once you do it works great. Also: After you pinch the patch and pass it through the slot in the brass tip, DO NOT pull it to tight(just snug will do)or it will be VERY hard to remove and use again. The cable system is great for the mini 14 type rifles. this kit is great for trips to the range or on a hunting trip. Every thing you need is in this small package.I highly recommend.
summary: Otis Tactical Cleaning  System (Made in U.S.A.)

reviewText: Had this in the military, this is not a complete cleaning kit but if youknow what you are doing this would definitely do the job for on sitecleaning. Incorporated this in my civilian life and currently run it inmy go bag. Price is the only disadvantage in my opinion, but as theold adage goes you get what you pay for.
summary: Must have for a go bag, for field cleaning!

reviewText: This is by far, the most innovative and practical cleaning kit on the market today if you are looking for all the basic necessities for your weapons maintenance in one small, easy to carry pouch. The best thing about the Otis system is the pull cables, they are just about indestructible and just as flexible, which correlates to faster, better cleaning of the rifle bore.  Similar to a bore-snake, with the added benefit of traditional bore brushes that won't wear out as quickly as the brushes on bore-snakes will.  This particular kit is missing the small AP brush and the Otis lens cleaning spray & wipes, but what it lacks it makes up for in ease of use and the variety of bore brushes.  All in all, the kit is a perfect addition to a shooters' collection of gun cleaning supplies, and a great replacement for outdated cleaning methods. Highly recommended for the shooter that has multiple pistols, rifles and even a shotgun or two but doesn't want to spend double the amount of time cleaning those guns than they did shooting them.
summary: One kit for most of today's popular calibers!

reviewText: Returned product for three reasons:  (1) Kit does not contain a #25 bore brush, which means you can't scrub out any weapon that fires .223 or NATO 5.56 rounds.  Rifles that shoot these rounds may be the most popular rifle in America today.  So if you do order this product, buy the #25 bore brush for your AR-15 or "tactical" rifle that uses the above numbered ammo.(2)cotton swab holders are a very light metal and threads strip out easily.  {couldn't remove swab holder from cable after first use.(3) The soft pouch is too cramped.  Otis is a great company....but they would be better served using steel threaded parts and a fishing box layout...with numbers on the parts that you do not need a magnifying glass to read the part sizes.The Otis cleaner is terrific, however!  I did order the next less expensive kit, which comes with two tubes of cleaner. I ordered the #25 bore brush and M-16 chamber brush seperately.  These two items are "sine qua non," (can't do without)parts if you are going to call a cleaning kit a "tactical" cleaning kit.Joe RubiPrescott Valley, AZ
This is by far the best cleaning kit I own I can't believe they made all that stuff fit it works perfectly with my gear I'm vary happy with it thax

While I normally use BoreSnakes for a one-and-done approach to cleaning my pistols, I picked up one of these Otis kits for more of a detail strip and clean. For the price, you really get a lot for your money in this kit. All the included components are really well made and will stand up to years of abuse. The only negative thing I have to say about the kit is that the pouch that holds everything wasn't sewn correctly and the zipper hangs up about 3/4 of the way around. In my case, I need to pull on the edge of the pouch and really yank the zipper to get it closed. Small price to pay for something so portable and complete however. Cleans everything from my AK to my .22 pistol.
Has everything you need. Little pricey but worth it. Very nice. All in one. Would recommend. Fits compactly in any bag.

I was impressed with how compact the cleaning system actually is. I am able to store it in my safe while taking up very little space. I used it clean my AR, 12g shotgun, and 22mag and it worked great! I have always used the rod style cleaning kits so I wasn't sure if I would like the "snake" style but now will not use a rod style cleaning system again. I would definitely recommend this product.

Wanted to love this, but the breach to bore style can be done much better in my opinion. The accessories aren't easily accessible and readily attachable. This would be great to use on the range if it wasn't so compact it was cumbersome. Not to mention the patch thread seemed to be flimsy and the jags included seemed to flake after a couple passes. I sent it back, but if range cleaning is what you are set on give it a try.
summary: Not the kind of clean I expected...

reviewText: I purchased this because I read a lot of rave reviews about Otis cleaning kits.  I find that it's a good compact kit to take to the field, but overall it really doesn't clean very well--especially for the price.

The Otis cleaning system lets you clean from gun breech to barrel on almost any firearm, which is much superior to the barrel-to-breech method necessitated by standard systems equipped with cleaning rods. Otis supplies two cables instead, which allows you to pull a brush or cotton pads the other direction. That way, you're not pulling gunk and fouling into the chamber.This method takes a little getting used to, but after owning the kit for a month or so, I must say two things: All my firearms are shooting better, and I'm enjoying cleaning the guns whereas before it was just a chore to me.Criticism: The small, round case is great for portability -- you can drop this into your range bag quite easily -- but it's a tight, tight fit to get all the brushes etc. in there and get it zipped up. I would've appreciated a slightly roomier case.Otis also makes larger kits with more instruments including scraping tools, but for most gun owners, this kit is more than adequate. I recommend it.

Still getting used to it though.  Here's my first impressions.1. The cables are a nice idea.  Can't say they clean any better than a rod.2. The t-handle is helpful but not always needed.3. The patches supplied handled my 9mm (larger "all caliber" patches) and AR-15 (smaller caliber patches).  They don't nearly include enough especially the smaller patches.4. There was some confusion as to the directions indicating that the larger patches could be used in my AR.  I didn't ever get them to work as they would never pull through my barrel.  I could have really pulled on it but didn't want to get the patch stuck.  The smaller patches are perfect though.  MAKE SURE YOU ORDER SOME ADDITIONAL PATCHES OF EACH DEPENDING ON YOUR FIREARMS.5. They include a very thin long cable with a non-detatchable patch loop.  Not sure what this would be used for but the limitation is no brush could be put on the end of this.  The long thicker cable and the short thick cable were fine for my AR-15 and 9mm respectively.6. The quality of brushes and attachments are OK.  The brushes are clearly marked with the brush number and the attachments allow you to use just about any attachment desired.7. Nice compact kit, though I tend to use Hopes and Break-Free products.  The cleaner/oil is a nice extra if I decide to travel with the kit but not something I use much.If my impression changes, I'll post an update.

Otis offers a dozen of these kits, but this is the one to get.  Covers nearly all calibers.  Just buy this and add the little specialty tools that come in other packages (AR bolt cleaning tool for example).  Obviously they are aware of this as the kits now cost $15 more than when I purchased this last one.  At the current price, buying from Amazon is not that great a deal.
summary: Great system, but price hike reduces the value

reviewText: Great price and comes with a lot to work with. Nice kit to get if you don't already have one.

The design is excellent for compactness and portability yet comprehensive in inclusion. Intuitively usable, though I did read all the instructions (which I recommend - they help with total understanding and were especially useful when I resolved a blockage issue in a rifle barrel). The many provided sizes of brushes and patch holders are marked with large indications of caliber - very helpful when making choice. Easy to use very quickly and I really like the concept - it makes sense, but also provides the ability to do a quick barrel- and exterior-cleaning more frequently as well as a more thorough cleaning with a total break-down of the firearm. I cleaned 3 rifles and 3 pistols consecutively the day I got it and was very pleased at how quickly I was done and even more so because it was a very thorough cleaning of all in much less time than usual.
summary: As good as I hear it is.

reviewText: Nice cleaning kit. I am new to the sport so am not any type of expert. It works for my needs.

I was very excited when I first started using this.  Eventually I ended up discovering that a "one size fits all" kit really wasn't what it was cracked up to be, even though there were multiple elements to the system that helped it have a chance at being so.  The parts are easy to use, but also easy to lose.  The bag has great zippers but doesn't zip up very easily, is bulky and cumbersome for what it is, and doesn't hold its parts very well.  This often lead to losing parts.  The brushes included also don't include some of the more popular calibers (namely the .223/5.56mm).  It's ok, but I think that just sticking with dedicated kits for particular firearms is going to be better.
This is a nice kit, easy to pack and bring with to the range and cleans a variety of gun calibers.Pat

This kit is decent and comes with the basics to clean most guns. However, it does not come with a .223/5.56 brush! Kinda silly since it claims to be 'tactical' yet does not support the AR caliber... I called Otis and they sent me a free one in the mail and threw in a mop as well! This also does not include a .22 limited breech brush. If you want to clean a standard ruger or any rimfire rifle you will need to buy that separately.I recommend breaking down and using the Otis patches, trying to cut your own is very frustrating. If you find them on sale you can get 1,000 of them for $48
Bought this for my husband.  Everything you need to keep your gun clean. Priced reasonably and quality seems good. It's working great for my husband.
summary: Everything you need in one place

reviewText: Bought this kit to replace the last one I bought in 1978. Great kit has everything you need except for bore snakes.  Mine is on the way as well.  You will be amazed at just how tiny the case for this is.  This has more than my last cleaning kit in about 25 percent of the case.  Easy to fit in a range box.
Otis is a leader in such products and this one is excellent.  It covers most of the popular sizes and is very convenient to use.

Great little cleaning kit. I've slowly migrated to this kit for most of my cleaning. I still have some other nylon brushed that I use on a few of my firearms, but this kit gets heavy use. I like the different sized cleaning snakes and the way the patches work with the kit. If you are buying this kit though, make sure you get extra cleaning patches. Also, I would store the patches separately from the kit. I noticed some discoloration on patches that I have left in the kit (I assume from cleaner/oil I have used with the kit while cleaning.) I use different gun oil and solvent than included, but I like knowing I have a tube in the kit just in case I need it while I'm away from home.

These are not the same quality that I came to expect from the Otis kits I used while active duty. The plastic lamination on the pull-throughs started to peel and split after the first use. I thought it may have been a bad batch, and contacted Otis to take advantage of their excellent warranty - one of the major selling points of any Otis product.Unfortunately, their customer service has also taken a dive lately. It took two weeks of phonecalls and emails to get a reply from their customer service. They asked me to send my mailing address, and said they would send out a replacement ASAP - that, unfortunately, never happened, and I've been unable to get ahold of anyone since.I do have a couple of positive things to say, though.The pouch is much nicer than they used to be, with a molded plastic insert rather than the junky foam block that used to be standard. I also happened to need it to remove a chamber blockage (an over-expanded shell that would not extract) for the first time, and, despite being dubious that a flexible cable would be able to push it out from the muzzle end, it worked exactly as advertised.
summary: Unfortunately, they don't seem to make 'em like they used to.

reviewText: I suppose that if I really needed a very small package to carry my cleaning kit, this would be a life saver. Otherwise, it seems like it was a waste of money. Traditional rods and brushes work fine.
summary: it seems like it was a waste of money

reviewText: This kit covers all my weapons; .22cal, 9mm, .38spl., 308cal. and 12ga.Best kit I found - reasonable price; good quality.

Purchased this kit for cleaning different firearms in different calibers. Very compact and easily fits in a range bag and contains the necessary items to adequately clean and lubricate. All of the parts in the kit are well made and should last for a long time. I highly recommend the kit!

Of all the money I've wasted through the years on cheap gun cleaning kits with those worthless rods and junk in them, can't beliveit. Go ahead gun people and spend a few bucks more and get this OTIS , you won't be sorry in the long run. IT WORKS.

Ive been buying Otis since they first started offering procts and I'd never go back to traditional rods. They may be a bitMore of an investment up front but they last forever and there is zero chance you could damage your barrel. Believe me I've used the Elite kit on about 20 rifle/shotguns/handguns over time and am never disappointed.

I love that it comes with all of the major sizes!  As your collection grows, you'll have all the brush sizes you need!  I love the compact size of this thing.  I also use it to carry my Bore Snake and a few extra patches!

I have 2 other cleaning kits at home.  I ordered this because the slotted tips are brass (not plastic) and the cleaning rods are flexible and roll up, making it very small to transport.  Having now used it, I found the quality to be great.  The included cleaner isn't my preferred solution (I like Ballistol), but that was an easy swap.  The slotted tips are brass, so they won't bend and break. It is important to read the instructions as the way they want you to use the included patches is different than what most people do with the standard slotted tips.  It includes brushes, obstruction removers, etc.  It's a great kit, I highly recommend it. I can use this from my 22lr pistol all the way up to my shotguns,
summary: Great cleaning kit, and very portable

reviewText: Great cleaning system, but consumables are pricy.  This is a great system for in the field or a quick "in-between" cleaning, but I do a more thorough cleaning with a conventional jag system periodically.  You'd be surprised what comes out!
summary: Great cleaning system, but consumables are pricy.

reviewText: The Otis "Tactical Cleaning System" is compact with all the tools to completely clean your AR in a nice compact case.

Received the kit and was satisfied with the pack. I bought this kit for a bug out bag (medium size Australian duffle bag). I simply inspected it for contents and put it in my bug out bag and did not use it. What I like about is the compactness and contents.

I purchased the Otis Tactical cleaning kit (not from Amazon -- got a better deal elsewhere at the time) to care for two 12 gauge shotguns, a pair of .22 cal target pistols, several .38 cal and .357 magnum revolvers, and several 9mm and .45 cal pistols.  From its advertising it seemed like the perfect "one size fits all" cleaning kit.  But it does not live up to the hype.This kit does come with some basic tools to clean all common types of guns, including the needed slotted tips and bore brushes.  But it does not have the (optional) picks and brushes needed to do a thorough cleaning.  That will cost you another $15 or so.  Only a small number of patches come with the kit, so you should plan on buying more right away.  Interesting, no one who sells these cleaning kits locally in my area also sells the Otis patches.  So I had to purchase those online (which I did buy from Amazon).  The patches cost about 10 times the amount you would spend for common square patches.  Even though Otis claims you can get 6 uses out of each patch I found you will drag dirty patches through your barrel if you try to get that many uses.  At best you may get 2 or 3 uses from each Otis patch if you really want your gun to be clean.  In all I spent about twice a much for this cleaning kit as I did for a similar comprehensive rod-based cleaning kit.So how well does this kit clean your guns?  The patches will clean your bore about as well as any other slotted patch system.  But I find I can get the bore much cleaner using a jag and rod.  The fact that you can pull the patch breech to muzzle is handy, though, for revolvers.  But if you clean your gun the way Otis illustrates in their instructional videos it will not get very clean.  If you dissassemble your gun you will find the breech end of the bore is not very clean, and the slide is filthy.  You will need to scrub all of these areas with a brush (which the kit does not include but sells separately) and wipe it down with patches (don't use your expensive Otis patches for this unless you want to spend a fortune on patches).In the end, the Otis cleaning kits (they make several but work fundamentally the same way) are useful if you want to take a compact cleaning kit with you to the range or hunting where taking a cleaning rod would be a hassle.  If you want to do just a quick clean of your bore without disassembling your gun it will work fine.  It is handy to clean the bore of a revolver from breech to muzzle.  If you think a Bore Snake cleans your gun sufficiently then you will probably be happy with the Otis system.  But don't expect this kit to clean your gun as well as you can clean it with full disassembly and use of a simple rod and jag with much cheaper patches, a toothbrush, and some solvent (I usually use Hoppes and BreakFree).  I have spent many thousands of dollars on nice guns.  I don't mind spending money on a good gun cleaning system to protect that investment.  But you will spend a fortune on the Otis cleaning system and, in the end, your guns will not be all that clean.
I like the kit but there is one problem.  There is no way that the brass brush for .22 caliber is the correct size, it will not fit into the muzzle of my 10/22 rifle.  I'm dissapointed.

Well guys, you tried to build the better mousetrap and a darn fine job. OOPS, your main beef about the breach to muzzle cleaning just doesnt apply to "most" of the firearms as you boast. AND ONE OF THEM IS MINE! FAIL!

This is the correct way to clean your gun. The old ram rod style was pushing all the crud down the barrel into the chamber. This is a pull through style cleaner which eliminates that problem. With the cable system you can carry the system right with you on the hunt. Its' priceless with that accident happens and your barrel gets plugged with mud or snow.
summary: Gun cleaning made easy and portable by Otis through Amazon.

reviewText: Last thing to go into my bail out bag. Carrying a 9mm and a 12g shotgun, this kit has all you need to keep your guns clean and ready to use at a moment's notice.
summary: Perfect for the all terrain and survivor guy's pack

reviewText: Compact size and very functional. I put this inside my rifle case and it goes with my at the range. I have gotten a few comments about it from friends. Easy to use and easy to put back together for storage.

I have used these a couple of times now and they do a fine job cleaning the small parts in my guns.  Tis is a nice set and includes just about everything you need to clean and maintain your firearms or other small machines.

I wanted a paddle holster, the description even says, rubberized paddle, I got a belt holster, it doesn't even look like the one in the picture. The belt loops are too small for any belt I own so I can't even use it if I wanted to.
summary: Not even close to what I ordered

reviewText: Simple design, holds handgun firmly in holster, paddle stay in place locked behind pants and belted area. No reason to spend more as this little holster works well on the range with the Ruger SR9c.

I see that this model is mainly advertised as an H&K; pistol holster, but the title and description both had written that it would fit the S&W; Sigma 9ve. Of course, it didn't. It couldn't be THAT easy, right?As you can see from the picture, this holster has a square trigger guard area. This trigger guard area is actually the main retention device, other than just friction fitting -- so it's pretty important to get the trigger guard area properly fitted I would think. When I slid the 9VE into it, I had to apply a significant amount of pressure to get it in, and I expected it to "snap" into place or something. It never did. Instead, the seam of the trigger guard area spread apart so much that I thought it would break. The 9ve not only has a round trigger guard, but it also seems quite a bit wider than the holster trigger guard mold is capable of accepting. The gun physically fits into the holster dimension-wise, but the trigger guard does NOT properly "snap" into place, it just kinda spreads the plastic apart, which is not good and does not provide more than just friction fitting.I liked the idea of the holster for an inexpensive way to carry around a 9ve on the farm, but I never got a chance to test the product out because it didn't even fit the gun, mainly due to the trigger guard area. I didn't want to play holster roulette online again, so I decided not to order another of a different model, but the s&w; m&p; fobus holster may work, seeing as it DOES have a rounded trigger guard mold.
summary: Did not properly fit SW9VE as advertised

reviewText: This is the first fobus holster I've purchased.  I've seen them in their packaging at some firearm stores and they did look kind of cheap, but I have been seeking a holster for my H&K; USP 45 Compact for a while now to use as a home carry holster.The CONS:First I would like to start with the description.This is an area Amazon and their vendors need to fix. They need better descriptions and a way to contact the vendor for questions.  If you look at the photo you see a paddle behind the holster but the main title says belt. I was under the impression you get both just like Blackhawk holsters.  Well this one just come with a permanent fixed belt attachment. Ok, you know what they say about what happens when you ASSUME.Second issue I have which can also fall under the first issue I have is that this holster will NOT fit the H&K; USP 45 COMPACT if you have a rail adapter on it. (I have a GG&G; Slimline Rail adapter).  I was unable to find a review saying it would not fit and it says nothing about it in the description.Third issue: After removing my rail adapter, this holster doesn't really fit this firearm well, you can see that it is very tight and the seem of the holster is just about splitting. Definitely will put wear on the finish of my firearm if used often.Fourth issue the mold has bumps and scratches all over it like it has been used.The PROS:Low cost for someone who wants a belt attached holster.If you own a threaded barrel, this will fit.That's my gripe.Overview:I will be keeping this holster because when i received it I didn't bother to look and see the packaging was zip-locked and I ripped it open so this item will not be resellable as "NEW".I did try some of the other firearms I own and my Sig Sauer Mosquito slides in this well however the sight clips the bottom of the holster when drawing the firearm.There is a seperate paddle adapter you can purchase for this holster right here on Amazon for just under $10.00, but if you do the math, you are better off buying a BlackHawk serpa holster as they are definitely better quality as I own a bunch with carbon fiber detailing for my other firearms and they come with both attachments (Paddle and Belt) and cost is about the same if you buy the paddle adapter.  Unfortunately I did not have enough patience to wait for one for my USP.  I believe they just recently made one for it, not sure if the rail adapter will fit either.As information for some people reading this that is about to recommend a custom Kydex holster.  I do have one that will fit with a light attachment (Raven Concealment).I just wanted one that I can quickly slap on when I need one on my person right away for when unknown people are at my doorstep ringing my doorbell.  I do not want to do it "Ghetto Style" and do a Plaxico.I've been getting a lot of unprofessional solicitors recently showing up at my door (No ID and looking suspicious) and it just takes one time.. I will not longer accept that risk.Hope this review helps someone's decision.
summary: Not High Quality, Description is bad.

reviewText: Good holster for the price. I have it attached to an NCstar crossdraw vest on the belt. Took a little work but it does accept a full 2" belt. The retention is good, and it locks in positively. No worries when running. It actually holds the pistol a lot closer to the body than I expected and I like it. The rivets are pretty good and I think they will hold up. It's not a high dollar holster so its not the most beautiful injection molding but it has a purpose and serves it well. Not made in America, so no 5th star but its a good product. I have a video review on the u-tube - seach ThatDudeSirraj if you want to see it in action.
summary: Fobus HK1 Belt Holster I use for a Sigma 9mm

reviewText: Decent range holster, quick on/off - protects the gun and keeps it on your hip instead of setting it down.  Wouldn't suggest for any type of real world carry, but does what it appears to be made for - a quick, easy cheap holster solution.
Very nice light weight holster. Fits my S&W 686p like a glove. Initially was a bit too tight, but after a couple times of use it felt great.

This holster fits my gun perfectly and clicks in place.  The paddle fits well, the clip is strong, the materials are good, there is a surface inside the paddle that is grips comfortably against the body. The only draw back is that it has two bumps along the waistline that poked into my side.  You can either tuck in your shirt or smash the bumps down.  I got a vice grip and just squeezed the crap out of them - and now it fits perfectly. Other than that minor tweak - I am super happy.
summary: Fits well but pokes my side

reviewText: The holster is ok. The gun fits, but very snug. I'm sure with some use it will break in, but was a little disappointed. The other Fobus paddles I have purchased worked great out of the packaging.
summary: It is alright for the money

reviewText: I have a Smith and Wesson 686 Plus chambered in .357 Magnum/.38 Special with a 4 inch barrel.  For those not familiar, the plus denotes that the cylinder holds seven rounds, instead of the traditional six.  Almost all S&W 686 holsters fit my plus model, though I have had a few plastic ones not work.  I am happy to report that this Fobus model fits just fine. I have Fobus Standard Paddle holsters for several of my guns and I have never had any issue with them.  I much prefer the standard paddle holster to the Evolution line of holsters.  I don’t carry my 686 Plus much, so this holster is more for the range. For the price it does that job perfectly.  I like using the paddle holsters at the range because I can easily and quickly switch holsters, depending on what gun I am shooting, without undoing my belt. With a proper sturdy belt, you can definitely feel comfortable carrying with this holster as well, if you are so inclined.  I would highly recommend this holster to anyone.
I wasn't really looking for a paddle holster when I decided to order this and I'm glad I did because there's no play in the holster at all.
This holster is Very comfortable and easy to wear around the ranch.  I Never have to worry about wet leather again.

This holster gets three stars for its three star price and the equal quality of the product.  It retains K-frame Smiths OK, L-frame is a better fit for retention.  The attachment of the paddle to the body of the holster is weak, it does flap a bit easier than I'd like.  I had no misconception of what the product was, I needed a cheap holster that would retain a hammerless (DAO) Smith 64 and this fits the bill.  I wear a 1.75" belt and there is a bit of a fit issue - the paddle/holster junction is a bit narrow so I get a poor fit.  A 1.5" belt works fine.  Also note that depending where the belt loop of your pants is located this might also effect how the holster rides.

Believing that I got the right holster for my Security Six Ruger revolver, the gun fits really tight. I cannot draw with one hand from the holster. Still working on it. Hoping it will loosen up over time.
simply didn't fit. i could jam it in then barley rip it out so i tried to "break it in" yea that wasn't happening
summary: said it would work for a Taurus

reviewText: These are decent holsters, but if you don't have a chance to test them, it's really a crap-shoot.  This may fit medium frame smiths, but none of my Taurus (taurii?) fit.
summary: Does NOT fit taurus tracker 992 4" 22lr, or rossi 972 357 6"  or rossi 44Mag snubby

reviewText: Exact fit. This is a really nice Holster. If I had a complaint it would be TOO tight - a bit difficult to draw.

Looks like a great holster, but did not work out for my S&W 686 - Plus seven round revolver.  Just too to to use and no way to adjust.  Also does not allow for changing out the belt attachment like the Blackhawks.
summary: L/K Frame Yes, but not S&W 686-Plus Model

reviewText: This custom holster fits the gun perfectly and is comfortable to wear on the hip.  The adjusting screw allows for a customized release-pull pressure.

This holster is one of the best investment i have ever made. It does not qualify as NIJ approved holster, but it is an excellent concealed carry citizen's holster. I use it my off duty private use and carry holster.
Really like the Fobus holsters. Gun fits each holster very well, paddle works well with a belt for a secure mount. Gun draws well, yet is held securely. Good price.

This is a real piece of crap. First it does not fit my L frame revolver. It is made of two pieces of thin cheap plastic, riveted together, with no tension adjustment. The paddle is very small with a piece of red rubber glued to your skin side for extra discomfort. I want my money back.
summary: This is a real piece of crap.

reviewText: I recently purchased this Fobus Double Mag holster.  I'm currently deployed and use this Mag holster do house 2 9mm double stack mags for my Beretta M9 (92FS).  I've never had problems with Fobus products and I was just as pleased with this one.  A feature I like is the material they place on the inner portion of the Holster.  It's rubber like, allowing the holster to better grip to the wearer.  Retention could be slightly bette, but I havn't had any problems with Mags falling out.  It is, afterall, a multi-use mag holster.
summary: Good Product, Good Price, Good shipping.

reviewText: Comfortable to wear and hold the magazines with just the right amount of snugness--couldn't ask for more (except for it to be free!).
summary: Holds my Browning Hi-Power magazines perfectly

reviewText: I have a Gen 4, Glock G21 (.45 ACP) and this magazine holster does a fantastic job holding two mags.  They actually "lock" in place and will not fall out. You can easily pull them from the holder but they won't accidentally fall out.  The paddle that tucks in your pants is very secure but not too difficult to put on or remove (i.e. you don't have to unbutton your pants to get in on like I do to put on or take off my Serpa CQC holster).  I purchased this primarily for range use because it is far too big to conceal without layers of clothes.  However if you can open carry or just headed to the range it's perfect.
summary: Perfect for the range or open carry

reviewText: been using this mag pouch for several months now. it's sturdy and doesn't let go of the magazines during normal activity but they are easy to retrieve when needed.
Fits all size mags right down to the baby glock, great for speed load drills at the range, no retention screw but seems to hold the mags just fine.
Must have for any range work. If you've got a Glock 20, 21 or some others you will like this cheap handy option. Not carried around every day but when I prefer to carry I prefer to carry Dos Equis.

I was let's say uber surprised to find that the flat, curved nature of this magazine holder makes it conceal under a loose shirt tail such as an untucked button down shirt.  The holsters are kind of flimsy, and I don't recommend those to anyone.  However this mag holder is great.  Try it out.  At this price point it's hard to resist.

I purchased this along with the Fobus GL4 for my Glock 21sf.  This is just as perfect, it stays secure on your hip without a lot of movement.  The 13-round magazines fit perfect, snug enough that they don't move around but easily slide in and out.  Another great thing is that the magazine can go in either direction unlike some other mag pouches I have.

I purchased this Magazine holder several months ago.  I have a concealed weapons permit and carry a glock 21 in a Fobus paddle holster with this mag holder.  It fits very well, holds the mags securely and is comfortable on the hip. The price is affordable, you don't have to worry about treating leather and it's durable.  The paddle type makes it easy to put on and take off. It doesn't come off until you want it to.

I received the mag pouch before the date it said i would receive it. Only downside was it was completely scratched and you can tell it was definitely used. Fits my glock 17 mags, and has nice retention. Perfect product, but it'd be 5 stars if it was new and not all scratched up... Only reason i wasnt completely satisfied.
summary: Great holster, Downside is mine was definitely used.

reviewText: I bought the Fobus Elite Double Mag pouch at the same time I bought a BlackHawk double mag pouch. While this is an excellent product I prefer the Blackhawk's belt clip/belt mount mechanism more than the Fobus paddle. The Blackhawk pouch is also smaller overall which makes it much more convenient to pack in the range bag. Otherwise both pouches do a good job at holding my Glock 19 magazines and both are comfortable to wear. Price wise the Fobus is a better deal.
This worked great at a four day defensive pistol coarse!I like the fact that they just slip on with out having to take off your belt. I plan to use this in IDPA as well.
summary: This worked great at a four day defensive pistol coarse!

reviewText: Great paddle holster design.  Looks & feels great. I feel well-armed with this by my side!  Three magazines should definitely get the job done!

I purchased the paddle holster as a more convenient & secure solution to a belt clip mag holster. I am extremely surprised at how comfortable the holster is! After proper placement I can wear the holster all day without any rubbing issues or soreness in any way. I don't realize I am wearing it. Great for CCW carriers for natural all-day comfortable concealment. Magazines fit snug and secure but not too stiff. Great delivery time.

I ordered this Fobus 9mm/.40 S&W; for use with my Glock 17 magazines.  It fits into place comfortably and securely.  I don't feel that it will ever slip.  It took some getting used to when bending over and the like, but otherwise it's magic.  You can do a handstand and the mags will never fall out of their slots, yet when you want to draw one, it slides out with ease.Fobus knows how to make holsters (gun or mag); get this one with the paddle for ease of donning (and doffing).  Fantastic item for the price!
Perfect fit for the 1911 mags.  Also holds single stack 9mm mags in terms of length and thickness; pouch is a bit larger than 9mm mag width using Ruger LC9 mags.
This is a great Magazine holder.  Holds the magazines firmly in place.I would recommend to anyone the only drawback is that it is not for conceal carry.

Works as advertised.  Holds my mags pretty snug.  When carrying them on your person, they hold very close to your body.  I haven't gone out doing handstands or cartwheels, but they held pretty firm while at my last outing.  I would recommend to friends.

I purchased this double magazine holder for CCW purposes.  For that purpose, it is an abject failure.  Simply put, it is too large and bulky.  It is very high quality; of that you cannot quarrel.  However, as can be seen in the photo, the construction is bulky by design.  There are rivets on the outside.  It makes it very hard to carry under a shirt nearly anywhere except right in your front waist area.  That, however, makes it impossible to crouch or bend down, and makes it entirely obvious that you are carrying something -- which defeats the purpose of CCW.  Unless you are walking into a gunfight, for which no concealment is necessary or warranted, I suggest a different product.
summary: Does its job, but do not expect concealment!

reviewText: Enough said...the best paddle holster in the business.  Fobus is the best in the business.  Holds mags tight and secure
I returned this and kept the IDF dual mag holder because i like it better and the price was about the same. Matter of personal preference. You may like this one. Nothing bad to say at all
summary: Returned it, but you may like it.

reviewText: Comfortable, holds my Glock 17 mags snugly, but not too snugly.  Have not had an issue, so I would definitely recommend this product.
summary: What else could you ask for?

reviewText: Carry two spare magazines for Glock 21 and it is very comfortable. I would buy this again in a heartbeat because of the comfort and you really don't feel like you are carrying around that many .45 rounds with you.
summary: Very good and comfortable to wear

reviewText: Fobus usually makes great gear, but this mag holder didn't secure to my belt with the paddle as well as I required. Having two G20 mags on your belt is challenging enough without worrying about them falling off. I don't fault Fobus for this, but it just didn't work for me.
Well made, easy to use, attaches to belt very securly, and hold my 2 Glock 9mm magazines perfectly.  Highly recommended.

This keeps the Glock magazines secure, but easy to remove.  I can turn it upside down and they won't come out unless I really shake the pouch.  But they're not hard enough to make them hard to remove.

I like this mag pouch i take it to the range with me every time. Simply slip it on your pants and you good to go. I got FOBUS holsters for my GLOCK pistols and FOBUS products are heavy duty and really comfortable.
summary: It does what it soppose to

reviewText: It is very stable, I have zero concern that it will move around at all. It holds the magazines very securely, likewise zero concern there.I did get a little bit of an uncomfortable, slightly sore sport on my leg where the bottom edge of the paddle sits. It wasn't too bad, and I wore the thing for about 9 hours each on consecutive days. But it was definitely noticeable.
summary: It's pretty good, but not 100% comfortable

reviewText: For the price it will be excellent for the range.  It fits my Glock .45 magazine perfect.  I would buy again from this manufacturer.

I bought two of these in 9mm/40cal for use in Steel Challenge competitions and to have conveniently stored ammo near at hand.  They are very comfortable, easy to put on and very secure (it takes some work to get them off of your belt).  I expect these to last as long as I will.
summary: Great Mag Holster and good value

reviewText: I love this holster. When it comes to firearms training it is always a good thing to have a holster that is durable and will take a beating. Like when you fall on and multiple mag reloads. This thing is up for the task. I use Fobus for all of my training holsters and they are the real deal.

The item arrived on time and was just as expected. It functioned as expected and is a very good unit. I like this product and highly recommend the seller. I am very satisfied with this purchase. It gets a little weak if you keep the mags in it for a long time, they tend to slip a little. Easy on and off the belt. Overall, a good carrier for the price.
This works great.  I've run a few classes with this on my belt and I can't find anything to complain about.  I'll be buying more of these in the future.  Can't beat it for the price.
I bought this to match the holster. they hold the mags to my g30/g21 snuggly. you can put the mags in either way so its good for righties or lefties
Magazines fit well and they seem to be secure in the pouch. I gave it a four because I haven't had a chance to use in adverse conditions.
Looking for a good decent double  mag pouch this is it. Fits comfortable around the waist. It's a good buy

The mag pouch arrived very quickly. I am using it on both my G34 and G19 that use the double stack mags.  The mags fit perfectly with just the right tension to keep them secure but not enough that they don't come out when doing a mag change.  I was a bit apprehensive about a paddle type retainer on this pouch.  However, since I have given it a try and wear it on a daily basis the paddle system does very well.  It is getting more comfortable the longer I wear the unit.  Strong material, I don't expect any issues with the construction of the pouch.
summary: Fobus Double Mag, Double Stack Pouch

reviewText: great product esp for the price. It will work well for hiking and hunting. Good quality. Fits my 40 cal. Block ammo perfectly
Pretty good fit, albeit rather snug, for my Tanfolglio Witness-P-S 9mm double stack magazine. I use it in USPSA shoots at the local range. A one-pocket was enough for this application.
summary: Fits Tanfolglio Witness-P-S 9mm double stack magazine - snugly

reviewText: I have a fobus holster for my Pt111 G2. I wanted to carry another 12 round mag. This unit works perfectly. It holds the magazine tightly.I highly recommend this for the Taurus pt111 G2 magazine.
summary: Works perfect for PT111 G2 mag

reviewText: Well I was on the fence about a open top mag pouch.. I'm now off the fence loving the mag paddle. No slippage mag stays secure. Used for a 15 rd p95 mag. Would i recommend? Yes!
The product itself is great and would work well, but the description of "Universal" is incorrect.  It is for Beretta and a few other brands, but does NOT fit Glock double stack mags.

Stated in the description (hopefully they've changed this) that this mag holder fit Glock double-stack (9mm) mags...Nope...Promptly returned.The description also stated that the paddle was "rubberized"...Nope...Just plastic.

now this holster is the s***s and is the best i've seen as far as type of holster.  there are shoulder holsters, leg holsters, ankle holsters, vests with built-in holsters, groin holsters, belly holsters, concealable holsters, etc., but a hip holster such as this one is the most practical and comfortable holster, in my opinion.  the rest are just too much hassle to adjust, readjust, take off, put on, etc.  they have tons of velcros, buckles, straps, etc, but this fobus hip holster has nothing at all and requires no maintenance.  all you need is a regular pants belt and the holster will fit in it easily and quickly with little effort.  it is very comfortable to wear and sometimes you forget you're packing.  very practical and easy to draw your gun, however, it does take some practice to draw it because of its passive retention system.  that is good because the gun will not fall out and difficult for a bad guy to unholster it because it has to be unholstered the right way.  very durable, comfortable, practical, and simple holster on your hip.
summary: nice holster that's comfortable, practical, and easy to use

reviewText: Solid and creative design. However not appropriate for conceal carry as it significantly shows, even when wearing a jacket. IMO it will make a great open carry holster. The plane, cheap(price), plastic holster made by glock and sold here did work for me for CC.
summary: Fobus Standard Holster RH Paddle GL4 Glock 29/30/39/ 21SF/30SF / S&W 99 / S&W Sigma Series V

reviewText: This is a super great holster. very smooth action, very comfortable, and very cheap.  Shipping takes a while so be patient.  It comes from israel.  Also, be advised that not all Fobus holsters are equal.  The model for the glock 27 sucks!

There are more bad reviews on youtube than good ones for this Fobus holster, but for the price I took a chance.  I couldn't be more happy with this.  It's incredibly light and simple and it stays securely in position on my hip.  My glock 21sf snaps in snugly and doesn't come loose on it's own, but when you mean to draw it releases easily.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because I have an ambidextrous magazine release and if you hit it just right with a full magazine it can release it.  But it's nothing 30 seconds with a dremel won't fix.

This Forbus Paddle Holster is an excellent choice for the Glock 30. One of my customers asked me to research a holster solution for his needs and this is one of the two I selected for him (Gould & Goodrich B891-G30 Concealment Belt Slide Holster (Black) Fits Glock 30, 39;  S&W; CS40, S&W; CS9, Taurus PT140, Sig 239, S&W; M&P; 9, .40, .357 and .45).I like paddle holsters for their ease of putting on and taking off but generally personally prefer "Level 2" type holsters like,BLACKHAWK! Serpa CQC Carbon Fiber Black Holster (Matte Finish). My customer's needs are different than mine and this one was the style he wanted.This is a very well made holster that works as expected!Highly Recommended!CFH
This fits my Glock 21 gen 4 well. The best part is how easy it is to get on and off my belt. Very secure.

My Glock 30 snaps perfectly into it. Drawing from this holster is smooth enough, but you don't have to worry about your gun falling out of the holster on its own.Slips nicely into place.Overall good holster for the price.
This holster fits the Glock 30 nicely and and holds tight to your belt.  The gun is easy to draw yet holds securely in the holster.  The paddle makes for a comfortable fit.
summary: Great holster at a great price

reviewText: Fits my Glock 21SF perfectly.  I have another Fobus holster which is why I ordered this one.  Retention is good, but does not have the adjustable screw that my previous holster had to make it a tighter retention

I have been using FOBUS holsters for 13 years.Great holster for the money very comfortable.And it keeps your weapon secure.I have taken mine with a unloaded weapon and shook it upside down and weapon did not move.Very durable and well made.Note unlike leather you have to draw completely and in one smooth motion.A little practice before going in the field is recommended.
Extremely comfortable to use even with my Glock 30SF handgun.  The paddle is padded with a very comfortable rubber material that makes contact with the body.  Gun retention is perfect.
summary: Fobus Standard Holster RH Paddle GL4 Glock 29/30/39/ 21SF/30SF / S&W...

reviewText: Purchased for a S&W sigma .40 and it holds it very well. Pretty comfortable to wear and stays put when I draw the gun.
Nice and simple.  Comfortable and allows smooth draw.  I am pleased with purchase and fast delivery.  Recommend for occasional use or everyday concealed carry.

I looked around for a quality holster of this type. All the sporting goods stores wanted $30-40 bucks or more. I was a little apprehensive about purchasing a holster without trying it out first. I love this holster, it is very snug and will not come loose during daily activities. I have a Glock 30 and the weapon fits great, snaps in and is very secure. I would purchase this holster for another caliber weapon and would recommend it to friends.

There are times when my leather holsters seem too surprise me by tightening up when I least expect it. Not this Fobus. Extremely easy to draw and provides a fast presentation.I debated long because a few bad reviews but so far I am thrilled!
I love how light weight and comfortable this holster is.  Very comfy.  great buy and price.  I will get more thanks

I purchased the Fobus Holster on Sunday and received it on Thursday.  I was nervous about the holster because all I have heard is to buy Uncle Mike's Holsters at $60 to $80 bucks.  This Holster fits my .45 Glock 30sf PERFECTLY.  As long as you have a sweater on or something baggy its great.  Its a little big for a T-Shirt but hey, the Glock itself is a fat little gun.  This holster will be perfect for the range and the gun fits in it nicely.  I highly recommend this holster.

Fobus makes a good, reasonably priced holster. Paddle works well with a belt, comfortable for extended wear, good customer service. Some buyers complain the fit is too tight. if so, heat the holster with a hairdryer and hold the area around the trigger open as it cools. This is from Fobus, I had the problem, did what they said, problem fixed.

I purchased a used Glock 30 for CC and this holster came with it.  The holster looked cheap so I ignored it for about a year, then decided to try it out.  The holster was used so the 30 is well retained and a fast pull removes it nicely.  If you have a larger shirt that does not tuck in this holster works very well.It is not the most comfortable holster I own, but for the price and ease of use I rate it five stars.

There are so many knock offs of the 1911 out there... my early 70s model 70 fits rather loose in this, while my glocks fit quite snug in their respective fobus paddle holsters. i guess Focus had to compromise a bit to make it all encompassing for today's 1911 market.

The Fobus paddle holster fits well, even on my not-so-slim frame.  It holds the gun securely and closely to the body.  I could easily wear my 1911 under a slightly baggy shirt and it be concealed completely.  I haven't used it enough to judge durability or longevity, but so far so good.
summary: Nice holster at a great price

reviewText: For the money spent, I have no complaints at all. It was a little too tight out of the box but after a little wear and tear it broke in nicely.

Great quality at a very competitive price. Top notch service. Shipping was quick and package arrived without damage. I would recommend this holster to everyone. It hlods my 1911 very nugly and the paddle attachment allows for a quick draw without dragging the holster off of your belt. five stars
very nice holster.  locks the gun into place and is comfortable to use.  Would recommend to other 1911 owners .

Shipping was fast packaged nicely. Exactly as described. My rating is four stars because it is a friction retention holster and there is no adjustment and when drawing it wiggles a little on the belt making it a little slower and sloppier. I wanted it for IDPA competition and it is not up to par for that. Switched to a blackhawk holster

Very durable. I was a little weirded out by the fact that the trigger is out in the open, but the thumb strap holds the hammer in place.It does seem to flop around just a bit, but I guess that's due to the GP100 being a really heavy revolver rather than any fault of the holster.
This is a perfect
